finding: This lead SNP was associated with the TNFAIP3 gene, which plays a crucial role in immune response regulation, linking it to several immune-mediated diseases.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: This SNP was linked to ATG5, involved in plasma cell differentiation, indicating its importance in antibody production.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: This SNP was linked with IRF4, a key regulator in B-cell development, underscoring its potential significance in immune modulation.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: Associated with the TREM2 gene, this SNP demonstrated a significant meta-analysis P-value of 0.0329, adding to the understanding of genetic contributions to AD.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals new Alzheimer’s disease-associated rare variants in loci related to synaptic function and neuronal development

finding: Located in the HLA region, this SNP is associated with AD and indicates the involvement of genes within this immune-related area.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with atopic dermatitis and is situated near genes involved in immune regulation.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: Associated with atopic dermatitis, it is intronic for the AHI1 gene, tying into the complex genetic architecture influencing the condition.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: The minor allele (T) of rs12526070 was associated with increased serum levels of folate (p=9.19x10^-5), triglycerides (p=0.006), total cholesterol (p=0.041), and HDL cholesterol (p=0.023). Additionally, this SNP's mQTL (cg07077240) was linked to cardiometabolic phenotypes, suggesting a role in the regulation of these traits, particularly during pregnancy.
title: Epigenome-wide association study of serum folate in maternal peripheral blood leukocytes

finding: Noteworthy for its association with a significant p-value of 1.6×10^-12 concerning PSA variations.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rs6903956 SNP in the ADTRP gene had been associated with familial early-onset coronary artery disease (CAD). GATA2 was found to regulate this CAD susceptibility gene through preferential interaction with the G allele, suggesting that this SNP played a role in CAD susceptibility.
title: Peripheral blood GATA2 expression impacts RNF213 mutation penetrance and clinical severity in moyamoya disease

finding: The SNP rs6921438, located near the VEGFA gene, was identified as having the strongest association with VEGF levels with a P-value of 7.94×10^-30 at visit1 and 2.49×10^-28 at visit2, confirming its role in regulating VEGF concentration during early pregnancy.
title: Genetic Associations with Placental Proteins in Maternal Serum Identify Biomarkers for Hypertension in Pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs4349809, also near the VEGFA gene, showed a significant association with sFlt-1 levels at visit1 (P=2.89×10^-12) and was correlated with VEGF levels at both visits, illustrating its impact on the regulation of placental protein sFlt-1.
title: Genetic Associations with Placental Proteins in Maternal Serum Identify Biomarkers for Hypertension in Pregnancy

finding: The rs1800562 SNP was correlated with binge-eating disorder (BED) and represented the C288Y missense mutation, which had pathogenic implications for hemochromatosis. The SNP was identified within the HFE gene and significant associations with iron overload were noted, suggesting dysfunction in iron metabolism as a contributing factor to BED.
title: Genome-wide analysis of binge-eating disorder identifies the first three risk loci and implicates iron metabolism

finding: The rs17789218 SNP, located near the MCHR2 gene, demonstrated a consistent genetic effect in the study of BED across African ancestry cohorts. However, the replication was limited by low statistical power. MCHR2 is known to be involved in eating behavior and metabolic regulation, thereby linking this SNP to BED.
title: Genome-wide analysis of binge-eating disorder identifies the first three risk loci and implicates iron metabolism

finding: The rs3253 variant was identified as a putative causal variant for FEV1 changes, where it colocalized with THBS2 protein expression in both AGES-Reykjavik (P = 1.4×10^-19, β = -0.18, RCP = 0.9976) and deCODE cohorts (P = 2.1×10^-186, β = -0.26). This variant showed directionally consistent effects across observational and causal estimates, contributing to the consideration of THBS2 as a candidate target for COPD.
title: Proteomic associations with forced expiratory volume – a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The variant rs60755019 in the TREML2 locus was replicated with nominal significance (P=0.005) in the study. This SNP has a known association with Alzheimer's Disease, previously identified in large GWAS, and its significance was confirmed within the context of the Peruvian population.
title: A genome-wide association study in Peruvians suggests new risk loci for Alzheimer Disease

finding: The SNP rs5029937 at locus 6q23.3 demonstrated significant association with SLE with a P-value of 4.4×10⁻²⁴. This finding contributed to the identification of crucial non-HLA genes related to SLE susceptibility in both populations.
title: Genome-wide Association Clustering Meta-analysis in European and Chinese Datasets for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus identifies new genes

finding: This SNP was associated with the gene HLA-DRB1 and identified as a significant eSNP in both blood and brain. It was reported as associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk, demonstrating a significant correlation in various cell types, including myeloid lineage cells.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: This SNP was associated with HLA-DRB5 and demonstrated significant eQTL and ct-eQTL effects in multiple brain cell types. It has been associated with Alzheimer's disease risk at a genome-wide significance level.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: This SNP was part of a significant eQTL signal associated with the gene CD2AP and showed colocalization with AD GWAS signals, suggesting its involvement in Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: This SNP was also linked to the gene CD2AP and supported significant ct-eQTL associations with AD risk, indicating its relevance in Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with CD2AP in AD risk and provided evidential support as a significant eQTL and ct-eQTL for its role in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: This SNP was one of three eSNPs targeting the gene HLA-DOB, significant only in microglia and macrophages. It indicated differential regulatory roles in immune response related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: Similar to rs3763355, this SNP was also an eSNP for HLA-DOB and indicated involvement in immune responses within myeloid cell types in the context of AD.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: This SNP acted as an eSNP for HLA-DOB and was significant within microglia and monocytes/macrophages. It emphasized the immune system's role in Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: The SNP rs9275477 was identified as a lead genome-wide significant SNP from the amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) GWAS and had the highest posterior probability of being implicated in both ALS and Alzheimer's disease (AD) as part of a shared variant analysis within the human leukocyte antigen (HLA) region, with a posterior probability of 0.9.
title: Statistical examination of shared loci in neuropsychiatric diseases using genome-wide association study summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs9271247 was noted for its demonstrated regulatory role, as it had the highest probability of being causal for Alzheimer's disease (AD) among the 95% credible set of SNPs identified in the fine-mapping of the HLA region. Variants around HLA-DQA1 and HLA-DRB1 were also associated with AD, indicating a significant role of this SNP in the disease.
title: Statistical examination of shared loci in neuropsychiatric diseases using genome-wide association study summary statistics

finding: The sentinel variant rs3734381 in the CEP85L/PLN locus was identified as being associated with spatially resolved left ventricular wall thickness, demonstrating an apical to basal gradient. This variant has been recognized in prior studies for its association with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) and QRS duration but not specifically for wall thickness or mass.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac structure and function

finding: This exome variant in the CEP85L gene was part of significant findings linked to spatial traits concerning wall thickness, although further specific associations were not detailed.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac structure and function

finding: The rs9352691/PHIP variant was associated with multiple HF risk factors including blood pressure, BMI, HDL-C, alcohol consumption, and AF, thus contributing to HF risk assessments.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The rs10455872/PLG variant was confirmed in association with HF in this analysis, relating to the findings from the GBMI study.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The association between rs3916765, located near HLA-DQA2, and cytogenetically normal acute myeloid leukemia (CN-AML) was replicated in the Leucegene cohort. The odds ratio was 1.88 (P-value=0.005), confirming earlier findings. This effect was stronger in AML patients with NPM1 mutations, with odds ratios over 2.35.
title: Replication of a GWAS signal near HLA-DQA2 with acute myeloid leukemia using a disease-only cohort and external population-based controls

finding: The SNP rs910416 located at 6q25.1 was identified to show the highest significance in genetic correlation, with a p-value of 1.90×10^-29, indicating a strong pleiotropic effect associated with breast cancer.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The SNP was found near HLA-B and significantly associated with glioma risk (p=3.08×10⁻⁴), indicating a notable risk factor for the disease.
title: The immunogenetics of viral antigen response is associated with sub-type specific glioma risk and survival

finding: This SNP, located near HLA-DRB9 (MCV), was also significantly associated with glioma risk (p=2.86×10⁻⁴), suggesting its potential impact on glioma susceptibility.
title: The immunogenetics of viral antigen response is associated with sub-type specific glioma risk and survival

finding: This locus, located near the SOX4 gene, was previously associated with both heel and femoral neck BMD traits, marking it as significant in existing literature.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: The rs9272624 variant was associated with significant seroreactivity for JCPyV, HPyV6, and MCPyV, highlighting a strong association with HLA class II variation. This variant showed a P-value of 9.62e-14, indicating a robust impact on the immune response to these polyomaviruses.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: The association of rs112463084 with MCPyV was found to be significant, evidenced by a P-value of 2.18e-20, indicating a relationship with HLA class II variation affecting the humoral immune response against the virus.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: This SNP was associated with seropositivity for JCPyV and MCPyV, revealing a strong genetic correlation with humoral responses against these pathogens.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: The variant rs73401330 demonstrated significant associations with seropositivity for MCPyV, affirming the role of the corresponding genetic regions in the immune response.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: The rs3957357 C>T SNP in GSTA1 was associated with a higher risk of occurrence of hepatocellular carcinoma in European individuals, relating to liver cancer risk.
title: Identification of potential core genes in hepatoblastoma via bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs56076919 on chromosome 6 was associated with knee pain with a p-value of 9.82 × 10^-12, further emphasizing the importance of collagen structural components in pain pathology.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The SNP rs687878 showed significant linkage with knee pain with a p-value of 2.38 × 10^-8. Its involvement in inflammatory processes was highlighted, linking it to joint health.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The rs2477820 SNP was identified as a novel risk variant located within the FOXP4 gene, with significant associations featured in the study.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: rs2496644 was noted for its moderate linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs2477820, which links it to COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The SNP rs1800562 located in the HFE gene was found to be associated with higher serum iron levels, contributing to increased risk of atrial fibrillation based on genetically instrumented analyses. This SNP was part of a larger investigation that established a causal link between iron status and atrial fibrillation.
title: Genetic support of a causal relationship between Iron status and atrial fibrillation: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1799945, also in the HFE gene, showed a correlation with increased serum iron and was inversely associated with higher systolic and diastolic blood pressure. Its relationship with high blood pressure was linked to an increased risk of atrial fibrillation, as hypertension is a well-documented risk factor for this condition.
title: Genetic support of a causal relationship between Iron status and atrial fibrillation: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: In the liability GWAS for type 2 diabetes, rs7756992 located in the CDKAL1 gene showed a significant association that was not identified using the binary method. This finding was consistent with previous literature.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs1800562, known as the C282Y mutation in the HFE gene, was rediscovered in this study as it was significant for the 'Hemochromatosis Brain' phenotype, with a p-value of 6.93×10^-75, supporting its role in iron-related disorders.
title: Polygenic architecture of a novel MRI endophenotype: the “hemochromatosis brain”

finding: This SNP was included in super variant chr6_54 (OR=1.329, p=1.67×10−7) associated with lung-related disease and mortality from COVID-19.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: The variant rs2627230, located in the regulatory region of SLC2A12, was identified as the most significant lead SNP associated with increased levels of native myocardial T1 time (P = 8.08×10−14). SLC2A12 encodes a glucose transporter implicated in heart function.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: Lead SNP rs6912979 in SOD2 was associated with decreased interventricular septum T1 times (P = 1.06×10−10). This gene is known to be involved in cardiac hypertrophy and oxidative stress response.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The variant rs115740542, near the HFE gene and linked to hereditary hemochromatosis, was associated with increased T1 time (P = 2.71×10−10), emphasizing iron overload as a factor in myocardial fibrosis.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The SNP rs1800562, associated with hereditary hemochromatosis, was relevant due to strong linkage disequilibrium with rs115740542, suggesting its potential impact on myocardial interstitial fibrosis via iron metabolism.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: Lead SNP rs9457699 was an eQTL for SOD2 and associated with increased expression and lower myocardial T1 time, indicating a significant role in oxidative stress and myocardial interstitial fibrosis processes.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The common variant rs1050462 in HLA-B was discovered to be associated with NPC susceptibility, marking it as a novel finding in the context of known HLA associations. Although specific odds ratios were not provided, this association contributes to the overall understanding of genetic risk factors for NPC.
title: Whole-Exome Sequencing Association Study Implicates Genetic Effects on Viral Oncogenesis and Tumor Microenvironment in Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma

finding: The variant rs6456822 was associated with total protein levels in women and SHBG levels in men, indicating its relevance to OC-related traits.
title: Phenome-wide association study of ovarian cancer identifies common comorbidities and reveals shared genetics with complex diseases and biomarkers

finding: The paternal polymorphism rs5370 in the EDN1 gene had been found to decrease the risk of preeclampsia, demonstrating a specific association with paternal contributions to blood pressure and preeclampsia outcomes.
title: Preeclampsia prediction with maternal and paternal polygenic risk scores: the TMM BirThree Cohort Study

finding: The SNP rs41272114 was associated with low LP(a) concentrations, specifically showing that T alleles at this SNV resulted in null alleles that led to extremely low levels of LP(a). In this study, three subjects were homozygous TT at rs41272114 with the highest LP(a) concentration recorded at 3.0 nmol/L, indicating this genotype resulted in significant reductions in LP(a).
title: Comprehensive analysis of the genetic variation in the LPA gene from short-read sequencing

finding: The lead SNP rs56393506 was reported to be associated with increased LP(a) concentration, showing a per-allele change in LP(a) levels of 1.065 with a genome-wide significance (p=1.74 × 10^-211). This SNP was recognized as a significant finding related to LP(a) levels in multiple studies.
title: Comprehensive analysis of the genetic variation in the LPA gene from short-read sequencing

finding: The rs2229092 variant in the LTA gene was associated with T1D with kidney complications, showing a P-value of 0.0044 in the FinnGen data, suggesting its protective role against kidney disease progression.
title: Whole-exome and Whole-genome Sequencing of 1097 Individuals with Type 1 Diabetes Reveals Novel Genes for Diabetic Kidney Disease

finding: The SNP rs6927687 was identified as the likely BMI-dynamic regulatory SNP of the gene SLC16A10, a monocarboxylate transporter also known as MCT10. It showed context-wide regulatory shifts and had a predicted impact on MZF1 binding, indicating its significant role in regulating gene expression related to body mass index (BMI).
title: BMI Interacts with the Genome to Regulate Gene Expression Globally, with Emphasis in the Brain and Gut

finding: The SNP rs4945850 also displayed context-wide regulatory shifts at the SLC16A10 locus, reinforcing its role in the BMI-related regulatory landscape. This SNP contributed to understanding the gene's expression in various contexts influenced by BMI.
title: BMI Interacts with the Genome to Regulate Gene Expression Globally, with Emphasis in the Brain and Gut

finding: The variant rs75932628 (p.R47H) in the TREM2 gene locus was found to be associated with lower levels of soluble TREM2 (sTREM2) and higher Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk. Its association with sTREM2 levels was significant, indicating that carriers of this risk variant exhibited lower CSF sTREM2 levels.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The variant rs142232675 (p.D87N) also showed significant association with lower sTREM2 levels and was linked to an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease. This missense variant, like rs75932628, was identified for the first time as impacting CSF sTREM2 levels.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rare variant rs12664332 in the TREM2 gene region emerged as a significant marker associated with decreased sTREM2 levels and was previously unreported in this context.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs2245133 was reclassified from MED23 to ENPP3, suggesting its involvement as a mediator linking trait-associated variants to HDL traits.
title: Multi-omics Integration Identifies Genes Influencing Traits Associated with Cardiovascular Risks: The Long Life Family Study

finding: The critical SNP rs2025994 was identified as located approximately 40 kb upstream of the SNX9 coding region and was analyzed in relation to severe long COVID. It was determined to contribute significantly to the risk of severe long COVID, particularly in interaction with the genotypes of two other SNPs.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for Severe and Fatigue Dominant Long COVID and Commonalities with ME/CFS Identified by Combinatorial Analysis

finding: The rs1800630 polymorphism linked to the TNF gene was found prevalent in the Indian population, indicating increased risk of severe COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: Located at 6p22.2, this SNP was associated with smoking propensity and linked to susceptibility to lung cancer, emphasizing its relevance in tobacco-related cancer risks.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: This variant was found to be associated with lung cancer susceptibility near the MHC region, representing new insights into smoking-related cancer mechanisms.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The rs200483 SNP was identified as a differentially active SNP (daSNV) with the highest normalized BRAIN-MAGNET cb score among 7 SNPs in linkage disequilibrium (LD) at a schizophrenia-associated locus, indicating its likely impact on NCRE activity.
title: A novel functional genomics atlas coupled with convolutional neural networks facilitates clinical interpretation of disease relevant variants in non-coding regulatory elements

finding: The variant rs3130968 was found within the HLA region, showing significant association with Raynaud's syndrome. This SNP has prior associations with peripheral vascular disease, implying a potential immune-related mechanistic pathway in RS.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The rs1800562 variant in the HFE gene was positively associated with disorders of mineral and iron metabolism, as well as various diseases, despite it not meeting the GWAS significance for manganese.
title: New insights into the genetic etiology of 57 essential and non-essential trace elements in humans

finding: Similar to rs12464825, SNP rs2388334 also robustly emerged from the multivariate analysis, showing weaker effects across various features with opposite signal directions.
title: The genetic architecture of human cerebellar morphology supports a key role for the cerebellum in recent human evolution and psychopathology

finding: The SNP rs7759971 was identified as a significant risk locus within the AHI1 gene, with a p-value of 4.90 × 10^-12, indicating a strong association with pediatric steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome (pSSNS). Furthermore, this SNP overlapped with open chromatin in multiple immune cell types, suggesting its role in the pathobiology of the disease.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: Upstream of the HLA-DQB1 gene, the SNP rs1794497 had a remarkably low p-value (p = 6.79 × 10^-52), further affirming its significance in relation to pSSNS and was classified among the significant findings in the study.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2256318, located within the MICA gene, was associated with pSSNS, revealing a significant p-value of 9.70 × 10^-18, thus representing a substantial finding for the genetic analysis of the disease.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2281591, associated with the ELOVL2 gene, also indicated a beneficial impact on long-chain omega-3 fatty acid conversion which may correlate with a lower risk of schizophrenia. The results showed that the protective effect of DHA persisted even when considering other lipids, reinforcing the importance of the ELOVL2 locus in fatty acid metabolism relating to schizophrenia risk.
title: Causal associations between fatty acid measures and schizophrenia – a two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: This intronic variant located near PRIM2BP showed a positive association for olfactory bulb volume in males (β = 0.06) but not in females (β = 0.01), highlighting a significant sex difference.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: Located in the intron of CENPW, this SNP exhibited a substantial positive association with pituitary gland volume (β = 0.16), previously linked to testosterone and male-pattern baldness.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The rs206783 SNP was identified as the top cis-pQTL of BRD2 and was found to be associated with an increased risk of rheumatoid arthritis (RA) in the general population. Individuals with the AA genotype exhibited a higher risk of RA with an odds ratio of 1.10 (95% CI: 1.01-1.20), and this association was statistically significant with a p-value of 0.03. This finding was corroborated by additional data in the FinnGen study.
title: Identifying therapeutic targets for rheumatoid arthritis by genomics-driven integrative approaches

finding: Identified as one of the pivotal SNPs related to both WC and HC, this variant contributed to the causal association with PCOS, indicating its involvement in central obesity's impact on the syndrome.
title: Both general- and central- obesity are causally associated with polycystic ovarian syndrome: Findings of a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The lead SNP rs61028892 at the HBS1L-MYB locus was significantly associated with fetal hemoglobin levels, with an effect size of 0.73 and P = 1.18 x 10^-9. This finding highlighted the importance of haplotypes within this locus in determining HbF levels in SCD patients.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: The 3-bp deletion variant rs66650371 at the HBS1L-MYB locus was proposed as a functional variant, influencing HbF levels and considered critical due to its impact on genetic regulation in high fetal hemoglobin states.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: The SNP rs9399137 was identified within significant haplotypes at the HBS1L-MYB locus, influencing HbF levels and highlighted for its role in enhancing fetal hemoglobin production dictated by nearby variants.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: The SNP rs361525 in the TNF gene had previously been linked with inflammatory processes affecting liver function, making it significant for understanding glucagon dynamics in metabolic disease contexts.
title: Studies to develop a glucagon sensitivity test in humans: The GLUSENTIC study protocol

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with proxy Alzheimer’s disease and represented a genome-wide significant missense variant in the TREM2 gene, causing an arginine to histidine substitution (p.R239W). It had a CADD score of 26.1, indicating potential pathogenicity. This was consistent with findings from Sims et al. (2017).
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was identified as a significant missense variant in TREM2 associated with the proxy Alzheimer’s disease, causing an arginine to histidine substitution (p.R47H). Its CADD score was 9.7, suggesting it was less deleterious compared to rs75932628, but was also previously noted in relevant literature.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs3117230 demonstrated a near-genome-wide significant association with tuberculosis (TB) susceptibility, with a p-value of 5.292 × 10^-6 and an odds ratio (OR) of 0.437. This association was derived from KhoeSan ancestry and confirmed the role of the HLA-II region in TB susceptibility specifically within admixed South African populations.
title: Confirmation of HLA-II associations with TB susceptibility in admixed African samples

finding: The lead SNP rs6927022 was in the intron of gene HLA-DQA1, which was associated with multiple risk alleles for inflammatory bowel disease, including ulcerative colitis.
title: A powerful replicability analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The variant rs140780894 at the MHC locus was significant for pulmonary tuberculosis (PTB), with an Odds Ratio (OR) of 1.2 and a p-value of 2.9×10−23. It was noted as an East Asian-specific variant, which was not found in the European population.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The variant rs2523559 at the MHC locus exhibited associations with 24 traits, making it a pleiotropic variant in the Japanese population.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: Also located at the MHC locus, rs9265949 had associations with 46 traits in the European population.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs12189871 was identified within the MHC region on chromosome 6, showing a very strong association with psoriasis (OR: 3.31, P=1.8×10^-1524), consistent with previous GWAS findings.
title: GWAS meta-analysis of psoriasis identifies new susceptibility alleles impacting disease mechanisms and therapeutic targets

finding: The missense variant rs33980500 (p.Asp10Asn) was shown to have a regulatory role at the TRAF3IP2 locus, wherein both coding and regulatory contributions were highlighted as factors in psoriasis susceptibility.
title: GWAS meta-analysis of psoriasis identifies new susceptibility alleles impacting disease mechanisms and therapeutic targets

finding: The variant rs6908585 was identified as a skin-specific regulatory variant with a regulatory probability of 0.491, suggesting its relevance to the pathobiology of psoriasis through its impact on TRAF3IP2.
title: GWAS meta-analysis of psoriasis identifies new susceptibility alleles impacting disease mechanisms and therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs12206258 was characterized as an inductive dex SNP-DRE predicted to regulate the etranscript FOXC1. Upon genome editing and deletion of the rs12206258 region, researchers observed a significant blunting of the transcriptional response to dex, with a p-value of 0.040 when comparing homozygously edited C/C cells to wild type T/T cells. This finding indicated that rs12206258 played a critical role in modulating the expression of FOXC1 in response to stress.
title: Assessment of glucocorticoid-induced enhancer activity of eSNP regions using STARR-seq reveals novel molecular mechanisms in psychiatric disorders

finding: The analysis revealed that individuals with the AA genotype of rs206783 exhibited a slightly higher risk of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), with an odds ratio of 1.10 (95% CI: 1.01-1.20) and a p-value of 0.03, compared to those with the CC genotype. This significant relevance was further reaffirmed in the FinnGen study using RA GWAS summary statistics, supporting the association of rs206783 with RA incidence.
title: Identifying therapeutic targets for rheumatoid arthritis by genomics-driven integrative approaches

finding: The variant rs28383206 was identified as a significant genetic correlate for tuberculosis (TB) susceptibility at genome-wide significance (p < 5.0 × 10^-8) in the human leukocyte antigen (HLA)-II region. This finding was part of a multi-ancestry analysis involving 14,153 TB cases and 19,536 controls, indicating a substantial heritable component to susceptibility shared across different ancestries.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of host genetic susceptibility to tuberculosis identifies shared genetic architecture

finding: Replicated in the Asian ancestry-specific analysis with a significant p-value of 3.53E-05, rs41553512 is located in the HLA-DRB5 gene, which is part of the HLA-II region associated with TB susceptibility.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of host genetic susceptibility to tuberculosis identifies shared genetic architecture

finding: The synonymous polymorphism rs1049353 in the CNR1 gene was associated with a higher weight gain following clozapine and olanzapine treatment in African American patients.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The rs9372120 SNP, located in the ATG5 gene, was identified through a methylation quantitative trait locus analysis as a significant genetic variant potentially regulating the DNA methylation levels of the CpG site cg20372759. This SNP was associated with allergic disease within the PIAMA dataset, with a mediation effect of 75.7% of its influence on allergic disease being mediated by methylation changes at cg20372759. This highlights a specific genetic mechanism linking ATG5 to allergic conditions.
title: Nasal DNA methylation at three CpG sites predicts childhood allergic disease

finding: The synonymous polymorphism rs1049353 in the CNR1 gene was linked to a higher weight gain in African American patients treated with clozapine and olanzapine, indicating its influence on treatment side effects.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: This SNP was connected with schizophrenia and served as an eQTL for multiple genes, suggesting its role in psychiatric genetic architecture.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The SNP was tagged for bipolar disorder risk and explored in terms of its influence on brain structure.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: This variant was linked to major depressive disorder, further contributing to the understanding of genetic influences on brain shape.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: Tied to educational traits, this SNP shed light on its potential impact on brain structure characteristics.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: Associated with self-reported math ability, this SNP provided insights into cognitive and educational traits.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The SNP rs3135394 was part of the tri-SNP haplotype associated with type 1 diabetes (T1D) risk. Individuals homozygous for the high-risk DR3-DQ2 haplotype showed increased T1D susceptibility, particularly with the AGG/AGG (010/010) genotype that conferred a substantial odds ratio of 4.65 compared to the protective GCA/GCA (101/101) genotype, highlighting its significant role in T1D pathology.
title: Polymorphisms in Intron 1 of HLA-DRA Differentially Associate with Type 1 Diabetes and Celiac Disease and Implicate Involvement of Complement System Genes C4A and C4B

finding: The SNP rs9268645 contributed to the tri-SNP haplotype linked to T1D susceptibility. Analysis in multiple cohorts indicated that the presence of the AGG/AGG (010/010) genotype significantly increased the risk of T1D, with an odds ratio of 4.65. This finding underscores its relevance in T1D pathogenesis as part of the larger haplotypic context.
title: Polymorphisms in Intron 1 of HLA-DRA Differentially Associate with Type 1 Diabetes and Celiac Disease and Implicate Involvement of Complement System Genes C4A and C4B

finding: The SNP rs3129877 was identified as part of the tri-SNP haplotype influencing T1D risk. The association was characterized by a higher prevalence of the AGG/AGG (010/010) genotype among T1D patients, leading to an odds ratio of 1.70 in a Finnish cohort, confirming its impact on the susceptibility to type 1 diabetes.
title: Polymorphisms in Intron 1 of HLA-DRA Differentially Associate with Type 1 Diabetes and Celiac Disease and Implicate Involvement of Complement System Genes C4A and C4B

finding: This missense variant in HMGA1 was noted for having the strongest height-increasing effect of any SNP in the entire dataset, correlating to an increase of 3.5 cm in height. This finding exemplified how the GEL-UKB data allowed for the discovery of variants not identified in previous studies.
title: A Genomics England haplotype reference panel and the imputation of the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs16880565, which tags DEK/RNF144B, was significantly associated with low T1D PRS, contributing to the understanding of autoimmune genetic risk factors.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs80292134, associated with RGS17, demonstrated significant association with low T1D PRS, highlighting its potential implications for type 1 diabetes genetics.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs3800237, related to DLL1/FAM120B, was identified as significantly associated with low T1D PRS, suggesting it may play a role in type 1 diabetes susceptibility.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: Located within the FOXP4 gene, rs2477820 was identified as a novel risk variant and showed moderate LD with rs2496644, which had been linked to COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: This SNP has previously been linked to COVID-19 hospitalization and showed moderate LD with the novel risk variant rs2477820 identified in this study.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The missense variant rs10305420 was crucial in the analysis, revealing a significant association with lower PI risk when genetically proxied GLP-1RAs were considered. The odds ratio (OR) per 1 mmol/mol decrease in glycated hemoglobin was determined to be 0.066 with a 95% confidence interval of 0.006-0.774, indicating it played an essential role in the beneficial effects of GLP-1RAs on PI risk.
title: GLP-1 Receptor Agonists and Risk of Paralytic Ileus: A drug-target Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The variant rs72928038 at the BACH2 locus was prioritized through T-cell-specific SCENT enhancer-gene map and was associated with multiple autoimmune diseases including RA, T1D, atopic dermatitis, and hypothyroidism. The link between this variant and BACH2 was confirmed by base-editing in T cells, which showed that the variant affected BACH2 expression and shifted naive T cells toward effector T cell fates.
title: Tissue-specific enhancer-gene maps from multimodal single-cell data identify causal disease alleles

finding: The <italic>HFE</italic> p.C282Y homozygote genotype (rs1800562) was associated with a 32% increased risk of prostate cancer in males, with a projected excess proportion of 3.8% developing the cancer by age 75, compared to individuals without <italic>HFE</italic> mutations. Additionally, this genotype was previously known to confer increased risks of liver cancer.
title: Hereditary haemochromatosis beyond liver cancer: increased risk of prostate cancer during an 11-year follow-up

finding: The SNP rs2187668 was identified as a critical tag variant for determining the HLA DR haplotype in individuals at risk of Type 1 Diabetes (T1D). This finding contributed to the genetic risk score for T1D, demonstrating that it played a significant role in the genetic predisposition analysis within the UK Biobank cohort.
title: Estimating population level disease prevalence using genetic risk scores

finding: The SNP rs7454108 also served as a tag variant crucial for HLA DR haplotype determination in Type 1 Diabetes risk assessment. Its inclusion in the T1D genetic risk score underscored its relevance in understanding individual susceptibility to T1D, utilizing imputed genotype data from the UK Biobank.
title: Estimating population level disease prevalence using genetic risk scores

finding: The TSH-increasing allele of the intronic SNP, rs1743963, was associated with decreased risk of both hypothyroidism and hyperthyroidism and demonstrated positive associations with increased calcium levels in the phenome-wide association study.
title: Genome-wide association study of thyroid-stimulating hormone highlights new genes, pathways and associations with thyroid disease susceptibility and age-of-onset

finding: SNP rs2087182, located in the MMS22L gene, was found to be a female-specific neuroticism risk locus that achieved genome-wide significance.
title: Sex-specific genetic and transcriptomic liability to neuroticism

finding: The rs699947 (−2578 C/A) SNP showed a significant protective association against head and neck cancers (HNCs). Specifically, the A-allele, A-carrier, and AA genotypes had odds ratios of 0.651, 0.613, and 0.393, respectively, suggesting a reduced risk for HNCs.
title: Strong and Significant Associations of Single Nucleotide Variants (SNVs) in the Promoter and 3’-Untranslated Region (3’-UTR) of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor (VEGF) Gene with Head and Neck Cancers

finding: The rs3025039 (+936 C/T) SNP was associated with an increased susceptibility to head and neck cancers (HNCs). The T-allele, CT genotype, and T-carrier genotype had odds ratios of 1.882, 2.060, and 2.023, respectively, indicating a higher risk for HNCs and significant associations with higher tumour grade.
title: Strong and Significant Associations of Single Nucleotide Variants (SNVs) in the Promoter and 3’-Untranslated Region (3’-UTR) of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor (VEGF) Gene with Head and Neck Cancers

finding: The variant rs3130048 at the LTA locus was found to be associated with BMI (beta=-0.10 kg/m²/allele, P=1.10×10^-23) and was further correlated with circulating lymphotoxin alpha levels, which were positively associated with increased BMI.
title: Protein-truncating variants in BSN are associated with severe adult-onset obesity, type 2 diabetes and fatty liver disease

finding: The minor allele of SNP rs2234253 was associated with higher expression of ADCY10P1 and TREML2, with p-values of 0.026 and 0.044 respectively, indicating its relevance in AD risk.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of Alzheimer disease reveals many differentially expressed genes and multiple biological pathways in brain tissue from African American donors

finding: Similar to rs2234253, the minor allele of SNP rs73427293 was involved in increased expression of ADCY10P1 and TREML2, reinforcing the association with AD risk through gene expression.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of Alzheimer disease reveals many differentially expressed genes and multiple biological pathways in brain tissue from African American donors

finding: The minor allele of CD2AP SNP rs7738720 was linked with reduced CD2AP expression, with a p-value of 0.026, suggesting a potential impact on AD pathogenesis.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of Alzheimer disease reveals many differentially expressed genes and multiple biological pathways in brain tissue from African American donors

finding: The intronic variant rs973205, part of the peak at chromosome 6 in boys, was identified in the Tanner 3 to Tanner 4 transition. It serves as an eQTL associated with regulation of the RP11-524H19.2 gene.
title: Joint models reveal genetic architecture of transitions between pubertal stages and their association with BMI in a Latino population

finding: The SNP rs9469907 was found to be the lead SNP at a locus significantly associated with a somatoform common factor, with a p-value of 6.80e-16. This locus was identified as being associated with epigenetic modifications, particularly influencing genes involved in synaptic transmission, and was implicated as an eQTL for genes such as C6orf106, SNRPC, and CLPS in various brain tissues, showcasing its relevance to somatoform traits.
title: Multivariate, Multi-omic Analysis in 799,429 Individuals Identifies 134 Loci Associated with Somatoform Traits

finding: Found to be significantly associated with rapid progression subtype (Subtype III), suggesting it may play a role in the aggressive form of the disease.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: This SNP was associated with rapid progression subtype (Subtype III), underscoring its potential impact on the clinical progression of Parkinson's disease.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: Found to be associated with mild progression subtype (Subtype I), pointing towards distinct genetic pathways affecting symptomology.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs143334143 was significantly associated with hospitalized COVID-19 at a genome-wide significant level and was noted as a new finding in the 6p21.33 locus.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs6457620 was associated with the HLA-DQB1 gene in the MHC region, indicating a significant contribution to genetic susceptibility related to autoimmune diseases, including rheumatoid arthritis.
title: New Genetic Insights in Rheumatoid Arthritis using Taxonomy3®, a Novel method for Analysing Human Genetic Data

finding: The SNP rs9268557 was linked to the HLA-DRA gene, evidencing its importance in autoimmune disease genetic studies and supporting its relevance in rheumatoid arthritis.
title: New Genetic Insights in Rheumatoid Arthritis using Taxonomy3®, a Novel method for Analysing Human Genetic Data

finding: The genetic variant rs2133037 was located near the HLA-DQB1 gene. This gene's encoded protein is involved in immunity and neuronal survival, thereby suggesting its relevance to ALS within the context of chronic inflammation and immune response, although similar to rs7554873, a direct causal link was not established.
title: Polygenic associations and causal inferences between serum immunoglobulins and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: Analysis of rs10499096 revealed it was located upstream of the MAN1A1 gene and illustrated extensive promoter-capture interactions in muscle tissues. This SNP was part of a larger regulatory network that could affect mannosidase activity potentially impacting extracellular matrix remodeling.
title: Candidate gene modifiers of dystrophinopathy identified by the uniform application of genome-wide datasets to novel GWAS-identified loci

finding: The rs9271609-C allele at the HLA-DQA1 locus presented a significant association with type 1 diabetes mellitus (DM) among the African American (AA) and European American (EA) cohorts. This allele was implicated in COVID-19 severity, highlighting a potential connection between autoimmune conditions and reduced risk of severe COVID-19.
title: A comprehensive knowledgebase of known and predicted human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 susceptibility and severity

finding: The SNP rs6930598 at the 6q26 locus was linked to inconsistent effects on ΔNIHSS across ethnicities, indicating potential polymorphic behavior of the associated genes.
title: Multi-ancestry genetic study in 5,876 patients identifies an association between excitotoxic genes and early outcomes after acute ischemic stroke

finding: The SNP rs1140343 was identified as a significant variant associated with asthma in credible set 1, resulting in an amino acid change from glutamine to histidine at residue 253 of the HLA-DQB1 gene. This variant had the largest posterior inclusion probability among the variants analyzed and was correlated with previously reported asthma variants, indicating its relevance in asthma susceptibility.
title: Exome-wide analysis of copy number variation shows association of the human leukocyte antigen region with asthma in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs9273349 was found to be highly correlated with the rs1140343 variant, both of which are linked to the HLA-DQ signal associated with asthma. Though its direct association was not stated in the results, it is involved in linkage disequilibrium with variants known to be associated with asthma, further supporting the influence of HLA genes on asthma pathology.
title: Exome-wide analysis of copy number variation shows association of the human leukocyte antigen region with asthma in UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was associated with type 2 diabetes and thyroid stimulating hormone and was included in the positive effect cluster regarding obesity's impact on reproductive conditions such as PCOS.
title: The role of obesity in female reproductive conditions: A Mendelian Randomisation study

finding: Mapped to HMGA1 and associated with type 2 diabetes and multiple lipomatosis, this SNP was shared by the substantial clusters for endometriosis and UF.
title: The role of obesity in female reproductive conditions: A Mendelian Randomisation study

finding: The T allele of rs2982570 from the ESR1 gene exhibited a protective association related to longevity, being present in lower frequency among LLIs compared to younger controls, with an odds ratio of 1.692 linked to reduced risk of osteoporosis.
title: Genetic variants associated with longevity in long-living Indians

finding: The T allele of rs1339227, positioned between RIMS1 and KCNQ5 genes, was associated with a decreased risk of schizophrenia and provided a 1.604-fold increase in the chances of reaching the age of 85 among carriers.
title: Genetic variants associated with longevity in long-living Indians

finding: The G allele of rs2802292 from the FOXO3A gene showed significant association with longevity, supported by previous findings in other populations, hence implying its role in promoting lifespan in the studied Indian population.
title: Genetic variants associated with longevity in long-living Indians

finding: The rs138698596 SNP at the TINAG locus was identified as a new genome-wide significant risk locus in FTLD-TDP A, emphasizing its contribution to the disease pathology.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The analysis of SNP rs1049053 also contributed to the identification of a significant causal relationship between GD and T2D. This SNP, among others, helped demonstrate that patients with GD may face increased risks for developing T2D.
title: The causal relationship between Graves’ disease and type 2 diabetes: Evidence from Bidirectional Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs1214761 was part of the genomic analysis that identified variants likely affecting gene regulatory mechanisms, showcasing its involvement in the genetic linkage between BCTs and CVDs.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: The rare variant rs774461980 was found to be associated with type 2 diabetes, having an odds ratio of 5.9 (95% CI: 3.2-11.0, p = 1.59 x 10^-8). It was also linked to lower total circulating bilirubin levels in a UK Biobank cohort.
title: Rare variant association analysis in 51,256 type 2 diabetes cases and 370,487 controls informs the spectrum of pathogenicity of monogenic diabetes genes

finding: This SNP was included among the nominated putative causal variants and served as a lead variant from the adiponectin meta-analysis.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: This SNP was nominated as a putative causal variant in the multi-ancestry adiponectin loci.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: This SNP was highlighted as having the most evidence of being regulatory, located 12kb from RGS17.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: The SNP rs699947 was positively associated with hippocampal volume change following electroconvulsive therapy (ECT). This finding indicated that the effect on hippocampal volume was mediated by this SNP located in the promoter region of the VEGF gene, highlighting the role of genetic factors in the structural brain changes observed after ECT in patients with treatment-resistant depression.
title: Multimodal multi-center analysis of electroconvulsive therapy effects: brainwide gray matter increase without functional changes

finding: This SNP located in HLA-B showed a significant association with overall glioma risk (p=3.08×10^-4), particularly stronger in patients with IDH mutated gliomas (p=2.56×10^-4).
title: The immunogenetics of viral antigen response is associated with sub-type specific glioma risk and survival

finding: Found in HLA-DRB9, this SNP was also significantly associated with overall glioma risk (p=2.9×10^-4). The effect was notable but less pronounced compared to HLA-B regarding patient subpopulations.
title: The immunogenetics of viral antigen response is associated with sub-type specific glioma risk and survival

finding: The SNP rs10455872 was identified as a critical variant associated with cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk by serving as a proxy for assessing the copy number variations in the complex gene LPA. The analysis demonstrated that in European samples, this SNP was in linkage with a high-risk copy number variant (CNV) of KIV-2, which is highly polymorphic and influences Low-Density Lipoprotein (LDL) levels.
title: Closing the gap: Solving complex medically relevant genes at scale

finding: The SNP rs3798220 was similarly recognized as a significant variant related to cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk. It was used alongside rs10455872 to evaluate the impact of copy number variations in LPA. In the European cohort, this SNP was associated with the high-risk CNV of KIV-2, affecting LDL levels and consequently impacting CVD risk, which holds relevance for the genotypic characterization of populations.
title: Closing the gap: Solving complex medically relevant genes at scale

finding: The variant rs9391746 was associated with immune-related conditions, showing a large effect size in causal inference analyses.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: The variant rs28383206 was significantly associated with susceptibility to tuberculosis (TB) at genome-wide significance (p-value = 5.2×10⁻⁹). This variant was located in the human leukocyte antigen (HLA)-II region, which is crucial for antigen presentation and has a noted influence on the susceptibility to infections and autoimmunity.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of host genetic susceptibility to tuberculosis identifies shared genetic architecture

finding: The variant rs41553512 located in the HLA-DRB5 gene replicated in the Asian ancestry-specific analysis with a p-value of 3.53E-05, indicating a significant association with TB susceptibility.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of host genetic susceptibility to tuberculosis identifies shared genetic architecture

finding: The SNP rs3734398, located in ELOVL2, was primarily associated with higher levels of DHA while correlating negatively with eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) and n-3 DPA, indicating its role in fatty acid metabolism and association with cardiovascular traits.
title: The impact of fatty acids biosynthesis on the risk of cardiovascular diseases in Europeans and East Asians: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs9481408 was a significant genetic proxy for HDAC2 inhibition, indicated by a strong eQTL (p = 4.1E-07). This association was linked to the off-target effects of statins, implicating broader implications in pathways related to depression.
title: Statins and antidepressants induce similar in vitro gene expression responses

finding: The SNP rs2500086 was associated with alcohol-induced affective symptoms during alcohol withdrawal in a cohort of European Americans. This SNP was also identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene RNF182, which was found to be upregulated during binge-dose experiments in the current study, indicating a molecular mechanism potentially linked to the pharmacological effects of alcohol.
title: Peripheral blood transcriptomic profiling indicates molecular mechanisms commonly regulated by binge-drinking and placebo-effects

finding: TGFM fine-mapped the non-mediated variant rs56225074 (PIP: 0.55) within 1 Mb of the TSS of OVOL1 in lymphocytes, which were implicated in Eczema. This finding was contextually significant as OVOL1 loss was known to induce skin inflammation through an immune-mediated mechanism in T cells.
title: Fine-mapping causal tissues and genes at disease-associated loci

finding: The synonymous variant TBC1D7:c.447C>A (rs768742269) was found in individual 5 and parent 1. It was predicted to disrupt an exonic splice enhancer (ESE) site and was associated with downregulation of TBC1D7 exon 5. This finding was further supported by a mini-gene exon trapping assay that confirmed the variant caused skipping of exon 5, ultimately linking it to neurodevelopmental disorders such as macrocephaly and intellectual disability.
title: RNA-sequencing improves diagnosis for neurodevelopmental disorders by identifying pathogenic non-coding variants and reinterpretation of coding variants

finding: The SNP rs10455872, located in the LPA gene, was identified as a significant variant influencing the association between coronary artery disease (CAD) and prostate cancer (PCa). The findings indicated that there was a genetically conferred increased risk of CAD that was causally associated with an increased risk of PCa, as observed in a Mendelian randomization analysis (beta 0.13, SE 0.05, p = 0.03). This SNP explained a substantial portion of variation in plasma Lp(a) levels and was notable among the genome-wide significant (GWS) CAD loci in the PRACTICAL consortium genetic data. The results suggested that the relationship between CAD and PCa was likely mediated through pleiotropic effects of the LPA gene, indicating shared genetic risk factors.
title: Coronary artery disease and prostate cancer share a common genetic risk mediated through Lipoprotein(a)

finding: The variant rs1886814 was identified as associated with severe symptoms of COVID-19, showing a general increase in effect risk for critical illness compared to hospitalized cases, particularly in East Asian genetic ancestry samples.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The lead variant rs7741164 was associated with lung adenocarcinoma (OR=1.2, P=6.0 × 10-13) and linked to variant rs1886814 in FOXP4 locus.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The rs9352691 variant was positively associated with multiple HF risk factors, such as blood pressure, body mass index (BMI), high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C), alcohol consumption, and atrial fibrillation (AF), making it a significant variant in heart failure risk.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The hypothyroidism-related SNP rs9404989 within the HCG26 long non-coding RNA showed a significantly higher odds ratio in the top quartile of the functional genetic disorders (FGND) topic weight (1.90±0.24) compared to the bottom quartile (1.19±0.13), with a P-value of 3×10^-3. Although hypothyroidism associations were noted mainly in the HLA region, this finding suggested a new link with HCG26.
title: Age-dependent topic modelling of comorbidities in UK Biobank identifies disease subtypes with differential genetic risk

finding: The SNP rs3800373, a variant of FKBP5, was found to interact with urban living conditions to modify the neural stress response specifically in the anterior cingulate cortex. This finding was significant as it linked the genetic predisposition associated with FKBP5 to the effects of living in urban environments, highlighting how environmental factors can influence brain activity relevant to stress.
title: How does the macroenvironment influence brain and behaviour – a review of current status and future perspectives

finding: The rs241768 variant was associated with tyrosine and was a known eQTL for SLC16A10, affirming its established role in amino acid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: The rs143334143 SNP located at the CCHCR1 locus showed significant effect size heterogeneity with an association to lymphocyte count, demonstrating a strong β-value of 0.144 and high statistical significance (p=5.16×10^−179). This finding highlighted genetic variability in immune response potentially affecting COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Host genetic liability for severe COVID-19 overlaps with alcohol drinking behavior and diabetic outcomes and in over 1 million participants

finding: This SNP was identified as having some previously studied GWAS association.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: The HFE c.845G>A (p.Cys282Tyr, rs1800562) variant was notably prevalent in the dataset, observed in 112 out of 2078 individuals, which constituted 5.39% of the cohort. It was linked to hereditary hemochromatosis, an autosomal recessive disorder characterized by anomalous iron metabolism.
title: Unveiling the Landscape of Reportable Genetic Secondary Findings in the Spanish Population: A Comprehensive Analysis Using the Collaborative Spanish Variant Server Database

finding: The SNP rs11545686 was used as a proxy for HLA-DQA1*03:02 and was associated with susceptibility to MPO-ANCA positive AAV. Specifically, the study found significant associations with a P value of 5.8×10^-7 and an odds ratio of 1.74 in Japanese patients.
title: Association of HLA-class II alleles with risk of relapse in myeloperoxidase-antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody positive vasculitis in the Japanese population

finding: Identified as linked to larger mitral annular diameter in systole, this SNP was associated with decreased risk of coronary atherosclerosis and heart failure.
title: Computational estimates of mitral annular diameter in systole and diastole cardiac cycle reveal novel genetic determinants of valve function and disease

finding: The SNP rs7738720 in CD2AP was genome-wide significant with p=1.14×10^-9 in the combined MVP and ADGC results.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs2234253 near TREM2 was identified with a suggestive level of significance (p=2.95×10^-9), noted in its high linkage disequilibrium with other TREM2 variants.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs73427293 upstream of TREM2 showed a suggestive significant association in the MVP meta-analysis (p=2.95×10^-9).
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs7748513 in TREM2 was significant (p=6.06×10^-6) in combined analysis with the ADGC datasets.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs2234256 in TREM2 obtained suggestive significance (p=4.64×10^-9) in the analyses.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs2234258 in TREM2 was significant at p=5.48×10^-7 based on combined analyses.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The study identified that the exonic variant rs9479297 in the SYNE1 gene contributed to the development of both hepatocellular carcinoma and transitional cell carcinoma, indicating its role in promoting double primary cancer phenotypes.
title: Multiparametric MRI Along with Machine Learning Informs on Molecular Underpinnings, Prognosis, and Treatment Response in Pediatric Low-Grade Glioma

finding: This variant was found to be significantly associated with lymphocyte count and interacted negatively with rs4713570, suggesting a suppressive feedback mechanism in lymphocyte proliferation.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: This SNP was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for HLA-DQA1 that negatively interacted with rs3819720 to affect lymphocyte counts.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: This SNP interacted positively with the vQTLs rs2858993, rs12346, and rs2794719 within the HFE gene to influence hemoglobin levels.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: This variant is a vQTL in the HFE gene that positively interacted with rs4645 to enhance hemoglobin levels.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: This SNP was recognized for its positive interaction with rs4645 in the context of hemoglobin levels.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: This SNP demonstrated significant positive interactions with rs4645 regarding hemoglobin levels.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: This pathogenic variant in HFE was involved in interactions with rs4645 that enhanced hemoglobin levels.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: This pathogenic variant in HFE demonstrated interactions with rs4645 relevant to hemoglobin levels.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: The rs401754 SNP was associated with an increased risk for schizophrenia, located within a locus on chromosome 6 that contained 7 SNPs in linkage disequilibrium (LD). This association was validated through comparison with NCRE activity data.
title: BRAIN-MAGNET: A novel functional genomics atlas coupled with convolutional neural networks facilitates clinical interpretation of disease relevant variants in non-coding regulatory elements

finding: The rs200483 SNP demonstrated the highest normalized BRAIN-MAGNET cb score among 7 SNPs associated with schizophrenia, confirming its classification as a differentially active SNP (daSNV) in prior MPRA studies, indicating its significant functional relevance.
title: BRAIN-MAGNET: A novel functional genomics atlas coupled with convolutional neural networks facilitates clinical interpretation of disease relevant variants in non-coding regulatory elements

finding: This SNP was connected to chronotype traits, indicating associations with morning routines, and was among those linked to HG in the meta-analysis.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of severe pregnancy nausea and vomiting identifies risk loci associated with appetite, insulin signaling, and brain plasticity

finding: The rs6905617 SNP showed the most significant association with English Lexical Decision (ELD), located near the MANEA gene. Prior studies indicated it had a tentative link to general cognitive ability.
title: A genome-wide association study of Chinese and English language abilities in Hong Kong Chinese children

finding: The SNP rs4406273 served as a proxy-SNP for HLA-C*06:02 status, showing excellent performance. In this study, individuals with psoriasis who were HLA-C*06:02-positive (having one or two copies of the A allele of rs4406273) demonstrated lower levels of hsCRP, a marker of systemic inflammation, indicated an increased prevalence of atrial fibrillation, and a decreased prevalence of migraine. These findings related to the metabolic alterations associated with psoriasis highlight the significant role of HLA-C*06:02 in influencing health outcomes in psoriatic patients.
title: Body Composition, Cardiometabolic Risk Factors and Comorbidities in Psoriasis and the Effect of HLA-C*06:02 Status: The HUNT Study, Norway

finding: The SNP rs374248993 was in linkage disequilibrium with an amino acid change in HLA-DRB1, which was associated with a decreased risk of chronic sputum production (OR 0.91, P=3.43×10^-9). The amino acid change from threonine to arginine was fine-mapped to this SNP.
title: Genome-wide association study of chronic sputum production implicates loci involved in mucus production and infection

finding: The rs2076295-G allele in the DSP locus was associated with lower gene expression in alveolar cells, which was linked to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) genetic architecture, marking the first time this locus was associated with COVID-19.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: The rs12660421-A allele in the FOXP4 locus was linked to increased lung adenocarcinoma risk and was previously reported to be associated with long COVID-19.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: SNP rs2388334, like rs12464825, also displayed weaker effects across several features but emerged significantly from the multivariate analysis, highlighting its relevance despite lower univariate power.
title: The genetic architecture of human cerebellar morphology supports a key role for the cerebellum in human evolution and psychopathology

finding: The SNP rs1800562 was identified as a causative variant for hereditary haemochromatosis, accounting for 85% of cases. In the context of this study, it was used as an instrumental variable in a Mendelian randomisation analysis to evaluate the relationship between iron biomarkers and sepsis. The results indicated an association where higher iron biomarker levels increased the risk of sepsis, with a notable risk enhancement seen in individuals with iron deficiency and/or anaemia.
title: Causal associations between iron status and sepsis: a Mendelian randomisation analysis

finding: The SNP rs3094134, located in the TRIM10 gene, was associated with basal ganglia volumes and is novel in this context. It was part of a region previously linked to immune functions in the brain.
title: Unveiling the Genetic Landscape of Basal Ganglia: Implications for Common Brain Disorders

finding: The variant rs140068132, located on chromosome 6q25, was identified as a protective factor in a GWAS involving 1,497 Latina women in the US. It was associated with lower mammographic density, reduced rates of ER-negative breast cancer, and a 16% overall reduction in breast cancer risk. This finding highlighted the significance of genetic research focused on Latin American populations, particularly in understanding the unique hereditary factors affecting breast cancer in individuals of Indigenous American ancestry.
title: Germline Mutations Associated with Triple Negative Breast Cancer in US Hispanic and Guatemalan Women using Hospital and Community-Based Recruitment Strategies

finding: The study found that the T allele of rs28986310 was significantly associated with a higher risk of developing PTSD (z = 6.73, p = 1.68e-11). It was observed that higher methylation at the cg14753356 site correlated with the presence of the T allele at this SNP, indicating a complex relationship between DNA methylation and genetic susceptibility to PTSD.
title: Epigenome-wide association studies identify novel DNA methylation sites associated with PTSD: A meta-analysis of 23 military and civilian cohorts

finding: The SNP rs71557378, located in the major histocompatibility complex (MHC), was also associated with SA (OR for T allele = 1.10, P=1.97×10^-8). However, its effect was not significant after conditioning on MDD, suggesting its association with SA might be pleiotropic.
title: Dissecting the shared genetic architecture of suicide attempt, psychiatric disorders and known risk factors

finding: Identified as a sentinel SNP, rs9274669 showed a significant association with PTB in a meta-analysis of East-Asian datasets, with an OR of 1.160 and a p-value of 1.92×10^-17. It was significantly associated with PTB primarily driven by data from Japan, and also showed directional consistency in the Singaporean Chinese dataset.
title: Common variants at 22q12.2 are associated with susceptibility to Tuberculosis

finding: This novel SNP was associated with the A2 ("schizophrenia-like") dimension of ASD, characterized by enlarged subcortical volume and overlapping genetic traits with schizophrenia, along with antipsychotic medication use.
title: Three Imaging Endophenotypes Characterize Neuroanatomical Heterogeneity of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs150971595 near GABBR1 was negatively associated with FVC (P=1.49×10^-8, β=-0.0307). This SNP had previous associations with total cholesterol and triglyceride levels.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: This SNP demonstrated significant association in genetic determinants of PSA levels.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP at the RUNX2 locus showed a positive association with serum IgA levels, having a Beta of 0.06 and a significant P-value of 6.85×10^-14.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs17069163 located at the CITED2 locus showed significant association with IgA levels (Beta=0.05, P=5.94×10^-11), demonstrating its involvement in immune homeostasis.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The variant rs335407 demonstrated a significant association with incident CVD, yielding an HR of 1.25 (95% CI 1.16 – 1.35), P = 1.58×10^-8. It resided in an intergenic region between the TFB1M and NOX3 genes.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: Associated with CAD variants in people with T2D and found to be significant post-Bonferroni correction (P < 0.00024), indicating its relevance.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: The SNP rs56393506 was found to be associated with higher odds of atherosclerotic plaque presence, with an odds ratio (OR) for the T allele of 1.12 (95% CI: 1.07–1.16). This SNP is intronic within the LPA gene, known for encoding lipoprotein(a) and previously strongly associated with increased Lp(a) levels in individuals. Its relation to carotid atherosclerosis highlights its significance in cardiovascular disease risk.
title: Deep Learning-Based Detection of Carotid Plaques Informs Cardiovascular Risk Prediction and Reveals Genetic Drivers of Atherosclerosis

finding: Peak association at three months demonstrated a significant role for rs2268657 in childhood BMI at the <italic>GLP1R</italic> locus.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity
