finding: With peak observation at one year, rs2268647 showed complex relationships at the <italic>GLP1R</italic> locus, indicating potential impacts on childhood obesity.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: Demonstrated peak association at six months, rs1820721 showed potential contributions to BMI variations through its position relative to <italic>GLP1R</italic>.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: The SNP rs9379833 was reported to have increased risk for ASD and cognitive performance, whereas the ADHD risk allele was associated with decreased performance. This SNP was particularly noted for its location in the HIST1 gene cluster, which has connections to regional brain volume.
title: Identification of shared and differentiating genetic risk for autism spectrum disorder, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and case subgroups

finding: The SNP rs78636169, located near the JARID2 gene on chromosome 6, was significantly associated with tau deposition in Alzheimer's disease, with a P-value of 5.76×10^-10. This association remained significant even after adjusting for APOE-ε4 status, indicating its impact on tau pathology independent of the APOE risk allele.
title: Genome-wide scan of Flortaucipir PET levels finds JARID2 associated with cerebral tau deposition

finding: The study found that males with the HFE p.C282Y mutation (rs1800562) had a cumulative incidence of 56.4% for haemochromatosis diagnoses by age 80. The mortality rate among these males was notably higher at 33.1% compared to 25.4% in those without HFE variants, yielding a Hazard Ratio (HR) of 1.29 (95% CI: 1.12-1.48, p=4.7×10<sup>-4</sup>). Additionally, there was a significant association with excess cases of joint replacements (27.9% vs. 17.1%), liver disease (20.3% vs. 8.3%), and various forms of neurological conditions such as delirium, dementia, and Parkinson's disease.
title: HFE genotypes, haemochromatosis diagnosis status and clinical penetrance to age 80 in the UK Biobank community cohort

finding: The HFE p.H63D variant (rs1799945) in females was associated with a cumulative age 80 incidence of liver disease at 8.9% compared to 6.8% in those without the variant, reflecting a Hazard Ratio of 1.62 (95% CI: 1.27-2.05, p=7.8×10<sup>-5</sup>). The study did not find statistically significant excess fatigue or depression in individuals with this SNP, similar to results seen with the p.C282Y variant.
title: HFE genotypes, haemochromatosis diagnosis status and clinical penetrance to age 80 in the UK Biobank community cohort

finding: The SNP rs13194781, located at chromosome 6p22.1 within the major histocompatibility region, was associated with decreased depressive symptoms and a protective effect for pain. It was suggested to act as an eQTL influencing several nearby genes, although fine-mapping was complicated by extended linkage disequilibrium.
title: GWAS meta-analysis reveals dual neuronal and immunological etiology for pain susceptibility

finding: The variant rs1013698558 at 6p12 exhibited a moderate association with HGSOC risk, suggesting a role for GCLC gene interactions in ovarian cancer development.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of 398,238 women unveils seven novel loci associated with high-grade serous epithelial ovarian cancer risk

finding: The variant rs1794269, located near the HLA-DQB1 gene, was found to have a strong association with dermatophytosis (p = 1.42×10^-36, beta = 0.05), emphasizing the immunological dimension of susceptibility to this fungal infection.
title: The genetic basis of dermatophytosis skin infection susceptibility

finding: The shared causal variant rs2790099 at 6p21.1 was discovered between ASD2 and SCZ2 with a strong posterior probability (PP.H4.ABF = 0.92). This variant was linked to the RUNX2 gene, which is associated with cleidocranial dysplasia but has also been previously implicated in ASD and SCZ.
title: Nine Neuroimaging-AI Endophenotypes Unravel Disease Heterogeneity and Partial Overlap across Four Brain Disorders: A Dimensional Neuroanatomical Representation

finding: The SNP rs9257566 at 6p22.1 was identified as having significant colocalization between ASD3 and SCZ, with a PP.H4.ABF of 0.82. This variant was associated with multiple olfactory receptor genes, implicating dysfunction in the olfactory system in both ASD and SCZ.
title: Nine Neuroimaging-AI Endophenotypes Unravel Disease Heterogeneity and Partial Overlap across Four Brain Disorders: A Dimensional Neuroanatomical Representation

finding: The SNP rs1265079 was identified within the CCHCR1/POU5F1 locus and was implicated as a disease-associated SNP. Although it did not directly influence gene expression, it appeared to be in LD with variants regulating CCHCR1 levels (pSMR=4.4x10^-6; pHEIDI=4.5x10^-5). This highlighted a potential functional mechanism linking it to PPP.
title: A genome-wide meta-analysis of palmoplantar pustulosis implicates Th2 responses and cigarette smoking in disease pathogenesis

finding: The SNP rs7739897 in the UNC93A gene was identified in a Peruvian family with a strong clinical history of Alzheimer's disease and related dementias (ADRD). It was present in affected individuals across two generations, suggesting its association with genetic risk for familial ADRD.
title: Co-occurring Pathogenic Variants in 6q27 Associated with Dementia Spectrum Disorders in a Peruvian Family

finding: The SNP rs61740334 located in the WDR27 gene was found to be part of a novel combination of pathogenic variants linked to ADRD in a Peruvian family. This variant was present in affected individuals but absent in healthy family members, indicating its potential role in disease development.
title: Co-occurring Pathogenic Variants in 6q27 Associated with Dementia Spectrum Disorders in a Peruvian Family

finding: The SNP rs3800544, also in the WDR27 gene, was part of the identified combination of variants associated with familial ADRD in a Peruvian family. Similar to the other variants, it segregated with affected members but not with healthy individuals.
title: Co-occurring Pathogenic Variants in 6q27 Associated with Dementia Spectrum Disorders in a Peruvian Family

finding: The G-allele of the TNF rs3093662 A>G polymorphism in donor kidneys was significantly associated with a higher risk of primary non-function (odds ratio: 2.05, P = 0.032) and worse 5-year, 10-year, and 15-year graft survival (P < 0.05). The cumulative incidence of graft loss was greater in the AG/GG-genotype group (25.2%) compared to the AA-genotype group (15.9%). A hazard ratio of 1.51 confirmed this association after adjusting for confounders (P = 0.028).
title: Tumor necrosis factor-α gene polymorphism is associated with short- and long-term kidney allograft outcomes

finding: Similar to rs163184, the variant rs10305420 was found to be associated with lesser treatment response in Chinese patients, indicating its potential relevance in pharmacogenetic interactions.
title: Precision medicine in type 2 diabetes: A systematic review of treatment effect heterogeneity for GLP1-receptor agonists and SGLT2-inhibitors

finding: The SNP rs7739897 in the UNC93A gene was identified as a pathogenic variant associated with familial Alzheimer's disease and related dementias in a Peruvian family. Its presence was noted in affected individuals across two generations, indicating a significant genetic risk factor for the disease.
title: Co-occurring Pathogenic Variants on 6q27 associate with Dementia spectrum disorders in a Peruvian Family

finding: The SNP rs61740334 in the WDR27 gene was identified along with rs7739897 as a pathogenic variant in a Peruvian family with a strong clinical history of Alzheimer's disease and related dementias. This variant was present in affected individuals but absent in healthy family members.
title: Co-occurring Pathogenic Variants on 6q27 associate with Dementia spectrum disorders in a Peruvian Family

finding: The SNP rs3800544, also in the WDR27 gene, was part of the combination of three pathogenic variants identified in a family with Alzheimer's disease. Its presence in affected members indicated a crucial role in the genetic risk associated with the neurological disorders observed within the family.
title: Co-occurring Pathogenic Variants on 6q27 associate with Dementia spectrum disorders in a Peruvian Family

finding: The SNP rs601945 was associated with reduced levels of neurofibrillary tangles and phosphorylated- and total-Tau in cerebrospinal fluid, but not significantly associated with amyloid plaques. This finding suggested a protective role against Alzheimer’s (AD) and Parkinson’s (PD) pathology, underscoring a common immune response involving HLA-DRB1 variants across neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Protective association of HLA-DRB1*04 subtypes in neurodegenerative diseases implicates acetylated Tau PHF6 sequences

finding: Analysis revealed that rs504594 had a strong association with Parkinson's disease, with an odds ratio of 0.84. It was identified as the primary genetic signal driving the association with HLA-DRB1 amino acids that confer protection, suggesting a critical role in modulating disease risk in PD.
title: Protective association of HLA-DRB1*04 subtypes in neurodegenerative diseases implicates acetylated Tau PHF6 sequences

finding: The SNP rs35472547 was associated with Alzheimer’s disease, demonstrating an odds ratio of 0.91. This SNP was found to peak in association studies and was co-localized with the HLA signal in both AD and PD, indicating its significance in the shared genetic risks for both conditions.
title: Protective association of HLA-DRB1*04 subtypes in neurodegenerative diseases implicates acetylated Tau PHF6 sequences

finding: The variant rs2477820 was identified as a novel risk variant within <italic>FOXP4</italic> and showed a moderate LD with rs2496644, which has been linked to COVID-19 hospitalization, indicating its significance in this context.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: Like rs12464825, SNP rs2388334 also emerged significantly from the multivariate analysis despite weaker individual effects across several cerebellar features.
title: The genetic architecture of human cerebellar morphology supports a key role for the cerebellum in human evolution and psychopathology

finding: Located in the HLA region, downstream of *HCG22* and upstream of *HLA-C* and *HLA-B*, this SNP was associated with Raynaud's syndrome and has previously been linked to peripheral vascular disease, thus establishing a significant connection to vascular conditions.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The CCDC170 locus (lead SNP rs9397433) revealed a novel association with copper levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The low-frequency variant rs1016378028 was associated with a 1.77-fold increased risk of type 2 diabetes (MAF=1.3%, OR=1.77, P=7.0×10-7). It was identified as a Latino private variant, not imputed with the 1000G panel, and was located in an intron of the HDAC2 gene, which is highly expressed in pancreatic islets. The replication analysis indicated a consistent effect direction (OR=1.17, P=0.1547) despite lacking statistical significance.
title: The power of TOPMed imputation for the discovery of Latino enriched rare variants associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs2376620, located in the intron of the gene CDKN1A, was associated with the cross-sectional area of the interventricular septum (IVS.csad). It showed a significant Beta of 8.4 mm² (95% CI: 5.8 to 11.0) and p-value of 2.0e-10, indicating its role as a genetic determinant for hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM). This suggests that CDKN1A is crucial for the normal development and hypertrophic response in the heart.
title: Genetic determinants of interventricular septal anatomy and the risk of ventricular septal defects and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy

finding: The SNP rs116522341 was associated with type 1 diabetes (T1D) risk, particularly in individuals lacking high-risk HLA-DR3 or DR4 haplotypes. It contributed to the differentiation of T1D cases in non-DR3/DR4 groups compared to those with diabetes or normal controls.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: For rs1281934, the finding indicated it played a significant role in risk stratification for T1D in individuals without DR3 or DR4 haplotypes. This SNP was particularly relevant for regulatory pathways associated with autoimmune responses.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: The SNP rs1611547 showed a positive association with T1D in non-DR3/DR4 cases, contributing to the understanding of genetic variants influencing disease mechanisms related to immune system regulation.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: Investigations revealed rs114170382 was positively associated with T1D risk. It highlighted the diversity in genetic susceptibility factors contributing towards the disease within non-high-risk HLA haplotype populations.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: The association of rs17843689 with T1D indicated it had a notable role in modulating risk in individuals lacking the high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes, suggesting its importance in the broader genetic landscape of the disease.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: Analysis identified that rs371250843 was linked to T1D risk, particularly among those without the high-risk HLA haplotypes, pointing towards its involvement in beta cell-related pathways relevant to T1D pathology.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: Research indicated that rs144530872 was significantly associated with T1D, contributing to a better understanding of genetic risk factors applicable to non-DR3/DR4 patient groups.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: The analysis found rs149663102 was positively associated with T1D risk in individuals lacking the high-risk HLA DR haplotypes, illustrating its relevance in the genetic architecture of the disease.
title: Genetic discovery and risk prediction for type 1 diabetes in individuals without high-risk HLA-DR3/DR4 haplotypes

finding: The SNP rs9361235 was found to be significantly associated with positive treatment outcomes following fluoxetine treatments in a study that evaluated 83 adolescents diagnosed with major depressive disorder (MDD), obsessive-compulsive disorder, and generalized anxiety disorder. The study indicated that transcription factor binding site variations, including this SNP, played a critical role in predicting treatment response.
title: Leveraging DNA Methylation to Predict Treatment Response in Major Depressive Disorder: A Critical Review

finding: The SNP rs6298 was linked to improved efficacy of SSRI treatment in patients. A specific finding revealed that participants carrying the rs6298 SNP along with high methylation levels of the HTR1B CpG3-61 showed significantly better treatment outcomes, suggesting a potential interaction between genetic and epigenetic factors influencing antidepressant effectiveness.
title: Leveraging DNA Methylation to Predict Treatment Response in Major Depressive Disorder: A Critical Review

finding: The rs1800562 SNP (HFE p.C282Y) homozygotes in males had a significantly increased incidence of osteoarthritis (HR: 2.12, p=8.8x10-8) and elevated risks for hip and knee replacements (HR: 1.84 for hip replacements, HR: 1.54 for knee replacements). Lifetable estimates projected 30.4% of male homozygotes would develop osteoarthritis and 15.5% would have hip replacements by age 75, compared to lower percentages in non-mutation individuals.
title: Musculoskeletal outcomes with Hereditary Haemochromatosis genetic variants: 11.5 year follow-up in a community cohort

finding: The SNP rs4620159, located on chromosome 6, was identified as part of the CanUD intersected with Smk and Scz subset. This intronic variant in the gene REV3L showed a strong association with smoking and cannabis use disorder, linking it to previously identified metabolic traits.
title: Cross-ancestry genetic investigation of schizophrenia, cannabis use disorder, and tobacco smoking

finding: This intronic SNP in ESR1 was associated only in females and, while not significantly different from males, indicated potential implications in aortic traits.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The rs1800562 SNP, associated with the p.C282Y variant of the HFE gene, showed that male homozygotes had a significantly increased incidence of osteoarthritis (HR: 2.12, p=8.8×10⁻⁸) and hip replacements (HR: 1.84, p=1.6×10⁻⁸). It was found that 30.4% of male homozygotes might develop osteoarthritis and 15.5% hip replacements by age 75, compared to 23.0% and 8.7% respectively for individuals without HFE mutations.
title: Haemochromatosis genetic variants and musculoskeletal outcomes: 11.5 year follow-up in the UK Biobank cohort study

finding: This SNP showed association with FVC (P=1.49×10^-8, β=-0.0307) and had previous links to total cholesterol and triglyceride levels.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: The SNP rs9348441, near the CDKAL1 locus, was significantly associated with GDM (p=1.6×10−14). This SNP had previously been reported in the context of type 2 diabetes (T2D), thus reinforcing its relevance in the shared pathophysiology of both conditions.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of gestational diabetes mellitus highlights genetic links with type 2 diabetes

finding: This lead SNP mapped to exon 26 of LPA, demonstrating a negative association with longevity (β = -0.21, P = 4.2E-08). It was linked to coronary heart disease and was an eQTL for multiple genes, possibly implicating cardiovascular health in longevity.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: This coding variant was in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs41272112 and showed significant effects on 'lost healthy life years' in participants, linking its effects on longevity to broader health impacts.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: The rs140365013 SNP was located in the HLA region and associated with type 1 diabetes and systemic lupus erythematosus, indicating a potential link between SCZ and autoimmune diseases.
title: A transcriptome-wide Mendelian randomization study in isolated human immune cells highlights interferon regulatory transcription factor 3 as a schizophrenia hub gene

finding: The variant rs117473527 achieved genome-wide significance with a P-value of 3.93×10⁻⁸ and an odds ratio of 3.17, indicating it was significantly associated with congenital anomalies of the kidneys and urinary tract (CAKUT). It was identified as an intergenic variant downstream of GRIK2, which has links to neurodevelopmental disorders and urinary tract cancers.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals contribution of rare and common variation to structural kidney and urinary tract malformations

finding: The variant rs144171242 at 6p21.1 demonstrated significant association with PUV, with a P-value of 2.02×10⁻⁸ and an odds ratio of 7.20, indicating a strong positive association.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals contribution of rare and common variation to structural kidney and urinary tract malformations

finding: The missense mutation rs3131639 in MICB, associated with the antigen MICB*004:01, showed higher frequency in infected individuals, suggesting a link to increased susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection due to lower MICB expression.
title: “Immunogenetics of resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection in discordant couples”

finding: The missense mutation rs2071554, linked to the antigen HLA-DOB*01:02, was associated with susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection, indicating potential impact on immune response.
title: “Immunogenetics of resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection in discordant couples”

finding: The missense mutation rs9269942 in HLA-DRB1 was found more frequently in infected individuals, suggesting inappropriate antigen presentation might contribute to increased susceptibility to COVID-19.
title: “Immunogenetics of resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection in discordant couples”

finding: The variant rs2844526, part of the MICA susceptibility haplotype, was shown to be more prevalent in East Asian populations, which contributes to the understanding of regional differences in susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2.
title: “Immunogenetics of resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection in discordant couples”

finding: The variant rs2596541 in MICA was part of a haplotype associated with increased susceptibility to infection, with a higher frequency in East Asian populations.
title: “Immunogenetics of resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection in discordant couples”

finding: The investigation identified rs9275477 as the lead genome-wide significant SNP located in the HLA region, with a high posterior probability of being implicated in both amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) and Alzheimer's disease (AD). Its strong association was supported by the existence of a shared causal variant between these two neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Statistical examination of shared loci in neuropsychiatric diseases using genome-wide association study summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs9271247 was highlighted for its significant role in Alzheimer's disease (AD), having the highest probability of being causal across the 95% credible set in the fine-mapping of the HLA region. It was noted for demonstrating a regulatory role in modulating gene expression in the vicinity of HLA-DQA1 and HLA-DRB1, both of which are associated with AD.
title: Statistical examination of shared loci in neuropsychiatric diseases using genome-wide association study summary statistics

finding: The study established that homozygosity for the p.C282Y mutation (A/A at rs1800562) was linked to significant iron deposition in motor circuits, indicated by decreased T2 signal intensity in areas such as the basal ganglia and cerebellum. Additionally, there was a notable increased risk for movement abnormalities among male homozygotes (OR = 1.82, p=0.001), while the effect was not observed in females (OR = 1.10, p=0.71). Ultimately, the research highlighted a crucial relationship between the p.C282Y genotype and movement disorders, advocating for screening in high-risk individuals to prevent iron overload-related complications.
title: Genetic Risk for Hemochromatosis is Associated with Movement Disorders

finding: The strongest association was found at rs34645063 on chromosome 6 (P = 3.20×10−13), which was located between the genes MMS22L and POU3F2. This SNP was linked to various traits, including risk-taking behaviors, substance use (alcohol consumption, smoking initiation, caffeine intake), psychiatric disorders (bipolar disorder), externalizing psychopathology, neuroticism/mood instability, as well as educational attainment, intelligence, socioeconomic factors, and BMI.
title: Genome-wide association study of delay discounting in 134,935 individuals identifies novel loci and transdiagnostic associations across mental and physical health

finding: The SNP rs2070600, a functional RAGE polymorphism Gly82Ser, was linked to psychoticism and schizophrenia by modulating increased sRAGE plasma levels. This finding provided evidence that genetic variations at this locus may influence the severity of symptoms associated with methamphetamine-induced psychosis (MIP) by affecting the AGE-RAGE axis.
title: Increased AGE-RAGE axis stress in methamphetamine (MA) abuse and MA-induced psychosis: associations with oxidative stress and increased atherogenicity

finding: rs71717606 on chromosome 6 was discovered as a novel locus in the Hispanic ancestry GWAS, with a significant p-value of 4.84 x 10^-10, indicating it was not previously observed in the other GWAS and suggesting its unique relevance.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Novel Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: In the post-GWAS analysis, rs72965321 on chromosome 6 was associated with skin pigmentation and hippocampus characteristics, illustrating potential broader implications beyond dizziness.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Novel Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: The association of rs56393506 in the LPA gene with lipoprotein-A (LpA) was found significant (p-value = 1.97E-14). This SNP was previously identified in a European population but not reported in an Asian population until this study.
title: A Chinese host genetic study discovered type I interferons and causality of cholesterol levels and WBC counts on COVID-19 severity

finding: The association of rs9268517 in the BTNL2 gene with white blood cell counts (WBC) had a p-value of 4.05E-08. This gene was previously identified in European populations.
title: A Chinese host genetic study discovered type I interferons and causality of cholesterol levels and WBC counts on COVID-19 severity

finding: Associated with major depressive disorder (MDD), this SNP was predicted to impact GRIK2, which encodes a kainate glutamate receptor's subunit. GRIK2 was found to be upregulated in somatostatin (SST) cells for SCZ (logFC = 0.61, FDR = 6.4 x 10^-23), BD (logFC = 0.61, FDR = 2.8 x 10^-23), and MDD (logFC = 0.32, FDR = 1.4 x 10^-12), indicating its involvement in neuronal signaling across these disorders.
title: Transcriptomic pathology of neocortical microcircuit cell types across psychiatric disorders

finding: rs138141444, located at locus 6q24.1 in the gene ECT2L, was discovered as a novel site significantly associated with gray scale variation (V) in mammograms. It had not previously been linked to mammographic density (MD) phenotypes or breast cancer risk.
title: A genome-wide association study of mammographic texture variation

finding: rs2105898T was significantly associated with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) in a Japanese population, replicating findings from European populations. However, this association became non-significant when conditioned on HLA-DRB1*15:01, indicating that HLA-DRB1*15:01 primarily accounted for the risk.
title: Genetic dissection of HLA-DRB1*15:01 and XL9 region variants in Japanese patients with systemic lupus erythematosus: Primary role for HLA-DRB1*15:01

finding: rs9271593C also showed significant association with SLE in the Japanese population, similar to findings observed in Europeans. As with rs2105898, this association was no longer significant when conditioned on HLA-DRB1*15:01, highlighting the primary role of HLA-DRB1*15:01.
title: Genetic dissection of HLA-DRB1*15:01 and XL9 region variants in Japanese patients with systemic lupus erythematosus: Primary role for HLA-DRB1*15:01

finding: The SNP rs3135338 was identified as a cis-meQTL for cg00124375, annotated to HLA-DRA. It was significantly associated with multiple autoimmune disorders, including type 1 diabetes (P = 1e-300), multiple sclerosis (P = 3.7e-294), and rheumatoid arthritis (P = 1e-200), as observed in large GWAS findings.
title: DNA Methylation Signatures of Cardiovascular Health Provide Insights into Diseases

finding: This SNP was noted for its contributions to endometrial cancer susceptibility, marking it as a relevant locus when considering the genetic landscape of FGT polyps.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: The SNP rs80036911 located on MECOM was positively associated with aortic root diameter. This association was considered novel as it correlated with findings of previous research related to left ventricular trabeculation.
title: Using Machine Learning to Elucidate the Spatial and Genetic Complexity of the Ascending Aorta

finding: The novel genome-wide significant locus at 6q21-<italic>CD164</italic> was associated with CH, implicating its role in hematopoietic stem cell migration and homing.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: This SNP was classified as deleterious and was significantly associated with otosclerosis with an odds ratio of 1.19, indicating its relevance in disease susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide Screen of Otosclerosis in Population Biobanks: 18 Loci and Shared Heritability with Skeletal Structure

finding: This variant in SUPT3H was linked with an odds ratio of 1.25 for otosclerosis, indicating its contribution to susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide Screen of Otosclerosis in Population Biobanks: 18 Loci and Shared Heritability with Skeletal Structure

finding: The rs3798220 SNP was identified as a coding variant located in the protease-like domain of the LPA gene. It showed associations with plasma Lp(a) levels and cardiovascular risk, specifically in Caribbean Hispanics, where it had a carrier frequency of 0.12. In the WHICAP cohort, this variant was associated with baseline insulin c-peptide levels, indicating higher c-peptide levels in carriers and supporting links to hepatic insulin resistance and Lp(a) related diseases.
title: Ancestry specific distribution of LPA Kringle IV-Type-2 genetic variants highlight associations to apo(a) copy number, glucose, and hypertension

finding: The SNP rs58023137 was identified as being associated with higher THBS2 gene expression levels in an individual with AAA, supporting the gene's role in AAA development. It was part of a locus confirmed in the most recent GWAS, indicating its significance in AAA risk.
title: Differential expression analyses on aortic tissue reveal novel genes and pathways associated with abdominal aortic aneurysm onset and progression

finding: The SNP rs9505895 was linked to increased expression of the THBS2 gene in a patient with AAA. Similar to rs58023137, this variant was noted in the latest GWAS analysis emphasizing its connection to AAA risk and its role as an eQTL in aortic tissue.
title: Differential expression analyses on aortic tissue reveal novel genes and pathways associated with abdominal aortic aneurysm onset and progression

finding: The intronic variant rs12203592 in IRF4 was associated with lung cancer and demonstrated a significant association with gene expression in lung tissue samples from European descent.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: An association at rs17534632 in PPIL6 was identified, linking it to eosinophil count and further related to lung cancer susceptibility.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: A novel association at rs191133092 near HLA complex group 15 (HCG15) was identified, associated with the pathology of unipolar depression.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This SNP near HLA-DRB1-HLA-DQA1 was marked for its association with lung cancer.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The variant near HLA-DRA showed distinct associations with adenocarcinoma.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Located near HCP5, it showed significant signals with squamous cell carcinoma across diverse populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This intergenic variant near DCBLD1-GOPC was associated with lung cancer and adenocarcinoma.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The IRF4 variant correlated with adenocarcinoma, demonstrating genetic influences across populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs7759971 in the Abelson Helper Integration Site 1 (AHI1) gene was found to have a highly significant association with pediatric steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome (pSSNS), with a p-value of 4.90 × 10−12. Fine-mapping suggested that this SNP played a role in driving the risk signal associated with the HLA Class II region, implicating specific amino acid haplotypes.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs1794497, which is located upstream of HLA-DQB1, exhibited a highly significant association with pSSNS, with a p-value of 6.79 × 10−52. This SNP further established the connection between HLA loci and the disease.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2256318 found in an intron of MHC Class I Chain-related Gene A (MICA) showed a significant association with pSSNS, with a p-value of 9.70 × 10−18, highlighting additional genetic contributors to the disease.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs3104394 was identified with alopecia areata and reached experiment-wide significance only in the admixed American (AMR) population.
title: Diversity and Scale: Genetic Architecture of 2,068 Traits in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs3135388A was significantly associated with two of the four identified neuropathological MS subgroups when compared to non-MS non-NMO controls. The unadjusted p-values for these associations were robust (3.6 x 10^-8 for subgroup 2 and 6.1 x 10^-9 for subgroup 4), indicating a strong correlation. This SNP is known to be highly correlated with the HLA-DRB1*1501 allele, which is recognized as the strongest genetic risk factor for multiple sclerosis.
title: Identification of neuropathology-based subgroups in multiple sclerosis using a data-driven approach

finding: The SNP rs62401887 was associated with the hepatic biological age gap (BAG) and mapped to the MRS2 gene, which was linked to magnesium ion transmembrane transporter activity. Its deleterious score was 14.89 and it showed significant expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) with a P-value of 1.09×10^-10.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Biological Age in Nine Human Organ Systems

finding: The <italic>CFB<sub>R32Q</sub></italic> variant (rs641153) was found to significantly associate with better graft survival when present in the donor (P=0.027) and showed improved survival in donor-recipient pairs (P=0.045), highlighting its role in enhancing long-term outcomes.
title: Synergistic impact of three complement polymorphisms in the donor, not the recipient, on long-term kidney allograft survival

finding: The lead causal variant rs72951506 was located in the intron of the NUS1 gene. It reached nominal significance for schizophrenia with a p-value of 2.3 × 10^-5 and genome-wide significance for type 2 diabetes with a p-value of 9.93 × 10^-11. The study found that variants associated with rs72951506 had opposing risk-increasing alleles for type 2 diabetes and schizophrenia, showing that increased expression of NUS1 was linked with an increased risk of schizophrenia and a decreased risk of type 2 diabetes.
title: Genomic insights into the comorbidity between type 2 diabetes and schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs3130660, located in the intron of the FLOT1 gene at 6p21, was significantly associated with the Mtb L2 subclade, with an odds ratio of 1.39. Individuals carrying the A allele of this SNP had a 40% increased likelihood of being infected with Mtb strains associated with this specific subclade. This finding highlighted the interaction between human genetic variation and pathogen genomic variants in influencing clinical outcomes of tuberculosis.
title: A FLOT1 host regulatory allele is associated with a recently expanded Mtb clade in patients with tuberculosis

finding: The minor allele of rs12526070 (T) was associated with increased serum levels of folate (p=9.19×10−5), triglycerides (p=0.006), total cholesterol (p=0.041), and HDL cholesterol (p=0.023). In mediation analysis, the T allele of rs12526070 was suggested to mediate its association with serum folate levels through methylation at cg07077240, which is likely related to gene expression changes in HERC3.
title: Epigenome-wide association study of serum folate in maternal peripheral blood leukocytes

finding: The rs75932628 variant located in the TREM2 locus exhibited a suggestive association with Alzheimer's disease (p = 3 x 10^-3, MAF = 0.35%). This variant was identified as a functional variant and has previously been implicated in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Key variants via Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project whole genome sequence data

finding: The SNP rs201956837, located in <italic>HLA-B</italic>, was associated with IOP (P = 8.65 × 10<sup>−9</sup>, beta = 4.37) in pan-ancestry analysis. Even though this is an intronic variant, it showed a significant association with glaucoma in the FinnGen cohort (P = 1.10 × 10<sup>−9</sup>).
title: Whole-exome sequencing study identifies novel rare variants and genes associated with intraocular pressure and glaucoma

finding: The SNP rs9295988 (Chr6:31373718C>G) was significantly associated with colorectal cancer (CRC) risk, with an overall odds ratio (OR) of 1.09, particularly stronger in early-onset CRC (EOCRC) with an OR of 1.26. MICA genotype at this SNP exhibited a linear decrease in MICA RNA expression in normal colonic epithelium with additional G alleles, and individuals with CG or GG genotypes showed reduced NK cell infiltration in colorectal tumors compared to those with the CC genotype.
title: Genetic Variation and Regulation of MICA Alters Natural Killer Cell-Mediated Immunosurveillance in Early-Onset Colorectal Cancer

finding: SNP rs660895 captured significant associations with several Phecodes, including Type I diabetes and Rheumatoid arthritis, through both Gold-standard logistic regression and Poisson models. This analysis revealed a strong genetic association with these diseases.
title: Overcome the Limitation of Phenome-Wide Association Studies (PheWAS): Extension of PheWAS to Efficient and Robust Large-Scale ICD Codes Analysis

finding: The SNP rs2790102, located in the RUNX2 gene region, was significantly associated with BAG with a p-value of 8.92×10^-9 and an effect size of -0.15 years, marking an advancement from previous suggestive significance.
title: Genetic architecture of brain age and its casual relations with brain and mental disorders

finding: The variant rs7773324-A located between DUSP22 and IRF4 was found to increase the risk of non-melanoma skin cancer (NMSC) by 14%. This variant was significant with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.14 (95% CI 1.09-1.19) and replicated in the validation cohort.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Risk Variants Are Associated with an Increased Risk of Skin Cancer

finding: The rs1847472-C variant located in the BACH2 gene was associated with a 5% increased risk of NMSC (OR 1.05, 95% CI 1.01-1.09), qualifying it as a positive original finding due to its replication in the validation cohort.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Risk Variants Are Associated with an Increased Risk of Skin Cancer

finding: The study reported a genome-wide significant association between this rare intergenic variant in the MHC region and pneumonia (OR = 1.59, P = 1.15 x 10^-9), making it a positive finding regarding pneumonia susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of pneumonia suggests a role for mucin biology and provides novel drug repurposing opportunities

finding: In African-American patients, the rs1049353 variant in the CNR1 gene was linked to increased weight gain following clozapine and olanzapine treatment, indicating its influence on treatment side effects.
title: Pharmacogenomic Diversity in Psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The SNP rs2206277 was noted as significant after testing independence from previously reported BMI-risk SNPs, indicating potential new association signals within the TFAP2B locus.
title: WHOLE GENOME SEQUENCING ANALYSIS OF BODY MASS INDEX IDENTIFIES NOVEL AFRICAN ANCESTRY-SPECIFIC RISK ALLELE

finding: The variant rs1853837 at the 6:40997035-42005196 locus showed strong association with COVID-19 susceptibility specifically in non-European populations, as indicated by genome-wide significant p-values when testing multiple ethnicities.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: At the 6:32555355-33555355 locus, rs9501257 was elucidated as the causal variant linked to the eQTL of HLA-DPA2, implicating the HLA region in COVID-19 susceptibility.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: The variant rs1886814 at the 6:40997035-42005196 locus was recognized for its role in COVID-19 susceptibility associated with the B2 phenotype and varied significantly across ethnicities.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: The SNP rs9273410, located at the HLA-DQB1 locus, was previously reported to be associated with both asthma and lung function, and it was found to have an odds ratio of 1.20 with a p-value of 9.19×10<sup>–28</sup> for ACO. It indicated significance in the context of inflammation and autoimmune diseases.
title: Genetic associations and architecture of asthma-chronic obstructive pulmonary disease overlap

finding: The SNP rs9271378 was located in the HLA class II region, with a significant association to severe PUUV infection shown by a p-value of 2.30×10-34. This SNP contributed to the immune response mechanisms associated with the severity of the disease.
title: Genetic analysis implicates ERAP1 and HLA as risk factors for severe Puumala virus infection

finding: The SNP rs2844614 was identified as being closest to the HLA-C gene within the HLA class I region and showed a strong independent association with severe PUUV infection (p = 1.0×10-13), highlighting its role in antigen presentation.
title: Genetic analysis implicates ERAP1 and HLA as risk factors for severe Puumala virus infection

finding: The SNP rs3130304, located approximately 200 kilobases from the HLA class II region and closest to the NOTCH4 gene, revealed a significant association with severe PUUV infection (p = 5.34×10-12), further linking genetic factors to disease severity.
title: Genetic analysis implicates ERAP1 and HLA as risk factors for severe Puumala virus infection

finding: The SNP rs3135388, which is associated with the HLA-DRB1*15:01 allele, was identified as having a dominant contribution to the risk of Multiple Sclerosis (MS). This finding relates to the significant heritable component of MS risk, particularly in the context of environmental factors such as EBV, smoking, and obesity. In the FutureMS cohort, there was an expected significant over-representation of this risk locus, confirming its importance in both the genetic susceptibility and potential variability in disease course of relapsing remitting MS.
title: FutureMS Cohort Profile: A Scottish Multi-Centre Inception Cohort Study of Relapsing-Remitting Multiple Sclerosis

finding: The association of this SNP with the rapid progression subtype (Subtype III) highlights its potential significance in the fast worsening of PD symptoms.
title: Integrative analyses of multimodal clinical, neuroimaging, genetic, and transcriptomic data identify subtypes and potential treatments for heterogeneous Parkinson’s disease progression

finding: Linked to the rapid progression subtype (Subtype III), it suggests possible involvement in severe symptoms manifestation in PD.
title: Integrative analyses of multimodal clinical, neuroimaging, genetic, and transcriptomic data identify subtypes and potential treatments for heterogeneous Parkinson’s disease progression

finding: This SNP was identified with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I), suggesting its role in influencing gradual symptom progression.
title: Integrative analyses of multimodal clinical, neuroimaging, genetic, and transcriptomic data identify subtypes and potential treatments for heterogeneous Parkinson’s disease progression

finding: The variant rs9367106, located at the FOXP4 locus, was identified as the lead variant associated with Long COVID, with a genome-wide significant association. The C allele was linked to an increased risk of Long COVID with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.63 (95% CI: 1.40-1.89). This association was notable even across various studies with differing population genetics, underscoring its significance in the context of pulmonary dysfunction linked to Long COVID.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Long COVID

finding: This specific reference was another description of the lead variant rs9367106, reinforcing its association with Long COVID as noted previously.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Long COVID

finding: The rs9271608 variant showed a likely causal relationship in the association between Alzheimer's disease (AD) and type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM). It was located in the HLA-DRB1 gene, which is involved in immune response and targeted by several immunosuppressive and psychotropic drugs.
title: Local patterns of genetic sharing challenge the boundaries between neuropsychiatric and insulin resistance-related conditions

finding: The rs9275599 variant was identified as likely causal in linking Alzheimer's disease (AD) to type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM). It mapped to the MTCO3P1 gene, contributing to the shared pathophysiological mechanisms between these two conditions.
title: Local patterns of genetic sharing challenge the boundaries between neuropsychiatric and insulin resistance-related conditions

finding: The SNP rs7776158 was linked to the regulation of SOX4 via transcriptional inhibition, validating its role in chromatin interactions related to melanoma.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs2125570 was implicated in the regulation of SOX4 through targeted CRISPRi experiments, indicating its importance in melanoma risk.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs6935117 demonstrated significant correlation with SOX4 expression as an eQTL in TCGA melanomas, linking it to melanoma risk.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs6935124 showed a significant association with SOX4 expression, serving as an important candidate in melanoma susceptibility.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs6914598 was tested for its influence on SOX4 expression, although its effects were less clear compared to other variants.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs72834823 was associated with reduced SOX4 levels, suggesting a regulatory role in melanoma-related gene expression.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs72834822 also contributed to the gene regulation of SOX4, consistent with findings from other tested SNPs in the region.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs6456503 was correlated with decreased SOX4 levels, supporting its role in transcriptional regulation associated with melanoma.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs34481484, which was located in the HLA-DQA1 gene, emerged as a significant locus for MG with a p-value of 3.72x10^-9 and an odds ratio of 2.11. This finding further supported the involvement of HLA genes in MG.
title: A Myasthenia Gravis genomewide association study of three cohorts identifies Agrin as a novel risk locus

finding: The SNP rs9262202 was the top variant associated with Early-Onset Myasthenia Gravis (EOMG) with a significantly low p-value of 5.56x10^-29 and an odds ratio of 0.37, indicating a distinct genetic architecture for EOMG.
title: A Myasthenia Gravis genomewide association study of three cohorts identifies Agrin as a novel risk locus

finding: The SNP rs9271539 was identified as the top variant in the Late-Onset Myasthenia Gravis (LOMG) analysis with a p-value of 2.75x10^-21 and an odds ratio of 0.37, illustrating the genetic differences in onset types of MG.
title: A Myasthenia Gravis genomewide association study of three cohorts identifies Agrin as a novel risk locus

finding: The SNP rs2596492 was identified as a key variant tied to the HLA-B locus associated with EOMG, demonstrating significant association with a p-value of 2.69x10^-37 and an odds ratio of 3.24, indicating its relevance in the genetic framework of this subtype of MG.
title: A Myasthenia Gravis genomewide association study of three cohorts identifies Agrin as a novel risk locus

finding: The SNP rs9256943, located in the HLA-DRB1 locus, was found to be the top variant for LOMG with a p-value of 1.01x10^-20 and an odds ratio of 0.58, underscoring the significance of HLA-DRB1 in the susceptibility to this phenotype of MG.
title: A Myasthenia Gravis genomewide association study of three cohorts identifies Agrin as a novel risk locus

finding: The SNP rs113720465 was associated with an increase of 0.76 standard deviation units in C4 protein concentration, indicating a strong effect size related to C4 levels.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of neonatal Complement Component 3 and 4 protein concentrations with a focus on psychiatric and autoimmune disorders

finding: Positioned within 2Mb of the C3 gene, this SNP was tied to C3 protein concentration and involved in immune-mediated pathways.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of neonatal Complement Component 3 and 4 protein concentrations with a focus on psychiatric and autoimmune disorders

finding: This study revealed a novel association of rs10945476 with acetate levels in South Asians, a finding that had not been documented before, being located in the gene PRDM15.
title: Genome-wide association and mendelian randomisation study of metabolites and pregnancy dysglycemia in a UK multi-ethnic birth cohort

finding: This pseudogene variant was significantly associated across multiple populations (EUR, AFR, AMR) with p-values of 2.15×10^-18 and 3.88×10^-24, implicating it in broader genetic studies of ERM.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: Identified during fine-mapping, this SNP was included in credible sets for potential causal variants, aiding further investigation in ERM research.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: The SNP rs9268905 was strongly associated with TAB-positive GCA (p=1.9×10^-54, OR=1.79), indicating its relevance in diagnosing GCA.
title: Estimating overdiagnosis in giant cell arteritis diagnostic pathways using genetic data: genetic association study

finding: The SNP rs477515 also showed a strong genetic association with TAB-positive GCA (p=4.0×10^-40, OR=1.73), linking it to the disease phenotype.
title: Estimating overdiagnosis in giant cell arteritis diagnostic pathways using genetic data: genetic association study

finding: The SNP rs9275184 retained statistical significance at p<0.05 in TAB-negative cases, highlighting its potential relevance, although the association was diluted compared to TAB-positive GCA cases.
title: Estimating overdiagnosis in giant cell arteritis diagnostic pathways using genetic data: genetic association study

finding: The SNP rs2235215 near MYLIP (IDOL) was identified as a novel gain-of-function mutation significant for LDL metabolism, confirming its crucial role in LDLR degradation with therapeutic implications.
title: Lipoprotein profile and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: The lead variant rs9274619:A was significantly associated with decreased triglycerides (TG) levels only among individuals with type 2 diabetes (T2D). In the T2D group, it exhibited a negative effect on log(TG) with an estimate of -0.066 (p-value=3.9×10^-15), while showing no significant difference among non-T2D individuals (beta=0.002, p-value=0.21). This finding highlights the variant's role in TG metabolism particularly in the context of T2D and was validated in an independent cohort.
title: Genome-wide Discovery for Diabetes-Dependent Triglycerides-Associated Loci

finding: This SNP was found to be a contributing SNP to the super-variant chr6_148, which contained genetic variants related to thromboembolic disease. Gene studies indicated that variations might increase the risk of death due to excessive inflammation and thrombotic disease in COVID-19 patients.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: As a high-risk variant located at a regulatory region, rs1165183 was linked with SLC17A4 and demonstrated the ability to promote SLC17A4 expression in experimental models, thereby influencing uric acid transport.
title: Locus-specific stratification and prioritization unveil high risk genes underlying hyperuricemia

finding: The SNP rs9271609 was associated with white blood cell (WBC) traits and located on the HLA region. In conditional analyses, it showed strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the 2q31.2 duplication, suggesting it may account for the WBC association signal.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies common and rare structural variants contributing to hematologic traits in the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The SNP rs3132388, located on chromosome 6, was identified as a conditionally independent genome-wide significant SNP within a risk locus related to posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD). It was noted that this locus is situated within the major histocompatibility complex (MHC) region, which possesses a complex linkage disequilibrium structure that might not be accurately represented by reference panels.
title: Discovery of 95 PTSD loci provides insight into genetic architecture and neurobiology of trauma and stress-related disorders

finding: The SNP rs693906 was identified as the most significantly linked to schizophrenia after accounting for transdiagnostic effects, with a p-value of 2.13E-13. This SNP is located on chromosome 6 within the intron of the SLC44A4 gene, which had been previously linked to schizophrenia in a Japanese sample. This finding represented a novel association not previously reported in the original GWAS for schizophrenia.
title: Isolating transdiagnostic effects reveals specific genetic profiles in psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs9389268 was significantly associated with mitochondrial genome copy number (MT-CN) in blood-derived DNA, with P = 3.24x10^-8 in METSIM analyses. It was located in an intergenic region between the MYB and HBS1L genes, which are known hematopoietic regulators. The association suggested that variations at this locus primarily reflected blood cell composition rather than mitochondrial abundance in individual cells.
title: Mitochondrial genome copy number measured by DNA sequencing in human blood is strongly associated with metabolic traits via cell-type composition differences

finding: The rs3130618-A variant near MSH5 was associated with increased survival among TMZ-treated IDH-mutant and 1p/19q non-codeleted gliomas, with A-allele carriers experiencing a median improvement of 79.6 months in survival compared to CC genotype carriers.
title: Functional germline variants in DNA damage repair pathways are associated with altered survival in adults with glioma treated with temozolomide

finding: Variant rs2677109 was associated with multiple genes in a trans-regulatory capacity and linked with the expression of the cis-gene SUPT3H. This connection highlights the variant's potential role in the regulatory networks affecting gene expression across different cell types.
title: Single-Nucleus Atlas of Cell-Type Specific Genetic Regulation in the Human Brain

finding: Replicated with nominal significance in the DS+AVSD phenotype with p=0.042 and OR=0.82 from the previously performed GWAS.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: This SNP also showed replication (p=0.004, OR=0.77) from a past GWAS with suggestive indication in the current analysis.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: The SNP rs4151702 was identified in the 6p21.2 region colocalized with global myocardial-wall thickness at end-diastole and atrial fibrillation, with a high posterior probability (PPH4) for shared causal variant hypothesis.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs3176326 colocalized with atrial fibrillation in the 6p21.2 region, showing correlations with myocardial-wall thickness at end-diastole.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs1334489 was noted as an eQTL for CEP85L and associated with various neuropsychiatric disorders, indicating a significant genetic overlap.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The hypothyroidism-associated SNP rs9404989 in the HCG26 long non-coding RNA showed a higher odds ratio in the top quartile of FGND topic weight (1.90±0.24) than in the bottom quartile (1.19±0.13). The interaction test indicated a significance of P=1 × 10^-4, suggesting that this SNP might significantly influence comorbidities associated with FGND.
title: Age-dependent topic modelling of comorbidities in UK Biobank identifies disease subtypes with differential genetic risk

finding: The SNP rs2232423 was the most significant mRNA exonic variant identified at the 6p22.2 locus, regulating the expression of the gene ZSCAN12, which was recognized for its relationship with depression and schizophrenia.
title: Role of Blood Lipids in the Shared Genetic Etiology Between Major Depressive Disorder and Myocardial Infarction: A Large-scale Multi-trait Association Analysis

finding: The index SNP rs71557378 was identified as a genome-wide significant locus for suicide attempt (SA) in individuals of primarily European ancestry, with a reported p-value of 1.97×10^-8. This SNP contributed to the heritability of suicidal thoughts and behaviors.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis of suicide attempt identifies twelve genome-wide significant loci and implicates genetic risks for specific health factors

finding: The SNP rs13205116 showed a correlation with the choice of Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitors for first-line treatment in Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia, informing decisions on therapeutic strategies.
title: Trending Drugs Combination to Target Leukemia associated Proteins/Genes: using Graph Neural Networks under the RAIN Protocol

finding: The rs1799971 SNP located in the OPRM1 gene was well understood in its relation to perioperative management. The A>G substitution resulted in an amino acid change (p.Asn40Asp), which led to increased opioid resistance and necessitated a higher therapeutic dose in patients with AG and GG genotypes, as supported by detection of the G allele in two of five Japanese participants.
title: Rapid detection of single nucleotide polymorphisms using the MinION nanopore sequencer: a feasibility study for perioperative precision medicine

finding: This SNP was associated with higher fever events (both 37.5°C or higher and 38°C or higher) after COVID-19 mRNA vaccination, indicating a genetic predisposition to fever responses in individuals vaccinated with BNT162b1 and mRNA-1273.
title: Identification of susceptibility loci for adverse events following COVID-19 vaccination in the Japanese population: A web-based genome-wide association study

finding: Identified as one of the loci linked with muscle pain and fever responses (37.5°C or higher and 38°C or higher) after vaccination, highlighting its role in adverse reaction occurrence.
title: Identification of susceptibility loci for adverse events following COVID-19 vaccination in the Japanese population: A web-based genome-wide association study

finding: This locus was associated with muscle pain and different fever thresholds after vaccination, reinforcing its impact on vaccine-related adverse reactions.
title: Identification of susceptibility loci for adverse events following COVID-19 vaccination in the Japanese population: A web-based genome-wide association study

finding: This SNP showed association with muscle pain after vaccination, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors affecting potential adverse reactions.
title: Identification of susceptibility loci for adverse events following COVID-19 vaccination in the Japanese population: A web-based genome-wide association study

finding: This SNP was also significantly associated in the context of gene-based analysis in relation to UC and was validated in external datasets.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The SNP in HLA-DQA1 showed a significant association with a P-value of 2.20×10−14 and represented a critical marker related to UC susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The variant rs2308891 influenced significant associations at the amino acid level, indicating protective effects linked to specific DQA1 alleles.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: This multiallelic variant associated with the DRB1 gene had significant statistical support, aligning with known associations in UC pathogenesis.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: This SNP was involved in the interactions of risk alleles associated with HLA-DRB1 and presented significant associations in the study.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: This variant showed high posterior probability for height across populations and was previously implicated in type 2 diabetes.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This intronic variant was fine-mapped for coronary artery disease and co-localized with a eQTL for PHACTR1.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: SNP rs2388334, like rs12464825, was detected with weaker effects distributed across cerebellar features and also showed robust significance in the multivariate analysis.
title: The genetic architecture of human cerebellar morphology supports a key role for the cerebellum in human evolution and psychopathology

finding: This missense variant in OPRM1 was confirmed for its association with PAU in the cross-ancestry analysis, with prior reports linking it to opioid use disorder, marking a notable crossover in substance dependency studies.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The intergenic SNP rs60707664 was significantly associated with progression to dementia in PD with an HR of 2.31, indicating a potential role in the neurodegenerative process.
title: Association between the LRP1B and APOE loci and the development of Parkinson’s disease dementia

finding: This SNP was linked to decreased expression and shorter transcript length in PRDM1 (rs=-0.58, p=0.03), and was associated with higher predicted TNFα levels in the ML model, indicating reduced efficacy of BIRB796 in patients carrying this variant.
title: Combining explainable machine learning, demographic and multi-omic data to identify precision medicine strategies for inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The SNP rs9399401 was linked to paternal inheritance effects in the context of preeclampsia, highlighting the role of paternal genetic factors in this condition.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: The variant rs9273363 was identified as a known risk factor for Type 1 diabetes, with an odds ratio of 2.1 and a p-value of less than 10^-5. The minor allele frequency was 0.39 in diabetic gastroparesis cases.
title: The role of M1 to M2 macrophage polarization in the etiology of idiopathic gastroparesis: GWAS perspective

finding: The variant rs9275638 was identified in the context of diabetic gastroparesis, showing potential relevance to the disorder but primarily focusing on Type 1 diabetes associations.
title: The role of M1 to M2 macrophage polarization in the etiology of idiopathic gastroparesis: GWAS perspective

finding: This SNP was associated with HHV7 U14 antibody levels showing a significant association with MS (P=2.175e-05, adjusted P=0.002, OR=2.562), indicating a potential causal link.
title: Causal Effects of Herpesvirus-Associated Antibodies on Autoimmune neuroinflammatory diseases: Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: Found to have a strong association with HHV7 U14 antibody levels and MS (P=3.911e-12, adjusted P=4.300e-11, OR=4.277), supporting its role in MS risk.
title: Causal Effects of Herpesvirus-Associated Antibodies on Autoimmune neuroinflammatory diseases: Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: Identified as strongly associated with MS (P=1E-200) in a single SNP MR analysis, suggesting potential horizontal pleiotropy.
title: Causal Effects of Herpesvirus-Associated Antibodies on Autoimmune neuroinflammatory diseases: Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: SNP rs191786 was associated with an increased risk of MACE in African Americans, validated with an odds ratio of 1.77 (p = 0.049) for homozygous carriers of the C allele, indicating its potential impact on cardiovascular risk.
title: Investigation of genomic and transcriptomic risk factors in clopidogrel response in African Americans

finding: rs71717606 was identified as a novel locus in the Hispanic population on chromosome 6, with a significant P-value of 4.84 × 10−10, marking it as unobserved in previous GWAS studies.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: Located within an intron of the gene ROS1, rs72965321 showed significant correlations with various phenotypic traits, including brain white matter alterations.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: The SNP rs2749010 located at 6:52761774 was identified as the lead variant associated with GSTA1 in the protein quantitative trait locus (pQTL) analysis across various populations, further supporting its causal role in the development of T2D.
title: Circulating proteomic profiles are associated with the onset of type 2 diabetes in a multi-ethnic Asian population – a longitudinal study

finding: The SNP rs2187668 (risk allele T) was strongly associated with FGID status in the cohort, being identified as HLA-DQ2.5, which is noted for its common occurrence in celiac disease cases.
title: Digital Therapeutics Care Utilizing Genetic and Gut Microbiome Signals for the Management of Functional Gastrointestinal Disorders: Results from a Preliminary Retrospective Study

finding: SNP rs7775228 (risk allele C) was linked to an increase in summative symptom severity and IBS symptom severity, while also being involved in gluten sensitivity and inflammation, supporting its inclusion in care protocols.
title: Digital Therapeutics Care Utilizing Genetic and Gut Microbiome Signals for the Management of Functional Gastrointestinal Disorders: Results from a Preliminary Retrospective Study

finding: This SNP was associated with the zinc finger protein 184 locus (ZNF184), which showed significant overlap between bipolar disorder type I (BDI) and type II (BDII) with a p-value of 5.26×10^-3 in the pleioFDR analysis.
title: Patterns of convergence and divergence between bipolar disorder type I and type II: evidence from integrative genomic analyses

finding: This SNP was showcased as a shared causal variant between ASD2 and SCZ2, exhibiting significant colocalization with a posterior probability of 0.92. It was mapped to the RUNX2 gene, which is involved in a rare skeletal disorder but had previous links to ASD and SCZ.
title: Neuroimaging-AI Endophenotypes of Brain Diseases in the General Population: Towards a Dimensional System of Vulnerability

finding: This SNP was highlighted as a shared causal variant between ASD3 and SCZ with a posterior probability of -0.82. It was linked to multiple olfactory receptor genes and implicated in the dysfunction of the olfactory system in SCZ and ASD.
title: Neuroimaging-AI Endophenotypes of Brain Diseases in the General Population: Towards a Dimensional System of Vulnerability

finding: The rs2325259 SNP was identified as a lead variant within the BACH2 gene, which encodes a transcription factor that regulates gene expression. The study demonstrated that this variant is associated with hemoglobin switching and that targeting it can influence fetal hemoglobin (HbF) levels.
title: Genetic regulation of fetal hemoglobin across global populations

finding: The rs1010473 SNP was identified as a putative causal variant in high linkage disequilibrium with the lead variant rs2325259. This variant was located in a region of accessible chromatin in hematopoietic stem and progenitor cells and appeared to play a significant role in regulating BACH2 expression, affecting HbF levels.
title: Genetic regulation of fetal hemoglobin across global populations

finding: Similar to rs1010473, the rs1010474 SNP was also identified as a putative causal variant strongly linked to rs2325259. It contributed to the regulatory mechanisms influencing BACH2 expression and thereby affected HbF levels in the studied cohorts.
title: Genetic regulation of fetal hemoglobin across global populations

finding: The SNP rs9349379, located near the gene PHACTR1, was identified as a genome-wide significant variant. The G allele of this SNP was associated with lower values of notch smoothness on finger photoplethysmography, suggesting a connection to vascular physiology. The finding highlighted that this G allele conferred a higher risk of coronary artery disease but a lower risk of hypertension, indicating that hypertension was likely the primary driver influencing notch smoothness. Furthermore, this SNP played a role in vascular disease risk via the expression of EDN1, which encodes the vasoconstrictor ET-1.
title: Machine Learning to Understand Genetic and Clinical Factors Associated with the Pulse Waveform Dicrotic Notch

finding: The protective coding SNP rs143332484, associated with TREM2, was enriched in centenarians, linking it to a better neuro-immune response which may help maintain cognitive health.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: The protective allele of rs75932628 in TREM2 was enriched in centenarians, highlighting its importance in modulating microglial activation and boosting neuro-protective immune responses.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: The SNP rs679242 was identified as a significant finding associated with severe COVID-19 in relation to rheumatoid arthritis (RA), localized near the HLA-DRB1 gene with a meta P-value of 2.43×10−345.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs17425622 showed a strong association with COVID-19 hospitalization among RA patients, with a meta P-value of 5.44×10−567, indicating its importance in the genetic relationship.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: For the SNP rs2647062, a significant correlation with SARS-CoV-2 infection was found, linked to RA, with a meta P-value of 1.49×10−294.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1150753 had the strongest signal for severe COVID-19 in systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) patients, with a meta P-value of 1.73×10−69.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: For the SNP rs2855426, it was reported to be relevant in shared genetic loci for RA and COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs3130564 contributed to the genetic landscape shared between RA and COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1265093 was identified as part of the shared loci for RA and COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The known missense SNV on TREM2 was found to be exome-wide significant in all three models applied, highlighting its strong association with Alzheimer's disease.
title: A novel age-informed approach for genetic association analysis in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs11759553 was also associated with increased HbF production, contributing to 7% of variation in HbF levels and offering protection against clinical malaria while increasing gametocyte prevalence.
title: Fetal hemoglobin enables malaria parasite growth in sickle cells but augments production of transmission stage parasites

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with OUD with a p-value of 4.92×10^-09 in the European ancestry GWAS. It represents a functional variant in the OPRM1 gene, which has previously been implicated in both OUD and broader substance use disorders.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: Identified as a significant variant (p=1.11×10^-08) in the European ancestry GWAS, this SNP resides in the OPRM1 gene and was found to have low linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs1799971 (r^2=0.02), indicating it may represent an independent risk locus.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: This intronic variant in the OPRM1 gene showed a genome-wide significant association (p=1.95×10^-08) in a cross-ancestry meta-analysis. It was also confirmed as a significant risk factor for opioid addiction in previous studies.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: The fine-mapping method TGFM successfully identified the non-mediated variant rs56225074 with a posterior probability (PIP) of 0.55, linking it to the gene OVOL1 in lymphocytes for the phenotype Eczema. This finding was supported by previous knowledge that loss of OVOL1 was related to skin inflammation and immune-mediated mechanisms in T cells, demonstrating consistency with existing literature on Eczema.
title: Fine-mapping causal tissues and genes at disease-associated loci
