finding: TAGAP, linked to the rs212388 CD risk locus, had a protective rare variant. This variant (E147K) demonstrated an association with changes in expression levels, indicating a protective aspect against CD.
title: Integrated cell type-specific analysis of blood and gut identifies matching eQTL for 140 IBD risk loci and entrectinib as possible repurposing candidate

finding: The rs1819333 locus showed differential expression patterns in immune populations, linking RNASET2 expression with CD susceptibility while showing that different DAPs could match distinct EAPs.
title: Integrated cell type-specific analysis of blood and gut identifies matching eQTL for 140 IBD risk loci and entrectinib as possible repurposing candidate

finding: The SNP rs62423175 located in MTRNR2L9 was previously found to be associated with various sleep-related traits, including chronotype, duration of sleep, daytime napping, daytime sleepiness, snoring, and insomnia. This association provided a basis for examining sleep disturbances as a potential factor in the risk of esophageal adenocarcinoma (EAC), which was a primary focus of the study.
title: Association of Sleep Behaviors with Risk of Esophageal Cancer

finding: The variant rs12190287 was identified as a significant eQTL for the TCF21 gene, a known regulator of the smooth muscle cell phenotype transition to fibromyocytes in plaque, suggesting its relevant role in coronary artery disease (CAD) mechanisms.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: The variant rs1535616 served as a lead eQTL for TARID, an lncRNA that colocalized with CAD and blood pressure (BP) trait associations, indicating its potential involvement in the genetic regulation linked to CAD.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: The SNP rs75757892, linked to RREB1, demonstrated a significant differential effect on ONL thickness across the macular fields, indicating its importance in ocular phenotype variances.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs375435 showed interaction effects with VSX2 in modulating ONL thickness, underlining its relevance in influencing retinal structure.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs35049516 in SUPT3H was associated with HSM4, indicating a narrower femoral neck and larger femoral head (P = 4.3×10^−10). It was reported to be protective of OA and HOA.
title: Genome-wide association study of DXA-derived hip morphology identifies associations with 4 loci in Chinese populations

finding: The SNP rs7761119 near UST was associated with HSM8 (P = 1.7×10^−8). This SNP was reported for the first time to be associated with hip morphology and indicated a role in the musculoskeletal system.
title: Genome-wide association study of DXA-derived hip morphology identifies associations with 4 loci in Chinese populations

finding: The SNP rs13195402 was highlighted as the most significant finding in the extended MHC region, identified as a missense variant in BTN2A1 with a very low p-value (P = 5.8×10−15), indicating a strong association with bipolar disorder, forming a single association signal across the MHC region.
title: Fine-mapping genomic loci refines bipolar disorder risk genes

finding: The SNP rs1541269 represented another significant variant in the classical MHC with a p-value of 6.71×10−12. It demonstrated linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the original index SNP rs13195402 and suggested the presence of a single association signal across the MHC concerning BD, despite initial findings of associations that were dependent on conditioning.
title: Fine-mapping genomic loci refines bipolar disorder risk genes

finding: This SNP reached genome-wide significance for association with tuberculosis in previous studies (p=3.1E-05) and was successfully replicated in the FinnGen study.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: Similar to rs557011, rs9271378 showed genome-wide significant association to tuberculosis (p=8.5E-06) and was replicated in the current FinnGen research.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: This SNP was reported previously with genome-wide significance in the context of tuberculosis and was also replicated within the FinnGen cohort.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: SNP rs2894257, also from the HLA region, was found to be genome-wide significant (p=2.6E-02) in European ancestry individuals and replicated in FinnGen.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: As the lead SNP in this study, rs9391858 showed significant association with tuberculosis and was closest to gene HLA DRA within the HLA locus.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: This SNP, along with rs9391858, was found to be genome-wide significant in the study and placed in the HLA region which is critical in tuberculosis susceptibility.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: This SNP was identified in the context of respiratory TB specifically, showing a significant association (p=4.5E-09) within the HLA locus.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The SNP rs13195636 was identified as highly influential in conventional Mendelian randomization (MR) methods. It was associated with increased lymphocyte count (beta=0.014; FDR adjusted p-value=0.010) and monocyte count (beta=0.009; FDR adjusted p-value=0.045), while also being implicated in elevated neutrophil counts (beta=0.011; FDR adjusted p-value=0.028). This SNP was located at the major histocompatibility complex (MHC) on chromosome 6 and was the strongest SNP reported by the Psychiatric Genomics Consortium (PGC) for schizophrenia while also showing significant results in differential white blood cell (WBC) studies.
title: Bidirectional two-sample Mendelian randomization study of differential white blood cell count and schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs17425622 was validated as associated with Parkinson's disease in the analysis, although specific statistical results were not detailed. It was part of the group of SNPs previously recognized in studies related to the HLA locus.
title: Fine mapping of the HLA locus in Parkinson’s disease in Europeans

finding: The SNP rs2395163 was also validated for its association with Parkinson's disease, but specific p-values or statistical metrics were not provided in the context.
title: Fine mapping of the HLA locus in Parkinson’s disease in Europeans

finding: The SNP rs3129882 was reported to be associated with Parkinson's disease in previous studies, suggesting its potential influence via differential expression of HLA genes, even though the current study's main focus was on amino acid changes.
title: Fine mapping of the HLA locus in Parkinson’s disease in Europeans

finding: The SNP rs9275326 was validated in the context of its association with Parkinson's disease, conforming to findings from earlier research regarding this SNP's significance in the HLA locus.
title: Fine mapping of the HLA locus in Parkinson’s disease in Europeans

finding: The SNP rs1040574 was found to be an independent locus in the PA-FGRS GWAS with a beta of -0.011 and a p-value of 3.3 × 10^-8. This indicates a notable genetic association with MDD, and it also demonstrated consistent effects in a separate MDD GWAS conducted by Howard et al.
title: PA-FGRS is a novel estimator of pedigree-based genetic liability that complements genotype-based inferences into the genetic architecture of major depressive disorder

finding: The SNP rs3777421 was located 36.3Kb from rs1040574 and was also part of the GWAS of binary diagnoses, showing a beta of -0.073 and a p-value of 4.6 × 10^-8. This genetic variant was confirmed to have a consistent association with MDD in the study by Howard et al.
title: PA-FGRS is a novel estimator of pedigree-based genetic liability that complements genotype-based inferences into the genetic architecture of major depressive disorder

finding: There was a trend indicating a higher echocardiographic calcium score (eCS) in patients carrying the G allele of rs10455872, a SNP associated with aortic stenosis, though the result did not reach statistical significance.
title: Screening for Cardiac Disease with Genetic risk scoring, Advanced ECG, Echocardiography, Protein Biomarkers and Metabolomics

finding: The SNP rs9470000 was newly identified in African Americans, showcasing its potential association with pain intensity in chronic pain studies.
title: The genetic architecture of pain intensity in a sample of 598,339 U.S. veterans

finding: The variant rs766406 at locus 6p22.2 was linked to chronotype and showed shared genetic influences with DTI parameters.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: The variant rs2207944 at locus 6q14.2 was associated with snoring and thickness of the inner nuclear layer across subfields in the eye.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: The variant rs7752421 at locus 6q14.2 showed its association with average INL thickness and was related to multiple sleep traits.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: Identified in the HLA region, rs9275602 was significantly associated with PSA levels, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors influencing prostate cancer diagnostics.
title: Incorporating Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Improves Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP in JARID2 was found to be significantly associated with levels of PSA, suggesting its potential role in genetic risk assessment.
title: Incorporating Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Improves Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs9321878 was located within an intron of the HIVEP2 gene at locus 6q24.2. It was identified as a variant that could influence the transcriptional changes in circulating extracellular vesicles (EVs) related to obesity. Furthermore, Hi-C contacts indicated that this SNP was situated in a regulatory element that interacted with the neighboring gene PEX3. In a murine model, knockout of PEX3 led to a classic metabolic phenotype, suggesting that the regulatory impact of rs9321878 might have significant implications in metabolic disorders associated with obesity.
title: The extracellular vesicle transcriptome provides tissue-specific functional genomic annotation relevant to disease susceptibility in obesity

finding: The top SNP found in HLA region, rs28895246, was strongly correlated with mumps-specific IFN-γ secretion, achieving a p-value of 8.97E-14, indicating its notable role in immune response.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: This top SNP in the HLA region was significantly correlated with IL-2 secretion, reaching a p-value of 1.11E-16, illustrating its associated impact on immune responses.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: This SNP was previously links to mumps susceptibility and was highlighted as associated with immune responses in earlier studies, suggesting its influence on the mumps vaccine response.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: Located in 6q16.1, rs11759769 was associated with migraine and colocalized with functional connectivity changes in the default mode network during resting fMRI.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The SNP rs11152952 was identified in relation to migraine and showed colocalization effects with functional connectivity in the default mode network during resting fMRI.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The risk-associated SNP rs2971609 was identified in the 6q16.1 region, correlated with cerebral blood flow metrics.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The rs9352691/PHIP variant was associated with multiple heart failure risk factors including blood pressure, body mass index (BMI), high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C), alcohol consumption, and atrial fibrillation (AF).
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify drug targets for heart failure

finding: The rs10455872/PLG variant was among those previously reported with heart failure associations and demonstrated significance in the context of heart failure risk.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify drug targets for heart failure

finding: The SNP rs7773324 was reported as the top lead SNP for the gene IRF4, showing a P-value of 7.8×10^-7, along with a high CADD score indicating its functional importance.
title: Integrated multi-omics data analysis identifies a novel genetics-risk gene of IRF4 associated with prognosis of oral cavity cancer

finding: The C282Y mutation at this SNP in the HFE gene was rediscovered in this study, confirming its previous associations with iron overload traits, particularly in the Hemochromatosis Brain context, with a p-value of 6.93×10⁻⁷⁵.
title: Hemochromatosis Neural Archetype Reveals Iron Disruption in Motor Circuits

finding: Findings indicated that rs130067, related to CCHCR1, combined with CMB 216 also significantly influenced individuals' responses to NADT, as evidenced by statistical mediation analysis (total effect p < 0.05; average causal mediation effects p < 0.05). It provided important prognostic value in the context of adjusting for CMBs and various clinical metrics.
title: AI-Powered cellular morphometric biomarkers discovered in needle biopsy of prostatic cancer predict neoadjuvant androgen deprivation therapy response and prognosis: an international multicenter retrospective study

finding: The SNP rs217291 was found within the gene body of SNAP91. IsoTWAS identified a significant association of the isoform ENST00000519133 with schizophrenia risk, with an adjusted P value of 6.06 × 10^-7. SNAP91 is implicated in synaptic development, affecting clathrin and phosphatidylinositol binding activity.
title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: The SNP rs10455872 located in the SLC22A3/LPA locus was associated with relative biomarker change, having a beta of -0.148 and a p-value of 5.07e-16.
title: Leveraging large-scale biobank EHRs to enhance pharmacogenetics of cardiometabolic disease medications

finding: The common variant rs1050462 in the HLA-B locus was linked to NPC susceptibility with significant evidence, marking it as a novel discovery in this context.
title: Large-Scale Whole-Exome Sequencing Association Study Implicates Genetic Effects on Viral Oncogenesis and Tumor Microenvironment in Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs9274477 was linked to the gene HLA-DQB1, showing overlap in meQTL associations found in neutrophils and T cells of lupus patients. This suggests its involvement in the autoimmune processes associated with lupus.
title: Hypomethylation of miR-17-92 cluster in lupus T cells and no significant role for genetic factors in the lupus-associated DNA methylation signature

finding: The SNP rs12203592 in the IRF4 gene was found to have enhanced effect sizes for SCC risk in SOTRs with newly derived weights leading to improved risk prediction.
title: Re-weighting MC1R, ASIP and IRF4 risk variants optimises polygenic risk scores for keratinocyte cancer stratification in solid organ transplant recipients

finding: The rs143334143:A variant in the MHC region was associated with severe COVID-19 cases compared to COVID-19 negative or unknown cases, having a MAF of 7%, an OR of 1.32, and a p-value of 3×10^-4.
title: Common genetic variants identify targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: The SNP rs1063478 in HLA-DMA was associated with better outcomes in chronic hepatitis C virus type 1 patients receiving interferon/ribavirin therapy, and low expression of HLA-DMA was linked to reduced survival in lung adenocarcinoma patients, thus indicating its relationship with various cancers.
title: Gene-based Hardy–Weinberg equilibrium test using genotype count data identifies novel cancer-related genes

finding: The SNP rs12206298, located intronic to ANKS1A on chromosome 6, exhibited a suggestive association with celiac disease with an initial p-value of 4.1 × 10^-7, which passed genome-wide significance after conditional association with a p-value of 4.9 × 10^-8.
title: Joint analysis reveals shared autoimmune disease associations and identifies common mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs4713844 demonstrated a secondary independent effect in celiac disease, with a p-value of 9.9 × 10^-8 after the identification of rs12206298 as part of the continued association analysis.
title: Joint analysis reveals shared autoimmune disease associations and identifies common mechanisms

finding: The minor allele (G) of rs55966428 was linked to decreased expression of both BMP6 and IFNB1 following Mtb infection, highlighting its effect on immune modulation.
title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis-dependent Monocyte Expression Quantitative Trait Loci and Tuberculosis Pathogenesis

finding: Evidence suggested that rs6924573 was linked to MAS1 expression and had a role in regulating IL6 levels, further connecting it to inflammatory signaling in the context of Mtb infection.
title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis-dependent Monocyte Expression Quantitative Trait Loci and Tuberculosis Pathogenesis

finding: The SNP rs13191376 in <italic>RUNX2</italic> was associated with CCT in a cross-ancestry GWAS, supporting the contribution of this transcription factor to the variation in CCT.
title: Mendelian randomization analysis identified genes pleiotropically associated with central corneal thickness

finding: The SNP rs1755056 in <italic>RUNX2</italic> was significantly associated with intraocular pressure and weakly associated with primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG) in a GWAS combing data from the UK Biobank and the International Glaucoma Genetic Consortium.
title: Mendelian randomization analysis identified genes pleiotropically associated with central corneal thickness

finding: The locus indexed by rs9369062 was associated with sleep proxy phenotypes, particularly timing of TLA, supporting its influence on sleep pattern metrics.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identified novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: In the 6q16.1 region, the rs11759769 variant was associated with migraine and influenced connectivity in the auditory and cingulo-opercular networks.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The rs2971609 variant in the 6q16.1 region was linked to cerebrovascular traits and showed significant associations with cerebral blood flow measures, underscoring its implications for vascular health.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: A statistically significant interaction was observed for rs3765467 in the GLP1R gene with baseline weight, indicating a weight change of 0.09 kg from baseline weight after GLP1-RA treatment.
title: Association between plausible genetic factors and weight loss from GLP1-RA and bariatric surgery: a multi-ancestry study in 10 960 individuals from 9 biobanks

finding: The variant rs6923761 in the GLP1R gene showed a nominally significant interaction with baseline weight, demonstrating a weight change of 0.02 kg from baseline weight following GLP1-RA treatment.
title: Association between plausible genetic factors and weight loss from GLP1-RA and bariatric surgery: a multi-ancestry study in 10 960 individuals from 9 biobanks

finding: rs9376090 was associated with acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) with genome-wide significance (P = 8.23 x 10^-9, OR = 1.27). This association was driven primarily by non-Latino white (NLW) participants. Subsequently, the association was replicated in an independent cohort.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The SNP rs9388010, located within the GJA1 gene, was associated with pulse rate in African individuals. This intergenic variant was identified as a novel finding and corresponds to a variant with a significantly higher minor allele frequency in Africans (frequency = 0.54) compared to Europeans (frequency = 0.1), highlighting its potential relevance in cardiovascular traits specific to the African population.
title: Distinct Genetic Loci and Variations in Blood Pressure and Pulse Rate in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs7750412, an intergenic variant associated with pulse rate in Europeans, exhibited a significantly higher frequency in Europeans (frequency = 0.80) compared to Africans (frequency = 0.25). This finding was established through a genome-wide association study and represents a significant contributor to cardiovascular traits within the European ancestry.
title: Distinct Genetic Loci and Variations in Blood Pressure and Pulse Rate in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs196023 was identified as the most likely causal variant for diastolic blood pressure (DBP) in Europeans, located at locus 6p22.3 within the CASC15 gene. Although not previously linked specifically to DBP, CASC15 has associations with various cardiovascular traits including systolic blood pressure (SBP) and cardiovascular disease, providing new insights into the genetic underpinnings of cardiovascular health.
title: Distinct Genetic Loci and Variations in Blood Pressure and Pulse Rate in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank

finding: It was among the strong associated SNPs with colorectal cancer (CRC) found in the DEPTH analysis, particularly in the HLA locus at 6p21, showing significant association in both CCFR and GECCO datasets.
title: Using DEPendency of association on the number of Top Hits (DEPTH) as a complementary tool to identify novel risk loci in colorectal cancer

finding: This SNP was identified as significantly associated with CRC in the DEPTH approach, located within the HLA region at 6p21, consistent across both CCFR and GECCO studies.
title: Using DEPendency of association on the number of Top Hits (DEPTH) as a complementary tool to identify novel risk loci in colorectal cancer

finding: Found to be a strong associated SNP for CRC in the DEPTH analysis conducted, also located within the influential HLA locus at 6p21, validated by both CCFR and GECCO datasets.
title: Using DEPendency of association on the number of Top Hits (DEPTH) as a complementary tool to identify novel risk loci in colorectal cancer

finding: Identified as a strong associated SNP for CRC in both CCFR and GECCO datasets through DEPTH analysis, also situated in the HLA risk region at 6p21.
title: Using DEPendency of association on the number of Top Hits (DEPTH) as a complementary tool to identify novel risk loci in colorectal cancer

finding: This SNP was the strongest associated variant identified in the GECCO dataset for CRC risk, specifically within the HLA region at 6p21, demonstrating the effectiveness of DEPTH.
title: Using DEPendency of association on the number of Top Hits (DEPTH) as a complementary tool to identify novel risk loci in colorectal cancer

finding: This SNP was one of the six lead SNPs from conventional GWAS that was also located within the commonly identified DEPTH risk regions, having been detected in comparison with other analysis methods.
title: Using DEPendency of association on the number of Top Hits (DEPTH) as a complementary tool to identify novel risk loci in colorectal cancer

finding: The minor allele C at rs199659767 was associated with significant changes in the expression of the ZPF57 gene in dendritic cells with a p-value of 1.8 x 10^-31, highlighting its potential role in immune response variance.
title: History of tuberculosis disease is associated with genetic regulatory variation in Peruvians

finding: This novel intronic variant in MLN was associated with AUD and had previous associations with smoking and depression.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: This variant near CDC5L exhibited significant associations with AUD.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: This SNP was identified as a low-frequency lead variant located in the intronic region of the SYNE1 gene, which is crucial for nuclear envelope integrity. A splice donor loss was predicted for this variant, contributing to atrial fibrillation (AF) susceptibility.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: This SNP was found associated with height and body mass index, pointing towards its relevance in metabolic syndrome characteristics that may overlap with AF risk.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: This SNP was associated with body mass index and had implications in metabolic pathways linked to AF risk.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: This SNP was associated with anti-VZV IgG level and corroborated previous findings, indicating it plays a role in the immune response to varicella-zoster virus (VZV).
title: Exploring the possible causal role of the immune response to varicella-zoster virus on multiple traits: a phenome-wide Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was linked to higher anti-VZV IgG levels and congruent with earlier studies, suggesting a consistent role in the body's immune response to VZV.
title: Exploring the possible causal role of the immune response to varicella-zoster virus on multiple traits: a phenome-wide Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP also demonstrated a significant association with anti-VZV IgG levels, consistent with earlier GWAS findings, indicating its importance in VZV immunity.
title: Exploring the possible causal role of the immune response to varicella-zoster virus on multiple traits: a phenome-wide Mendelian randomization study

finding: Found to be associated with anti-VZV IgG levels, this SNP confirmed its role in influencing the humoral immune response to varicella-zoster virus as per previous studies.
title: Exploring the possible causal role of the immune response to varicella-zoster virus on multiple traits: a phenome-wide Mendelian randomization study

finding: Associated with severe COVID-19, this SNP exhibited an odds ratio of 1.09 in the current analysis compared to 1.3 reported by Pairo-Castineira et al. It was part of the genetic regions that overlapped with broader COVID-19 susceptibility analyses.
title: Genetic associations with severe COVID-19

finding: This SNP was positively associated with cardiovascular traits, showing strong significance in the African cohort (AFR, MTAG p=2.8×10^-10) and also replicated in the European cohort (EUR, MTAG p=2.0×10^-8).
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: This variant demonstrated significant association with cardiovascular traits in both the EUR group (p=4.4×10^-13) and replicated in the AFR population (p=1.3×10^-9).
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: This SNP exhibited significant associations with cardiovascular traits, with EUR population showing p=7.9×10^-9 and similarly significant results in the AFR population (p=7.1×10^-9).
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: Previously linked to multiple cardiovascular traits including heart rate, this SNP showed strong significance in the AFR cohort (MTAG p=1.1×10^-10) and was replicated in the EUR population (MTAG p=1.8×10^-72).
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: The SNP rs1800562, which corresponds to the HFE gene, was rediscovered in this study as it is associated with the C282Y mutation, previously linked with hemochromatosis. It had a significance level of p=6.93x10^-75, highlighting its importance in iron metabolism and potential relation to Parkinson's Disease.
title: Neural Archetypes Learnt from Hemochromatosis Reveals Iron Dysregulation in Motor Circuits

finding: The finding related to SNP rs9265880 indicated an increase in significance for association with HIV-1 set point viral load (spVL) in the major histocompatibility complex (MHC) region, where the p-value improved from 3.5 × 10−07 to 7.7 × 10−09 when accounting for phylogenetic information of the pathogen strain.
title: A phylogeny-aware GWAS framework to correct for heritable pathogen effects on infectious disease traits

finding: The SNP rs4443534 in the NUS1 gene was associated with altered type 2 diabetes risk. This association suggested that variants in the NUS1 gene might influence glucose metabolism and diabetes progression, corroborating findings linking the gene product NogoB to insulin signaling and other mechanisms relevant to diabetes.
title: Novel biomarkers for glycaemic deterioration in type 2 diabetes: an IMI RHAPSODY study

finding: The SNP rs13195636 was identified as highly influential and pleiotropic in conventional Mendelian randomization (MR) methods. It was associated with both schizophrenia and differential white blood cell (WBC) counts. The analysis indicated that it had the smallest p-value in the schizophrenia GWAS, suggesting a significant role in influencing schizophrenia risk and WBC count variations, particularly lymphocyte and eosinophil counts. The estimation showed that schizophrenia could cause an increase in lymphocyte count (OR=1.080; FDR adjusted p-value=0.010) and eosinophil count (OR=1.050; FDR adjusted p-value=0.010). Furthermore, this SNP is located at the major histocompatibility complex on chromosome 6, a region implicated in neurodevelopment and immune regulation, which supports the hypothesis of neuroinflammation in schizophrenia.
title: Bidirectional two-sample mendelian randomization study of differential white blood cell count and schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs9273363 was associated with Long COVID (OR=1.06, p=3.79X10^-11), indicating a potential role in the immune response related to the condition. It showed consistent effect sizes across European, Latinx, and African-American ancestries.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of Long COVID identifies immune-related loci and etiological links to chronic fatigue syndrome, fibromyalgia and depression

finding: Associated with Long COVID (OR=0.91, p=1.18X10^-09), this indel variant in the MICA-MICB intergenic region displayed significant linkage with pQTL signals linked to MICB protein.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of Long COVID identifies immune-related loci and etiological links to chronic fatigue syndrome, fibromyalgia and depression

finding: The rs1265081 variant located in the CCHCR1 gene was identified as associated with RT-induced oral mucositis in HNC patients, implicating pathways involved in keratinocyte proliferation and differentiation as significant in the context of radiation therapy.
title: Systematic Review of Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Acute Pain and Relevant Acute Toxicities Induced by Radiotherapy for Head and Neck Cancer

finding: The SNP rs67714619 near PTPRK demonstrated a GWS association in Hispanic participants with P=2.4×10^-8 and OR=1.34, suggesting increased risk.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis of 56,241 individuals identifies LRRC4C, LHX5-AS1 and nominates ancestry-specific loci PTPRK, GRB14, and KIAA0825 as novel risk loci for Alzheimer’s disease: the Alzheimer’s Disease Genetics Consortium

finding: The SNP rs13206045 at the SYNE1 locus (6q25.1) was significant at a Bonferroni-corrected threshold with a p-value of 3.20x10^-4, related to endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: Located in the HLA region, this SNP is associated with several plausible candidate genes and is novel in the context of this GWAS.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This SNP was identified as novel in the study and is associated with ATG5 and PRDM1, important genes in immune function.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: Associated with AHI1, this SNP was novel in the context of AD and had critical implications for immune system expression.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: The SNP rs2516396 colocalized with the CpG cg11554650 (PPP1R18) and was associated with type 2 diabetes. This association explained 100% of the observed PPFC, indicating a strong link between DNA methylation at this locus and the diabetes phenotype.
title: Elucidating the genetic architecture of DNA methylation to identify promising molecular mechanisms of disease

finding: This SNP was reported for the first time in relation to autism and intersected with twelve associations identified in the landmark common genetic variants of autism study.
title: Exploring autism and autism co-occurring condition associations to elucidate multivariate genetic mechanisms and insights

finding: This SNP was linked to increased neutrophil extracellular traps and citrullinated epitopes in SLE patients and is associated with the TNFAIP3 gene, an SLE risk factor.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: The SNP rs9347480 was associated with increased prostate cancer risk, showing the risk allele C linked to a significant p-value of 1.41 x 10^-07. Additionally, this allele correlated with decreased protein expression (p = 4.57 x 10^-33) and decreased gene expression (p = 0.038) in prostate tumor samples compared to normal samples, suggesting a role for the protein plasminogen (PLG) as a potential tumor suppressor.
title: Large-scale integration of omics and electronic health records to identify potential risk protein biomarkers and therapeutic drugs for cancer prevention and intervention

finding: The variant rs75932628 was identified as a genome-wide significant missense variant causing an amino acid substitution from arginine to histidine (p.R47H) in exon 2 of TREM2. This variant had a CADD score of 26.1 and was significant in both the discovery dataset (P=2.55×10-9) and replication dataset (P=8.71×10-7), linking it to the risk of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s disease/Dementia

finding: The variant rs143332484 caused an amino acid substitution from arginine to histidine (p.R62H) in exon 2 of TREM2 and was associated with reduced ligand affinity, signaling response, and phagocytosis of lipoprotein in microglia. This variant was moderately significant in the discovery dataset (P=4.37×10-5) and almost moderately significant in the replication dataset (P=1.30×10-4), indicating its relevance to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s disease/Dementia

finding: This pLOF variant, rs104894002, was found to cause a stop gain (p.Q33S) in exon 2 of TREM2. It was identified in the replication dataset (MAF=4.56×10-5, P=8.86×10-6) and has been previously linked to Alzheimer's disease cases.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s disease/Dementia

finding: The SNP rs3132386 was identified as a primary signal associated with schizophrenia (SCZ) and showed pleiotropic effects alongside rs16897420 on the CpG cg15026241.
title: Potentially causal associations between placental DNA methylation and schizophrenia and other neuropsychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs16897420 served as a secondary signal for schizophrenia (SCZ) and was correlated with the CpG site cg15026241, impacting the expression of ZSCAN23 in fetal placenta.
title: Potentially causal associations between placental DNA methylation and schizophrenia and other neuropsychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs17754910 was identified as exceeding genome-wide significance with a p value of 4.73 x 10^-9 in a haplotype-based association study. This marker was located within a region enriched with regulatory elements and was associated with early-onset breast cancer (EOBC) phenotype.
title: Retrospective analysis of The Two Sister Study using haplotype-based association testing to identify loci associated with early-onset breast cancer

finding: In the analysis, the SNP rs1800562, located in the HFE gene, was found to be associated with serum iron levels. This SNP is carried by approximately 5-10% of the European population, suggesting a potential role in iron absorption and metabolism, which might influence brain iron depositions related to alcohol consumption.
title: Impact of moderate alcohol consumption on brain iron and cognition: observational and genetic analyses

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs1799945, also in the HFE gene and carried by about 15% of Europeans, was assessed. It showed associations with increased serum iron levels, thereby contributing to the understanding of how genetic variations could affect systemic iron levels and subsequently brain iron accumulation in the context of alcohol use.
title: Impact of moderate alcohol consumption on brain iron and cognition: observational and genetic analyses

finding: The SNP rs12190287 in the TCF21 gene was found to be associated with coronary atherosclerosis using the combined genetic approach. This finding aligned with earlier studies that indicated its association with coronary artery disease.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs10455872, located in the LPA gene, was associated with hypercholesterolemia via the CC-liability method. Its significance was previously validated in other studies of the UK Biobank, underscoring its role in lipid metabolism.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs71717606, located on chromosome 6, presented a novel finding in the GWAS for the Hispanic population with a P-value of 4.84 × 10^-10. This insertion/deletion is situated within an intron of the DCBLD1 gene.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: The SNP rs72965321 was associated with skin color and white matter tracts in the hippocampus, identified in the fine mapping analysis.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: The rs833061 SNP showed a significant risk for schizophrenia, particularly more prevalent in undifferentiated forms. It was also reported to impact patients' symptomatology.
title: Association of VEGF and KDR polymorphisms with the development of schizophrenia

finding: The rs3025039 SNP indicated a significant risk for schizophrenia in the examined population. It was noted to be one of the crucial polymorphisms analyzed in relation to schizophrenia.
title: Association of VEGF and KDR polymorphisms with the development of schizophrenia

finding: The likely pathogenic variant p.A125V in TNFAIP3 was associated with familial autoinflammatory, Behcet-like syndrome (OMIM: 616744) and was significantly enriched in the Sub-Saharan African subpopulation of Qatar with an allele frequency (AF) of 1.6%, compared to 0.16% in the global gnomAD V2 dataset.
title: Genetic landscape of rare autoinflammatory disease variants in Qatar and Middle Eastern populations through the integration of whole-genome and exome datasets

finding: Located in an intergenic region on chromosome 19, this SNP was found to be study wide significant in relation to cognitive measures.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: Located in the 3’ UTR of BACH2, this SNP showed significance in association with Parietal Lobe cortical thickness and a neuroprotective effect.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: Located near HLA-B, this SNP retained study-wide significance in cognitive measures after accounting for APOE allele status.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: Near HLA-DPB1, this SNP was significant after adjusting for APOE and implicated in cognitive measures.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: The significant SNP rs4712314 linked to KIF13A exhibited a p-value of 2.37 × 10^-7 with a beta of 0.27.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The TNXB gene's identified SNP rs367364 gave a significant p-value of 7.07 × 10^-7.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: This SNP was replicated in the GWAS for gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) and was found to be genome-wide significant, indicating its importance in the genetic component of GDM.
title: Genetic studies of gestational diabetes mellitus in 21,813 Chinese women

finding: Identified as an independent signal in the COJO analysis for GDM risk, this SNP reflects a significant genetic factor associated with GDM.
title: Genetic studies of gestational diabetes mellitus in 21,813 Chinese women

finding: The SNP rs9274619:A was significantly associated with decreased triglyceride (TG) levels specifically among individuals with type 2 diabetes (T2D), with a log(TG) beta estimate of -0.066 (95% CI: -0.082, -0.050) and a highly significant p-value (3.9×10^-15). The allele was enriched in T2D cases with lower TG concentrations, indicating its potential role in the metabolic regulation associated with T2D, while showing no effect in non-T2D individuals.
title: Genome-wide Discovery for Diabetes-Dependent Triglycerides-Associated Loci

finding: The SNP rs7766070, situated within the CDKAL1 gene, was found to be significantly associated with GDM susceptibility, presenting an odds ratio of 1.27 and a p-value of 8.07×10^-12. This finding contributed to the overall understanding of genetic factors linked to GDM.
title: Genome-wide association and Mendelian randomisation analysis among 30,699 Chinese pregnant women identifies novel genetic and molecular risk factors for gestational diabetes and glycaemic traits

finding: The intronic SNP rs2076295 in the DSP gene showed a positive association with IPF, revealing an OR of 1.31 (95% CI 1.00-1.63). This suggests that the G allele might increase susceptibility to the disease.
title: Genetic landscape of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: A systematic review, meta-analysis and epidemiological evidence of case-control studies

finding: The rs1800562 SNP was associated with disorders of iron metabolism, involving a p.Cys282Tyr mutation in HFE, with an extremely low P-value of 1×10^-178.
title: Leveraging large-scale multi-omics to identify therapeutic targets from genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs557074 was part of an ATAC peak that did not show significant peak-gene correlation in healthy oligodendrocytes, indicating a lack of association in healthy conditions. In contrast, it demonstrated associations with gene expression specifically in disease-associated oligodendrocytes, suggesting a role in the pathology of Parkinson's disease.
title: Single-nuclei paired multiomic analysis of young, aged, and Parkinson’s disease human midbrain reveals age- and disease-associated glial changes and their contribution to Parkinson’s disease

finding: In the study by Chu et al. (2021), the exonic variant rs9479297 located in the SYNE1 gene was reported to contribute to the development of concurrent hepatocellular and transitional cell carcinoma in patients with double primary cancer. This finding highlighted the role of this SNP in cancer genetics, suggesting it has implications in tumor growth.
title: Multiparametric MRI Along with Machine Learning Informs on Molecular Underpinnings, Prognosis, and Treatment Response in Pediatric Low-Grade Glioma

finding: The SNP rs9349050 was identified as a significant genetic variant linked to the protein MDGA1. This variant differentiated levels of MDGA1 and its metabolite, 1-Arachidonoylglycerol (1-AG), in individuals with different genotypes, suggesting a genetic basis for their co-regulation.
title: Longitudinal analysis of genetic and environmental interplay in human metabolic profiles and the implication for metabolic health

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with severe COVID-19 cases compared to COVID-19 negative or unknown, having a MAF of 7%, OR of 1.36, and a significant P-value of 6×10^(-4).
title: Common genetic variants identify therapeutic targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: The SNP rs9267499, located in the HSPA1A gene, demonstrated a strong association with mLOX susceptibility, particularly driven by the Finnish subpopulation where the risk allele had a higher frequency (16%). The meta-analysis revealed a P-value of 1.4 x 10^-21, indicating significant genetic influence on mLOX.
title: Population analyses of mosaic X chromosome loss identify genetic drivers and widespread signatures of cellular selection

finding: The SNP rs2448705 in the CENPQ gene showed an OR of 0.96 for mLOX susceptibility, indicating a protective effect, while it had no significant association with mLOY, affirming its specificity to mLOX.
title: Population analyses of mosaic X chromosome loss identify genetic drivers and widespread signatures of cellular selection

finding: The SNP rs9398805, located in the CENPW gene, was identified as a significant variant for mLOX with associations linked to autoimmune diseases, showcasing its potential genetic contribution to immune-related phenotypes.
title: Population analyses of mosaic X chromosome loss identify genetic drivers and widespread signatures of cellular selection

finding: The variant rs533280354 was identified as a novel East Asian-specific risk variant located in the 5'UTR of the FKBP5 gene. It disrupted the binding of the transcription factor KLF15, leading to decreased transcription of FKBP5. This variant was significantly associated with high myopia (HM) with a P-value of 1.3 × 10^-9 and corroborated by functional assays that demonstrated reduced transcriptional activity when the G-to-A transition occurred.
title: Sequencing of 19,219 exomes identifies a low-frequency variant in FKBP5 promoter predisposing to high myopia in a Han Chinese population

finding: The low-frequency variant rs35985881 in the intron region of RIPOR2 was found to be associated with high myopia, showing a P-value of 2.36 × 10^-7 in association analysis.
title: Sequencing of 19,219 exomes identifies a low-frequency variant in FKBP5 promoter predisposing to high myopia in a Han Chinese population

finding: Similar to rs35985881, the variant rs35730227 in the intron region of RIPOR2 was associated with high myopia with a strong P-value of 2.26 × 10^-9.
title: Sequencing of 19,219 exomes identifies a low-frequency variant in FKBP5 promoter predisposing to high myopia in a Han Chinese population

finding: The SNP rs146918648 was found to be significantly associated with the female PTS factor 1 (PTS-f1) with a beta of -0.072 and a p-value of 6.73×10^-9. It was positionally mapped to an intronic region of the SCAND3 gene, which had been previously implicated in studies of well-being, depressive symptoms, and positive affect.
title: Sex-stratified genomic structural equation models of posttraumatic stress inform PTSD etiology

finding: The SNP rs4406273 served as a proxy for HLA-C*06:02 status, which indicated a significant association with the clinical presentation of psoriasis. Individuals carrying one or two copies of the A allele of rs4406273 were classified as HLA-C*06:02-positive and showed a notably lower level of hsCRP, which is a marker of systemic inflammation. Additionally, these individuals exhibited an increased prevalence of atrial fibrillation and a decreased prevalence of migraine when compared to HLA-C*06:02-negative individuals. This finding supported the hypothesis regarding altered inflammatory processes and potential comorbid conditions related to psoriasis.
title: Body Composition, Cardiometabolic Risk Factors and Comorbidities in Psoriasis and the Effect of HLA-C*06:02 Status: The HUNT Study, Norway

finding: The SNP rs9357455 was associated with early-onset AMI, being positioned upstream of PHACTR1, which regulates inflammation. It exhibited an OR of 0.666 and a p-value of 9.73 × 10−6.
title: Genome-wide analyses of early-onset acute myocardial infarction identify 29 novel loci by whole genome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs150899739, present in SASH1 at 6q24, significantly increased the risk of HPC in the Mixed ancestry with an OR of 5.84 (95% CI: 3.17, 10.76; p=1.47×10^-8).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The rs28360051 variant near PSORS1C3 was found to increase HNSCC risk, especially correlating with HPV(+) OPC.
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The intronic variant rs1536036 in ITPR3 was protective for overall HNSCC with an OR of 0.85 (95% CI: 0.80, 0.91; p=8.42×10^-7) among admixed populations.
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The variant rs4143334 located in ZDHHC20P2 increased risk for HPV(+) OPC with an OR of 1.89 (95% CI: 1.51, 2.35; p=1.91×10^-8).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The novel variant rs2523679 was associated with decreased risk of HPV(+) OPC (OR: 0.63, 95% CI: 0.53, 0.75; p=2.26×10^-7).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The functional variant rs1131212 in HLA-B conferred increased risk of HPV(-) OPC with an OR of 1.33 (95% CI: 1.19, 1.49; p=5.33×10^-7).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The variant rs1264813 in HLA-A showed similar risk effects to other related functional variants indicating a consistent pattern of increased risk.
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The SNP rs9268925 was significantly associated with a novel risk haplotype in decreased risk of OC (OR: 0.80, 95% CI: 0.73, 0.86; p=2.15×10^-8).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The novel variant rs9267280 was linked to increased OC risk specifically within the European ancestry with OR reported as 1.32 (95% CI: 1.19, 1.47; p=3.48×10^-7).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The variant rs4990036 showed association with non-HPV infections and was related to varicella zoster, highlighting its impact in cancer risk.
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The SNP rs28414666 was associated with pernicious anemia (p=1.40 × 10⁻¹⁶, OR=1.38) and was located within the HLA-DQB1 gene, which is integral in autoimmune responses.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies five risk loci for pernicious anemia and implicates the role of HLA-DR15 haplotype

finding: The SNP rs76826738, located in an intron of SMOC2, achieved genome-wide significance with a p value of 2.95 x 10^-8 in the T.b. gambiense case-control contrast. This finding suggested a substantial association with the risk of HAT (human African trypanosomiasis), indicating potential importance in understanding the genetic susceptibility to the disease.
title: A Genome-Wide Association Study Reveals Novel Genetic Markers Associated with Human African Trypanosomiasis

finding: The SNP rs17843689 was demonstrated to influence the structure in the first two principal components of the African (AFR) super-population in the 1000 Genomes project dataset. Analysis showed that samples with varying genotypes (0, 1, or 2 effect alleles) clustered distinctly in PCA space, indicating a potential association of this SNP with population stratification or phenotype differences.
title: Simulating genetic risk scores from summary statistics with an application to type 1 diabetes

finding: The variant chr6:29820015:AAAAT:A, which is synonymous with rs144943243 in this context, had a strong association with severe reactions to COVID-19 vaccination, indicated by a p-value of 3.51E-11, reinforcing the importance of this genetic location.
title: HLA-A*03:01 is associated with increased risk of fever, chills, and more severe reaction to Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccination

finding: The rare variant rs144171242 at 6p21.1, located in an intron of the PTK7 gene, exhibited a statistically significant association with PUV (P=2.02x10^-8; OR 7.20) based on the mixed ancestry analysis. In replication, this variant also indicated association but with a smaller effect size (P=4.5x10^-3; OR 2.17). The variant was highlighted for its potential regulatory role in mesendoderm cells and its association with congenital defects, underlining a link to embryonic development.
title: Mixed ancestry analysis of whole-genome sequencing identifies TBX5 and PTK7 as susceptibility genes for posterior urethral valves

finding: Identified as a novel AD-associated locus within the SASH1 gene, this SNP exhibited significant interaction effects with the APOE SNP (rs429358) relating to AD.
title: Novel Alzheimer’s disease genes and epistasis identified using machine learning GWAS platform

finding: This SNP associated with SASH1 was noted for its role in a triplet interaction with APOE (rs429358) and ACOT11 (rs7552961), which was crucial in revealing complex interactions associated with AD.
title: Novel Alzheimer’s disease genes and epistasis identified using machine learning GWAS platform

finding: The SNP rs9268848 was identified from enQTL-colocalized events related to the genes HLA-DQA1 and HLA-DQB1. It contributed to the phenotypic variation of neutrophil percentage, indicating its role in immune response mechanisms.
title: Genetic determinants of gene expression noise and its role in complex trait variation

finding: In the context of multiple sclerosis (MS), the SNP rs362538 was associated with increased risk while showing attenuated noise in the target gene HLA-A in CD4 cells.
title: Genetic determinants of gene expression noise and its role in complex trait variation

finding: SNP rs35984974 was recognized as an intergenic variant near ZNF184 and associated with all four substance use traits, exhibiting high genetic correlation.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs1799971, located in the OPRM1 gene, was a lead variant significantly associated with opioid use disorder (OUD) in the MTAG analysis, confirming its previously recognized role.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs112126124, an intergenic variant near TMEM170B, was discovered as a novel GWS variant associated with several substance use traits.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs411136, an exonic variant in SYNGAP1, was identified as a novel GWS variant linked to alcohol use disorder (AUD).
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs12526369 was identified as an intergenic variant near TMEM170B linked with multiple substance use traits.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The SNP rs9375442, which is located intronically within the CENPW gene on chromosome 6, was identified to have a genome-wide significant effect associated with Group 3 in the study. This locus was linked to increased expression of CENPW, which could have contributed to decreased cortical volume and cognitive function by affecting neurogenesis and promoting apoptosis. Furthermore, a higher CENPW score was observed in Group 3 compared to Groups 1 and 2, indicating a correlation between this genetic variation, neurocognitive performance, and behavioral risk factors during adolescence.
title: Structural neurodevelopment at the individual level - a life-course investigation using ABCD, IMAGEN and UK Biobank data

finding: The rs75932628 variant, known as R47H, was found to confer the greatest relative Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk, approximately 3.9 times that of homozygous common alleles. Carriers of this variant exhibited earlier symptoms, accelerated cognitive decline, and increased levels of hyperphosphorylated-tau (pTau) in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). This finding highlighted the significant association of the R47H variant with neurodegeneration and cognitive impairment.
title: Mechanisms contributing to differential genetic risks for TREM2 R47H and R62H variants in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs143332484 variant, referred to as R62H, was identified as more prevalent compared to R47H, with a minor allele frequency of 0.97%. However, its effect on Alzheimer's disease risk was smaller, around 1.4 times that of homozygous common alleles. This highlighted that while R62H presents some level of risk for AD, it is notably less significant than that of the R47H variant.
title: Mechanisms contributing to differential genetic risks for TREM2 R47H and R62H variants in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs2758339 was identified in a study examining its association with heroin dependency, revealing evidence that links this polymorphism to the risk of developing opioid use disorder (OUD). The context of this finding emphasized the SNP's relevance in alterations to SOD2 expression levels.
title: Profiling Neuronal Methylome and Hydroxymethylome of Opioid Use Disorder in the Human Orbitofrontal Cortex

finding: The SNP rs5746136 was also explored in the context of heroin dependency. This investigation highlighted another association between this polymorphism and the enhanced risk for OUD, further supporting its role in influencing SOD2 expression.
title: Profiling Neuronal Methylome and Hydroxymethylome of Opioid Use Disorder in the Human Orbitofrontal Cortex

finding: Located in the HLA region on chromosome 6, this SNP was demonstrated as significant for cervical cancer with a multi-ancestry p-value of 1.04 × 10^-39, revealing its relevance in immune response.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: This SNP also lay in the HLA region and showed extreme significance for cervical cancer with a European ancestry p-value of 2.55 × 10^-44.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: The missense variant rs76863441 was identified as a <italic>cis</italic>-pQTL for PLA2G7 in an East Asian population. Its minor allele frequency (MAF) was found to be 0.06 in this population, contrasting with a MAF of <0.001 in other populations. The research indicated that PLA2G7 is associated with inflammation, cardiovascular disease (CVD), and longevity.
title: Comparative studies of genetic and phenotypic associations for 2,168 plasma proteins measured by two affinity-based platforms in 4,000 Chinese adults

finding: The SNP rs143821594 was identified as an outlier that did not significantly alter the estimated causal effect linking SLE to CHF, suggesting a positive association with the increased risk of CHF in the East Asian population.
title: The potential causal association of systemic lupus erythematosus with congestive heart failure in the East Asian population: A two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1210063 was identified on chromosome 6, nearest to the gene PREP. The effect allele G was associated with increased susceptibility to EBV, with a significant association recorded at p=4.01×10^-9.
title: Unpicking the Gordian knot: Mendelian randomization to elucidate the risk factors for infectious diseases, using EBV as a model pathogen

finding: The variant rs72928038 was significant for multiple autoimmune diseases including rheumatoid arthritis (RA), type 1 diabetes (T1D), atopic dermatitis, and hypothyroidism. It was located at the 6q15 locus within a T-cell-specific SCENT enhancer linked to the gene BACH2, which showed that editing the variant in T cells affected BACH2 expression, skewing naive T cells towards effector T cell fates.
title: Tissue-specific enhancer-gene maps from multimodal single-cell data identify causal disease alleles

finding: The SNP rs1799971 was identified in the gene encoding the mu opioid receptor (OPRM1) and was the only one found to be genome-wide significant for opioid use disorder (OUD) with a very small effect size (beta = -0.066). This finding was part of a larger genetic study that included 15,756 OUD cases and 99,039 controls.
title: Ancestry May Confound Genetic Machine Learning: Candidate-Gene Prediction of Opioid Use Disorder as an Example

finding: The removal of variant rs1633106 resulted in a statistically significant IVW effect estimate indicating a negative correlation between sleep duration and motor progression, providing evidence that increased sleep duration might protect against faster motor decline in Parkinson's disease.
title: Relationship between sleep and progression of Parkinson’s disease – A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP was found to correlate significantly with IgA serum levels and levels of proteinuria in IgAN patients, indicating its influence on disease manifestations.
title: Candidate genes for IgA nephropathy in pediatric patients: exome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs1799945 in HFE showed a strong association with hepatic iron content (HIC) in men. This genetic variant was linked to hepatic iron overload due to decreased hepcidin levels, which correlated with increased ferritin and transferrin levels.
title: Distribution and associated factors of hepatic iron – a population-based imaging study

finding: The SNP rs1800562 in HFE was found to have a significant association with hepatic iron content (HIC) in women. Similar to rs1799945, this variant also led to hepatic iron overload through decreased hepcidin levels and was correlated with ferritin and transferrin.
title: Distribution and associated factors of hepatic iron – a population-based imaging study

finding: The SNP rs1210063 was associated with EBV susceptibility and located on chromosome 6 near the gene PREP. The finding indicated that the effect allele G was linked to increased susceptibility to EBV, supported by a p-value of 4.01×10−9.
title: Unpicking the Gordian knot: Mendelian randomization to elucidate the risk factors for infectious diseases, using EBV as a model pathogen

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with Subtype III, marking it as a contributor to the rapid symptom progression pattern observed in Parkinson's disease.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with Subtype III, reinforcing its connection to rapid symptom progression.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: This SNP was found significantly associated with Subtype I, underscoring its role in mild progression.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: SNP rs9369062 was associated with TLA during the 10pm-12am period, adding to the evidence of genetic influence on sleep behavior and activity during nighttime.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: The variant rs9264393 was associated with numerous significant phenotypic associations across traits, indicating its relevance in influencing health traits associated with blood measures.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: The variant rs2275652 also displayed numerous significant associations across health traits, marking its importance in the context of clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: The analysis indicated that rs2904602 in TNF-beta was strongly colocalized with idiopathic membranous nephropathy (IMN), showing a high posterior probability of hypothesis 4 (PPH4) of 0.88. This finding suggested that they share the same causal variant, relating to the genetically predisposed risk of IMN.
title: Circulating inflammatory proteins may be potential drug targets for Idiopathic Membranous Nephropathy: proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization and colocalization analysis

finding: The rs6923761 variant (Gly168Ser) in the GLP-1R gene was associated with a lower reduction in HbA1c after GLP-1RA treatment. Specifically, each copy of the Ser allele corresponded to a reduction of -0.9 mmol/mol in HbA1c, with a p-value of 6.0×10^-5, indicating its significance in influencing glycemic response to GLP-1 analogs.
title: Pharmacogenomics of GLP-1 Receptor Agonists: A genome wide analysis of observational data and large randomized controlled trials

finding: The SNP rs3104413 was identified as the lead eQTL for HLA-DQA1 in myeloid cells, with a highly significant association (P = 8.04 × 10^-127) indicating that increased dosage of the G allele was associated with higher HLA-DQA1 expression. This SNP was commonly found in phase with the classical HLA-DQA1*03:01 allele, which is linked to type 1 diabetes and celiac disease.
title: Mapping the dynamic genetic regulatory architecture of HLA genes at single-cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs9272294 was associated with HLA-DQA1 expression in myeloid cells after controlling for rs3104413. It was considered a secondary independent variant, located about 1.4 kb upstream of HLA-DQA1, with a significant association (P = 3.06 × 10^-58).
title: Mapping the dynamic genetic regulatory architecture of HLA genes at single-cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs9271117 was the lead eQTL for HLA-DRB1, exhibiting strong effects in B cells with a significant interaction (P = 1.08 × 10^-128), whereas it had a notably weaker effect in myeloid cells.
title: Mapping the dynamic genetic regulatory architecture of HLA genes at single-cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs2163472 was identified as an eQTL for HLA-DPA1, showing much stronger regulatory effects in B cells compared to myeloid and T cells (Beta = 0.43 in B cells vs 0.04 in myeloid; P < 5 × 10^-8).
title: Mapping the dynamic genetic regulatory architecture of HLA genes at single-cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs2395305 was the primary eQTL for HLA-DPB1 in B cells and showed significantly stronger effects compared to myeloid and T cells, further supporting the notion of cell-type dependency in HLA regulation (Beta = 0.55 in B cells).
title: Mapping the dynamic genetic regulatory architecture of HLA genes at single-cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs3104371 was highlighted as a dynamic eQTL for HLA-DQA1 in T cells, particularly strong in gamma-delta and cytotoxic T cell states, with a notable interaction P-value of 2.9 × 10^-200.
title: Mapping the dynamic genetic regulatory architecture of HLA genes at single-cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs7747253 was classified as a dynamic eQTL for HLA-A, showing particularly strong regulation during T cell proliferation, as indicated by a strong interaction effect (P = 4.9 × 10^-68).
title: Mapping the dynamic genetic regulatory architecture of HLA genes at single-cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs9271375 was associated with HLA-DQA1 in B cells, revealing significant state-dependent effects (interaction P < 2 × 10^-9), particularly stronger in plasma cells.
title: Mapping the dynamic genetic regulatory architecture of HLA genes at single-cell resolution

finding: This SNP was linked to the CENPQ/MUT locus and supported the original discovery results with replication outcomes showing significant association with ischemic stroke (P-values of 2x10^-4). It also acted as an eQTL for the CENPQ and MUT genes.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis identifies 2 novel loci associated with ischemic stroke and reveals heterogeneity of effects between sexes and ancestries

finding: The rs1800562 SNP, corresponding to the p.C282Y variant of the <italic>HFE</italic> gene, was associated with significantly increased incidence rates of osteoarthritis (HR: 2.12, p=8.8×10^-8), hip replacements (HR: 1.84, p=1.6×10^-8), and knee replacements (HR: 1.54, p=8.4×10^-4) in male homozygotes. Furthermore, male homozygotes exhibited a notable risk of femoral fractures (HR: 1.72, p=0.04) and osteoporosis (HR: 1.71, p=0.02) primarily in those with liver fibrosis/cirrhosis. Cumulative incidence projections indicated that by age 75, 10.4% of male p.C282Y homozygotes were expected to develop osteoarthritis and 15.5% were projected to undergo hip replacements.
title: Haemochromatosis genetic variants and musculoskeletal outcomes: 11.5 year follow-up in the UK Biobank cohort study

finding: Associated strongly with UC (P-value=2.20×10^-14, OR=0.64), this SNP was indicated in the HLA-DQA1 locus, established significant linkage in previous literature.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: This variant in DQA1 proposed significant protective associations against UC with a key amino acid (glutamic acid at position 175) contributing to its role.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The multiallelic variant showed strong association with UC influences on amino acid coding in the DRB1 allele, driving significant characterization in the disease model.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: This SNP supported a risk variant profile in the DRB1 group of alleles, further implicating its relevance in the pathogenic processes associated with UC.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The SNP rs2760985, tagging the HLA-DRB1 gene, was confirmed to have the most pronounced association with PMR in the study and was noted for showing heterogeneity between the FinnGen and UK Biobank cohorts.
title: Modifiable risk factors and inflammation-related proteins in polymyalgia rheumatica: genome-wide meta-analysis and Mendelian randomisation

finding: The variant rs2325259 was identified as a lead variant within the BACH2 gene, which encodes a transcription factor. Its association with hemoglobin switching was significant, as it implicated BACH2 as a new genetically-nominated regulator of fetal hemoglobin (HbF). This finding provided insights into transcriptional regulation mechanisms related to HbF expression.
title: Genetic regulation of fetal hemoglobin across global populations

finding: The SNP rs1010473 was fine-mapped and shown to be in tight linkage disequilibrium with the lead variant rs2325259, indicating its potential role in regulating BACH2 expression. It was associated with fetal hemoglobin levels, demonstrating its significance in the genetic architecture of HbF regulation.
title: Genetic regulation of fetal hemoglobin across global populations

finding: Similar to rs1010473, the variant rs1010474 was also in high linkage disequilibrium with rs2325259. It contributed to the understanding of regulatory elements affecting BACH2 expression and further implicated the regulatory mechanisms governing HbF levels.
title: Genetic regulation of fetal hemoglobin across global populations

finding: The variant rs142516820 in the TINAG gene region demonstrated a strong correlation with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) levels, which indicated its potential role in kidney function. This finding came from an analysis of changes in gene expression associated with glycemic stress in diabetic kidney disease (DKD), particularly in the context of type 1 diabetes (T1D).
title: Urine extracellular vesicles capture kidney transcriptome and hyperglycemia linked mRNA signatures for type 1 diabetic kidney disease

finding: The variant rs6920364 was associated with lung cancer (LC) in the McKay et al. meta-analysis and served as a lung eQTL for the RNASET2 gene, linking expression levels in plasma to disease.
title: Machine learning-based proteogenomic data modeling identifies circulating plasma biomarkers for early detection of lung cancer

finding: The SNP rs7766070, associated with the CDKAL1 locus, was identified among the seven shared SNPs between type 2 diabetes and self-reported depression.
title: Bi-directional Mendelian randomization and multi-phenotype GWAS show causality and shared pathophysiology between depression and type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs6296 in the HTR1B gene was found to be associated with susceptibility to opioid use disorder. This finding was significant as it indicates a genetic basis for the risk of developing opioid use disorder, which relates to the broader context of chronic pain management and the psychological profiles observed in patients using opioids.
title: Neuropsychology of chronic back pain managed with long-term opioid use

finding: The SNP rs7752421, located in 6q14.2, showed shared genetic influences with schizophrenia through INL thickness (INL_thickness_right) and was part of the evidence demonstrating its role as an eQTL of SNAP91 in brain tissues, with PPH4 = 0.952.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: In the context of 6q14.2, the SNP rs3798869 further supported the association of INL thickness with schizophrenia, demonstrating significant genetic overlaps.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs17211748, located upstream of HLA-DQB1, showed a suggestive association with asymptomatic ANA positivity, with a p-value of 1.4×10⁻⁶ and an odds ratio (OR) of 0.82 (95% CI 0.76-0.89). Furthermore, when comparing SLE patients to asymptomatic ANA negative individuals, rs17211748 displayed a more significant genetic association (p-value = 3.7×10⁻⁷, OR = 1.26, 95% CI 1.15-1.38) indicating that this variant may have a role in the susceptibility to SLE rather than just asymptomatic ANA positivity.
title: Genetic analysis of asymptomatic antinuclear antibody production

finding: The <italic>HFE</italic> p.C282Y homozygote genotype (rs1800562) was associated with a significantly increased incidence of various musculoskeletal disorders in males. Findings included an increased risk for osteoarthritis (HR: 2.12), hip replacement (HR: 1.84), knee replacement (HR: 1.54), femoral fractures (HR: 1.72), and osteoporosis (HR: 1.71, among those with liver fibrosis/cirrhosis). Cumulative incidence projections indicated that 30.4% of male homozygotes were expected to develop osteoarthritis and 15.5% were expected to require hip replacements by age 75.
title: Haemochromatosis genetic variants and musculoskeletal outcomes: 11.5 year follow-up in the UK Biobank cohort study

finding: The SNP rs17211748, located upstream of HLA-DQB1, showed a suggestive association with asymptomatic ANA positivity (p-value = 1.4×10−6, OR = 0.82, 95% CI 0.76-0.89). This finding was part of a multi-ancestry meta-analysis that included a total of 1,955 asymptomatic ANA positive and 3,634 asymptomatic ANA negative individuals, indicating its importance in understanding genetic factors related to ANA positivity.
title: Genetic analysis of asymptomatic antinuclear antibody production

finding: The SNP rs9505286 reached genome-wide significance in Sub-Saharan African (SSA) individuals with a p-value of 4.3e-08.
