It was located in the intronic region of the BMP6 gene, which is associated with kidney function and has been suggested as a major regulator of kidney fibrosis. This finding was significant in the Meta_SSA analysis.
title: Genetic Association and Transferability for Urinary Albumin-Creatinine Ratio as a Marker of Kidney Function in four Sub-Saharan African Populations and non-continental Individuals of African Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs143334143 at the CCHCR1 locus showed significant effect size heterogeneity concerning lymphocyte count across six ancestries, with a meta-analysis beta of 0.144 and a p-value of 5.16×10^-179. This indicated a robust genetic correlation influencing immune response relevant to COVID-19 severity.
title: Host genetic liability for severe COVID-19 overlaps with alcohol drinking behavior and diabetic outcomes in over 1 million participants

finding: The rs2856448 SNP was linked to the protein Tenascin-X, with a considerable explained variance of 61.5%, highlighting its role in plasma protein levels.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The variant rs116775335 near the POLR1C gene was found to have a significantly different allele frequency between populations, with a frequency of 0.230 in UKB-AFR compared to 2.7 x 10<sup>-05</sup> in UKB-EUR (p = 3.7 x 10<sup>-60</sup>), indicating its relevance in population studies.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The rs7743244 variant near POLR1C exhibited a higher frequency of 0.551 in UKB-AFR versus 0.061 in UKB-EUR (p = 9.4 x 10<sup>-322</sup>), signifying its potential importance in epigenetic studies.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The common variant rs1267502 in the JARID2 gene showed a significant allele frequency difference, with a frequency of 0.252 in UKB-AFR and 0.985 in UKB-EUR (p = 9.63 x 10<sup>-322</sup>), emphasizing its relevance in genetic diversity research.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The GTF2H4 gene mQTL variant rs1264313 was found to be associated with 17 biomarkers including albumin and calcium, reflecting its significance in biomarker studies.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The SNP rs2516396 was found to colocalize with the CpG cg11554650 (<PPP1R18>) which is associated with type 2 diabetes. This relationship had a significant PPFC of 0.98, explaining 100% of the observed PPFC and contributing to the understanding of the genetic factors that influence cardiovascular diseases.
title: Elucidating the genetic architecture of DNA methylation to identify promising molecular mechanisms of disease

finding: The SNP rs7766641 was associated with lung cancer at the 6p22.2 locus and was also linked with smoking behavior.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The SNP rs6913550 was identified at the 6p22.2 locus and noted for associations with lung cancer susceptibility.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The SNP rs62401887 at position 24416482 was significantly associated with the hepatic biological age gap (BAG). It was mapped to the MRS2 gene, which is linked to magnesium ion transport, displaying a deleterious score of 14.89 and an eQTL P-value of 1.09x10^-10, suggesting a functional implication in hepatic aging.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Biological Age in Nine Human Organ Systems

finding: The tag SNP for HLA-DQB1*57, rs1064173, was identified as a strong feature influencing the classification of T1D when using the T1GRS model, confirming its established association with T1D.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: The lead variant rs1391373 at the HLA-DRB1 locus was shown to interact significantly with the tag SNP rs1064173 and other HLA alleles in relation to T1D risk.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: The variant rs9273530, representing the known risk allele HLA-DQB1*02:01, was associated with T1D in the MHC region, demonstrating significant linkage to T1D.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: The variant rs9273375, representing HLA-DQB1*06:02, was identified as linked to T1D, underscoring its role in the genetic susceptibility to the disease.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: At the HLA-A locus, rs17185657 was confirmed as a significant risk marker for T1D, being part of the established alleles linked to T1D susceptibility.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: Identified as a novel signal not linked to known T1D risk alleles, rs9276235 was associated with intergenic regions predicting T1D susceptibility.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: The credible set variant rs7763052 near HLA-A was noted for its overlap with an accessible chromatin site active in effector CD8+ T cells, relating it to T1D.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: The variant rs9270965 was annotated with a high probability of being a novel signal upstream of HLA-DRB1, impacting T1D risk.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: The variant rs9268652 was linked to the protective haplotype in association with T1D, further elucidating the genetic risks associated with the MHC locus.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs140780894 was associated with pulmonary tuberculosis (PTB) in a Japanese population. It exhibited a significant odds ratio of 1.2 with a P-value of 2.9 × 10^-23, indicating increased susceptibility to this disease, which has a notably higher prevalence in Japan compared to Europe.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs6928864 was identified as significantly associated with breast cancer phenotypes in a GWAS analysis. It was linked to the mTSGS, which encompassed 20 genes transcriptionally altered in human breast cancers. The mTSGSS based on rs6928864 showed prognostic value, predicting pathological complete response (pCR) to chemotherapy treatments independent of traditional clinical factors.
title: A susceptibility gene signature for ERBB2-driven mammary tumor development and metastasis in Collaborative Cross mice with human translational value

finding: This SNP was identified as a regulatory variant within the FOXF2 gene, recognized as a risk variant for ischemic stroke. Its finding highlights a novel locus associated with system segregation, implicating cerebrovascular health.
title: Genetic variants link lower segregation of brain networks to higher blood pressure and worse cognition within the general aging population

finding: The study identified the variant rs137852949, which was enriched in the Finnish population, having a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.748% compared to 0.324% in the non-Finnish European population. This variant was implicated as a heterozygous cause of polycystic liver disease and provided evidence of its role as a monoallelic cause of cystic kidney disease.
title: Contribution of variants across the allelic frequency spectrum to cystic kidney disease

finding: The variant rs9389268 was strongly associated with MT-CN in both whole exome sequencing (WES) and imputed array data, with P-values of 7.87×10^-7 and 1.62×10^-8 respectively. Its location in an intergenic region between MYB and HBS1L was noted, and it has known associations with several hematological parameters, suggesting that its role in MT-CN may reflect blood cell composition.
title: Mitochondrial genome copy number in human blood-derived DNA is strongly associated with insulin levels and related metabolic traits and primarily reflects cell-type composition differences

finding: The SNP rs138367190, located near the SOX4 gene at chr6, was also associated with both total hip and FN BMD traits. This association further corroborated its prior involvement in BMD studies, particularly relating to the heel and FN.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: The rs2758339 SNP was found to be significantly associated with the risk of heroin dependency. This association was linked to altered SOD2 expression levels, highlighting its potential role in opioid use disorder (OUD).
title: Profiling Neuronal Methylome and Hydroxymethylome of Opioid Use Disorder in the Human Orbitofrontal Cortex

finding: Similarly, the rs5746136 SNP demonstrated a significant association with heroin dependency risk, also correlating with SOD2 expression levels. This finding reinforced the role of this SNP in the context of OUD.
title: Profiling Neuronal Methylome and Hydroxymethylome of Opioid Use Disorder in the Human Orbitofrontal Cortex

finding: The rs9481408 SNP was associated with significant eQTL effects for HDAC2 (p = 4.1E-07). This strong statistical association highlighted its potential role as a genetic proxy for analyzing the inhibitory effects of statins on HDAC2 within the context of depression.
title: Using Genomic data to Investigate the Anti-Depressive Effects of Statins

finding: This SNP was found to be intronic in SYNE1 and likely had regulatory functions, suggesting its significance in BD.
title: Fine-mapping genomic loci refines bipolar disorder risk genes

finding: This SNP was the most significant variant in the MHC region associated with BD risk, indicating a potential genetic signal in this area.
title: Fine-mapping genomic loci refines bipolar disorder risk genes

finding: The SNP rs10455872 was identified as a significant genetic instrument for Lp(a), accounting for a substantial proportion of the variance explained in Lp(a) levels. In doing so, it contributed meaningfully to the genetic risk score (GRS) for Lp(a), which was associated with coronary artery disease (CAD) and other cardiovascular endpoints.
title: Evaluating genetically-predicted causal effects of lipoprotein(a) in human diseases: a phenome-wide Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs140570886 was also among the key variants selected for the Lp(a) GRS. Its inclusion in the analysis confirmed its role in explaining variance in Lp(a) concentration, which had significant implications for cardiovascular disease risk, particularly noted in the broader context of vascular health.
title: Evaluating genetically-predicted causal effects of lipoprotein(a) in human diseases: a phenome-wide Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs1547247 SNP in HBS1L was associated with Endoglin plasma levels (p = 1.98 x 10^-8), contributing to the understanding of the factors influencing Endoglin levels.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The SNP rs1547247 at the HBS1L locus was found to correlate with Endoglin plasma levels (p=1.98e-8), contributing to the emerging landscape of genetic factors influencing Endoglin.
title: Unveiling Endoglin non canonical regulation: spotlight on the new role of the uPAR pathway

finding: The SNP rs4712314 in KIF13A presented with significant effects on PSP risk (p = 2.37 × 10^-7, beta = 0.27), suggested strong involvement of microtubule-related processes.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The locus corresponding to SNP rs367364 was associated with PSP (p = 7.07 × 10^-7, beta = -0.37), linked to TNXB within the MHC region.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The A-allele of rs926552 was associated with a moderate increase in plasma OT levels (β = 0.31, p-value = 1.58 × 10<sup>-4</sup>). This SNP resides in the GABBR1 gene.
title: Genetic and epigenetic signatures associated with plasma oxytocin levels in children and adolescents with autism spectrum disorder

finding: This intronic variant in ANKS1A was significantly associated with hospitalization in men (OR 3.30; P=1.71×10⁻⁸), highlighting its role in Covid-19 outcomes.
title: A year of COVID-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: The association signal for haemochromatosis was discovered through an ROH diplotype located in the extended HLA region, specifically chr6:25988167-26122453. The finding showed a p-value of 9.16 × 10^{-120} with an odds ratio of 102.21 for carriers. It was noted that the well-established causal SNP rs1800562, although not directly genotyped or imputed in the UK Biobank data, displayed a strong association signal that is related to the recessive effect of the HFE gene for haemochromatosis.
title: Discovery of runs-of-homozygosity diplotype clusters and their associations with diseases in UK Biobank

finding: Associated with the TFB1M gene, this SNP showed similar colocalisation evidence with cis-eQTL signals in fibroblasts, indicating its relevance to osteoarthritis development.
title: Investigation of the genetic architecture of cam morphology, and its relationship with hip osteoarthritis, using alpha angle as a proxy measure

finding: The SNP rs12203592 was significantly associated with D_f and implicated in retinal traits, corroborating findings related to ocular health and CAD risk.
title: Decreased retinal vascular complexity is an early biomarker of MI supported by a shared genetic control

finding: This SNP was associated with fracture risk in individuals confirming fractures based on various criteria, indicating its relevance to not only TBS but also to fracture susceptibility.
title: Genetic Determinants of Bone Microarchitecture and its Association with Health Outcomes: A Genome-wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study on Trabecular Bone Score

finding: This variant was found to be a top trans-eSNP affecting EPO expression, connecting it to hypertension through its influence on red blood cell traits.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: The VEGF -2578 A-allele, A-carrier genotype (dominant model), and AA genotype (co-dominant model) were significantly associated with a protective effect against head and neck cancers (HNCs). The findings reported p-values less than 0.01, 0.042, and 0.009 for the respective analyses with odds ratios of 0.651, 0.613, and 0.393, indicating a notable risk reduction.
title: Strong and Significant Associations of Single Nucleotide Variants (SNVs) in the Promoter and 3’-Untranslated Region (3’-UTR) of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor (VEGF) Gene with Head and Neck Cancers

finding: The VEGF +936 C/T polymorphism showed that the T-allele, CT (over-dominant model), and T-carrier (dominant model) genotypes were significantly associated with an increased risk of HNCs. The findings showcased p-values less than 0.047, 0.037, and 0.038, respectively, with odds ratios of 1.882, 2.060, and 2.023, indicating a heightened susceptibility.
title: Strong and Significant Associations of Single Nucleotide Variants (SNVs) in the Promoter and 3’-Untranslated Region (3’-UTR) of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor (VEGF) Gene with Head and Neck Cancers

finding: The SNP rs73743401 was also associated with higher circulating FGF23 concentrations, with each additional T allele correlating with a ~22% higher FGF23 level. This SNP was found in proximity to the IP6K3 and ITPR3 genes, which play roles in inositol phosphate biosynthesis, further linking it to pathways relevant to FGF23 biology.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS for circulating FGF23 Identifies Novel Network Interactions Between HRG-HMGB1 and Cardiac Disease in CKD

finding: The SNP rs9269041, located near HLA-DRA, demonstrated a strong association with PAPS (p-value 2.07×10^-8, OR 0.63). It was linked to overexpression of several HLA class II genes and was shown to have independent effects from HLA-DRB1*1302.
title: A genome-wide association study suggests new susceptibility loci for primary antiphospholipid syndrome

finding: This SNP was associated with high transcript levels of the LY6G5B gene in whole blood, indicating a significant risk for coronary artery disease (CAD) with an odds ratio (OR) of 7.10 (95% CI: 4.34 – 11.64) among East Asian populations.
title: Integrative multi-ethnic Mendelian randomisation identifies tissue-specific causal genes for Coronary Artery Disease and interactions with post-acute Covid

finding: In contrast, this SNP was linked to transcript levels of the LY6G5B gene in lung tissue, reflecting a small but protective effect against CAD, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.81 (95% CI: 0.75 – 0.89).
title: Integrative multi-ethnic Mendelian randomisation identifies tissue-specific causal genes for Coronary Artery Disease and interactions with post-acute Covid

finding: This SNP was associated with elevated transcript levels of the RPS18 gene in whole blood, correlating with a high risk for CAD, shown by an odds ratio (OR) of 4.27 (95% CI: 2.36 – 7.71).
title: Integrative multi-ethnic Mendelian randomisation identifies tissue-specific causal genes for Coronary Artery Disease and interactions with post-acute Covid

finding: This SNP was part of multiple associations replicating in UK Biobank for antibodies against Epstein-Barr virus, demonstrating effects in the same direction as observed in ALSPAC.
title: Genetic analyses of common infections in the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children cohort

finding: It replicated successfully for antibodies against Epstein-Barr virus, maintaining a consistent effect in line with previous findings.
title: Genetic analyses of common infections in the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children cohort

finding: This SNP was significantly replicated in relation to antibodies against Epstein-Barr virus, aligning with previous associations.
title: Genetic analyses of common infections in the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children cohort

finding: Also successfully replicated for Epstein-Barr virus antibodies, this SNP maintained the same direction of effect.
title: Genetic analyses of common infections in the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children cohort

finding: The rs1886814:A>C variant in the FOXP4 locus was significantly associated with critical illness due to COVID-19 and was reported to have higher allele frequencies in South East Asian groups.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The lead variant rs7741164 in the FOXP4 locus was linked to lung adenocarcinoma risk and associated with COVID-19 progression.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: At the HLA locus, rs9270887 was identified as a significant emVar, where the risk allele A was associated with increased activity of HLA-DRB1, providing a mechanism for its association with AD.
title: Deciphering the functional impact of Alzheimer’s Disease-associated variants in resting and proinflammatory immune cells

finding: The SNP rs35248896 was identified as the strongest associated locus for current medication-use, located within the HLA-DQA1 gene in the major histocompatibility complex (MHC) region. It had a significant P value of 1.52×10−46. This finding was critical as the MHC region is linked to a higher number of diseases compared to any other genomic region, indicating a profound influence of the genetic basis on medication-use.
title: The genetic architecture of medication-use

finding: The rs1050462 SNP at HLA-B was identified as a novel locus associated with NPC. This variant's significance was confirmed through stepwise conditional analysis, indicating its association was independent of previously reported HLA variants (P ≤ 3.23x10<sup>-5</sup>), marking it as a new discovery in the context of NPC.
title: Large-Scale Whole-Exome Sequencing Association Study Implicates Genetic Effects on Multiple Cell Types and EBV in Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma

finding: This novel risk variant within <italic>FOXP4</italic> was identified in the study, although it showed moderate LD with previously associated SNPs.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The rs6903956 SNP was associated with the susceptibility gene adtrp, with Gata2 regulating its expression. The study highlighted that Gata2 had a preferential interaction with the G allele of the SNP, which could point to its role in the pathogenesis of conditions such as intracranial aneurysms and periodontitis.
title: The potential crosstalk genes andmolecular mechanismsbetweenintracranial aneurysm and periodontitis

finding: The SNP rs9486715 was located at the FHL5-UFL1 locus on chromosome 6q16.1, identified as the second most significantly associated locus with a P value of 6.57 × 10-39. This finding corroborated previous associations with headaches.
title: A meta-analysis of the genome-wide association studies on two genetically correlated phenotypes (self-reported headache and self-reported migraine) identifies four new risk loci for headaches (N=397,385)

finding: The intergenic SNP rs11962863 within the MHC region showed a substantial association with pneumonia (OR = 1.59, P = 1.15 × 10−9), but demonstrated significant heterogeneity in its effects across cohorts.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of pneumonia suggests a role for mucin biology and provides novel drug repurposing opportunities

finding: This deletion/insertion polymorphism was associated with caffeine intake from coffee or tea and displayed linkage disequilibrium with previously identified SNPs related to coffee GWAS.
title: Genome-Wide Association Studies of Coffee Intake in UK/US Participants of European Ancestry Uncover Gene-Cohort Influences

finding: The SNP rs17754910 was significantly associated with early-onset breast cancer (EOBC) with a p-value of 4.73 x 10^-9. Its haplotype context indicated that it resided in a region enriched with regulatory elements and had methylation patterns linked to various cancers, including breast cancer.
title: Retrospective analysis of The Two Sister Study using haplotype-based association testing to identify loci associated with early-onset breast cancer

finding: Similarly, rs1886814 was found to have a nominal association with risks of hospitalization or severe disease among COVID-19 cases, supporting its involvement in disease severity.
title: Genome-wide analysis in 756,646 individuals provides first genetic evidence that ACE2 expression influences COVID-19 risk and yields genetic risk scores predictive of severe disease

finding: The SNP rs2187668 was identified as a significant variant associated with the risk of Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) through the generation of the Type 1 Diabetes Genetic Risk Score (T1DGRS) using UK Biobank data. Its inclusion in the risk score allowed for the assessment of the HLA DR haplotype that contributed to the overall genetic risk profile for T1D.
title: Estimating population level disease prevalence using genetic risk scores

finding: The SNP rs7454108 was also confirmed to be a significant variant associated with Type 1 Diabetes risk, as it was part of the mechanism used to determine the HLA-haplotype component in the T1DGRS. This contributed to a better understanding of genetic predisposition to T1D within the cohort studied.
title: Estimating population level disease prevalence using genetic risk scores

finding: The variant rs2229092 in LTA was associated with vorinostat response (p=8.28x10-7). The role of LTA, a factor influencing apoptosis and immune response, was highlighted in relation to tumor survival.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukaemia patients

finding: The SNP rs3135388, which is tagged by HLADRB1*15:01, was identified as a dominant contributor to the heritable risk of developing multiple sclerosis (MS). The context of this finding was related to the significant overrepresentation of the HLA DRB1*15:01 risk loci in the FutureMS cohort, which included participants with new diagnoses of relapsing-remitting MS.
title: FutureMS Cohort Profile: A Scottish Multi-Centre Inception Cohort Study of Relapsing-Remitting Multiple Sclerosis

finding: The lead SNP rs9396861 at RNF144B was identified in AFR with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.49, indicating it increased the risk for chondrocalcinosis. This finding was confirmed in the crystal arthropathy cohort.
title: Genome-wide association study in chondrocalcinosis reveals ENPP1 as a candidate therapeutic target in calcium pyrophosphate deposition disease

finding: At RNF144B, rs1886248 was the lead SNP in the EUR cohort with an OR of 1.44, also linked to the risk for chondrocalcinosis. This SNP was associated with increased expression of RNF144B in various tissues.
title: Genome-wide association study in chondrocalcinosis reveals ENPP1 as a candidate therapeutic target in calcium pyrophosphate deposition disease

finding: The G (risk) allele of rs6939185 at the ENPP1 locus was shown to increase its expression in brain tissues, reinforcing its role as a significant genetic contributor to chondrocalcinosis.
title: Genome-wide association study in chondrocalcinosis reveals ENPP1 as a candidate therapeutic target in calcium pyrophosphate deposition disease

finding: This SNP was significant in the AFR cohort for both chondrocalcinosis and crystal arthropathy, reinforcing its risk association.
title: Genome-wide association study in chondrocalcinosis reveals ENPP1 as a candidate therapeutic target in calcium pyrophosphate deposition disease

finding: The SNP rs3916765 at 6p21.32 was associated with cytogenetically normal AML with a genome-wide significant P-value of 1.51 × 10^-10 (OR 1.72, 95% CI 1.46-2.03). This SNP was located intergenic to the HLA-DQB1 and HLA-DQA2 genes and suggested a role in immune function related to AML risk.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies susceptibility loci for acute myeloid leukemia

finding: A nonsense variant in an unspecified gene associated with congenital myopathy was recorded, confirmed as pathogenic in multiple submissions to ClinVar.
title: Non-coding variants are a rare cause of recessive developmental disorders in trans with coding variants

finding: An intronic 1bp insertion was identified near an exon in a gene associated with congenital myopathy, predicting exon skipping due to loss of splice acceptor and donor sites, indicated by SpliceAI scores.
title: Non-coding variants are a rare cause of recessive developmental disorders in trans with coding variants

finding: The variant chr6:33061456:C:CT was associated with higher HBV antibody responses, identified through a genome-wide association study (GWAS). This finding had a beta of 0.48, standard error of 0.04, and a significance level of p=2.6×10−28, indicating a strong association with the HBsAg serological trait.
title: Targeting hepatitis B vaccine escape using immunogenetics in Bangladeshi infants

finding: The second most significant association was observed for the variant chr6:32466021:C:T, linked to the DT serological response. It exhibited a beta of 0.35, standard error of 0.04, and a significance of p=3.0×10−21, confirming its role in the immune response.
title: Targeting hepatitis B vaccine escape using immunogenetics in Bangladeshi infants

finding: The variant chr6:32602046:AAT:A was significantly associated with serum responses to B. pertussis virulence factor PT, producing a beta of 0.24, standard error of 0.04, and a significance of p=3.8×10−9, underscoring its influence in vaccine response.
title: Targeting hepatitis B vaccine escape using immunogenetics in Bangladeshi infants

finding: Similarly, the variant chr6:32635710:T:C demonstrated a significant association with the PRN response to B. pertussis, with a beta of -0.29, standard error of 0.04, and a significance level of p=4.0×10−14, highlighting its impact on immune evasion.
title: Targeting hepatitis B vaccine escape using immunogenetics in Bangladeshi infants

finding: The SNP rs190947828 demonstrated a significant association with cystic kidney disease, a condition recognized to be driven by elevated levels of TNFα. Carriers of this SNP were shown to have increased susceptibility to this inflammatory pathology, linking non-coding germline variation in TNF with the disease.
title: Systematic perturbation screens decode regulators of inflammatory macrophage states and identify a role for TNF mRNA m6A modification

finding: The SNP rs777492465 was also associated with cystic kidney disease, similarly linked to the effects of TNFα elevation in the context of the disease. This association indicated that individuals with this SNP could be at greater risk for developing conditions related to inflammatory processes driven by TNF.
title: Systematic perturbation screens decode regulators of inflammatory macrophage states and identify a role for TNF mRNA m6A modification

finding: The SNP rs28411362, located in a super-enhancer (SE) under proinflammatory cytokine stimulation, was shown to form three-dimensional chromatin contacts with the promoter of the MTF1 gene. Its involvement highlighted the regulatory mechanisms influencing gene expression changes in SFs under inflammatory conditions associated with RA.
title: Parsing multiomics landscape of activated synovial fibroblasts highlights drug targets linked to genetic risk of rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs9349205 was linked to reduced expression of CCND3 in erythroid cells, confirmed by 3C interactions indicating it regulated the target gene during differentiation.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: The intronic variant c.21-94G>A (rs142226267) was observed to have an allele frequency of 111/31250 in the gnomAD database. Initially filtered out through the whole-exome sequencing analysis pipeline, it was later reassessed for its pathogenicity. It was predicted to function as a cryptic splicing acceptor site for exon 2, likely leading to aberrant splicing and the introduction of a premature termination codon (PTC). In vitro splicing assays confirmed the presence of aberrant splicing patterns, indicating a significant impact of this variant on MAD2L1BP mRNA processing.
title: Biallelic Variants in MAD2L1BP (p31comet) Cause Female Infertility Characterized by Oocyte Maturation Arrest

finding: The SNP rs1800562, located in the HFE gene, was reported as a missense variant associated with reduced putamen volume and T2* signal in the striatum. It was recognized as a significant risk variant for hemochromatosis, being responsible for about 85% of cases.
title: Identifying genetic variants associated with cerebellar volume in 33,265 individuals from the UK-Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2153960, located within the FOXO3 gene, was associated with Insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF-I) concentration in a cohort of 10,000 middle-aged Europeans. This SNP demonstrated a GxE interaction with logBMI, with a significant p-value of 6.5×10^-9. However, it did not reach genome-wide significance using standard linear regression GWAS tests, indicating that while it was an important finding, its association may not have been robust enough to meet higher thresholds of significance.
title: Gene-environment interactions using a Bayesian whole genome regression model

finding: The SNP rs10370 was located in the gene renamed blpT, which encoded a surface protein known to facilitate disulfide bond formation in gallocin A peptides. Deletion of this gene significantly impaired the ability of SGG to outcompete Enterococcus faecalis in co-culture experiments, indicating the crucial role of blpT in the production of effective gallocin A, particularly under anaerobic conditions in the colon.
title: Gallocin A, an atypical two-peptide bacteriocin with intramolecular disulfide bonds required for activity

finding: The SNP rs4947296 on chromosome 6 was detected by the GGE test, mapped to the RNU6-1133P and C6orf15 genes, which are associated with LDL, triglyceride, and total cholesterol levels, reflecting a positive finding despite the SNP itself not being directly associated.
title: A multivariate approach to joint testing of main genetic and gene-environment interaction effects

finding: The SNP rs13205205 was associated with increased expression of <italic>FOXA1</italic>, which was identified as a significant gene connected to breast cancer subtypes, particularly in relation to TNBC and estrogen signaling.
title: A Comprehensive Meta-Analysis of Breast Cancer Gene Expression

finding: A study found that the IL-17A polymorphism (rs2275913) was associated with the pathogenesis of preeclampsia (PE) in Chinese patients. This polymorphism was linked to variations in IL-17A levels, indicating its potential role in the immune response changes observed during PE, particularly relating to the frequency of specific immune cell populations.
title: Unveiling the Crucial Role of Pro-inflammatory Macrophages in the Immune Network Imbalance of the maternal-fetal interface with Preeclampsia

finding: The SNP rs174399 was linked to schizophrenia risk, being in linkage disequilibrium with the risk variant rs11153302. It served as an eQTL for the HERV LTR25_6q21, where the risk (G-) allele was correlated with reduced expression of this HERV, which was upregulated in patients.
title: Schizophrenia risk from locus-specific human endogenous retroviruses

finding: The rs339331 SNP at the RFX6/6q22 locus was identified as significantly associated with prostate cancer (PCa) risk across diverse populations. It resided at an epigenetically reprogrammed androgen receptor (AR) binding site in PCa tumors, with the T risk allele exhibiting enhanced AR chromatin occupancy under androgen signaling. This association was further supported by a phenome-wide analysis indicating the rs339331 variant demonstrated the highest association with PCa among multiple disease endpoints in the FinnGen cohort, alongside confirmation of increased RFX6 expression correlated with the T risk allele. Elevated RFX6 was linked to poor prognostic outcomes, including increased metastasis and biochemical recurrence in PCa patients, particularly those with the rs339331 TT genotype.
title: RFX6 at locus 6q22 confers metastasis and drug resistance in prostate cancer

finding: The rs77651740 SNP was indicated as associated with gene expression variation and linked to potential differences in breast cancer risk among populations.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: The rs3101018 variant was noted for its association with both SLE and rheumatoid arthritis. It exhibited 1.7-fold stronger enhancer activity for the non-risk 'C' allele than for the risk 'T' allele, thus influencing the expression of the complement gene C4A.
title: Genome-wide discovery of SLE genetic risk variant allelic enhancer activity

finding: The SNP rs2076295 was identified as a functional variant that regulates desmoplakin (DSP) expression. The findings related to abnormal DSP expression provided insights into the pathophysiology of pathological fibrosis observed in desmoplakin-associated conditions, specifically highlighting its impact on fibrogenesis in mesenchymal stromal cells.
title: Desmoplakin mutations in cardiac fibroblasts cause TGFβ1-mediated pathological fibrogenesis in desmoplakin cardiomyopathy via beclin-1 regulation

finding: The SNP rs3088442 was characterized in the context of its association with susceptibility to Type 2 Diabetes. It was found that this polymorphic variant in the OCT3 gene played a significant role in the interaction affecting diabetes susceptibility.
title: Structural basis of organic cation transporter-3 inhibition

finding: The SNP rs2292334 was also identified as a polymorphic variant contributing to the susceptibility against Type 2 Diabetes. Similar to rs3088442, it was linked to the functional characteristics of OCT3, highlighting its importance in diabetes.
title: Structural basis of organic cation transporter-3 inhibition

finding: The SNP rs2859338 located in the 3' regulatory region was identified to differ in luciferase activity among genotypes. The G/G genotype exhibited the highest activity, while the A/A genotype showed significantly lower activity. This SNP's influence on Endothelin-1 production was attributed to VDR, although direct binding was not established.
title: Common variation in EDN1 regulatory regions highlights the role of PPARγ as a key regulator of Endothelin in vitro

finding: The rs3891176 SNP was associated with a significant increase in susceptibility to celiac disease in individuals carrying two A alleles, showing a rise in frequency from approximately 0% to 20% over the last 4000 years, with a selection coefficient of 4.5% (π > 99%). This finding highlighted the evolutionary impact of dietary changes on the prevalence of celiac disease.
title: Pervasive findings of directional selection realize the promise of ancient DNA to elucidate human adaptation

finding: The rs3135388 SNP showed positive selection, with its frequency rising from approximately 0% to 18% between 6000 and 2000 years ago, indicated by a selection coefficient of 4.0% (π > 99%). This SNP was suggested to have implications for the higher risk of multiple sclerosis in northern Europeans.
title: Pervasive findings of directional selection realize the promise of ancient DNA to elucidate human adaptation

finding: For the rs1800562 SNP, there was positive selection, increasing from approximately 1% to 5% from 5000 to 2000 years ago (s = 2.9%, π = 98%). Despite a subsequent frequency drop to around 3%, the historical selection was thought to link to the pathogen Yersinia pestis, although this hypothesis was challenged due to the timing of allele frequency changes.
title: Pervasive findings of directional selection realize the promise of ancient DNA to elucidate human adaptation

finding: The SNP rs1800562 at the HFE locus was replicated for liver iron association, confirming its previously established connection with hemochromatosis.
title: Genetic architecture of 11 abdominal organ traits derived from abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: Similar to rs1800562, SNP rs1799945 also demonstrated robust association with liver iron, reaffirming findings from past studies on iron overload.
title: Genetic architecture of 11 abdominal organ traits derived from abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs6912739 was associated with a conserved target site for the microRNA let-7a-5p in the MTAP gene. This target site was not detected in the reference genome due to the loss of the ancestral target site in European populations, while the target allele was maintained in other human groups. This finding highlighted the influence of population dynamics on microRNA target sites that might escape detection by standard target prediction programs.
title: PopTargs: A database for studying population evolutionary genetics of human microRNA target sites

finding: Associated with IRF4, this SNP was involved in immune responses and regulation of Th17 cell differentiation.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The HLA-DQB1 rs41552812 variant was identified as predominant in the Serbian population and associated with severe sarcoidosis. This SNP affected the function of the HLA-DQB1 protein and was observed in a notable portion of female and male samples, suggesting a potential link to unique clinical manifestations of sarcoidosis in this demographic.
title: The first insight into the genetic structure of the population of modern Serbia

finding: At the HLA region, the SNP rs7747253, associated with heel bone mineral density, began to reduce in frequency around 8,000 years ago, suggesting a strong selection event linked to immune response and implying genetic trade-offs affecting current autoimmune disease prevalence.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The SNP rs9267677, located within the HLA region and associated with psoriasis risk, displayed a gradual increase in frequency starting around 4,000 years ago, revealing insights into autoimmune disease susceptibility linked to past selection.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The rs2305089 variant (G177D) in the TBXT gene was strongly associated with a predisposition to chordoma, a rare spinal cancer, although the specific mechanism of its pathogenicity remained unknown.
title: An efficient and adaptable workflow for editing disease-relevant single nucleotide variants using CRISPR/Cas9

finding: The removal of this SNP in the leave-one-out analyses attenuated the associations of self-reported physical activity with overall lung cancer, adenocarcinoma, and lung cancer in never-smokers, suggesting a potential pleiotropic effect related to lung cancer risk.
title: Physical activity and risk of lung cancer: a two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: Associated with GWAS findings related to cancer and systemic lupus erythematosus, rs2763979 was noted for its connections to significant disease traits, indicating its functional relevance in the studied populations.
title: Profiling genetically driven alternative splicing across the Indonesian Archipelago

finding: The variant rs9294987 was identified as a fine-mapped variant (PIP = 0.48) associated with systolic blood pressure in the UK Biobank. Its activating allele displayed a minimal increase in transcription (Δ log2 activity of 0.09), which was significantly amplified when paired with the nearby variant rs9294988.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution

finding: Variant rs9294988, located just 2 bps from rs9294987 and with a PIP of 0.39, showed a similar minimal activating effect (Δ log2 activity of 0.20). Together with rs9294987, these variants produced a greater transcriptional increase, indicating a near consensus Jun motif.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution

finding: The SNP rs79220007 was found to be highly associated with Polycythemia Vera (PV) diagnosis with a p-value of 1.42E-14, linking iron regulation to PV through mutations in the HFE gene.
title: Iron homeostasis governs erythroid phenotype in Polycythemia Vera

finding: The SNP rs1800562 (C282Y) was re-examined under a recessive model and showed an association with PV, where homozygous AA genotype had 12.58 times increased odds of PV, with a p-value of 2.63E-26.
title: Iron homeostasis governs erythroid phenotype in Polycythemia Vera

finding: The SNP rs13198474 was linked with various non-FA measures of white matter microstructure, showing significant implications for traits such as AD and RD.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: The co-segregation of a stop-gained variant of the gene EGFL8 (rs141826798) was reported in a family with cholesteatoma. EGFL8 had been previously associated with psoriasis, a common inflammatory skin disorder, which shares features with cholesteatoma regarding abnormal growth of keratinizing epithelium.
title: Whole exome sequencing study identifies candidate loss of function variants and locus heterogeneity in familial cholesteatoma

finding: The SNP rs6931421 was genome-wide significant in the UK Biobank (UKB) and replicated in a separate meta-analysis of European-ancestry individuals, indicating its strong association with sitting height ratio (SHR).
title: Genetics of skeletal proportions in two different populations

finding: The SNP rs4959783 was identified as an sQTL for the gene PSMG4, significantly disrupting the binding site for the RNA-binding protein RBFOX2. This highlighted the mechanism by which splicing regulation can be altered through RBP binding modifications.
title: Identification and analysis of splicing quantitative trait loci across multiple tissues in the human genome

finding: Variant rs9368977 was found to increase enhancer activity within 6p21.2, residing in open chromatin and serving as an eQTL for C6orf89. Its alternative allele disrupted the motifs of USFs SP3 and KLF4.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: Variant rs6912602 was found to significantly decrease enhancer activity and is an eQTL associated with reduced expression of PPIL1, whose loss-of-function variants result in neurodegenerative pontocerebellar hypoplasia.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: Variant rs1343025 was identified with increased expression of VEGFA, known to regulate cerebral blood volume and associated with schizophrenia.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: This SNP was also associated with multiple dietary and metabolic phenotypes, adding to the understanding of microbiome-related genetic influences.
title: Large-scale association analyses identify host factors influencing human gut microbiome composition

finding: The rs75932628 variant, encoding the <italic>TREM2</italic> p.R47H protein-altering variant, showed a significant association with Alzheimer’s disease (AD). This finding was robust, being the only variant to retain significance after extensive quality control filtering, indicating its pivotal role in AD pathology.
title: Identification of novel Alzheimer’s disease genes co-expressed with TREM2

finding: The SNP rs1247559 was found to be associated with aggressive periodontitis in Europeans, supporting the role of polymorphisms downstream of the PLG gene in periodontitis risk.
title: Fibrin is a critical regulator of neutrophil effector function at mucosal barrier sites

finding: The SNP rs2465836 was identified as the lead SNP associated with severe periodontitis, with a gene-centric p-value of 4.2×10^-4, reinforcing previous findings regarding the connection between PLG polymorphisms and severe periodontal disease.
title: Fibrin is a critical regulator of neutrophil effector function at mucosal barrier sites

finding: The SNP rs4252200 was related to high colonization of Aggregatibacter actinomycetemcomitans (Aa), which is linked to aggressive periodontitis, with a gene-centric p-value of 1.3×10^-3.
title: Fibrin is a critical regulator of neutrophil effector function at mucosal barrier sites

finding: The SNP rs641153 was identified as a missense variant in the MHC region and acted as a sentinel pQTL for the CFAB protein. It was shown to possibly affect binding sites for transcription factors including EBF1, TFAP2A, TFAP2C, and HNFA.
title: A Bayesian joint pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: The SNP rs2781666 was found to confer risk of Type 2 diabetes mellitus, linking it to metabolic dysregulation which can be a comorbidity associated with coronary artery disease.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: Similar to rs2781666, rs2781665 was also associated with an increased risk for Type 2 diabetes mellitus, emphasizing its relevance in metabolic pathways potentially influencing CAD risk.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The missense variant rs12210538 in the SLC22A16 carnitine transporter was associated with variability in RBC levels of free and acetyl-carnitine, illustrating its significance in carnitine metabolism.
title: Genome-wide metabolite quantitative trait loci analysis (mQTL) in red blood cells from volunteer blood donors

finding: The SNP rs11156429 was the most significantly associated variant for male puberty timing, located in/near the gene LIN28B, confirming findings from previous studies in both men and women.
title: Expanded genomic analyses for male voice-breaking highlights a shared phenotypic and genetic basis between puberty timing and hair colour

finding: The SNP rs6931884 presented directionally-opposite effects on puberty timing; it conferred earlier timing in males (beta = -0.064 years/allele for voice-breaking) while delaying puberty in females (beta = 0.059 years/allele for menarche), indicating significant heterogeneity between sexes.
title: Expanded genomic analyses for male voice-breaking highlights a shared phenotypic and genetic basis between puberty timing and hair colour

finding: There was a SNP-level association peak identified 700 kb upstream of the POU3F2 gene, with a lead SNP rs2388334 showing a p-value of 1.0e-6. This finding supports the gene-level association of POU3F2 with autism spectrum disorder (ASD), correlating with the gene’s role as a key regulator in multiple psychiatric disorders.
title: Transcriptome-wide transmission disequilibrium analysis identifies novel risk genes for autism spectrum disorder

finding: The SNP rs62422661 exhibited a significant interaction with the promoter region of POU3F2 in the cortical plate zone, with a p-value of 2.0e-12. This indicated its relevance in the enhancer-promoter architecture associated with POU3F2 and its implications in ASD.
title: Transcriptome-wide transmission disequilibrium analysis identifies novel risk genes for autism spectrum disorder

finding: The index variant rs183882582 on chromosome 6 was found to be significantly associated with ADHD across the lifespan, with an odds ratio of 1.43 (95% CI 1.26-1.60) and a p-value of 1.57E-08.
title: Shared genetic background between children and adults with attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder

finding: The credible set for the significant locus on chromosome 6 included rs12197454, which was associated with the expression of RSPH3 in blood and brain, showing significant p-values in eQTL analysis.
title: Shared genetic background between children and adults with attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder

finding: The SNP rs2274911 (p.Pro91Ser) in GPRC6A was associated with prostate cancer (p=8.2×10^-8, OR=1.12), confirming its relevance to cancer risk but had confounding factors with other nearby associations.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs3130614 was identified as part of a cross-gene epistasis involving MICB and TOB2, suggesting a significant association with the phenotype based on p-value from the chi-squared test.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs9344977 was found within an intron of BACH2, and its interaction with rs56148686 is suggested to affect BACH2 gene expression through post-transcriptional mechanisms involving AD.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs56148686 is located in another intron of BACH2 and may affect transcriptional regulation alongside rs9344977, linking it to oxidative stress responses in AD.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs9469982 was found to control the expression level of the gene DEF6, which is associated with asthma risk. This variant fell within a chromatin accessibility peak bound by the transcription factor SOX8, which exhibited significantly increased activity in response to LPS+DEX treatment in T cells. The alternative allele showed a remarkably higher binding score for SOX8 compared to the reference allele, indicating a strong functional impact.
title: Functional characterization of eQTLs and asthma risk loci with scATAC-seq across immune cell types and contexts

finding: CaptureSeq detected multiple novel splice isoforms of the RIMS2 gene, located within the first intron of the gene associated with cocaine dependence. Three novel internal exons were identified in the first intron that were predicted to collectively add 56 amino acids to the RIMS2 protein, with conservation and validation evidence presented.
title: Targeted, High-resolution RNA Sequencing of Non-coding Genomic Regions Associated with Neuropsychiatric Functions

finding: The study demonstrated that the V288V polymorphism (rs8192620) in the TAAR1 gene was associated with an increase in craving response in individuals with active methamphetamine dependence (MA-ACT) and those in remission (MA-REM). Specifically, individuals carrying at least one copy of the V288V variant exhibited an estimated craving level 1.55 times higher in the MA-ACT group and 1.77 times higher in the MA-REM group compared to those without the SNP, indicating its potential role in modulating neuroadaptation and dopamine signaling in the context of MA dependence.
title: Trace amine-associated receptor gene polymorphism increases drug craving

finding: This SNP was linked to the regulation of AXL expression, which played a role in cancer metastasis and drug resistance in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) as described in the study by Auyez et al. (2021). Increased AXL levels were found in hypoxic mesenchymal cells, suggesting a potential mechanism for EMT and subsequent tumor progression.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals microenvironment context-specific routes for epithelial-mesenchymal transition in pancreas cancer cells

finding: This SNP related to factors governing epithelial to mesenchymal transition, highlighting its involvement in PDAC progression and chemoresistance, as discussed in the work of Palamaris et al. (2021). The SNP provided insights into the signaling pathways involved in EMT, particularly under the influence of the tumor microenvironment.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals microenvironment context-specific routes for epithelial-mesenchymal transition in pancreas cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs13213604 emerged as a plausible regulatory variant through functional assays and demonstrated significant differences in gene expression alignment with SLE risk.
title: High-throughput identification of functional regulatory SNPs in systemic lupus erythematosus

finding: SNP rs6917603 was identified as a plausible variant associated with HDL. Despite not being reported in the Northern Finland Birth Cohort (NFBC) analysis, it was recovered through the Iterative Hard Thresholding (IHT) method.
title: Multivariate GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: The SNP rs13205226 was initially identified in the research as being linked to disruptions in microtubule dynamics, specifically impacting the formation of ribbon synapses critical for sensory function in retinal and auditory cells. This finding was characterized through a quantitative cell-based assay that explored the effects of microtubule destabilizing drugs, providing context for its relevance to the understanding of synapse formation and sensory dysfunction.
title: Microtubule networks in zebrafish hair cells facilitate presynapse transport and fusion during development

finding: This SNP was highlighted in the context regarding the expression levels of rad51 which inversely correlated with the survival of glioblastoma patients, indicating its potential role in patient prognosis.
title: Exploring glioma heterogeneity through omics networks: from gene network discovery to causal insights and patient stratification

finding: This SNP was shown to influence NCOA7 gene expression with a 236% increase in enhancer activity linked to the A allele in luciferase assays, supporting its significance in eQTL analysis regarding eGFR.
title: Mapping genomic regulation of kidney disease and traits through high-resolution and interpretable eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs9479402 was associated with the gene VIP, which produces vasoactive intestinal peptide. This association was relevant to individuals self-reporting as 'a morning person' in a GWAS involving 89,283 individuals from the 23andMe cohort. The p-value of this association was 3.9 × 10^-11. Furthermore, in the context of PhenomeXcan, it had a significant p-value of 1.812 × 10^-17, with a locus regional colocalization probability (RCP) of 0.30, indicating a strong link between the variant and the chronotype trait.
title: PhenomeXcan: Mapping the genome to the phenome through the transcriptome

finding: The SNP rs1360780 in the FKBP5 gene was associated with differential stress responses and psychiatric conditions. Mice carrying the high induction AT-allele exhibited increased expression of FKBP5 when stimulated by glucocorticoids compared to those with the CG-allele, indicating a direct relationship between this SNP and altered HPA-axis functioning. This finding suggested that carriers of the AT-allele who experienced early life adversity (ELA) were more susceptible to developing psychiatric symptoms in adulthood, a trend observed also in human studies.
title: Impact of Fkbp5 × Early Life Adversity × Sex in Humanized Mice on Multidimensional Stress Responses and Circadian Rhythmicity

finding: The SNP rs7775698 was linked to an enhancer connected to the dysregulated TSPAN32 gene in Ts21 HSCs. While TSPAN32 was the only gene significantly dysregulated within the studied comparison of Ts21 and disomic liver HSCs, the findings pointed toward a broader genomic restructuring of enhancer-gene relationships impacting haematopoiesis in individuals with Down's Syndrome.
title: Single-cell multi-omics map of human foetal blood in Down’s Syndrome

finding: SNP rs1800562 in HFE was significantly associated (p-value < 1e-300, beta = 0.565) with traits and replicated previous findings related to iron metabolism.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs1799945 in HFE was found to be significantly associated (p-value = 1.10e-61, beta = 0.177), further confirming its role in iron overload conditions.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: SNP rs35323862 showed a significant association (p-value = 8e-13, beta = 0.07) related to pancreatic volume, especially in the context of diabetes.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs9368197 was associated with breast cancer risk, situated in an intron of the CDKAL1 gene. Findings suggested that this SNP's link to breast cancer was significant, contributing to the understanding of heterogeneous effects in heritable breast cancer.
title: Finding associations in a heterogeneous setting: Statistical test for aberration enrichment

finding: The SNP rs17070386 was found to be located within the <italic>ASAR6-141</italic> region, which is associated with critical roles in the control of replication timing and chromosome stability. This SNP was included in the analysis of genomic regions where RNA-seq and eCLIP reads showed significant interaction with RNA-binding proteins (RBPs), particularly referencing the identified approximately 7kb RNA binding protein domain crucial for chromosome replication in <italic>cis</italic>. The presence of this heterozygous SNP likely influenced the interaction of ASAR RNAs with their chromosome territories, implicating its potential role in modifying the replication dynamics across autosomes.
title: ASAR lncRNAs control DNA replication timing through interactions with multiple hnRNP/RNA binding proteins

finding: rs4613794 was linked to lower SA in ANX, emphasizing its significance in psychiatric disorder-related morphological changes.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Associated with lower SA in PTSD, rs9375138 contributed to understanding morphological brain changes.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Linked with greater CT and SA in regions of BD and SCZ, this SNP indicated strong genetic connections across disorders.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This SNP was implicated in cortical structure variations for both ASD and BD, reinforcing its significance in neurogenetics.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs9375188 signified similar patterns in brain structure alterations between ASD and BD.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This SNP was associated with greater CT and SA in the superior temporal cortex for disorders ASD and BD, establishing its biological relevance.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Linked with increased CT and SA in BD and ASD, this SNP demonstrated significant genetic overlaps between these disorders.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This SNP linked to both BD and ASD indicated substantial genetic shifts in brain structure.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This SNP exhibited genetic overlap in SCZ and CT as an exonic variant within the CUL9 gene, emphasizing its importance.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Linked to better thickness in SCZ and was associated with CUL9—variables that define complex neurogenetic interactions.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This exonic variant showed connections in SCZ related to cortical structure alterations.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs66650371 was reported to be associated with the -84 kb Myb enhancer region, which is homologous to the -81 kb murine enhancer. It was found to reduce LDB1 binding to this enhancer, subsequently decreasing interaction frequency with the MYB promoter, which is significant as it relates to the regulation of Myb gene expression and fetal hemoglobin levels in adult erythroid cells.
title: An enhancer RNA recruits MLL1 to regulate transcription of Myb

finding: The SNP rs13214467 was associated with improvements in deep neural network models that predicted photosynthetic capacity from leaf reflectance data, emphasizing its importance in enhancing the predictive accuracy in remote sensing studies related to plant physiology.
title: Hyperspectral imaging for chloroplast movement detection

finding: This stop-gained variant was significantly associated with multiple phenotypes, including blood urea nitrogen (BUN; P = 2.75×10⁻⁷), calcium (P = 7.15×10⁻⁸), and glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase (GOT; P = 9.65×10⁻⁶), illustrating its broad impact on renal and liver function tests.
title: Phenome-wide association study of a comprehensive health check-up database in a Korea population: Clinical application & trans-ethnic comparison

finding: The SNP rs9271520 exhibited co-eQTL effects across CD4+ and CD8+ T cells, monocytes, and dendritic cells, with connections to immune-mediated diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis and multiple sclerosis. However, its association was complicated by linkage disequilibrium with numerous immune disease SNPs.
title: Identification of genetic variants that impact gene co-expression relationships using large-scale single-cell data

finding: The SNP rs393727 was associated with RNASET2 and four co-eGenes. It was in high linkage disequilibrium with SNPs linked to Crohn's disease and IBD, suggesting potential shared regulatory mechanisms influencing gut immunity and inflammation.
title: Identification of genetic variants that impact gene co-expression relationships using large-scale single-cell data

finding: The SNP rs1334706 was reported to be most strongly linked to schizophrenia diagnosis, implicating it in hyperactivity of the superior temporal sulcus (STS) during emotionally neutral face perception. This hyperactivity in STS is particularly associated with the risk allele of the SNP, highlighting its role in the neurobiological basis of social cognitive impairments in schizophrenia.
title: Oxytocin and vasopressin 1a receptor alterations in the superior temporal sulcus and hypothalamus in schizophrenia

finding: This SNP was associated with significant upregulation of L1 RNA levels, indicating a regulatory effect of HLA (human leukocyte antigen) genes on transposon behavior, particularly in relation to aging traits.
title: An eQTL-based Approach Reveals Candidate Regulators of LINE-1 RNA Levels in Lymphoblastoid Cells

finding: The IL-17A rs2275913 SNP was found to be associated with protection against tuberculosis in a study conducted in Argentina. However, it was also related to higher disease severity, indicating a complex relationship between this SNP and the immune response in tuberculosis infection. The findings reflect the role of IL-17A in both protective immunity and immunopathology within tuberculosis contexts.
title: Exaggerated in vivo IL-17 responses discriminate recall responses in active TB

finding: For SNP rs13205235, research showed a significant role in enhancing tumor growth suppression through the use of DARPin_9-29-targeted gold nanorods. The study highlighted its implications in selectively mitigating HER2-positive tumor growth in xenograft models.
title: Internalization-Responsive Nano-PLGA For Image-Guided Photodynamic Therapy Against HER2-Positive Breast Cancer

finding: At the 6q15 locus associated with type 1 diabetes, rs72928038 was a caQTL in naive CD4+ T cells, linked to the BACH2 promoter. The G allele was associated with increased chromatin accessibility and validated for regulatory activity in Jurkat T cells.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: Variant rs1475159 was identified as a caQTL specifically for CD4+ T cell sites, showing notable accessibility (π=0.65, q=0.013).
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: Variant rs4959438 was a caQTL for a distal site in B cells and also linked to the DSP promoter (π=0.65, q=0.0066).
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: The SNP rs11077, located in the microRNA-related gene XPO5, was associated with susceptibility to thyroid cancer. This finding suggested that rs11077 could potentially serve as a genetic marker for cancer susceptibility, emphasizing the importance of microRNA-related mechanisms in tumorigenesis.
title: Comprehensive Analysis of Exportins Expression and its Prognostic Significance in Colon Adenocarcinoma: Insights from Public Databases

finding: The genetic variant associated with OCT2, c.596C>T (p.Thr199Ile, rs201919874), was linked to a decrease in transporter function, which correlated with higher plasma exposure and reduced renal clearance of metformin compared to the reference genotype.
title: Quantitative contributions of hepatic and renal organic cation transporters to the clinical pharmacokinetic cimetidine-metformin interaction

finding: The OCT2 variant c.602C>T (p.Thr201Met, rs145450955) was shown to reduce transporter function, resulting in significantly higher metformin plasma exposure and decreased renal clearance compared to individuals with the reference genotype.
title: Quantitative contributions of hepatic and renal organic cation transporters to the clinical pharmacokinetic cimetidine-metformin interaction

finding: The OCT2 variant c.808G>T (p.Ser270Ala, rs316019) demonstrated a significant connection to reduced transporter function, showcasing increased plasma exposure and decreased renal clearance of metformin compared to the reference group.
title: Quantitative contributions of hepatic and renal organic cation transporters to the clinical pharmacokinetic cimetidine-metformin interaction

finding: The intronic OCT1 variant c.1386-2964C>A (rs622342) was associated with impaired glucose-lowering effect, indicating a considerable impact on transporter function.
title: Quantitative contributions of hepatic and renal organic cation transporters to the clinical pharmacokinetic cimetidine-metformin interaction

finding: Participants homozygous for the OCT1 variant c.480G>C (p.Leu160Phe, rs683369) showed a significant increase in metformin AUC(0-24 h) and Cmax with a 33% and 48% increase respectively, indicating enhanced pharmacokinetic measures in response to cimetidine treatment.
title: Quantitative contributions of hepatic and renal organic cation transporters to the clinical pharmacokinetic cimetidine-metformin interaction

finding: Individuals homozygous for the OCT2 variant c.518+32G>C (rs2774230) exhibited a 35% increase in AUC(0-24 h) in the context of cimetidine co-administration, alongside a reduction in renal clearance.
title: Quantitative contributions of hepatic and renal organic cation transporters to the clinical pharmacokinetic cimetidine-metformin interaction

finding: The OCT2 variant c.1506C>T (p.Val502=, rs316003) was associated with a 27% increase in metformin AUC(0-24 h) under cimetidine treatment conditions, with significant pharmacokinetic alterations noted.
title: Quantitative contributions of hepatic and renal organic cation transporters to the clinical pharmacokinetic cimetidine-metformin interaction

finding: This SNP affected the expression of FOXO3, with a z-score of 6.64, highlighting its role in processes important for white matter injury repair.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: The rs66650371 SNP was found to reduce LDB1 binding to the -84 kb Myb enhancer, which led to a decrease in interaction frequency with the MYB promoter. This SNP was associated with reduced Myb gene expression and elevated fetal hemoglobin levels in adult erythroid cells, indicating its relevance in the context of Sickle Cell Disease and β-Thalassemia.
title: An enhancer RNA recruits MLL1 to regulate transcription of Myb

finding: Found to show the strongest associations with total cholesterol and HDL in lipid phenotypes, indicating its important role in lipid metabolism.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The common variant rs9349379 in PHACTR1 was found to be significantly associated with prevalent coronary heart disease (CHD), demonstrating its involvement in the etiology of heart disease.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: The rs6917676 T2D risk allele (T) was associated with increased accessibility of an ER stress-responsive cis-regulatory element (CRE). The T allele was shown to enhance MAP3K5 expression, which promotes beta cell apoptosis, thus linking this variant to T2D risk.
title: Comparative Multi-omic Mapping of Human Pancreatic Islet Endoplasmic Reticulum and Cytokine Stress Responses Provides Insights into Type 2 Diabetes Genetics

finding: The SNP rs3131638 was mapped to the SKIV2L gene, which was implicated in insomnia-like behavior through the mutation experiments in zebrafish, as it was associated with a significant reduction in sleep duration and increased sleep latency, indicating an insomnia-like condition.
title: Zebrafish screen of high-confidence effector genes at insomnia GWAS loci implicates conserved regulators of sleep-wake behaviors

finding: The SNP rs610913, a G>T polymorphism resulting in a P261H exchange, was associated with HIV-1 acquisition in a cohort study. This study indicated a nominal over-representation of the T allele in HIV-1 infected individuals compared to controls, suggesting that this variant may facilitate HIV-1 acquisition in vivo. Additionally, while cGAS(P261H) exhibited a similar steady-state activity and capacity for responding to viral challenges as the wild-type cGAS, there were trends towards reduced responses to DNA challenges, indicating a potentially altered susceptibility to viral infections.
title: A base-line cellular antiviral state is maintained by cGAS and its most frequent naturally occurring variant rs610913

finding: The SNP rs13215533 was linked to the roles of galectins in glioma, suggesting that variations in this locus could impact cancer progression and inform future treatment directions involving immune modulation.
title: Single-cell analysis reveals diversity of tumor-associated macrophages and their interactions with T lymphocytes in glioblastoma

finding: The lead SNP rs7767396 showed a significant association with the expression of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor-A (VEGF-A). This association was characterized by a substantial effect of -0.42, with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.46 and a Holm corrected p-value of 8.7×10^-18, indicating a robust link between this SNP and the protein's expression, highlighting its relevance in the context of inflammatory bowel disease.
title: Serum proteomic profiling at diagnosis predicts clinical course, and need for intensification of treatment in inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The SNP rs6913677 in the BAI3 gene showed a novel significant association with body mass index (BMI) in Indian populations. This variant was linked to methylation at a specific CpG site and displayed characteristics of repressing chromatin as well as strong binding sites for transcription factors implicated in obesity.
title: Multifaceted genome-wide study identifies novel regulatory loci for body mass index in Indians

finding: The rs11154537 (A/G) variant was identified as a puQTL associated with the activity of the hidden major promoter in the TMEM200A gene (prmtr.94867) with a very significant P-value of 1.96 x 10^-54 and a beta coefficient of -0.99. It was also associated as an eQTL with the total expression level of the TMEM200A gene.
title: Mapping of promoter usage QTL using RNA-seq data reveals their contributions to complex traits

finding: The SNP rs6940658 was found to significantly associate with CER[N(26)S(19)], marking it as a novel finding in the study of ceramide levels and their implications in inflammation, as it is upstream of CD83.
title: Heritability and family-based GWAS analyses of the N-acyl ethanolamine and ceramide lipidome reveal genetic influence over circulating lipids

finding: The SNP rs67476479, situated at the HLA-DRB1 locus, was found at a putative enhancer region in EAE-OLG but not in MiGl. This SNP also presented chromatin accessibility in Ctr-OLG and EAE-OLG, indicating its potential involvement in immune regulation relevant to MS.
title: A primed immune transcriptional program is activated in oligodendroglia in multiple sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs17493811, found within the Pitpnm2 locus, showed overlapping chromatin accessibility primarily in Ctr- and EAE-OPCs. This SNP may influence transcriptional output in oligodendrocytes related to MS.
title: A primed immune transcriptional program is activated in oligodendroglia in multiple sclerosis

finding: Identified in the context of significant selection signals in the UK, this SNP was associated with genetic variability and evolutionary pressures.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: This SNP was found to be a significant signal of selection in the UK, elucidating its role in population genetic structure.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: The SNP rs2395029 was identified as being significantly associated with HIV susceptibility, reflecting its role in influencing disease outcomes. The connection was highlighted in studies by Limou and Zagury (2013) and Fellay et al. (2007), underscoring its importance in understanding genetic factors influencing HIV infection.
title: Optimal HLA imputation of admixed population with dimension reduction

finding: The missense mutation rs6905572 within the SAPCD1 gene was associated with macular degeneration, pointing to its significance in eye health and disease.
title: Vision-related convergent gene losses reveal SERPINE3’s unknown role in the eye

finding: Identified exclusively associated with triple-negative disease in the CIMBA/BCAC-TN meta-analysis, it showed a significant odds ratio of 0.85 (95% CI=0.81-0.89; P=8.6×10^-13). This SNP highlighted subtype-specific susceptibility for TN breast cancer.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 32 novel breast cancer susceptibility loci from overall and subtype-specific analyses

finding: This SNP was noted to be significant above the genome-wide threshold even after adjusting for dominance and scaling issues, indicating its strong correlation with obesity-related genetic factors.
title: Identifying latent genetic interactions in genome-wide association studies using multiple traits

finding: This SNP in HFE was replicated in association studies with liver iron content.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: Similar to rs1800562, this SNP in HFE was linked to liver iron levels.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: This SNP near the ABO gene was associated with pancreatic fat and linked to cardiovascular and lipid traits.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: The SNP rs9366778 was previously linked to birth weight (BW), exhibiting a fetal effect.
