In this study, it was confirmed as significantly associated with BW, specifically showing a P-value of 0.011 when conditioned on classical HLA alleles. Moreover, it was in low to moderate linkage disequilibrium (LD) with HLA-C*04:01 and HLA-B*35:01, with r² values of 0.14 and 0.06 respectively, supporting its role in fetal genetic influences on BW.
title: Partitioning genetic effects on birth weight at classical human leukocyte antigen loci into indirect maternal and direct fetal components using structural equation modelling

finding: rs6911024 was identified in prior studies as associated with BW, primarily exhibiting a maternal effect. In this analysis, it was included alongside classical HLA alleles in the structural equation model and showed a nominal significance with a P-value of 2.81×10^-3, indicating it maintained some influence on BW, although its effect appeared largely conditioned by classical HLA associations.
title: Partitioning genetic effects on birth weight at classical human leukocyte antigen loci into indirect maternal and direct fetal components using structural equation modelling

finding: The rare SIRT5 coding mutation rs201979175 (c.C303G:p.F101L) was identified in the Utah Population Database as segregating dominantly with finger interphalangeal joint osteoarthritis (OA) in a family. This mutation involved the substitution of an evolutionarily invariant phenylalanine (Phe) to leucine (Leu) at position 101 in the catalytic domain, resulting in higher MaK levels, decreased expression of cartilage ECM genes, and increased expression of inflammation-associated genes.
title: Sirt5 regulates chondrocyte metabolism and osteoarthritis development through protein lysine malonylation

finding: This SNP was a primary signal at the RREB1 locus, with tissue profiles indicating effects in both islet (TOA=0.31) and adipose (TOA=0.27).
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: For the SNP rs6908626, a fine-mapped SNP with a PIP of 0.99, it was linked to the gene BACH2, a known master-regulator transcription factor crucial for controlling immune responses. This gene was also linked to 'All Auto Immune Traits', suggesting its importance in autoimmune diseases including lupus and type 1 diabetes.
title: SNP-to-gene linking strategies reveal contributions of enhancer-related and candidate master-regulator genes to autoimmune disease

finding: The SNP rs9478812 located near the PLEKHG1 gene was previously identified in a maternal preeclampsia genome-wide association study. It was associated with blood pressure in an independent GWAS, indicating that genetic predisposition at this locus is relevant to the development of preeclampsia, thereby suggesting shared genetic mechanisms between hypertension and preeclampsia.
title: Risk of preeclampsia in patients with genetic predisposition to common medical conditions: a case-control study

finding: The SNP rs13215345 was implicated in the regulation of PD-L1 expression, mediated by the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor subunit alpha7. Its involvement was highlighted in the context of cigarette smoke influencing immune evasion mechanisms in head and neck cancer.
title: Tobacco smoke exposure is a driver of altered oxidative stress response and immunity in head and neck cancer

finding: The SNP rs9274741 was found to have a significant association with leprosy in the Jatt/Choudhry subgroup, with a p-value of 4×10^-10, indicating a strong influence of this variant on susceptibility to the disease.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: The SNP rs9275596 was associated with IgA nephropathy within the Jatt/Choudhry subgroup, showing a very strong p-value of 3×10^-31, underscoring its potential role in this kidney disease.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: The SNP rs3115663, along with several others (rs3130618, rs3134945, rs11229), was part of a significant association with idiopathic membranous nephropathy in the same subgroup, with a combined p-value of less than 2×10^-40, pointing to a crucial genetic factor in this condition.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: Similar to rs3115663, rs3130618 was also associated with idiopathic membranous nephropathy, contributing to the cumulative evidence for this condition's genetic risk, highlighting the SNP's relevance.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: The SNP rs3134945 was implicated in idiopathic membranous nephropathy, with a statistical significance that supports its role in this disease within the identified subgroup.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: The SNP rs11229 was part of a group of variants that were strongly associated with idiopathic membranous nephropathy in the Jatt/Choudhry subgroup, emphasizing its involvement in disease susceptibility.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: The SNP rs2071278, related to complement C4 levels, demonstrated an extraordinary association with a p-value of 4×10^-72, suggesting a vital role in immune response mechanisms in the Jatt/Choudhry subgroup.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: The SNP rs10885 was found to be significantly associated with haemoglobin levels, with a p-value of 2×10^-36, indicating its impact on hematological traits in the subgroup studied.
title: Fine-scale population structure and demographic history of British Pakistanis

finding: The SNP rs7747253, located in the HLA region, showed selection beginning approximately 8,000 years ago, correlating with a rapid decrease in allele frequency, potentially linked to autoimmune resistance during the transition to agriculture.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: At the C2 locus (rs9267677), selection began around 4,000 years ago, with a gradual increase in frequency, indicating a relationship with psoriasis risk and supporting the genetic trade-offs hypothesis.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The rs1800562 SNP, located in the HFE gene, was associated with hereditary hemochromatosis. The colocalization analysis at this locus revealed significant impacts on total cholesterol, low density lipoprotein, and various red blood cell traits.
title: Genetic colocalization atlas points to common regulatory sites and genes for hematopoietic traits and hematopoietic contributions to disease phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs117780815 located in the NKAIN2 gene demonstrated a genome-wide significant SNP-by-sex interaction (p=3.2×10^-8). It was identified as a significant risk factor for schizophrenia (SCZ) and bipolar disorder (BIP) but showed opposite risk effects in males and females for both disorders.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: SNP rs3020314 served as an anchor variant for an LD block that was analyzed. The analysis provided valuable insights into its association with breast cancer.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: In the context of the ESR1 gene, rs2982689 was found to be part of a critical set of SNPs indicating its importance as a potential breast cancer risk factor.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: This SNP was among the key variants identified alongside rs2982689 in a composite finding associated with breast cancer.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: It was noted as part of a significant combination of SNPs related to breast cancer risk, contributing to the observed statistical significance.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: SNP rs2347867 was included in the statistically significant set of SNPs together with other important variants linked to breast cancer.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: It appeared in conjunction with other high-weighted SNPs which together indicated an association with breast cancer risk.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: This SNP added to the risk profile put forth by the analysis of the ESR1 gene, indicating its potential association with breast cancer.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: Identified in the block analysis for ESR1, rs926777 was considered a new possibility for association with breast cancer.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: Located on Chromosome 18, this SNP was also associated with stomatal density (DS) and explained 36% of the variation in DS at the Duclos site, indicating that GA genotype accessions better controlled water loss and CO2 uptake.
title: Identification and analysis of genomic regions influencing leaf morpho-physiological traits related to stress responses in Dioscorea alata

finding: The SNP rs1800562 was replicated with a strong association (p<1e-300, beta=0.565) and involved in iron metabolism.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs1799945 was replicated with a significant association (p=1.10e-61, beta=0.177) in iron metabolism studies.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs35323862 was linked (p=8e-13, beta=0.07) to pancreatic volume, suggesting a relation with diabetes traits.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs72928038 was associated with several autoimmune diseases, including type 1 diabetes (T1D), rheumatoid arthritis (RA), and multiple sclerosis (MS). This variant was found to reside within an intron of the BACH2 gene, which is critical for regulating T cell differentiation and activation. Experimental validation showed that the risk allele (A) led to a reduction in BACH2 expression in human T cells, indicating it plays a significant role in T cell function and may contribute to the dysregulation seen in autoimmune diseases.
title: Prioritization of autoimmune disease-associated genetic variants that perturb regulatory element activity in T cells

finding: The SNP rs654690 was associated with psoriasis, inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), and RA. It was found to be preferentially located in the accessible chromatin of regulatory T cells, influencing the TAGAP promoter. The impact of the variant on gene regulation varied by disease; specifically, the RA-associated allele (C) decreased MPRA activity, while the allele associated with psoriasis and IBD (T) increased it.
title: Prioritization of autoimmune disease-associated genetic variants that perturb regulatory element activity in T cells

finding: The NOTCH4/rs367398 variant was significantly associated with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) with a p-value of 0.00576 and an Odds Ratio (OR) of 5.1. It was the only variant that passed multiple test corrections with a Bonferroni-adjusted p-value of 0.02305, indicating a strong link with the disease.
title: Targeted Sequencing of Alzheimer’s Disease Genes in Gujarat Cohort

finding: This SNP, located upstream of TCF21, was linked to peaks across multiple cell types and implicated in CAD regulation.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: This lead variant at the PHACTR1/EDN1 locus disrupted a MEF2 binding site and was positioned within a strong SMC and macrophage peak, implicating it in CAD.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: Roelfsema et al. (2021) indicated that this SNP was linked to research on assessing the extent of shallow coral habitats on the Great Barrier Reef. The findings highlighted the importance of collaborative research initiatives in understanding and documenting coral reef environments.
title: Broadscale reconnaissance of coral reefs from citizen science and deep learning

finding: The SNP rs3798220 was found to be associated with LP(a) levels and consequently linked to repeat number in the context of coronary heart disease risk. However, the influence of this SNP on Lp(a) levels accounted for only a minor portion of the variance, and its effects were noted to be race/ethnicity specific.
title: A pan-genome approach to decipher variants in the highly complex tandem repeat of LPA

finding: The SNP rs10455872 was also associated with LP(a) levels and repeat number related to coronary heart disease risk. Similar to rs3798220, it accounted for only a minority of the variance in Lp(a) levels, with effects that varied significantly with race/ethnicity.
title: A pan-genome approach to decipher variants in the highly complex tandem repeat of LPA

finding: The single nucleotide variant rs4947296 was identified in a study examining bilateral Meniere’s disease, suggesting that it regulates the TWEAK/Fn14 signaling pathway. This variant was found to be prevalent in a majority of patients with Meniere’s disease, linking it to activation of both the canonical and non-canonical NF-κB pathways, which had downstream inflammatory effects in the stria vascularis (SV). This elevated signaling was proposed as a potential therapeutic target for individuals carrying the variant, although the specific location of inflammation within the inner ear remained unclear. The findings highlighted the role of TWEAK signaling and suggested that understanding ligand-receptor interactions in the SV could facilitate the development of effective treatments for Meniere’s disease.
title: Molecular differences between neonatal and adult stria vascularis from organotypic explants and transcriptomics

finding: The variant rs9481842 was linked to the transcription factor NKX2-5 and demonstrated a strong association with atrial fibrillation (AF). It showed a significant trans eQTL effect with NKX2-5 transcript levels, indicating that the risk allele correlated with downregulation of target genes on both mRNA and protein levels, thus suggesting its role in AF pathology.
title: Tissue-specific multiOMICs analysis of atrial fibrillation

finding: The variant rs1460351219, resulting in the p.Arg581His alteration in the MCM9 gene, was observed in a male infertility patient and demonstrated compromised fertility in the mouse models, with homozygous mice exhibiting reduced sperm counts and signs of meiotic arrest and apoptosis.
title: In vivo versus in silico assessment of potentially pathogenic missense variants in human reproductive genes

finding: The IL-17A rs2275913 SNP was associated with protection against tuberculosis, yet it was also related to higher disease severity in cases observed in Argentina. This finding provided insights into the complex role of IL-17A in tuberculosis pathogenesis and the immune responses associated with active TB.
title: Exaggerated in vivo IL-17 responses discriminate recall responses in active TB

finding: SNP rs783153 significantly correlated with LPA expression in kidney tubules, showing that increased G allele dosage was associated with higher LPA expression in subjects with higher PT fractions, demonstrating a PT cell-type specific eQTL.
title: Mapping the genetic architecture of human traits to cell types in the kidney identifies mechanisms of disease and potential treatments

finding: The SNP rs61202914 was identified as a likely causal variant affecting the expression of the gene FYN. It was both an eQTL and located within a transcription factor binding site (TFBS) in the promoter region of FYN. This SNP's presence in the TFBS suggested it could influence the binding affinity of transcription factors, thereby regulating FYN expression, which is relevant to Alzheimer's disease (AD) traits.
title: Genome-wide prediction and integrative functional characterization of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genes

finding: The study revealed that rs6912511 significantly disrupted the RUNX3 motif, as indicated by a false discovery rate (FDR) of less than 5%. The researchers conducted an Allelic Binding Cooperativity (ABC) test, which demonstrated allelic imbalance at this locus. Summing read counts of each allele across all heterozygous samples yielded a p-value of 6.35E-3, confirming rs6912511 as an allele-specific binding (ASB) site. Furthermore, integrative genome viewer (IGV) analysis highlighted MEF2A binding enrichment at the rs6912511 loci. The results underscored rs6912511's important role in modulating MEF2A DNA binding and its implications for understanding B-cell-specific gene regulation.
title: A highly parallel, automated platform enabling individual or sequential ChIP of histone marks and transcription factors

finding: This SNP in HLA-DRA was identified as a high priority SNP with literature support, showing its significance in pesticide-induced nervous system disease.
title: Genetic variability in pathways associates with pesticide-induced nervous system disease in the United States

finding: The SNP rs13215353 was associated with somatic hypomethylation of pericentromeric SST1 repeats in human colorectal cancer cells, indicating a potential role in cancer biology.
title: Recombination between heterologous human acrocentric chromosomes

finding: The SNP rs2269424 (G/A) was identified as a Time Informative Marker (TIM) adjacent to the PPT2 and EGFL8 genes, associated with immunity. A strong evidence of selection was found at this marker, indicating its significance in ancient populations.
title: A genomic dating tool for ancient genomes resolves the origins of hundreds of Eurasian genomes

finding: The SNP rs1800562 (G/A) in the HFE gene was associated with hemochromatosis and exhibited temporal variation trends suggesting increased frequency of the risk allele, possibly due to dietary transitions towards a sedentary lifestyle.
title: A genomic dating tool for ancient genomes resolves the origins of hundreds of Eurasian genomes

finding: SNP rs1800460 was associated with Horvath-EAA and had a CADD score indicating potential deleterious effects on protein function, being associated with the TPMT gene, which plays a role in drug metabolism.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies of epigenetic age acceleration

finding: Associated with Horvath-EAA, SNP rs1142345 had a high CADD score, suggesting that it might negatively affect protein function related to TPMT, contributing to aging metrics.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies of epigenetic age acceleration

finding: The SNP rs10949483 was associated with Horvath-EAA and was linked to NHLRC1, a gene related to glycogen metabolism, also showing potential deleterious effects based on its CADD score.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies of epigenetic age acceleration

finding: The variant rs76244256 was strongly associated with Horvath-EAA, showing eQTL evidence for NHLRC1 expression, reaffirming its role in metabolic processes.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies of epigenetic age acceleration

finding: The SNP rs75932628, which encodes the p.R47H variant in TREM2, was identified as a strong risk factor for developing late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD). This variant was confirmed through genome-wide association studies (GWAS) and was associated with reduced TREM2 function, affecting the receptor's ability to bind its ligands.
title: A novel TREM2 splice isoform lacking the ligand binding is expressed in brain and shares localization

finding: The SNP rs143332484, associated with the p.R62H variant in TREM2, also emerged as a significant risk factor for late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD). Like rs75932628, this SNP was confirmed in multiple GWAS and linked to a reduction in TREM2 functionality, further emphasizing its role in Alzheimer's pathology.
title: A novel TREM2 splice isoform lacking the ligand binding is expressed in brain and shares localization

finding: The rs75932628 variant in the TREM2 gene was identified as significantly associated with increased risk of developing Alzheimer's disease (AD). This variant caused an arginine-to-histidine substitution at position 47 (R47H), which exhibited a comparable effect size to the APOE ε4 allele, resulting in approximately three-fold increased risk of AD. This association highlighted the crucial role of TREM2 variations in neurodegenerative diseases, extending beyond AD to include frontotemporal dementia, Parkinson's disease, and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, suggesting a broader impact of TREM2 in microglial function and survival in the brain.
title: Trem2 promotes anti-inflammatory responses in microglia and is suppressed under pro-inflammatory conditions

finding: The SNP rs10457592 was found to target the gene POU3F2, receiving a TransEPI score of 0.9400. This identification was also validated through Hi-C analysis, highlighting its association with neural functions.
title: Capturing large genomic contexts for accurately predicting enhancer-promoter interactions

finding: The high-risk GG genotype at rs3129882 in the HLA-DRA gene was associated with a 1.7-fold increase in risk for late-onset idiopathic Parkinson's Disease (PD). This genotype showed significant over-representation in PD patients and was linked to increased baseline mRNA and protein expression of MHCII in monocytes and B cells, facilitating higher MHCII inducibility in response to immune challenges.
title: MHCII deletion in mouse myeloid cells alters T-cell subset frequencies and inflammatory responses to alpha-synuclein pathology and epigenetic analysis of human monocytes reveals genotype-as well as disease-dependent differentially accessible chromatin regions in the HLA locus

finding: The ESR1 rs2234693 variant was linked to Coronary Artery Disease (CAD), indicating its importance in cardiovascular health.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The ESR1 rs9340799 SNP also showed an association with Coronary Artery Disease (CAD), reinforcing the potential impact of estrogen signaling on cardiovascular conditions.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The rs11755527 polymorphism in the BACH2 gene was associated with type 1 diabetes mellitus, implicating it in autoimmune disease mechanisms.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The nonsynonymous change in the VARS2 locus (rs4678) was found to be strongly associated with rheumatoid arthritis (RA), indicating its potential role in the disease.
title: kTWAS: integrating kernel-machine with transcriptome-wide association studies improves statistical power and reveals novel genes

finding: A mutation in HLA-DQA2 (rs9275595) was identified as potentially contributing to the pathogenesis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA), suggesting its significance in the genetic basis of the disease.
title: kTWAS: integrating kernel-machine with transcriptome-wide association studies improves statistical power and reveals novel genes

finding: The SNP rs56705452 was identified as a sex-biased eQTL for the MICA gene in muscle tissue. Variants of this gene have been associated with diseases like psoriasis and ankylosing spondylitis. The study suggested that rs56705452 might regulate MICA in a sex-dependent manner, which could explain differing disease presentations between males and females.
title: Sexual differences in genetic architecture in UK Biobank

finding: Associated with MDGA1, this SNP demonstrated a much larger effect, explaining 54.6% of the phenotypic variance in plasma protein levels, with a p-value of 6.6 × 10^-91.
title: Genetic and epigenetic architectures of neurological protein biomarkers in the Lothian Birth Cohort 1936

finding: The SNP rs9394903 was linked to the eGene PRPH2 in RPE2, which has established associations with geographic atrophy.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: Identified in the CIMBA/BCAC-TN meta-analysis, the SNP rs17215231 was exclusively associated with triple-negative breast cancer, presenting an odds ratio of 0.85, indicating a reduced risk for this subtype.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 32 novel breast cancer susceptibility loci from overall and subtype-specific analyses

finding: The SNP rs114892859 was associated with penicillin allergy, showing a significant meta-analysis result (P-value 4.59×10⁻²⁹, OR 1.59, 95% CI 1.47-1.73). This SNP was identified as the lead variant in the MHC region and tagged the HLA-B*55:01 allele, which was found to have a strong association with an increased risk of penicillin hypersensitivity (P-value 4.63×10⁻²⁶, OR 1.47, 95% CI 1.37-1.58). In silico analyses indicated that this SNP affected T lymphocyte function. Furthermore, it was linked with lower expression levels of nearby genes such as PSORS1C3 and MICA, which have been implicated in drug hypersensitivity reactions.
title: Genome-wide study identifies association between HLA-B*55:01 and penicillin allergy

finding: Associated with the STX7 gene, this SNP showed a P-imputed value of 6.06×10^-6, indicating its potential role in CL pathology.
title: A genome-wide association study highlights a regulatory role for IFNG-AS1 contributing to cutaneous leishmaniasis in Brazil

finding: The rs1043618 SNP was associated with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and depression. The study noted significant differences in the frequencies of this polymorphism between Japanese (0.1599) and Korean populations (0.2801), highlighting potential implications for environmental stressor responses.
title: A genomic study of the Japanese population focusing on the glucocorticoid receptor interactome highlights distinct genetic characteristics associated with stress response

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with rheumatoid arthritis (beta=0.82, p=1.91×10^-105) in East Asians, highlighting its contribution to immunological phenotypes.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was associated with chronic hepatitis B (beta=-0.618, p=2.87×10^-18), marking it as a relevant variant in immunological conditions.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with Graves' disease (beta=-0.477, p=3.90×10^-18), illustrating its relevance in endocrine phenotypes.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with mean corpuscular hemoglobin (beta=0.158, p=9.97×10^-304), contributing particularly to hematological traits.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: Significantly associated with type 2 diabetes, showcasing its relevance to metabolic phenotypes.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: Linked to body height and smoking behavior through GWAS peaks, with evidence of ASM detected in normal brain tissue.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: This SNP, linked to well-being metrics and tobacco use via GWAS, showed significant ASM, affecting TF motifs in the ZNF192P1 gene region.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Coinciding with multiple phenotypes indicating it can influence ASM pathways for diseases including anxiety and depression.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with Lp(a) serum levels in the LipidCardio cohort, showing the strongest evidence of association with a beta value of 0.794 and a p-value of 5.1×10^-52. While there was weak evidence overall for an association with coronary artery disease (CAD) (OR 1.35, 95% CI 0.93-1.99, p=0.118), a stronger association was observed in women (OR 1.85, 95% CI 1.02-3.35, p=0.04).
title: Cohort profile: The LipidCardio Study - Role of Lipoproteins in Cardiovascular Disease

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with Lp(a) levels in the LipidCardio cohort, replicating findings from previous studies. It contributed to the established relationship between LPA gene variants and elevated Lp(a) concentrations observed in the study population.
title: Cohort profile: The LipidCardio Study - Role of Lipoproteins in Cardiovascular Disease

finding: Similar to rs10455872 and rs3798220, this SNP was significantly associated with Lp(a) levels in the cohort, strengthening the evidence of the LPA gene's involvement in influencing Lp(a) serum concentrations.
title: Cohort profile: The LipidCardio Study - Role of Lipoproteins in Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The eQTL rs9271209 for HLA-DRB1 overlapped with ChIP-seq peaks and DNA-binding motifs for the transcription factors MEF2B, CUX1, and ATF2. Patients with the rs9271209 eQTL exhibited reduced expression of HLA-DRB1, indicating that the Alzheimer’s disease-associated effect on gene expression was likely mediated through inhibition of transcription factor binding.
title: A systems-biology approach connects aging mechanisms with Alzheimer’s disease pathogenesis

finding: This SNP served as an eQTL for the PSMB9 gene in B cells treated with LPS plus dexamethasone, but it did not affect gene expression variability. PSMB9 is linked with multiple autoimmune diseases.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: This SNP influenced both mean gene expression and variability of the RNASET2 gene in T cells treated with PHA plus dexamethasone, exhibiting contrasting effects. RNASET2 is involved in innate immune responses and has been associated with Crohn's disease and rheumatoid arthritis.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: This SNP was noted for its dynamic eQTL effects on the HLA-DRB5 gene, showing different genetic effects across pseudotime, specifically negative effects during early pseudotime and positive in late pseudotime. HLA-DRB5 is implicated in various immune-related diseases, including asthma.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The regulatory network involving rs730775 was replicated in this study through the use of the gLASSO method. Key connections were maintained (e.g., rs730775 ↔ NFKBIE ↔ NFKB1) while novel genes and CpG sites were identified, highlighting its relevance in regulatory processes.
title: Network reconstruction for trans acting genetic loci using multi-omics data and prior information

finding: This SNP was linked to schizophrenia susceptibility and acted as a cis-eQTL for genes such as PBX2 and RNF5. RNF5 showed differential expression in SCZ cases vs. controls, underscoring its relevance in SCZ pathology.
title: Network reconstruction for trans acting genetic loci using multi-omics data and prior information

finding: This SNP was implicated as an independent risk factor in schizophrenia susceptibility (R2 = 0.14), reinforcing its potential commonality with genetic influences in psychiatric conditions.
title: Network reconstruction for trans acting genetic loci using multi-omics data and prior information

finding: The variant rs2270450 was linked to the development of Hashimoto thyroiditis versus Graves’ disease and was significantly associated with the expression of TDRD6, which is involved in spermiogenesis and autoimmune polyendocrine syndrome. This variant was one of those under strong selection associated with autoimmune diseases.
title: Ancient DNA reveals that few GWAS loci have been strongly selected during recent human history

finding: The SNP rs912056 was identified on human chromosome 6 and associated with fat distribution traits through GWAS, implicating the gene LY86 as a causative factor. It was linked to a cluster of DInt that connected to the promoter of the gene Rreb1, which exhibited significant up-regulation during adipocyte differentiation.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: The SNP rs13205235 demonstrated a significant association with the selective suppression of HER2-positive tumor growth in murine models, highlighting its role in developing effective oncological therapeutics involving targeted nanoparticles.
title: Internalization-Responsive Nano-PLGA For Image-Guided Photodynamic Therapy Against HER2-Positive Breast Cancer

finding: The SNP rs6570507 was positively associated with adolescent idiopathic scoliosis in a multi-ethnic meta-analysis, indicating its relevance to this specific phenotype.
title: The N terminus of adhesion G protein-coupled receptor GPR126/ADGRG6 as allosteric force integrator

finding: The SNP rs1521 was associated with Graves’ disease and was found to reduce the expression of the HLA-C gene in thyroid cells. This down-regulation in HLA-C could not inhibit the activation of cytotoxicity of NK cells, suggesting that individuals carrying this variant could have increased NK cell-mediated cytotoxicity toward thyrocytes.
title: Multi-omic analyses reveal antibody-dependent natural killer cell-mediated cytotoxicity in autoimmune thyroid diseases

finding: The SNP rs3094228, associated with TPOAb-positivity, was shown to increase the expression of MIC-B in thyrocytes. This up-regulation could enhance the activation of cytotoxic NK cells when they bind to thyrocytes, promoting antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (ADCC).
title: Multi-omic analyses reveal antibody-dependent natural killer cell-mediated cytotoxicity in autoimmune thyroid diseases

finding: It showed association with TREML3P, a gene within the TREM locus, which is crucial for AD research.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs2071543, located at chr6:32,811,629, was associated with IgA glomerulonephritis (Berger Disease), showing a genome-wide significant p-value of 2.1 × 10^-9 in East Asians, but not in Europeans. The risk allele (G) frequency was 0.76 in Native American sources.
title: Continental-scale genomic analysis suggests shared post-admixture adaptation in Americas

finding: The SNP rs8111, found in the ATF6B gene at PHRED=22.2, was associated with Blood Protein Levels in European populations, corroborated by findings for additional 17 SNPs in the GWAS catalog.
title: Continental-scale genomic analysis suggests shared post-admixture adaptation in Americas

finding: The rs3130618 variant located in the GPANK1 gene was linked to MMR vaccination-related febrile seizure and Membranous Glomerulonephritis, with a PHRED score of 32.
title: Continental-scale genomic analysis suggests shared post-admixture adaptation in Americas

finding: The SNP rs2395617, located at chr6: 35,285,720, in the DEF6 gene, was associated with Apolipoprotein A1 levels in European individuals, with a PHRED score of 19.6.
title: Continental-scale genomic analysis suggests shared post-admixture adaptation in Americas

finding: The SNP rs2814982 at chr6:34,546,560 was reported to be linked with cholesterol levels and LDL levels in multiple studies.
title: Continental-scale genomic analysis suggests shared post-admixture adaptation in Americas

finding: The SNP rs9479402 was associated with the gene VIP, which produces vasoactive intestinal peptide, important for synchronization of circadian rhythms to light cycles. It was identified with a p-value of 1.812 x 10^-17 and a locus regional colocalization probability of 0.30. This finding was part of a GWAS involving 89,283 individuals from the 23andMe cohort, where it showed a significant association with self-reported 'morning person' status (p-value of 3.9 x 10^-11), marking it as a novel contribution to understanding chronotype.
title: PhenomeXcan: Mapping the genome to the phenome through the transcriptome

finding: The analysis indicated that SNP rs2305089 in the T (brachyury) gene was associated with local recurrence and overall survival in patients with spinal column chordoma. This finding underscored the prognostic significance of this SNP concerning the clinical outcomes for patients, suggesting that it could serve as a potential biomarker for assessing risk.
title: Selective targeting of TBXT with DARPins identifies regulatory networks and therapeutic vulnerabilities in chordoma

finding: The SNP rs652888 was linked to NHL and indicated a novel association with autoimmune and infectious diseases. It served as a potential marker for risk associated with Epstein-Barr virus infection, known to be a risk factor for NHL.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs9271378, located in HLA, was significantly associated with NHL, highlighting its role in cross-cancer susceptibility.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: Similar to rs9271378, SNP rs3135006 in the HLA region showed a strong association with NHL risk, reinforcing evidence of genetic pleiotropy in cancer.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: An association was found between rs2274911 in GPRC6A and prostate cancer (p=8.2×10⁻⁸, OR=1.12, 95% CI: 1.07-1.17). This variant was in linkage disequilibrium with another variant associated with prostate cancer.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank study

finding: The rs2070600 SNP showed significant interrelations with Serum Annexin A1 and soluble receptor for advanced glycation end products (sRAGE) levels in COPD patients, indicating its role in the disease pathology.
title: Identification of key genes and biological pathways in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The FKBP5 gene polymorphism rs4713916 was confirmed to influence the outcomes in older adults with COPD undergoing pulmonary rehabilitation.
title: Identification of key genes and biological pathways in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs60066732 was investigated for its association with circBACH2, a circular RNA linked to immune diseases including Type 1 diabetes (T1D). It was noted that rs60066732 was negatively correlated with the expression of both circBACH2 and its host gene BACH2, but exhibited a more extreme and significant effect on circBACH2 expression compared to the host gene, suggesting a potential role of circRNA in T1D risk. This SNP was also highlighted in the context of its collocation with T1D GWAS loci, showing a high probability of collocation (0.89) with T1D.
title: An integrative framework for circular RNA quantitative trait locus discovery with application in human T cells

finding: The CD2AP rs9349407 polymorphism was associated with susceptibility to Alzheimer's disease (AD) in a study involving 54,936 samples. The research demonstrated that variations in the CD2-associated protein influenced cognitive decline, linking this SNP to specific roles in the pathology of AD.
title: The Alzheimer risk factor CD2AP causes dysfunction of the brain vascular network

finding: The study identified rs13194850 as a SNP potentially associated with the p53-DREAM pathway, which was significantly involved in regulating the expression of genes mutated in blood disorders like dyskeratosis congenita and Fanconi anemia, as well as brain conditions such as primary microcephaly. The findings highlighted the relevance of this SNP in understanding the pathological mechanisms that contribute to hematopoiesis and brain development anomalies, linking them to tumorigenesis.
title: A systematic approach identifies p53-DREAM target genes associated with blood or brain abnormalities

finding: This SNP was identified as a homozygous G deletion mutation associated with retinitis pigmentosa (EYS<sup>2265fs</sup>), which caused a frame-shift mutation leading to blindness. In human embryos, Cas9 technology was applied to target this SNP, allowing for the evaluation of modifying potential during early embryogenesis.
title: Reading frame restoration at the EYS locus, and allele-specific chromosome removal after Cas9 cleavage in human embryos

finding: SNP rs66502009 was shown to be flanking the EYS mutation, allowing differentiation of maternal and paternal alleles. It was involved in the identification of alleles during the editing process following Cas9 treatment, with 51.3% of reads coming from paternal origin indicating successful modification efforts at the EYS locus.
title: Reading frame restoration at the EYS locus, and allele-specific chromosome removal after Cas9 cleavage in human embryos

finding: The SNP rs2395178, situated in the HLA-DRA gene, was identified as a CD8+ T-cell specific meQTL for cg00886432. This SNP was colocalized with type I diabetes (T1D) (PPFC=0.9802), highlighting its role in the immune system and genetic predisposition to T1D.
title: A hierarchical Bayesian interaction model to estimate cell-type-specific methylation quantitative trait loci incorporating priors from cell-sorted bisulfite sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs13205115 was associated with the metastatic pattern and management of malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors (MPNST), suggesting a linkage to oncological outcomes as described in the multicenter cohort study published by Acem et al. in 2021.
title: The CoREST complex is a therapeutic vulnerability in malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors

finding: rs62418762 was discovered to have a strong association with cerebral malaria (CM), showing a significant odds ratio effect on both CM and severe malaria anemia (SMA), with replication evidence demonstrating a robust impact.
title: New insights into malaria susceptibility from the genomes of 17,000 individuals from Africa, Asia, and Oceania

finding: This SNP was identified only by ESNN and is located upstream of the HLA-G gene, which has significant associations with Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) as documented in various studies.
title: Uncertainty Quantification in Variable Selection for Genetic Fine-Mapping using Bayesian Neural Networks

finding: This SNP, also found only by ESNN, is situated between MAS1L and UBD - both genes have been associated with T1D. Its identification highlights a potential genetic contribution to T1D through nonlinear effects.
title: Uncertainty Quantification in Variable Selection for Genetic Fine-Mapping using Bayesian Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs13195020 was associated with the expression of TBX2, a transcription factor implicated in the development of castrate resistant prostate cancer (CRPC). The study indicated that TBX2 over-expression was linked to the activation of the glucocorticoid receptor (GR) and repression of the androgen receptor (AR), which drove enzalutamide resistance in advanced prostate cancer. This reinforced the role of TBX2 as a molecular switch in the progression of CRPC.
title: TBX2 driven switch from Androgen Receptor to Glucocorticoid Receptor signaling confers therapeutic resistance in Prostate Cancer

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with EHR-OSA in the VUMC dataset (beta=0.10, p=1.31x10^-2) and related to celiac disease.
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: Synonymous variant in GABBR1 associated with EHR-OSA in a meta-analysis (beta=-0.05, p=2.27x10^-2).
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The C allele at rs1197452483 increased gene expression variability of the RPS18 gene in monocytes treated with PHA+DEX, linking it to autoimmune diseases.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: Genetic polymorphism at rs400063 impacted both mean and variability of RNASET2 gene expression in T cells treated with PHA+DEX in opposing directions, linking it to Crohn’s disease and inflammatory bowel disease.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: At rs116611418, divergent genetic regulation effects on the HLA-DRB5 gene were observed across pseudotime, linking it to multiple immune-related diseases, including asthma.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: Located on 6q21, rs35396874 was associated with a z-score of 6.64 and affected the expression of FOXO3, which is important for repair processes in white matter.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: At the 6p22.3 locus, rs4712528 was found intronic to CDKAL1, and 11 fragments interacting with CDKAL1 were identified. The study also provided evidence of interactions with SOX4, implicating a complex regulatory role over a long range.
title: Chromatin-based techniques map DNA interaction landscapes in psoriasis susceptibility loci and highlight KLF4 as a target gene in 9q31

finding: The SNP rs75932628 in TREM2 was found to be exome-wide significant with a p-value of 4.8 x 10^-12. This SNP was implicated in increasing the risk for late onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD).
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for a role for PSEN1 and suggests involvement of the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3β and WNT signalling pathways

finding: The SNP rs104894002 in TREM2 was identified as a high-impact variant which, in homozygous form, causes Nasu-Hakola disease—a rare form of dementia associated with fractures, showing its severe implications in Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for a role for PSEN1 and suggests involvement of the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3β and WNT signalling pathways

finding: The SNP rs9504361 was determined to be intronic to EXOC2 and associated with long-range interactions with the promoters of IRF4 and DUSP22 in a specific cell type. This finding suggested that the immune response pathways mediated by these genes could be critical in the context of psoriasis.
title: An active chromatin interactome elucidates the biological mechanisms underlying genetic risk factors of dermatological conditions in disease relevant cell lines

finding: This SNP was previously characterized and resulted in the non-synonymous L9H variant of the protein CFB, which is involved in the regulatory pathway of complement factors.
title: CoffeeProt: An online tool for correlation and functional enrichment of proteome-wide systems genetics

finding: This SNP was linked to a non-synonymous R32Q variant of CFB, contributing to genetic regulation influencing the abundance of complement factors.
title: CoffeeProt: An online tool for correlation and functional enrichment of proteome-wide systems genetics

finding: SNP rs2517606 was associated with TRIM26 and its EPIN promoter gene RRM2, providing evidence of its involvement in prostate cancer, with a significant p-value of 2.69e-7.
title: The PENGUIN approach to reconstruct protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions and its application to prostate cancer

finding: The analysis revealed that the SNP rs1321311 was significantly associated with an increased risk of colorectal cancer (CRC) in male carriers of the PMS2 mutation. The study noted that the association was statistically significant at the 5% level using the new generalized weighted cohort method.
title: A new inverse probability of selection weighted Cox model to deal with outcome-dependent sampling in survival analysis

finding: The C/T missense SNP (rs28732176) was found to be strongly associated with psoriasis (p=1.78 x 10^-210) and rheumatoid arthritis (p=5.58 x 10^-8). This variant was predicted to reduce FKBP-like protein (fkbpl) gene expression, indicating a genetic predisposition to these inflammatory disorders.
title: The immunophilin protein FKBPL and its peptide derivatives are novel regulators of vascular integrity and inflammation via NF-κB signaling

finding: An A/G variant in the 5' untranslated region of FKBPL (rs204892) was significantly associated with rheumatoid arthritis (p=7.84 x 10^-11) as well as with hay fever rhinitis or eczema (p=5.29 x 10^-13), suggesting its role in chronic inflammatory conditions.
title: The immunophilin protein FKBPL and its peptide derivatives are novel regulators of vascular integrity and inflammation via NF-κB signaling

finding: A G/C missense variant SNP (rs35580488) was associated with lymphocyte count (p=1.48 x 10^-11). This SNP is located within the region of the FKBPL-based therapeutic peptides (AD-01 and ALM201), highlighting its potential relevance in therapeutic targeting for immune response modulation.
title: The immunophilin protein FKBPL and its peptide derivatives are novel regulators of vascular integrity and inflammation via NF-κB signaling

finding: The missense variant rs1165196 of SLC17A1 was identified as part of the core instruments for serum urate levels. MR Corge estimates showed that increased serum urate levels elevated the risk of gout.
title: MR Corge: Sensitivity analysis of Mendelian randomization based on the core gene hypothesis for polygenic exposures

finding: Associated with right-handed versus non-right-handed individuals, the SNP rs9366770 had a p-value of 2.2E-09 and was located in an exon of the non-coding RNA HCG27.
title: The molecular genetics of hand preference revisited

finding: This SNP was detected in association with a broader locus within the MHC region and had a p-value of 2.0E-08; it is an eQTL for MICB in the cerebellar hemisphere.
title: The molecular genetics of hand preference revisited

finding: This SNP was identified within the same MHC region with a p-value of 2.4E-08, acting as an eQTL for the gene C4A in various tissues.
title: The molecular genetics of hand preference revisited

finding: The SNP rs6908626 exhibited a PIP of 0.99 and was associated with the gene BACH2, a known master-regulator transcription factor involved in controlling immune responses. This SNP was linked to 'All Auto Immune Traits' and highlighted BACH2's role in various autoimmune diseases, including lupus and type 1 diabetes.
title: Contribution of enhancer-driven and master-regulator genes to autoimmune disease revealed using functionally informed SNP-to-gene linking strategies

finding: The W719R substitution in kinesin family member 6 was noted to have a higher allele frequency in African populations (86%) and East Asian populations (53%). It was associated with altered response to statin treatment.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: This SNP is located in the HLA locus and was found to have a significant allele frequency difference especially among the Italy_IA_Romans, who exhibited the lowest frequencies of the effective alleles in comparison to other Italian populations from the 1st millennium BCE. This finding indicated a likely homogenizing effect of Roman domination.
title: The Genomic portrait of the Picene culture: new insights into the Italic Iron Age and the legacy of the Roman expansion in Central Italy

finding: Located in the HLA-DRA locus, this SNP also showed significant allele frequency differences similarly driven by the Italy_IA_Romans, who had lower effective allele frequencies compared to peers in the same era. This mirrored a broader trend of decreasing frequencies among other Italian groups due to Roman influence.
title: The Genomic portrait of the Picene culture: new insights into the Italic Iron Age and the legacy of the Roman expansion in Central Italy

finding: The SNP rs2802292 was found to be associated with the activation of stress-dependent expression of the FOXO3 gene by HSF1 through an intronic enhancer. This was discovered in the context of how Heat Shock Factors responded to stress conditions, illustrating a specific role of this SNP in the regulation of genes related to cellular stress response.
title: HSFs drive stress type-specific transcription of genes and enhancers

finding: This variant increased T cell proliferation when targeted, located within the BACH2 locus involved in T cell differentiation.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The SNP rs4839813 was associated with obesity, reporting raw p-values of 2.3×10^-5 in the PheWAS, indicating a notable connection with extreme obesity phenotypes.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: The SNP rs912056 linked to fat distribution traits was associated with the gene LY86. A significant interaction was found between this SNP and a DInt cluster involving the promoter of the gene Rreb1, which was up-regulated during adipocyte differentiation. The evidence suggested that RREB1 was a strong candidate for explaining the association with fat distribution traits, such as the ratio of visceral to subcutaneous adipose tissue volume.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: The SNP rs6597292 was noted to overlap with EC4-specific peaks, and it was associated with the BMP6 gene. This indicated that rs6597292 might influence endothelial cell functions that are implicated in CAD.
title: Single cell ‘omic profiles of human aortic endothelial cells in vitro and human atherosclerotic lesions ex vivo reveals heterogeneity of endothelial subtype and response to activating perturbations

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with OUD in human populations according to the well-powered meta-analysis, indicating its relevance to the disorder's genetic susceptibility.
title: Opiate responses are controlled by interactions of Oprm1 and Fgf12 loci in rodents: Correspondence to human GWAS findings

finding: Rs33932084 was identified as a missense mutation (N398S) in the transposase-derived domain of PGBD1, associating it strongly with schizophrenia (SCZ) susceptibility. The SNP enhanced the significance of PGBD1 as a candidate for schizophrenia and was supported by evidence of reduced PGBD1 levels in SCZ patients.
title: PiggyBac Transposable Element-derived 1 controls Neuronal Progenitor Identity, Stress Sensing and mammal-specific paraspeckles

finding: SNP rs628031 demonstrated significant marginal epistasis (ME) for serum lipoprotein A (lipoA) levels. The variant, a non-synonymous polymorphism in the organic cation transporter gene OCT1 (SLC22A1), altered the amino acid methionine to valine. OCT1 is crucial for the uptake and efflux of cationic metabolites, including various drugs like metformin, which is widely used to treat type 2 diabetes. Genetic variations in OCT1 had previously been identified to impact drug response.
title: A biobank-scale test of marginal epistasis reveals genome-wide signals of polygenic epistasis

finding: The SNP rs9277535 was extensively studied and linked to the hepatitis B virus. It demonstrated significant associations across various populations including those from Asian and Central Asian countries such as China, Japan, Turkey, Korea, and Indonesia. This finding highlighted its relevance in the context of infectious diseases, specifically relating to the susceptibility to hepatitis B.
title: HLA-SPREAD: A Natural Language Processing based resource for curating HLA association from PubMed abstracts

finding: The SNP rs806378 was positively identified in association with changes in cannabinoid receptor 1 (CB1) expression related to irritable bowel syndrome (IBS). This finding was based on observed alterations in glial endocannabinoid pathways between sexes following non-microbial stress (NMS) in males, indicating that polymorphisms at this locus affect CB1 expression, which is relevant in understanding visceral hypersensitivity linked to IBS.
title: Early life adversity promotes gastrointestinal dysfunction through a sex-dependent phenotypic switch in enteric glia

finding: Located in the ESR1 gene, rs3020314 was part of a block of SNPs showing significant association with breast cancer. It served as an anchor for additional correlated SNPs.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: This SNP in the ESR1 gene was part of a significant combination of six SNPs contributing to breast cancer risk, as shown in the analysis.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: Included in the significant associations found in the ESR1 gene's analysis, rs3020424 contributed alongside other linked SNPs.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: As part of the predisposition findings in the ESR1 gene, rs985695 showed prominence when combined with other SNPs, indicating its role in breast cancer susceptibility.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: This SNP's association with breast cancer risk was confirmed through its high weighting in an analysis of the ESR1 gene.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: rs3003921 also formed part of the accentuated associations in the ESR1 analyses related to breast cancer susceptibility.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: This SNP was noted as significant in the ESR1 analysis for its contribution to breast cancer risk through its high weight in inference.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: Identified as a significant candidate in the context of the ESR1 LD block, rs926777 contributed to possible new associations with breast cancer.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: For rs9380238, expression differences in HLA-C were observed in CD4+ T cells, showing a genotype-dependent effect with differences ranging from 0.73 to 1.25-fold. HLA-C is crucial for self- and viral-antigen recognition.
title: Systemic CD8+ T cell effector signature predicts prognosis of lung cancer immunotherapy

finding: The variant rs141826798 in EGFL8 was identified as a risk variant for psoriasis in a UK Biobank genome-wide association study. It was observed in 7 individuals across 44 different tissues, showing a significant proportion of reference reads below 0.65 in 98% of the observations (128 out of 131), suggesting potential issues with nonsense-mediated decay (NMD). The positioning of the VPT did not fall near the start of the gene, nor was it located in a long exon, or in processed regions suggesting it could induce NMD.
title: Nonsense-mediated decay is highly stable across individuals and tissues

finding: The rs1360780 SNP in the FKBP5 gene was found to affect FKBP5 chromatin shape and transcription. It was shown that FKBP5 gene expression (gex) was differentially induced by glucocorticoids based on this SNP genotype, with minor allele (T) carriers exhibiting the highest levels of FKBP5 expression following such stimulation. In a large-scale analysis involving various psychiatric conditions, a main effect of case-status on FKBP5 expression was observed, indicating its potential role in the pathology of disorders like schizophrenia, major depression, and bipolar disorder, despite the absence of significant additive effects based on genotype.
title: Associations of psychiatric disease and aging on FKBP5 expression converge on cortical supragranular neurons

finding: The SNP rs17079281 was identified to decrease lung cancer risk by creating a YY1-binding site that suppresses the expression of DCBLD1. This was significant in the context of DCBLD1's role in modulating angiogenesis, suggesting that variations at this SNP could influence tumor progression and therapeutic outcomes in ischemic cardiovascular diseases linked to angiogenic processes.
title: DCBLD1 modulates angiogenesis by regulating of the VEGFR-2 endocytosis in endothelial cells

finding: This SNP was previously reported as a genome-wide significant hit for adult antisocial personality disorder with an P=1.64E-09. However, in the current AGG analysis, it showed an opposite direction of effect (β=0.0022; P=0.41), indicating no significant relation to childhood aggression.
title: Genetic Association Study of Childhood Aggression across raters, instruments and age

finding: The SNP rs660895 was strongly associated with human ageing traits, achieved a P value of 2×10^-22, and was located near HLA-DRB1/DQA1. This SNP also demonstrated a connection to self-rated health and resilience and had been validated in earlier studies involving the same trait.
title: Genetically independent phenotype analysis identifies LPA and VCAM1 as drug targets for human ageing

finding: The study identified rs1885125 as a genetic variant that interacts with the IRF1 trans-regulatory factor to regulate MCM9 expression. It accounted for 47% of variability in MCM9 expression. This variant resided within a cis-regulatory element, with supportive evidence of IRF1 binding nearby and demonstrated an epistatic interaction with the IRF1-targeting CRISPR sgRNA.
title: Mapping gene regulatory networks of primary CD4+ T cells using single-cell genomics and genome engineering

finding: Similarly, rs4946371 was found to be in linkage disequilibrium (D' > 0.98) with rs1885125 and also implicated in the regulation of MCM9 expression through interactions with IRF1. This emphasized the significance of genetic variants in the cis-regulatory region affecting gene expression regulation in CD4+ T cells.
title: Mapping gene regulatory networks of primary CD4+ T cells using single-cell genomics and genome engineering

finding: rs1049115, an RNA editing QTL also linked to splicing events in NQO2, was involved in potentially disrupting LIN28 regulation on exon skipping. The variant's influence on splicing and editing emphasized its role in neurodegenerative disease mechanisms due to effects on free radicals production.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: A significant correlation was found between the rs9349407 variant and increased risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD) specifically within Chinese populations, highlighting the role of the CD2AP gene locus in AD pathophysiology.
title: CD2AP is Co-Expressed with Tropomyosin-Related Kinase A and Ras-Related Protein Rab-5A in Cholinergic Neurons of the Murine Basal Forebrain

finding: The rs7738720 variant was associated with an increased risk of AD pathophysiology in individuals of African ancestry, further emphasizing the relevance of CD2AP loci in the context of Alzheimer’s disease across different populations.
title: CD2AP is Co-Expressed with Tropomyosin-Related Kinase A and Ras-Related Protein Rab-5A in Cholinergic Neurons of the Murine Basal Forebrain

finding: This SNP was part of the Tier 3 ancestry-related heterogeneity signals identified in the KCNK17 gene, demonstrating significant differences in effect sizes between AFR_high and AFR_low populations, with a Cochran's Q p-value of 1.8x10^-10. It was associated with type 2 diabetes in studies across multiple populations.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: Similar to rs34247110, rs3734618 was included as a Tier 3 variant in the KCNK17 gene's credible sets, also indicating significant effect size differences between African ancestry high and low populations.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: The study identified a common cSNP corresponding to a Ser111 → Thr natural variant of GSTA2. This variant was associated with a 14 Da mass shift in the GSTA2 proteoform, confirming non-specific biallelic tissue expression and was observed in kidney tissue localizations. The allele frequency of this SNP was reported to be greater than 40%, illustrating its prevalence and the impact on proteoform variation.
title: Direct Imaging and Identification of Proteoforms up to 70 kDa from Human Tissue

finding: Homozygous carriers of the T2D-protective allele for the rs112498319 variant had a significant reduction in subcutaneous adipocyte area in all individuals analyzed. This reduction was consistent across both male and female carriers of the protective A allele, indicating a strong link to improved insulin sensitivity and potentially reducing diabetes risk.
title: Loss of RREB1 reduces adipogenesis and improves insulin sensitivity in mouse and human adipocytes

finding: This SNP was linked to major depressive disorder (MDD) and cross-psychiatric disorder risk. It was the most significant eQTL SNP in the region for the gene LIN28B, and exhibited allelic effects consistent with brain eQTLs, supporting its role in the regulation of associated genes.
title: Transcriptional-Regulatory Convergence Across Functional MDD Risk Variants Identified by Massively Parallel Reporter Assays

finding: This SNP was reported to lie in strong linkage disequilibrium with KIV-2 CN states, explaining around 36.00% of Lp(a) variation in European populations, although no association was found in Japanese or Hispanic populations.
title: Identification of allele-specific KIV-2 repeats and impact on Lp(a) measurements for cardiovascular disease risk

finding: Similar to rs10455872, this SNP was also utilized as a marker SNV in predicting Lp(a) variation in populations but showed no efficacy in Japanese and Hispanic cohorts.
title: Identification of allele-specific KIV-2 repeats and impact on Lp(a) measurements for cardiovascular disease risk

finding: This SNP was linked to pan-autoimmune diseases and was successfully identified as causal by NLDNN, showcasing its superior performance in SNP prioritization.
title: Cross-species prediction of transcription factor binding by adversarial training of a novel nucleotide-level deep neural network

finding: SNP rs9403386 was identified as having a genome-wide significant interaction with sex on lung function, specifically showing associations with lung function measures as part of the broader investigation of genotype-by-sex interactions.
title: SNPs associated with HHIP expression have differential effects on lung function in males and females

finding: SNP rs162185 exhibited a genome-wide significant interaction with sex regarding lung function traits, as part of the analysis described.
title: SNPs associated with HHIP expression have differential effects on lung function in males and females

finding: The SNP rs1535500, causing a gain-of-function (GOF) in TALK-1 activity (p.TALK-1 A277E), was associated with an increased risk for type-2 diabetes (T2D) and also linked to higher total cholesterol in a Han Chinese population. This association provided strong genetic evidence for the impact of alterations in TALK-1 function on diabetic phenotypes, aligning with observed effects of TALK-1 L114P which resulted in impaired glucose homeostasis.
title: The MODY-associated TALK-1 L114P mutation causes islet α-cell overactivity and β-cell inactivity resulting in transient neonatal diabetes and glucose dyshomeostasis in adults

finding: The rs116772905 variant, situated in exon 14 of the DDR1 gene, was associated with microalbuminuria, achieving an odds ratio of 3.78 (P = 4.40×10^-8), highlighting its relevance in renal phenotypes related to collagen metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The synonymous exonic variant rs118124843, located near the DDR1 gene, reached genome-wide significance for microalbuminuria. It was suggested to regulate expression of DDR1, which is implicated in collagen receptor activity in the kidneys.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The rs12523822 was replicated in the analysis and associated with DKD (P = 6.8×10^-4) indicating its relevance to kidney complications in diabetes.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The SNP rs7741021 was identified as a shared causal signal between circulating R-spondin 3 abundance and estimated bone mineral density (eBMD). The colocalization results suggested that this SNP contributed significantly to both traits, thereby indicating potential biological relevance.
title: SharePro: an accurate and efficient genetic colocalization method accounting for multiple causal signals

finding: The SNP rs9482773 was also identified as a shared causal signal between circulating R-spondin 3 abundance and estimated bone mineral density (eBMD). Its involvement indicated a common genetic influence on both traits as shown in colocalization analyses.
title: SharePro: an accurate and efficient genetic colocalization method accounting for multiple causal signals

finding: The SNP rs853974 was identified as another shared causal signal between circulating R-spondin 3 abundance and estimated bone mineral density (eBMD), highlighting its significance in jointly influencing both phenotypes as demonstrated in the analysis.
title: SharePro: an accurate and efficient genetic colocalization method accounting for multiple causal signals

finding: The SNP rs13215577 was positively correlated with the expression of the disialoganglioside GD2 in various breast cancer molecular subtypes. The study indicated that variable levels of GD2 expression were linked to specific genetic variations, highlighting its potential role in cancer progression and therapeutic targeting.
title: GD2 and its biosynthetic enzyme GD3 synthase promote tumorigenesis in prostate cancer by regulating cancer stem cell behavior

finding: The study demonstrated that rs6932603 was differentially regulated by miR-544a, which inhibited its expression, leading to an increased risk of osteoporosis. The allelic expression showed that the rs6932603-T allele had significantly lower expression levels than the rs6932603-C allele in both 293T and U2OS cell lines. This finding established rs6932603 as a potential etiological factor in osteoporosis.
title: Risk variant in miR-544a binding site in CCDC170 is associated with osteoporosis

finding: The SNP rs3777457 was found to loosely associate with type 2 diabetes in a Japanese population, with a significance level of p=6 x 10-7. This finding suggested a potential role of ASRA genetic variants in the regulation of energy balance.
title: A brown fat-enriched adipokine, ASRA, is a leptin receptor antagonist that stimulates appetite

finding: The SNP rs1267489 was noted as one of the few that overlapped between the analyses of MS-UC and MS-CD, although with different effect directions, suggesting distinct genetic pathways.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: Similarly, rs9370774 was found to overlap between MS-UC and MS-CD analyses, reinforcing the idea of differing genetic pathways despite shared genetic markers.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: The variant rs75932628 in TREM2 exhibited strong association with late onset Alzheimer's disease (p = 4.8 × 10^-12), indicating significant risk for AD.
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for a role for PSEN1 and suggests involvement of the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3β and WNT signalling pathways

finding: The high-impact variant rs104894002 in TREM2, which leads to Nasu-Hakola disease, was identified in 4 cases and not in controls, indicating a potential significant effect on disease risk.
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for a role for PSEN1 and suggests involvement of the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3β and WNT signalling pathways

finding: The SNP rs34437781 was significant in effective CD4 cells for HLA-B, illustrating its association with immune cell regulation.
title: Genetic variants associated with cell-type-specific intra-individual gene expression variability reveal new mechanisms of genome regulation

finding: The SNP rs2693076 was found to be significantly associated with increased LINC00680 expression and subsequent downregulation of immune genes related to macrophage regulation, implicating it in immune response modulation.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs4148876 was retained through conditional analysis and associated with TAP2 expression, highlighting its role in the HLA region's influence on immune response.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs2621321 was also retained in conditional analysis for TAP2 expression and was linked to several other health conditions, confirming its significance in immune-related pathways.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs1143146 was associated with decreased HLA-A allele expression and linked to lower infiltration of CD8 and CD4 T cells, impacting immune response in cancer patients.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs2844806 was associated with decreased HLA-A expression, unfavorably influencing patient survival outcomes, particularly in pancreatic and rectal adenocarcinoma.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs7751376 associated with infiltration of M2 Macrophages correlated with various malignancies, indicating a broader role in cancer risk and immune disease pathology.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The study related to SNP rs10080241 was part of a broader investigation into signaling pathways in high-grade serous ovarian carcinoma (HGSOC). This SNP was discussed in the context of its potential association with stemness and chemoresistance in ovarian cancer, suggesting a link in how genetic variations might influence the resistance to therapies targeting the MEK1/2 signaling pathway.
title: The MEK1/2 pathway as a therapeutic target in high-grade serous ovarian carcinoma

finding: This SNP exhibited an association with two traits in opposite directions, highlighting its role in complex trait variation.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: The SNP rs1360780 was identified as positively associated with the interaction of childhood abuse and amygdala resting-state functional connectivity. This finding highlighted how the genetic variation at this SNP may influence emotional resilience following adverse childhood experiences, thus serving as a biomarker for susceptibility and resilience in young adults.
title: Genetic-Dependent Brain Signatures of Resilience: Interactions among Childhood Abuse, Genetic Risks and Brain Function

finding: This SNP was found to have a significant effect on ICAM1 expression during CRISPR activation experiments (FDR<0.001). Although <italic>LPA</italic> is not expressed in teloHAEC, the ectopic expression induced by CRISPRa demonstrated its role in endothelial dysfunction.
title: CRISPR perturbations at many coronary artery disease loci impair vascular endothelial cell functions

finding: <italic>HFE</italic> E168Q (rs146519482) was identified as a novel variant associated with hereditary hemochromatosis (HH). The study involved utilizing Phenotype Risk Scores (PheRS), leading to the classification of E168Q as a pathogenic variant due to its disruptive effect on the HFE-TfR1 interaction, which resulted in loss of function of the HFE protein.
title: A rare variant on a common risk haplotype of HFE causes increased risk of hereditary hemochromatosis

finding: This SNP was strongly associated with TRBV19 with a beta of 0.760 and a P-value of 7.93 x 10^−13, demonstrating significant linkage with classical HLA alleles related to TCR repertoire.
title: Defining the genetic determinants of CD8+ T cell receptor repertoire in the context of immune checkpoint blockade

finding: This SNP was identified as the top secondary signal associated with TRBV19 with a beta of 0.705 and a P-value of 2.96 x 10^−7, suggesting it plays a role in influencing V-gene usage.
title: Defining the genetic determinants of CD8+ T cell receptor repertoire in the context of immune checkpoint blockade

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with the CDR3 K-mer TSGDYNE, with a beta of 1.12 and a P-value of 2.66 x 10^−10. It was linked to an intronic variant of MICA, which is associated with cancer immune response.
title: Defining the genetic determinants of CD8+ T cell receptor repertoire in the context of immune checkpoint blockade

finding: The SNP rs7772714 was located near KCNQ5, a gene that was downregulated in individuals with MDD along with other genes in the cholinergic synapse pathway.
