The expression of KCNQ5 was upregulated in mice treated with amitriptyline, which suggests a potential regulatory role in signaling transduction related to AD response.
title: Multi-omic modeling of antidepressant response implicates dynamic immune and inflammatory changes in individuals who respond to treatment

finding: The rs10305492 G>A variant, leading to the A316T substitution in the Glp1r gene, was associated with protection against type 2 diabetes (T2D) and cardiovascular disease. This missense variant exhibited lower fasting blood glucose levels and improved glucose tolerance in a humanized knock-in mouse model, indicating enhanced receptor action that likely contributes to its protective effects in the clinical setting.
title: In vivo functional profiling and structural characterisation of the human Glp1r A316T variant

finding: The R47H mutation in TREM2 was associated with increased risk of AD, with heightened significance compared to previous studies, affirming its relevance in AD pathology.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs2270450 was linked to SLC25A27 (UCP4), a gene expressed in neurons influencing neuronal metabolism and previously suggested to be involved in Parkinson's disease.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs4895441 affected HBG2 in trans, with associations previously noted for fetal hemoglobin levels.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The rs1800562 variant, linked to the HFE gene, correlated with regions including the putamen and cerebellar regions, establishing a significant connection to hereditary hemochromatosis and iron regulation in the brain's structure.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs1799945 C>G in HFE was linked to hemochromatosis type 1. The allele frequency in the Vietnamese population was about two to three times lower than that found in the world population (5.10%, 3.41%, and 10.82%, respectively), indicating a lower prevalence of this variant in the Vietnamese cohort.
title: Genetic profiling of Vietnamese population from large-scale genomic analysis of non-invasive prenatal testing data

finding: The strongest signal for South Asian populations (SAS) was found at this SNP, which was linked to levels of anti-rubella IgG, highlighting its relevance in immunity.
title: Improved detection of evolutionary selection highlights potential bias from different sequencing strategies in complex genomic-regions

finding: The SNP rs2305089 was strongly associated with the risk of developing chordoma in European populations, with an odds ratio of 6.1. This variant results in a glycine to aspartate substitution in the brachyury DNA binding domain, and although the precise role of this substitution in protein function and chordoma pathogenesis was unclear, prior in vitro assays suggested it may affect DNA binding.
title: Structures of the human transcription factor brachyury offer insights into DNA recognition, and identify small molecule binders for the development of degraders for cancer therapy

finding: The SNP rs28411362 was identified as being located in a super-enhancer in SFs under inflammatory conditions, forming three-dimensional contacts with the promoter of the MTF1 gene. It was implicated in the regulation of pathogenic cytokine production, reinforcing its role in the genetics of RA.
title: Parsing multiomics landscape of activated synovial fibroblasts highlights drug targets linked to genetic risk of rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs6908626, having a PIP of 0.99, was associated with the gene BACH2. This link was established by the Roadmap S2G strategy and indicated that BACH2 is a master-regulator transcription factor (TF) involved in immune responses, implicated in multiple autoimmune and allergic diseases, and ranked 311 for the Trans-master gene score.
title: Contribution of enhancer-driven and master-regulator genes to autoimmune disease revealed using functionally informed SNP-to-gene linking strategies

finding: The SNP rs2802292 was identified as a significant factor in longevity where HSF1 was shown to activate stress-dependent expression of the FOXO3 gene through an intronic enhancer. This provided new insights into the role of HSF1 in regulating gene expression in response to cellular stress, specifically linking it to mechanisms of longevity.
title: HSFs drive stress type-specific transcription of genes and enhancers

finding: SNPs rs2781666 and rs2781665 in the ARG1 gene were shown to confer risk for type 2 diabetes mellitus, linking inflammation pathways to metabolic disorders.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: As mentioned for rs2781666, this SNP also conferred risk of type 2 diabetes mellitus, reinforcing the involvement of ARG1 gene polymorphisms in diabetes.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The vascular endothelial growth factor gene polymorphism rs2010963 was explored for its association with carotid atherosclerosis in patients suffering from type 2 diabetes mellitus.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs117391865 reached genome-wide significance in the discovery cohort with respect to androstenone (p<1.35×10⁻⁸), representing a novel intronic association near SYNE1.
title: From musk to body odor: decoding olfaction through genetic variation

finding: The SNP rs113520162 was identified as having a GxC effect primarily governed by cellular differentiation, as explained by the first MOFA component. This finding was related to the gene IER3, showcasing how genetic effects varied across cell differentiation contexts.
title: CellRegMap: A statistical framework for mapping context-specific regulatory variants using scRNA-seq

finding: The SNP rs506770 revealed GxC effects in relation to the cell cycle, with the associated gene being HSPA1A, indicating that the genetic regulation varied with the phase of cell cycle during analysis.
title: CellRegMap: A statistical framework for mapping context-specific regulatory variants using scRNA-seq

finding: Genotype alterations at SNP rs9271894 led to an upregulation of multiple TE family gene sets, including a notable upregulation of the L1 family gene set (NES = 1.90, FDR = 7.19E-5), indicating its role in L1 expression regulation.
title: A Computational Approach for the Identification of Novel L1 Transcriptional Regulators

finding: SNP rs9271379 was also linked to L1 expression regulation, being identified as associated with gene HLA-DRB6 but lacked specific details in the provided text.
title: A Computational Approach for the Identification of Novel L1 Transcriptional Regulators

finding: This SNP was associated with trans-eQTL effects for L1MEb expression and linked to significant upregulation of the L1 family gene set, emphasizing its regulatory role.
title: A Computational Approach for the Identification of Novel L1 Transcriptional Regulators

finding: SNP rs9272222 showed significant influences on L1MEb expression as a trans-eQTL, although it was not linked directly to any specific candidate gene.
title: A Computational Approach for the Identification of Novel L1 Transcriptional Regulators

finding: This SNP was reported to improve predictions of photosynthetic capacity from reflectance by including leaf traits in a deep neural network model. It highlighted the importance of specific genetic components in the photophysiological responses of plants related to chloroplast function.
title: Hyperspectral imaging for chloroplast movement detection

finding: The SNP rs598493 was identified as a top candidate SNP with the highest PICs score, likely functioning as a sweep-driving mutation associated with autoimmune risk loci.
title: Prioritising Autoimmunity Risk Variants for Functional Analyses by Fine-Mapping Mutations Under Natural Selection

finding: The SNP rs1360780 in the FKBP5 gene was significantly associated with CES-D scores, showing that individuals with high financial strain who carried a T allele had the highest mean CES-D scores. The finding indicated that genetic variation contributed to increased susceptibility to depressive symptoms when social stressors, particularly financial strain, were present.
title: Financial strain and stressful social environment drive depressive symptoms, while FKBP5 variant intensifies the effect, in African Americans living in Tallahassee

finding: This SNP, located near the HLA-DRB1 gene, was identified in monocyte models. Its overlapping with immune-specific data suggests it may have a unique contribution to immune pathways relevant to Alzheimer's disease predisposition.
title: Regression convolutional neural network models implicate peripheral immune regulatory variants in the predisposition to Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Similar to rs9270921, rs9271182 is linked to the HLA-DRB1 gene. Its identification as an outlier in monocyte-related datasets suggests it plays a role in immune regulation associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Regression convolutional neural network models implicate peripheral immune regulatory variants in the predisposition to Alzheimer’s disease

finding: SNP rs9261224 was confirmed as a significant predictor for HDL, maintaining high correlation with other SNPs, indicative of its relevant role in lipid metabolism.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: SNP rs6917603 was identified as having the largest effect among the selected SNPs for HDL and showed a very high correlation with other SNPs in the analysis.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: SNP rs9261256 was identified in the HDL dichotomized analysis and was part of a group that provided predictive insights into HDL levels.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: The SNP rs2397118 (c.558A>G) was observed in three out of five samples, all of which also contained an Alu insertion in the 3'UTR of <italic>GHR</italic> (c.*+413_+422insAlu). This Alu insertion was associated with allele silencing, making it significant in the context of breast cancer risk.
title: A systematic screen of breast cancer patients’ exomes for retrotransposon insertions reveals disease associated genes

finding: The T allele of rs9266234 was linked to greater burst size and decreased burst frequency in gene CCHCR1. It induced preferential binding of transcription factors POUF2F and TBP, which demonstrated higher binding affinity compared to the flip genotype.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: The T allele of rs9271588 increased burst frequency and larger transcription variance for gene HLA-DQA1. It facilitated preferential binding of SRF and was associated with higher transcription factor binding affinity, influencing myeloid lineage cell counts.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: The C allele of rs72844311 was associated with increased burst frequency and decreased burst size, inducing binding of BHLHE40 while being in phase with the rs9271588_T allele related to HLA-DQA1, further influencing lineage counts and their heterogeneity.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: The SNP rs112243036 showed a remarkable association in the analysis with a nominal p-value of 7.0 × 10^-21. This result was consistent with the original study's findings, reaffirming its relevance in the genomic regions of interest.
title: Truly Privacy-Preserving Federated Analytics for Precision Medicine with Multiparty Homomorphic Encryption

finding: Similar to rs1015164, SNP rs59440261 was cited as being 42 Kbp away from rs112243036, located near the CCR5 gene and associated with HIV-1 disease progression. Its role was acknowledged as significant despite it not being available for direct analysis in the current data subset.
title: Truly Privacy-Preserving Federated Analytics for Precision Medicine with Multiparty Homomorphic Encryption

finding: The SNP rs9479402 was significantly associated with the gene VIP (p-value=3.9 × 10<sup>−11</sup>) in a GWAS involving 89,283 individuals from the 23andMe cohort who self-reported as 'a morning person.' This gene produces vasoactive intestinal peptide, which is involved in the synchronization of circadian rhythms to light cycles. The associated p-value from PhenomeXcan for rs9479402 was 1.812 × 10<sup>−17</sup> with a locus RCP of 0.26.
title: PhenomeXcan: Mapping the genome to the phenome through the transcriptome

finding: The SNP rs17079281 was found to decrease lung cancer risk by creating an YY1-binding site, which in turn suppressed the expression of DCBLD1. This finding emphasized the important role of this SNP in cancer biology.
title: Perspectives on Codebook: sequence specificity of uncharacterized human transcription factors

finding: The rs407238 SNP showed genome-wide significance in POAG and was the most significant SNP found associated with the HLA-G/HLA-H region, which is related to immune regulation, indicating a possible immune connection to POAG.
title: A large cross-ancestry meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies identifies 69 novel risk loci for primary open-angle glaucoma and includes a genetic link with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs11755280 was reported to be significantly associated with educational attainment in an updated GWAS meta-analysis involving about three million individuals, with a p-value of 2 x 10^-9, suggesting an important role in cognitive outcomes and behavior related to delay discounting.
title: Genome-wide association study of delay discounting in Heterogenous Stock rats

finding: Similar to rs11755280, the SNP rs12213071 was significantly associated with educational attainment with a p-value of 1.26 x 10^-9, further indicating its relevance in behaviors related to delay discounting and cognitive performance.
title: Genome-wide association study of delay discounting in Heterogenous Stock rats

finding: The SNP rs3135388, located on the gene HLA-DRB1, was originally found to be associated with both atrial fibrillation and multiple sclerosis in the first PheWAS conducted.
title: HCLC-FC: a novel statistical method for phenome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs3129716, mapped to the genes HLA-DQB1 and MTCO3P1, was found to have associations with 28 phenotypic blocks, with 16 of these being reported in the GWAS catalog as significantly associated. This was identified through the application of the HCLC-FC method while controlling the false discovery rate (FDR) at 5%.
title: HCLC-FC: a novel statistical method for phenome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs601945 showed strong associations with the immune-related gene HLA-DQA2 across all investigated tissues. It exhibited a positive normalized effect size (NES) of 1.12 with significant P-value (P <= 2.32·10^-16), indicating its influential role in various immune response pathways.
title: Understanding functional consequences of type 2 diabetes risk loci using the universal data integration and visualization R package CONQUER

finding: This SNP also exhibited a significant gender difference in allele effect size (p_diff=4.65×10^-6) with p values of 2.40×10^-26 in males and 1.30×10^-6 in females.
title: Genome-wide association study of appendicular lean mass in UK Biobank cohort

finding: Associated with SLE and rheumatoid arthritis, the reference 'C' allele of rs3101018 demonstrated 1.7-fold stronger enhancer activity compared to the risk 'T' allele, correlating with decreased expression of Complement C4A in B cell lines.
title: Genome-wide discovery of SLE genetic risk variant allelic enhancer activity

finding: The minor allele of rs76735376 was significantly associated with increased lipoprotein(a) [Lp(a)] values (p=1.01e-59) in a study involving 7512 participants. This SNP explained 3.5% of the variation in Lp(a) concentrations and was associated with an increase of approximately 37 mg/dL of Lp(a) per minor allele. Furthermore, eQTL data indicated a significant association between the minor allele and increased LPA expression, confirming its functional role in regulating LPA expression.
title: A genome-wide analysis of DNA methylation identifies a novel association signal for Lp(a) concentrations in the LPA promoter

finding: The SNP rs2076177 in the DMR of HLA-F was associated with enhanced expression in rejectors, indicating its potential role in modulating transcriptional responses related to liver transplant rejection.
title: The role of dynamic DNA methylation in liver transplant rejection in children

finding: The SNP rs1736924 in the DMR of HLA-F was associated with decreased expression in rejectors, suggesting its influence in the transcriptional regulation mechanisms that affect the acute cellular rejection in liver transplant recipients.
title: The role of dynamic DNA methylation in liver transplant rejection in children

finding: The variant rs9273375, located at the 3' end of the HLA-DQB1 gene, was associated with an increased predisposition to Lyme disease, with a P value of 6.53×10^-11. This finding confirmed the importance of the HLA region in influencing susceptibility to infectious diseases.
title: Secretoglobin family 1D member 2 (SCGB1D2) protein inhibits growth of Borrelia burgdorferi and affects susceptibility to Lyme disease

finding: Variant rs9368977, located in the SCZ-associated region 6p21.2, was predicted to disrupt binding of transcription factors SP3, SP1, KLF4, and EGR4. This variant increased enhancer activity and was linked to the expression of chromosome 6 open reading frame 89 (C6orf89).
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: Variant rs6912602 was noted for its significant decrease in enhancer activity (3.3-fold) and was an eQTL associated with reduced expression of peptidylprolyl isomerase like 1 (PPIL1), linking it to neurodegenerative disorders.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: Variant rs1343025, found in the SCZ-associated locus 6p21.1, was associated with increased expression of vascular endothelial growth factor A (VEGFA), a gene relevant to cerebral blood volume regulation and SCZ susceptibility.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: This SNP was associated with imatinib resistance in chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) patients. Specifically, higher levels of H1 subtypes were correlated with imatinib resistance, indicating that alterations in the proportions of specific H1 subtypes, including lower proportions of H1.0, H1.1, and H1X in non-responder patients, could play a significant role in the development of resistance to treatment.
title: Quantification of histone H1 subtypes using targeted proteomics

finding: The study highlighted the HSPA1B rs2763979 gene variant as a significant diagnostic and prognostic biomarker in asthma. This finding was connected to specific immune responses in asthma patients, indicating its relevance in understanding the disease's pathogenesis and the potential for personalized treatment approaches.
title: Deciphering the Immune Subtypes and Signature Genes: A Novel Approach Towards Diagnosing and Prognosticating Severe Asthma through Interpretable Machine Learning

finding: This SNP was linked to loss of ZNF292, demonstrating significant replications across cohorts.
title: Germline determinants of the prostate tumor genome

finding: The SNP rs59084763 located in an intergenic region downstream of ARHGAP18 was associated with heterotopic ossification (HO) susceptibility, achieving genome-wide significance with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.87 (95% CI 1.47–2.37) and a p-value of 2.48×10−8. This signal indicated a robust association with the modulation of cell signaling, cell shape, and motility, suggesting its relevance to HO.
title: Genome-wide association and functional analyses identify CASC20 and KIF26B as target loci in heterotopic ossification

finding: The SNP rs3129791, located on chromosome 6, was identified as part of a locus associated with general happiness levels. This locus is situated within the major histocompatibility complex (MHC) region, encompassing hundreds of genes involved in neurodevelopment, which may reflect pleiotropic effects on happiness.
title: A Genome-Wide Association Analysis of Happiness: Consistent Genetic Effects Across the Lifespan and Across Genetic Ancestries in Multiple Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs1891308, located near the gene ADGRG6, was associated with increased torso length. Conditional knockouts in ADGRG6 in mice displayed spine abnormalities directly correlated with reduced torso length, reinforcing the link between this SNP and skeletal proportions.
title: The genetic architecture of the human skeletal form

finding: This novel rare variant in the LPA gene was associated with LDL-C levels (p-value 6.55×10−29 discovery) and modified by alcohol consumption, showing a differential effect in carriers versus non-carriers.
title: Role of Rare and Low Frequency Variants in Gene-Alcohol Interactions on Plasma Lipid Levels

finding: SNP rs4897179 was identified as a progenitor eSNP colocating with rs9388490, an index SNP for global surface area and educational attainment GWAS, indicating a regulatory mechanism impacting CENPW gene expression.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: This SNP served as an index for both educational attainment and global surface area GWAS, showing colocalization with rs4897179, reinforcing its regulation of CENPW gene expression.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: Variant rs9388486 was colocalized with regulatory effects impacting the CENPW gene, where the C allele was associated with decreased binding of transcription factors that led to reduced CENPW expression, implicating it in cognitive functions.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: The SNP rs10807491 was found to be specifically associated with heel bone mineral density (BMD). This association contributes to understanding how genetic variants relate to bone health, especially in the context of chronic conditions like inflammation, which can affect bone density.
title: GDF15 mediates inflammation-associated bone loss through a brain-bone axis

finding: The common variant rs9349379 in the PHACTR1 gene was significantly associated with prevalent coronary heart disease (CHD), indicating its potential role in the etiology of this condition.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: This highly conserved coding variant in GPLD1 demonstrated an association with ALP, addressing its potential role in the biochemistry of serum biomarkers.
title: Analyses of Biomarker Traits in Diverse UK Biobank Participants Identify Associations Missed by European-centric Analysis Strategies

finding: The SNP rs13194850 was associated with abnormalities in genes regulated by the p53-DREAM pathway, which plays a significant role in hematopoiesis and brain development. This SNP was implicated in diseases related to blood disorders such as dyskeratosis congenita and Fanconi anemia, as well as brain disorders like primary microcephaly and pontocerebellar hypoplasia. These findings highlighted the relevance of p53-DREAM mechanisms in tumorigenesis and phenotypic variations observed in certain malignancies.
title: A systematic approach identifies p53-DREAM target genes associated with blood or brain abnormalities

finding: The SNP rs201510617, along with two other variants in the TNXB gene, was predicted to be deleterious across various scoring systems, with an allele frequency of 3.17E-02, indicating its contribution to severe phenotypes in patients with CMS due to its involvement in extracellular matrix components.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: Variant rs144415985 in the TNXB gene was identified as deleterious with an allele frequency of 4.83E-02. This finding connected to CMS through alterations in tenascins that are critical for neuromuscular junction integrity.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: The SNP rs367685759 also affected TNXB and was predicted to be deleterious with an allele frequency of 5.90E-03. Its significance in CMS phenotype severity was suggested due to its role in the stability of the extracellular matrix.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: The SNP rs10660361 was identified as significantly associated with chronic pain (CP) at a genome-wide level (P-value < 5×10⁻⁸). This SNP was located in the intronic region of LEMD2 on chromosome 5 and was also associated with back pain and multisite chronic pain at similarly significant levels. Additionally, it was linked to anthropometric traits such as height, BMI, body fat percentage, and platelet count.
title: Genetic, lifestyle and environmental risk factors for chronic pain revealed through GWAS

finding: The SNP rs2232429 was located in an intronic region of ZSCAN12 and was found to be associated with a genome-wide significant level (P = 2.06 × 10⁻⁸). This finding was linked to the common factor identified in the genomic structural equation model for schizophrenia (SCZ), bipolar disorder (BD), and major depressive disorder (MDD).
title: Spatial expression pattern of ZNF391 gene in the brains of patients with schizophrenia, bipolar disorders or major depressive disorder identifies new cross-disorder biotypes: A trans-diagnostic, top-down approach

finding: The SNP rs7746199 was prioritized in the in silico fine-mapping analysis for its high posterior probability (PP = 0.96) with ZNF391, which was implicated as a potential causal core gene influencing traits related to mental and behavioral disorders including schizophrenia. The inferred expression of ZNF391 at this SNP showed a decrease relevant to mental traits, indicating its significance in the pathophysiology of psychiatric disorders.
title: Spatial expression pattern of ZNF391 gene in the brains of patients with schizophrenia, bipolar disorders or major depressive disorder identifies new cross-disorder biotypes: A trans-diagnostic, top-down approach

finding: The SNP rs589235, when studied in conjunction with rs151288714, demonstrated interaction profiles indicative of regulatory roles, supporting its involvement in erythropoietic processes.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: The SNP rs9349205 was linked to reduced expression of CCND3 during erythroid differentiation, suggesting its regulatory role in cell cycle transition relevant to erythropoiesis.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: Linked with rs9349205, this SNP showed similar interaction with CCND3. Its association with chromatin openness in committed erythroid cells emphasized its functional relevance.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: This SNP was related to ZFP57 and recorded as a rare haplotype variant (HSV) with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.06%. Performer highly weighted this variant, indicating its significance in driving expression predictions. The alternative allele was noted to create a binding site for the transcription factors NFKB2 and/or RELA, which underscores its potential role in modulating gene expression.
title: Deep-learning prediction of gene expression from personal genomes

finding: This SNP was classified as a common haplotype variant (HSV) with a MAF of 19.98% associated with ZFP57. Performer also gave this variant a high weight. The alternative allele at this locus was shown to create binding sites for several blood transcription factors, reinforcing its relevance in gene expression regulation.
title: Deep-learning prediction of gene expression from personal genomes

finding: In the context of bone mineral density (BMD) analysis, the SNP rs9486902 was identified as mapping to the promoter region of the human gene FOXO3. Through the use of the AdaLiftOver tool, this SNP was successfully linked to the mouse orthologue Foxo3, addressing a limitation where UCSC liftOver failed to appropriately map this SNP due to it being located in a gap among human-mouse chain segments. The identification of this orthologous mapping was crucial as both regions displayed similar epigenomic features and shared transcription factor binding motifs relevant to BMD, emphasizing the importance of rs9486902 in understanding genetic influences on bone metabolism.
title: AdaLiftOver: High-resolution identification of orthologous regulatory elements with adaptive liftOver

finding: The rs2269424 (G/A) SNP, adjacent to the PPT2 and EGFL8 genes associated with immunity, showed strong evidence of selection. This variant was indicated to be a Time Informative Marker (TIM) as it provided insights into the evolutionary pressures acting on immunity-related traits.
title: A genomic dating tool for ancient genomes resolves the origins of hundreds of Eurasian genomes

finding: Findings on rs1800562 (G/A), located in the HFE gene and associated with hemochromatosis, showed a temporal variation trend indicating an increase in the risk allele frequency. This SNP was also recognized as a TIM, linking historical dietary shifts to genetic adaptations.
title: A genomic dating tool for ancient genomes resolves the origins of hundreds of Eurasian genomes

finding: The SNP rs7757969 was reported as significant with a p-value of 4.8×10⁻⁸, indicating a strong association with schizophrenia. This SNP is located in the FYN gene, which was identified as a prioritized candidate gene for schizophrenia. The involvement of the FYN gene relates to neuronal apoptosis, brain development, and synaptic transmission, with lower expression observed in platelets of schizophrenic patients compared to controls.
title: A General Statistic to Test an Optimally Weighted Combination of Common and/or Rare Variants

finding: The R47H mutation in TREM2 was associated with AD, showing an increased risk with a hazard ratio of 2.72. This SNP has been consistently linked to AD risk in previous studies.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The study replicated the association of rs9497673 with colorectal cancer risk, and the SNP was originally identified in previous studies.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for Colorectal Cancer in Multiethnic Indonesians

finding: The association for rs6936461 with colorectal cancer was replicated, and the SNP was reported in earlier studies as having implications in colorectal cancer risk.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for Colorectal Cancer in Multiethnic Indonesians

finding: This SNP was replicable in the study with a significant association to colorectal cancer (p=0.009, OR=2.2) and was originally identified in a Japanese case-control study.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for Colorectal Cancer in Multiethnic Indonesians

finding: Similar to rs61794783, this SNP was classified as a shared ASCAV with an allele change from G>T/C. This finding also demonstrated the reliability of the pipeline used for identifying ASCAVs among the melanoma samples.
title: Prioritization of enhancer mutations by combining allele-specific chromatin accessibility with deep learning

finding: In the context of autoimmune skin disorders, rs9468925 was identified as a shared risk variant for both vitiligo and psoriasis, suggesting a MHC-I driven etiology. This SNP was positively associated with clinical disease co-occurrence findings.
title: Autoimmune Alleles at the Major Histocompatibility Locus Modify Melanoma Susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs9394312 was associated with an interaction effect between genotype and disease status on the expression of the FKBP5 gene, specifically showing that the minor allele conferred a higher FKBP5 expression in controls and lower expression in cases of alcohol dependence (AD). This finding highlighted the significance of FKBP5 in the context of AD.
title: Assessing the role of long-noncoding RNA in nucleus accumbens in subjects with alcohol dependence

finding: The SNP rs10004 was associated with a polymorphic epitope recognized by SSR1-specific T cell clones, encoding either a serine (SSR1-S) or leucine (SSR1-L). It was noted that two out of three HLA-A2 positive healthy donors were heterozygous for this SNP, indicating the presence of the SSR1 epitope. Coculturing T cells with peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) from these donors showed an SSR1-directed T cell response specifically in monocytes, affirming the functionality of TAP-independent SSR1-antigen presentation in healthy cells.
title: Healthy cells functionally present TAP-independent SSR1 peptides: implications for selection of clinically relevant antigens

finding: The variant rs381218 (chr6:32977420:G>T) at the HLA-DOA locus was also cited for its strong in silico mutation effects, corroborated by Zhou et al. (2018), indicating its importance in influencing mRNA transcription.
title: Predicting cell-type-specific non-coding RNA transcription from genome sequence

finding: The study found that the SLC22A3 rs2048327 polymorphism correlated with diabetic retinopathy in Caucasians with Type 2 diabetes mellitus, suggesting genetic susceptibility.
title: Study on potential differentially expressed genes in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis by bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs2070600 polymorphism in the advanced glycosylation end-product specific receptor was found to have prognostic implications in heart failure, highlighting its predictive value in cardiovascular conditions.
title: Study on potential differentially expressed genes in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis by bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: Research indicated that SNP rs9390123 influenced DNA repair capacity in lung cancer by regulating the expression of genes such as PEX3.
title: Study on potential differentially expressed genes in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis by bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs9399451 was noted to have an effect on lung cancer DNA repair capabilities, impacting gene expression and susceptibility.
title: Study on potential differentially expressed genes in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis by bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The coding variant rs9379084 was identified as causal for type 2 diabetes (T2D) with a 92% posterior probability, indicating a strong association between this variant and T2D risk. Carriers of the minor allele (p.Asn1171-RREB1), predicted to affect RREB1 protein function negatively, exhibited a lower risk of developing T2D and lower fasting glucose levels on average. In human donor islets, glucose-stimulated insulin secretion was paradoxically higher in carriers of the T2D-risk allele, despite lower insulin content.
title: Loss of RREB1 in pancreatic beta cells reduces cellular insulin content and affects endocrine cell gene expression

finding: Carriers of the rs112498319 T2D-risk allele (C) displayed lower glucose-stimulated insulin secretion on average, indicating that this variant alters islet-cell function, supporting its role in diabetes risk.
title: Loss of RREB1 in pancreatic beta cells reduces cellular insulin content and affects endocrine cell gene expression

finding: The SNP rs76960013 was found to have an allele frequency of 0.0414 and an odds ratio of 3.95, with a significance level of P = 1.18×10^-13. It was linked to the non-synonymous variant c.2528G>A (p.G843E), which resolved 7.0% of Japanese ARRP cases, contributing to a 26.8% improvement in genetic diagnosis.
title: Systematic detection of Mendelian and non-Mendelian variants associated with retinitis pigmentosa by genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs59178556 had a higher allele frequency of 0.2161 and an odds ratio of 1.83, with P = 3.79×10^-10. It was strongly associated with the common non-synonymous variant c.7666A>T (p.S2556C), which is categorized as benign or likely benign in ClinVar.
title: Systematic detection of Mendelian and non-Mendelian variants associated with retinitis pigmentosa by genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs79476654 had a very low allele frequency of 0.0005 and a high odds ratio of 16.46, with P = 2.45×10^-8. It was linked to the founder mutation c.4957dupA (p.S1653Kfs), which had been previously identified as a significant mutation contributing to ARRP.
title: Systematic detection of Mendelian and non-Mendelian variants associated with retinitis pigmentosa by genome-wide association study

finding: This variant was also noted as an independent lead variant related to cardiometabolic diseases in type 2 diabetes, having similar associations to rs7870658. Additionally, it acted as a splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) for skeletal muscle, suggesting its role in muscle-specific gene regulation.
title: Insulin and Exercise-induced Phosphoproteomics of Human Skeletal Muscle Identify REPS1 as a New Regulator of Muscle Glucose Uptake

finding: This lead variant was associated with lipid traits, further emphasizing the correlation between REPS1 variants and cardiometabolic health.
title: Insulin and Exercise-induced Phosphoproteomics of Human Skeletal Muscle Identify REPS1 as a New Regulator of Muscle Glucose Uptake

finding: This variant was documented as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for muscle, highlighting its potential role in influencing gene expression specifically in muscle tissue.
title: Insulin and Exercise-induced Phosphoproteomics of Human Skeletal Muscle Identify REPS1 as a New Regulator of Muscle Glucose Uptake

finding: The SNP rs3817963 at 6p21.32 had the top PBS score for the Senegal branch and was associated with lung adenocarcinoma. Its risk-increasing allele frequency was notably higher in Senegal (33.9%) compared to Ghana (12.9%), Nigeria (10.4%), and South Africa (8.4%), with p-values < 0.0001 indicating significant differences.
title: A custom genotyping array reveals population-level heterogeneity for the genetic risks of prostate cancer and other cancers in Africa

finding: The SNP rs2070600 showed a missense variant in the AGER protein coding gene with an exceptional association to COPD and lung function in the overall analysis (p = 5.0 × 10−160). It had been previously linked with both conditions.
title: Omnibus Inverse Normal Transformation Based Association Test Improves Power in Genome-Wide Association Studies of Quantitative Traits

finding: This variant was associated particularly with risk of HER2-positive subtypes and was found in case-case comparisons with HER2 status and grade.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Strongly associated with risk of TN disease (OR 1.30, p=8.26×10^-23), and in case-case analyses, it was associated with ER and grade.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: It showed an OR of 1.15 (95% CI 1.12 to 1.19, p=1.24×10^-19) for risk of TN disease and was associated with ER and grade in case-case comparisons.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The minor allele of rs2802295 was associated with decreased total surface area and lower general cognitive function, indicating a link between this snp and cognitive capabilities.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: rs2490272 showed a strong association with cognition, indicating its relevance to cognitive function and supporting the relationship to rs2802295.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: The study identified that PSA levels consistently increased as the minor allele count for rs851023 transitioned from 0 to 2. This finding specifically related to the evaluation of biomarkers in prostate cancer cases, highlighting the genetic influence on PSA levels as determined by the SNP.
title: Testing monotonic trends among multiple group means against a composite null

finding: Rs79967607 was associated with a 0.41-fold (95% CI = 0.29-0.56) decrease in geometric mean percent pancreatic fat (Beta = -0.90, P = 4.91×10^-8), establishing its significant impact on pancreatic fat content. It also showed associations with some biomarkers, including a suggestive association with HDL levels (Beta = 0.09, P = 0.08).
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pancreatic Fat: The Multiethnic Cohort Adiposity Phenotype Study

finding: The effects at the RSPO3 locus were significantly altered after BMI and WHR adjustment, with the new sentinel variant rs72959041 showing enhanced significance (unadjusted p=2.1×10⁻¹⁰, adjusted p=3.4×10⁻⁴⁰). RSPO3 was linked to adiposity and blood trait variation, indicating its role in mediating blood trait variation through obesity-related mechanisms.
title: Obesity and adiposity have opposing genetic impacts on human blood traits

finding: The SNP rs3131638 at the SKIV2L locus was linked to significant alterations in sleep behavior. In zebrafish models, mutations in SKIV2L resulted in reduced sleep duration and increased sleep latency, underlining this locus's contribution to insomnia-like conditions as indicated in GWAS.
title: Zebrafish screen of high-confidence effector genes at insomnia GWAS loci implicates conserved regulators of sleep-wake behaviors

finding: The SNP rs1064173-A was significantly associated with overall autoimmune diseases, exhibiting a very strong correlation with a P-value of 2.74×10^-36 and an odds ratio of 1.80 (95% CI: 1.64-1.96). This finding underscored the genetic contribution of HLA loci in autoimmune conditions.
title: Genetic factors underlying the bidirectional relationship between autoimmune and mental disorders – findings from a Danish population-based study

finding: The rs1998266 variant served as a lead eQTL variant for ETV7 and was colocalised with autoimmune disease traits. The alternative allele (C) of this variant significantly upregulated ETV7 expression during secondary immune responses while modifying the binding motif of the transcription factor ATF6 which could enhance ETV7 transcription.
title: Mapping interindividual dynamics of innate immune response at single-cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs3131071 was identified as a candidate regulatory SNP, with its TF binding activity matched to ChIP-seq peaks for CEBPB, a key regulator involved in differential gene expression in tuberculosis patients.
title: RSAT Var-tools: an accessible and flexible framework to predict the impact of regulatory variants on transcription factor binding

finding: For SNP rs3132397, it was found to affect the binding of the transcription factor ELF1, making it a significant candidate among the regulatory SNPs associated with gene expression modulation.
title: RSAT Var-tools: an accessible and flexible framework to predict the impact of regulatory variants on transcription factor binding

finding: This lead SNP near C6orf106 represented a novel signal, validated in HISLA Stage 2 with perceived higher prioritization due to strong LD.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The variant DAXX A486G was specifically identified in sample GOE615. The analysis revealed that three markers (GADD45B, LOXL4, and ACKR3) showed significant regression to the variation, with an FDR < 0.05. The pathway associated with GADD45B includes critical cancer-related pathways such as p53 signaling and DNA damage repair mechanisms.
title: A novel single-cell RNA-sequencing platform and its applicability connecting genotype to phenotype in ageing-disease

finding: This SNP was identified as falling into a well-positioned Fiber-seq nucleosome footprint within the MOG1/HLA-F locus, which is associated with immune-mediated phenotypes like platelet counts. The finding underscored its potential regulatory role in modulating transcription factor (TF) occupancy.
title: A haplotype-resolved view of human gene regulation

finding: This SNP was found to directly disrupt single-molecule Fiber-seq transcription factor occupancy at a CTCF binding element within the MOG1/HLA-F locus, highlighting its potential significance in the regulation of immune responses.
title: A haplotype-resolved view of human gene regulation

finding: The T allele of variant rs12203592 was associated with a younger age at first sexual intercourse and increased risk of mortality. It also correlated with higher expressions of the IRF4 gene in lung and blood, but lower in skin tissues, highlighting its complex role in health outcomes.
title: Evidence for the role of selection for reproductively advantageous alleles in human aging

finding: This SNP was defined as pathogenic by all four algorithms and was included in the analysis of genes associated with neuroticism. Its pathogenic status indicated a significant contribution to the neuroticism phenotype.
title: Gene-based association analysis identified 190 genes with polymorphisms affecting neuroticism

finding: This SNP was previously found to be associated with neuroticism and was categorized as a potentially pathogenic variant, suggesting its important role in understanding the genetic factors potentially influencing neuroticism.
title: Gene-based association analysis identified 190 genes with polymorphisms affecting neuroticism

finding: The SNP rs12203592 situated in the IRF4 gene was recognized for being associated with eye colour, highlighting its role in pigmentation and its distinction from another associated trait, hair colour.
title: Investigating the genetic architecture of eye colour in a Canadian cohort

finding: Identified on chromosome 6, the SNP rs116072038 emerged with independent significant associations in prior studies and was tied to pigmentation traits.
title: Investigating the genetic architecture of eye colour in a Canadian cohort

finding: The study demonstrated that the targeting of the rs72928038 risk locus using the dCas9-p300 variant led to measurable changes in the expression of the BACH2 gene in K562 cells. This finding suggests a functional role for the rs72928038 locus in the regulation of BACH2 expression, thereby adding insights into its potential implications in epigenetic mechanisms.
title: Tailoring a CRISPR/Cas-based Epigenome Editor for Programmable Chromatin Acylation and Decreased Cytotoxicity

finding: The rs41272114 splice donor mutation variant was associated with significantly lower Lp(a) concentrations (p=3.18e-29). It created 'double-null' LPA alleles in conjunction with the R21X variant, indicating that this SNP is a key player in LPA genetics affecting Lp(a) levels and cardiovascular outcomes.
title: Investigation of an LPA KIV-2 nonsense mutation in 11,000 individuals: the importance of linkage disequilibrium structure in LPA genetics

finding: In the E2F3 gene (6p22.3), rs6456349 was strongly associated with total cholesterol and HDL.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs807701 on the DCDC2 gene was associated with reading ability, indicating its relevance to developmental dyslexia. Previous studies suggested that mutations in DCDC2 lead to reading difficulties, linking this SNP with academic performance across various subjects, including language.
title: Correlation analysis among single nucleotide polymorphisms in thirteen language genes and culture/education parameters from twenty-six countries

finding: The T allele at rs12203592 in the Interferon Regulatory Factor 4 (IRF4) gene was identified to confer an increased risk of developing de novo AML and MDS, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.38 (95% CI, 1.26-1.51, P_meta=2.8×10−12). This association was further supported by transcriptome-wide association studies that showed increased gene expression of IRF4 was correlated with a higher risk of these diseases (OR=3.90, 95% CI, 2.36-6.44, P_meta=1.0×10−7).
title: Genome-wide association analyses identify variants in IRF4 associated with Acute Myeloid Leukemia and Myelodysplastic Syndrome susceptibility

finding: The A allele at rs62389423, a variant in linkage disequilibrium (r²=0.7) with rs12203592 in the regulatory region of IRF4, was associated with an increased risk of de novo AML and MDS with an OR of 1.36 (95% CI, 1.21-1.52, P_meta=1.2×10−7).
title: Genome-wide association analyses identify variants in IRF4 associated with Acute Myeloid Leukemia and Myelodysplastic Syndrome susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs2153960, located in an intron of the FOXO3 gene, was associated with logBMI and exhibited a strong GxE interaction effect, with a p-value of 6.5 × 10^-9. It was previously linked to IGF-I concentration, a mediator associated with metabolic traits.
title: Gene-environment interactions using a Bayesian whole genome regression model

finding: A non-synonymous gain-of-function (GOF) polymorphism in KCNK16 (p.TALK-1 A277E) was associated with an increased risk for type-2 diabetes (T2D). This finding indicated a significant genetic relationship between alterations in TALK-1 function and diabetic phenotypes. In a Han Chinese population, this SNP also demonstrated a significant correlation with increased total cholesterol levels.
title: The MODY-associated TALK-1 L114P mutation causes islet α-cell overactivity and β-cell inactivity resulting in transient neonatal diabetes and glucose dyshomeostasis in adults

finding: The nonsynonymous variant rs142986308 (p. Arg587Trp) was discovered in the MHC region and was associated with alopecia areata (AA) susceptibility in the CCHCR1 gene. Mice carrying this variant displayed a patchy hair loss phenotype, and keratin abnormalities were identified in the hair shafts. Additionally, there was comparative differential expression of hair-related keratin genes in both alopecic mice and hair follicles from AA patients with the risk variant, validating the significance of this AA susceptibility variant through functional analysis.
title: The alopecia areata phenotype is induced by the water avoidance stress test in cchcr1-deficient mice

finding: The SNP was linked to Autism Spectrum Disorder with a notably higher positive effect size than those observed in gnomAD. There was an enrichment of gain-of-function mutations associated with ASD cases, particularly those overlapping with PASs and demonstrating significant gains in function.
title: Deciphering the Impact of Genetic Variation on Human Polyadenylation

finding: The variant rs3800461 on the gene C6orf106 was found to be implicated in autophagy, which relates to molecular mechanisms involved in Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) as it connects to phagocytosis and cellular autophagic processes.
title: Personalized Perturbation Profiles Reveal Concordance between Autism Blood Transcriptome Datasets

finding: For rs10455872, it was reported that compared to individuals with the AA genotype (non-carriers), those carrying at least one Lp(a) raising allele (AG or GG genotype) had an increased hazard ratio (HR) for all-cause mortality at 1.14 (95% CI, 1.07-1.22) and for cardiovascular mortality at 1.23 (95% CI, 1.11-1.36). The event rates for all-cause and cardiovascular mortality among those with AG or GG genotypes were also noted to be higher, at 31.9% and 13.9%, respectively.
title: Long-Term Exposure to Elevated Lipoprotein(a) Levels, Parental Lifespan and Risk of Mortality

finding: The SNP rs610913 was identified as a common variant of the cGAS protein, and it was found that this variant contributes to a baseline cellular antiviral state. The study demonstrated that this tonic activation of the cGAS-STING pathway, linked to the presence of the rs610913 variant, could impact the replication of SARS-CoV-2 in airway-derived cell lines.
title: A basally active cGAS-STING pathway limits SARS-CoV-2 replication in a subset of ACE2 positive airway cell models

finding: Associated with age-related macular degeneration (AMD), this SNP was linked to genes TSPYL1 and TSPYL4 and occurred in chromatin accessible regions in amacrine and horizontal cells. The eQTL data confirmed its significant relationship with TSPYL4 expression.
title: Single-cell multiome of the human retina and deep learning nominate causal variants in complex eye diseases

finding: The HFE variant was identified as negatively associated with age and replicated in the analysis.
title: Exome-wide association studies in general and long-lived populations identify genetic variants related to human age

finding: Similar to rs147398495, rs381218 in the HLA-DOA locus also exhibited significant in silico mutation effects on ncRNA transcription, validated by experimental data, thus strengthening the link between genotype and ncRNA expression.
title: Predicting cell-type-specific non-coding RNA transcription from genome sequence

finding: The rs365052 SNP, located on chromosome 6 within the ZFP57 gene, acted as a local eQTL influencing methylation at multiple clustered CpG-sites on chromosome 20, particularly near the promoter of the GNAS-AS1 anti-sense RNA transcript. This association supported ZFP57's function as a trans-acting modulator of methylation and linked it to the phenotype of body size, with implications for conditions such as transient neonatal diabetes mellitus 1.
title: Genetic control of KRAB-ZFP genes explains distal CpG-site methylation which associates with human disease phenotypes

finding: SNP rs9263745 mapped to CCHCR1, which also has associations with multiple genetic diseases.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns

finding: The SNP rs610913 was identified as a naturally occurring variant that maintained a baseline cellular antiviral state through the cGAS pathway. This finding was significant in the context of HIV-1 infection as it suggested that this variant might impact the efficacy of immune responses necessary for fighting off HIV-1, potentially influencing treatment strategies.
title: Type I interferons sensitise HIV-1-reactivating T-cells for NK cell-mediated elimination despite HDACi-imposed dysregulation of innate immunity

finding: The SNP rs1906953, located at 6p21.3 in the GRM4 gene, was identified as a susceptibility locus for osteosarcoma in previous genome-wide association studies, achieving genome-wide significance. It was believed to enhance transcription of GRM4 due to its presence at a DNase I hypersensitive site, and GRM4 was found to be overexpressed in the majority of osteosarcomas. This rs1906953 was implicated in the regulation of glutamate receptors, which played a role in osteosarcoma tumor progression, potentially linking neurotransmitter receptors to cancer cell proliferation and migration.
title: Vitamin D inhibits osteosarcoma by reprogramming nonsense-mediated RNA decay and SNAI2-mediated epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition

finding: The SNP rs9349379 resided in the intronic region of the gene PHACTR1, which was linked to coronary artery atherosclerotic disease. This SNP was situated in a predicted enhancer region, indicating a possible role in dysregulating an intronic enhancer, thus impacting cardiovascular phenotype.
title: Examining dynamics of three-dimensional genome organization with multi-task matrix factorization

finding: The ESR1 gene polymorphism rs2175898 had a significant sex-specific effect on obesity, indicating its influence on gender-related metabolic pathways.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The ADTRP rs6903956 was regulated by GATA2 through preferential interaction, suggesting its role in CAD susceptibility.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs45527431 was associated with schizophrenia at genome-wide significance levels, with alleles that increased the odds of left-handedness also increasing the risk of schizophrenia.
title: RSGenome-wide association study identifies 49 common genetic variants associated with handedness

finding: The SNP rs9405472 was located in the FOXF2 locus and was identified as a lead SNP associated with anterior segment dysgenesis. This was highlighted as a novel finding during the analysis of the EyePACS data, with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.4279 and a p-value of 2.0·10^-11.
title: transferGWAS: GWAS of images using deep transfer learning

finding: The SNP rs9356013 was associated with the age-at-onset (AAO) of Parkinson's disease (PD) specifically in the Spanish population, demonstrating a genome-wide significant association (corrected p-value= 4.44E-13). Carriers of this SNP displayed a notably younger mean AAO (42.67 ± 14.58 years for homozygous carriers and 60.07 ± 12.64 years for heterozygous carriers) compared to the overall case series mean AAO of 61.23 ± 11.47 years. The association was confirmed using conditional analyses indicating that rs9356013 likely tagged both a common and a rare variant, highlighting its role in PD etiology within the Spanish cohort.
title: The genetic architecture of Parkinson disease in Spain: characterizing population-specific risk, differential haplotype structures, and providing etiologic insight

finding: The SNP rs6903956, located on chromosome 6p24.1, was identified as a genetic risk factor for coronary artery disease (CAD) in a Chinese population cohort. It significantly increased risk with an adjusted odds ratio of 1.65. The risk allele A was associated with higher levels of circulating endothelial cells (CECs), suggesting endothelial injury related to CAD.
title: Trans-interaction of risk loci 6p24.1 and 10q11.21 is associated with endothelial damage in coronary artery disease

finding: The rs3094127 SNP in the FLOT1 gene was associated with an increased risk of invasive aspergillosis (IA) in a cohort of hematopoietic stem-cell transplant recipients. The study found that the cumulative incidence of IA significantly varied among different genotypes of this SNP: 38.5% for CC, 29.6% for TC, and 19.6% for TT genotypes, with p-values indicating statistical significance (p = 0.04 for CC and p = 0.05 for TC). Furthermore, in a multivariate model, the CC genotype at rs3094127 remained an independent predictor of IA with a hazard ratio of 1.89 (95% CI 1.14-5.67, p = 0.03). This finding highlighted a crucial role of lipid raft-dependent responses in the immune defense against A. fumigatus infection.
title: Flotillin-dependent lipid-raft microdomains are required for functional phagolysosomes against fungal infections

finding: The rs2842980 variant was related to the lengthening of the 3' UTR of the SOD2 gene by creating a canonical AUUAAA PAS site. This variant was in strong linkage disequilibrium with an intergenic genetic variant associated with atrophic macular degeneration, suggesting possible mechanistic involvement of SOD2 in the disease.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The rs2842992 variant was noted to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs2842980 and associated with atrophic macular degeneration. Its significance was highlighted by its proposed role in influencing the expression or functional mechanisms related to SOD2.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs13194864 was identified as associated with the AXL receptor's role in cancer metastasis and drug resistance. This finding highlighted how nutritional factors, such as oleic acid, could influence AXL activation and thereby promote an invasive phenotype in MITF<sup>Low</sup> melanoma cells.
title: Phenotype-specific melanoma uptake of fatty acid from human adipocytes activates AXL and CAV1-dependent β-catenin nuclear accumulation

finding: The SNP rs4140646 exhibited moderate linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the structural variant PD_DEL_chr6_2338, characterized as a 0.33kb intragenic deletion situated 2.5kb upstream of the gene ZSCAN9.
title: Genome-wide analysis of Structural Variants in Parkinson’s Disease using Short-Read Sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs114627468 associated with multiple phenotypes, including body height and smoking behavior, was involved in transcriptional regulation relevant to neuropsychiatric traits.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs9357065 was found to correlate with behavioral phenotypes and schizophrenia, supporting its role in neural processes through transcriptional mechanisms.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs1225618 was positioned as an ASB SNP for TAF1 and linked to various psychiatric and behavioral disorders, suggesting its influence through gene regulatory alterations.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs1150668 was linked to schizophrenia and autism spectrum disorder, indicating its regulatory importance in neural development.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs62620225 was identified as a GWAS peak related to various phenotypes, reinforcing its potential functional relevance in regulatory mechanisms.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: At the intergenic variant (rs7747253) in the HLA region, strong selection was detected, beginning approximately 8,000 years ago. This region is associated with heel bone mineral density, and the derived allele's frequency decreased significantly.
title: Population Genomics of Stone Age Eurasia

finding: The SNP rs9267677 within the HLA locus displayed a gradual increase in frequency commencing about 4,000 years ago, escalating more rapidly about 1,000 years ago, highlighting its association with educational attainment.
title: Population Genomics of Stone Age Eurasia

finding: The SNP rs1360780 correlated with altered cognitive function in aged individuals, indicating a relationship between FKBP5 locus variations and cognitive performance. This association aligned with observations of cognitive impairment and neuroinflammation resulting from SKA2 knockdown in mice.
title: SKA2 regulated hyperactive secretory autophagy drives neuroinflammation-induced neurodegeneration

finding: The rs9357271 SNP, located intronically in the BTBD9 gene, was solely associated with restless leg syndrome, highlighting its specific influence compared to other SNPs with broader associations.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: Detected as a significant rare variant in the PLA2G7 locus, showcasing its potential influence in biomarker profiles associated with inflammation.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: This rare variant was confirmed signifying associations in the PLA2G7 locus, indicating extensive genetic contribution to inflammatory signaling.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Part of the significant signals at the PLA2G7 locus, reinforcing the genetic architecture of inflammatory responses.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Found as a significant signal at the PLA2G7 locus, supporting its relevance in ongoing inflammatory biomarker research.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Identified as a major contributor in rare variant analyses and it's notable for loss-of-function effects at PLA2G7 related to inflammation.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: This variant supported significant rare variant associations in the PLA2G7 locus, contributing to understanding its role in inflammatory pathways.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: This rare SNP was confirmed as significant in relation to P-selectin metrics, establishing its relevance in the inflammatory process.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The SNP rs34247110 was characterized as a Tier 3 AFR_high-specific eQTL for the KCNK17 gene. This SNP was associated with type 2 diabetes in multiple populations, including European, African American, Hispanic, and Asian groups, signifying its relevance across diverse ancestries and its shared eQTL signals.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: The SNP rs3734618 was noted as a Tier 3 AFR_high-specific eQTL of the KCNK17 gene, associated with type 2 diabetes across various populations. Its identification alongside rs34247110 supported the notion of overlapping lead eQTL signals for Tier 3 ancestry-specific variants.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: The SNP rs761357 was indicated as the single causal variant linked to the association signal at AHI1 for Multiple Sclerosis and Irritable Bowel Syndrome based on MPRA data, despite not being the lead variant in either eQTL or GWAS data.
title: Multiple Causal Variants Underlie Genetic Associations in Humans

finding: The index SNP rs9271058 was mapped to a candidate cis-regulatory element (cCRE) linked to the HLA-DRB1 gene in microglia within the entorhinal cortex. It was noted that HLA-DRB1 was significantly down-regulated in microglia of sEOAD patients, indicating its potential role in the disease's pathology.
title: Single-nucleus multiomics reveals the disrupted regulatory programs in three brain regions of sporadic early-onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs1947413 was characterized as a heterozygous C/G SNP located 354 bp upstream of a validated de novo LINE-1 insertion in hEMB-3. It was genetically linked with the C allele, designated as allele B, which co-occurred with the LINE-1 insertion, demonstrating that the absence of this insertion in certain single cells corresponded with the presence of both empty alleles A and B.
title: LINE-1 retrotransposition impacts the genome of human pre-implantation embryos and extraembryonic tissues

finding: The SNP rs10944957 was identified as a heterozygous T/A SNP located 912 bp downstream of the LINE-1 insertion site in hEMB-3. It contributed to the genetic context of the LINE-1 insertion and was not present in the single cells that lacked the insertion, reinforcing the conclusion of genetic mosaicism in the embryo.
title: LINE-1 retrotransposition impacts the genome of human pre-implantation embryos and extraembryonic tissues

finding: The analysis showed that SNP rs6597292 overlapped with EC4-specific peaks related to the DSP and BMP6 genes, highlighting its significance in the context of cytoskeletal and signaling pathways relevant to coronary artery disease.
title: Multiomics of human aortic endothelial cells reveals cell subtypes with heterogeneous responses to canonical endothelial-to-mesenchymal perturbations

finding: The missense variant rs2817191 in KIAA0319 was associated with poor performance on spelling tasks, indicating its role in dyslexia-related traits.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: Similar to rs2817191, rs2744550 was identified as a missense variant in KIAA0319 that showed significant association with spelling performance.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: Another variant, rs2760164, was strongly correlated with decreased spelling performance, further supporting the dyslexia risk associated with KIAA0319.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: Like the other KIAA0319 variants, rs2760163 was significantly associated with poor performance on spelling, contributing to the overall genetic understanding of dyslexia.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: The variant rs2744549, which was closely related to a cluster of variants in KIAA0319, showed significant association with spelling performance though had slight discrepancies in analysis.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: The non-coding variant rs114526784 was associated with spelling tasks and has been implicated in disrupting transcription factor binding sites.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: Variant rs142310124 in DCDC2 was significantly associated with spelling tasks and influenced by covariate adjustments.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: This variant also showed significant association with multiple phenotypes related to spelling performance, supporting the involvement of DCDC2 in dyslexia.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: The variant rs72830859 was recorded as significant in evaluation related to transcription factor binding in the context of dyslexia.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: The SNP rs12198320 demonstrated significant association with specific traits, highlighting its contribution towards understanding dyslexia risk.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: The A allele at the intronic variant rs72928038 increased risk for MS and T1D, with disease associations confidently colocalized with multiple regulatory QTLs in naive CD4+ T-cells. It was identified as the most likely causal variant in fine-mapping studies utilizing QTL data, achieving a high posterior probability of 0.98.
title: Genetic associations at regulatory phenotypes improve fine-mapping of causal variants for twelve immune-mediated diseases

finding: The SNP rs9368219 near the CDKAL1 locus was also reported as a significant finding associated with age at diagnosis of T2D, with a p-value of 2.29 x 10^-8 and a Beta of -0.053. This SNP demonstrated similar directionality and consistency across different ethnic groups.
title: Common and distinct genetic architecture of age at diagnosis of diabetes in South Indian and European populations

finding: Identified as another novel SNP near CDKAL1, rs143316471 showed an association with age of diagnosis of T2D in South Indians but was rare in European populations. It had a p-value < 0.0054 indicating strong ethnic-specific significance.
title: Common and distinct genetic architecture of age at diagnosis of diabetes in South Indian and European populations

finding: The SNP rs76572975 was found in the PKHD1 gene and identified as an independent signal within a known locus associated with Mendelian kidney disease. It is protein-altering, which emphasizes its potential as a target for further functional studies.
title: Discovery and prioritization of variants and genes for kidney function in >1.2 million individuals

finding: The SNP rs9277535 was identified as the most studied SNP associated with hepatitis B virus. This association was highlighted across numerous studies involving large populations from various Asian and central Asian countries, including China, Japan, Turkey, Korea, and Indonesia, indicating a significant link between this genetic variant and susceptibility to hepatitis B.
title: HLA-SPREAD: A comprehensive resource for HLA associated diseases, drug reactions and SNPs across populations

finding: The SNP rs28724235 showed robust evidence of genome-wide significance in association with MPO+ ANCA EGPA, indicating a specific genetic basis for this subgroup.
title: Genetically distinct clinical subsets, and associations with asthma and eosinophil abundance, within Eosinophilic Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis

finding: The SNP rs3101018 also showed significant regulatory effects in both HepG2 and K562 cells and was associated with schizophrenia, highlighting its potential impact on neurological conditions.
title: High-throughput functional analysis of IncRNA core promoters elucidatesrules governing tissue-specificity

finding: The minor (A) allele was associated with lower triglycerides in Africans (β -0.55 TG, p=4.1 × 10⁻⁸) and in AA (β -0.076 TG, p=0.037). Variants in this gene have been linked to insulin resistance.
title: GWAS in Africans identifies novel lipids loci and demonstrates heterogenous association within Africa

finding: The SNP rs12202410 was nearby the FBXL4 gene, which is linked to energy homeostasis and was uniquely associated with depression.
title: Stratifying depression by neuroticism: revisiting a diagnostic tradition using GWAS data

finding: The SNP rs9273363 was found to be significantly associated with type 1 diabetes (T1D), replicating findings from prior studies in both EstFin and 1000G imputed datasets.
title: Advantages of genotype imputation with ethnically matched reference panel for rare variant association analyses

finding: The SNP rs2677110, located within the RUNX2 gene on chromosome 6, also demonstrated a significant association with RBA. RUNX2 encodes a transcription factor that regulates osteocalcin expression, and previous research indicated that low levels of osteocalcin could correlate with age-related cognitive decline.
title: Improving brain age estimates with deep learning leads to identification of novel genetic factors associated with brain aging

finding: The SNP rs3129058 was involved in regulating LPS-induced methylation at the CpG cg16885113. This variant colocalised with a GWAS risk locus for lung cancer, suggesting its potential implication in cancer pathology and immune response variations.
title: Characterisation of the genetic determinants of context specific DNA methylation in primary monocytes

finding: The SNP rs417764 was significantly associated with baseline methylation levels of 151 CpGs, which were influenced by ZFP57 expression. Furthermore, this SNP modulated the response to LPS stimulation for several of these CpGs, showing that its genotype affected the magnitude of demethylation during immune activation.
title: Characterisation of the genetic determinants of context specific DNA methylation in primary monocytes

finding: The SNP rs76572975 was identified within the gene PKHD1, a known cause of Mendelian kidney disease. It was located in a newly identified single variant credible set and was characterized as a protein-altering variant with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 2%, indicating its potential as a target for further exploration.
title: Discovery and prioritization of variants and genes for kidney function in >1.2 million individuals

finding: This SNP was previously associated with liver iron and was replicated in this study.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: This SNP, like rs1800562, was associated with liver iron levels and validated through replication.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: In a multi-ethnic meta-analysis conducted by Kou et al. in 2018, the SNP rs6570507 was confirmed to be associated with adolescent idiopathic scoliosis (AIS). This finding indicated a significant correlation between the genetic variant and the development of AIS, suggesting that individuals carrying this SNP might have an increased risk for this condition.
title: Mimicking extracellular matrix-mediated mechano-activation by antibodies to control signaling of the adhesion G protein-coupled receptor GPR126/ADGRG6

finding: The SNP rs237025, which results in the M55V polymorphism in SUMO4, was associated with the functionality of SUMO4 in double-strand break (DSB) repair. It was demonstrated that cells with this polymorphism were defective in forming 53BP1 and RAD51 foci, showed poor homologous recombination repair in SceI assays, and were sensitive to DSB inducing agents.
