This finding highlighted the significance of M55 in the DSB repair process.
title: SUMO4 regulates DNA double-strand break repair independently of conjugation

finding: The nonsynonymous change in the VARS2 locus (rs4678) was found to be strongly associated with rheumatoid arthritis (RA). This finding was part of a broader investigation where kTWAS identified numerous genes associated with RA, specifically highlighting the role of this SNP in the context of MHC region genetics.
title: kTWAS: Integrating kernel-machine with transcriptome-wide association studies improves statistical power and reveals novel genes

finding: A mutation in HLA-DQA2 (rs9275595) was identified as potentially contributing to the pathogenesis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA). This particular SNP was discussed within the context of the overall genetic contributions to RA, marking it as significant in conjunction with other findings in the MHC region.
title: kTWAS: Integrating kernel-machine with transcriptome-wide association studies improves statistical power and reveals novel genes

finding: In the context of the HLA-B gene, the rs713031 showed random allele expression over time, exhibited an allelic imbalance towards the alternative allele at 24 hours post-infection (hpi), and switched to the reference allele at 48 hpi. This finding was associated with an increased transcriptional level for the gene.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: For the BRD2 gene, the rs2071876 consistently expressed the reference allele in the H522 cell line at 72 and 96 hpi, indicating a stable expression pattern under the influence of SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: In the HLA-B gene, the rs41553715 had an increased expression of the alternative allele at 12 hpi, despite the gene being upregulated at 36 hpi in the Calu-3 cell line.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: This SNP in the HLA-C gene displayed a preferential expression of the alternative allele regardless of gene expression compensation measured in different HLA-C cell lines.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: In the HLA-A gene, the rs2075684 was found to be differentially expressed in iBCs-1566 cells after 24 hpi, where the reference T allele was more active than the alternative A allele, changing phenylalanine to tyrosine at position 33 of the HLA-A protein.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: The expression profiles of rs45585732 in the HLA-A gene were changed during viral infection, indicating responsive expression dynamics.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: Similar to rs45585732, the expression profiles of rs1655894 in the HLA-A gene altered during infection, reflecting variation in gene expression.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: Located in the major histocompatibility complex (MHC) region, this SNP showed significant selection pressure with a p-value of 2.04×10^-10, underscoring its role in autoimmune and infectious disease adaptation.
title: Genomic analyses of 10,376 individuals provides comprehensive map of genetic variations, structure and reference haplotypes for Chinese population

finding: The progenitor eSNP rs4897179 was significantly colocalized with index SNP rs9388490 for GWAS associated with Global Surface Area and Educational Attainment, indicating its role in gene expression dynamics for these traits.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: The C allele of rs9388486 disrupted transcription factor binding, leading to decreased CENPW expression, which correlated with increased cortical surface area and cognitive function, demonstrating its importance in neurogenesis.
title: Genetic influences on cell type specific gene expression and splicing during neurogenesis elucidate regulatory mechanisms of brain traits

finding: The SNP rs615672 was identified as having a possible interaction with rs9268831, located within potential genome regulatory elements. It was specifically associated with rheumatoid arthritis, indicating its relevance in autoimmune disease mechanisms.
title: Detecting epistatic interactions in genomic data using Random Forests

finding: The SNP rs9268831 was found to interact with rs615672, being part of potential genome regulatory elements and associated with autoimmune diseases, underlining its role in genetic interactions.
title: Detecting epistatic interactions in genomic data using Random Forests

finding: The SNP rs9273363 was highlighted as being associated with autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis and type 1 diabetes in multiple genome wide association studies, marking its significance as an interactive SNP.
title: Detecting epistatic interactions in genomic data using Random Forests

finding: The SNP rs6457617 was associated with several autoimmune diseases, including multiple sclerosis and Graves disease, as identified by genome wide association studies, indicating its importance in the genetic landscape of autoimmune conditions.
title: Detecting epistatic interactions in genomic data using Random Forests

finding: The finding indicated that the human-specific C-allele variant of rs9444584 drove higher levels of CNR1 promoter activity in hippocampal cells, compared to the ancestral T-allele. This SNP was part of a highly conserved regulatory sequence crucial for understanding cannabinoid pharmacogenetics and was linked to the reduced CNR1 expression associated with increased susceptibility to alcohol abuse.
title: Genetic and epigenetic influences modulating the tissue specific regulation of the cannabinoid receptor -1 gene (CB1); implications for cannabinoid pharmacogenetics

finding: The SNP rs13205205 was associated with the gene FOXA1, which played a significant role in breast cancer. It was part of the identified gene expression signature in uninvolved mammary gland samples that linked to both reduced tumor size and increased mortality rates. This finding was critical in understanding the dual roles of FOXA1 in cancer progression and potential as a molecular marker for breast cancer outcomes.
title: Prelude to Malignancy: A Gene Expression Signature in Normal Mammary Gland from Breast Cancer Patients Suggests Pre-tumorous Alterations and Is Associated with Adverse Outcomes

finding: The SNP rs1003260 in 6q13, although not significant in GWAS (P<sub>GWAS</sub> = 3.6E-08), was associated with <italic>RIMS1</italic> (P<sub>TWAS</sub> = 2.1E-8), marking it as an important candidate for further investigation in the context of osteoporosis.
title: Integrating genome-wide association and transcriptome predicted model identify novel target genes with osteoporosis

finding: The human-specific C-allele variant of rs9444584 was found to drive higher levels of CNR1 promoter activity in hippocampal cells compared to the ancestral T-allele. This SNP was specifically linked to reduced expression of CNR1 in ECR1 knockout mice, indicating its importance in cannabinoid-related behaviors and possible neuroprotection in addiction.
title: Genetic, epigenetic and pharmacological influences modulating tissue specific regulation of the cannabinoid receptor-1 gene (CB1); implications for cannabinoid pharmacogenetics

finding: The SNP rs9486719 was identified as a lead variant at the UFL1-FHL5 locus, reaching genome-wide significance for its association with coronary artery disease (CAD) at a p-value of 1.1E-8 and myocardial infarction (MI) at a p-value of 6.8E-10. This SNP was shown to influence FHL5 gene expression positively, indicating a regulatory role in CAD and MI risk.
title: FHL5 controls vascular disease-associated gene programs in smooth muscle cells

finding: The SNP rs10872018 was prioritized through epigenomic profiling and was found to be critical for regulating FHL5 expression. It was implicated as a causal variant influencing CAD risk by interacting with transcription factors, specifically affecting the binding site of SRF-Myocardin, which is crucial for smooth muscle cell differentiation.
title: FHL5 controls vascular disease-associated gene programs in smooth muscle cells

finding: The rs2274911 polymorphism in the GPRC6A gene was associated with insulin resistance in both normal weight and obese subjects. This finding highlighted a potential link between GPRC6A genetic variation and metabolic disorders, contributing to the understanding of insulin resistance mechanisms.
title: GPRC6A is a Potential Therapeutic Target for Metformin Regulation of Glucose Homeostasis in Mice

finding: The rs13215402 SNP at chr6:153447550 decreased enhancer activity by 50% when the reference G allele was replaced with the variant A allele, with a significance p value of 0.00349.
title: Optimized high-throughput screening of non-coding variants identified from genome-wide association studies

finding: The rs1360780 SNP, located in intron 2 of the FKBP5 gene, was associated with heightened FKBP5 mRNA and protein expression levels in individuals with severe psychiatric disorders. Carriers of the minor allele (T allele) demonstrated exacerbated FKBP5 induction following stress or glucocorticoid exposure. This association was particularly pronounced in cases compared to control individuals, indicating a potential role of this SNP in influencing stress responses and contributing to psychopathology, especially in older adults.
title: Genotype and age influence cortical-FKBP5 at multiple regulatory and single-cell-type levels in severe psychiatric disorders

finding: The interaction in psoriasis identified with logistic regression between the HLA-C variant (rs10484554) and ERAP1 (rs27524) yielded genotypic odds ratios (ORs) over 7.5 relative to the most protective genotype. The effect of the risk allele of HLA-C at rs10484554 was significant only when individuals also carried the ERAP1 risk allele at rs27524, indicating a notable interaction effect.
title: GWAIS-Web: A Fast and Secure Web Service for Epistasis Detection in Genome-wide Association Interaction Studies

finding: This SNP was found to have a significant role in the regulation of gene expression relevant to SLE, demonstrating differential binding to transcription factors.
title: High-throughput identification of functional regulatory SNPs in systemic lupus erythematosus

finding: The common functional variant rs1360780 was associated with altered cognitive function in aged individuals. This genetic variant was linked to the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis and peripheral blood gene expression, suggesting a crucial role in cognitive processes, particularly in the context of aging and potential implications for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Late-Life Alcohol Exposure Does Not Exacerbate Age-Dependent Reductions in Mouse Spatial Memory and Brain TFEB Activity

finding: The SNP rs1165834930, which corresponds to a G/C variant in the third KLF5 binding site, was found to have a significant effect on enhancer activity, leading to a 5.0-fold increase in activity. This finding was part of a study that established the importance of sequences with binding sites for STAT6 and KLF5 in modulating activity of the SPDEFe enhancer, which is essential for pathologic mucin production in asthma. The effect of this SNP was the most substantial observed among all tested variants.
title: Targeting a central feature of asthma using a cell type-selective IL-13-responsive enhancer

finding: SNP rs13194734 showed relevance in precision oncology efforts for gene expression profiling in Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer, indicating its potential implications in cancer-related gene regulation and treatment responses.
title: Gene Expression Profiling Unveils the Temporal Dynamics of CIGB-300-Regulated Transcriptome in AML Cells

finding: Variant rs2076309 in <italic>TAFP2B</italic> was listed among the genes under robust selection in association with common refractive errors, suggesting it may contribute to myopia risk through environmental adaptations.
title: Detection of adaptation to light environment in myopia-associated loci Diversity of the myopia genetic background

finding: The SNP rs953413 was shown to regulate polyunsaturated fatty acid metabolism by modulating ELOVL2 expression, illustrating its role in lipid metabolic processes.
title: HNF4α regulates acyl chain remodeling and ether lipid accumulation in hepatic steatosis

finding: The study highlighted the association of SNP rs13215498 with ataxia-telangiectasia (A-T), suggesting a link between the genetic variation and the failures in ATM protein functions that contribute to the disease's symptoms, including cerebellar degeneration and microtubule dynamics disruption.
title: The ataxia-telangiectasia disease protein ATM controls vesicular protein secretion via CHGA and microtubule dynamics via CRMP5

finding: The SNP rs13194932 was associated with cancer-related phenotypic variations, specifically in the context of pancreatic cancer, influencing tumor microenvironment heterogeneity, which was determined to be an essential factor affecting development, progression, and therapy response.
title: Understanding and leveraging phenotypic plasticity during metastasis formation

finding: The SNP rs12203592, located in intron 4 of the gene Irf4, was genetically linked to the phenotype of human hair graying, attributed to the loss of melanocyte stem cells (McSCs). This particular SNP disrupts an intronic enhancer element that affects TFAP2/MITF-mediated transcription of the Irf gene. The findings indicated that IRF4 works in coordination with MITF to regulate the expression of the gene Tyr, and loss of Irf4 was associated with lighter hair color in Mitf mutant mice. Furthermore, within the qMcSCs identified in the study, Irf4 expression was only present in the most differentiated subpopulation (C0), highlighting its role and relevance in the quiescent state of McSCs.
title: Molecular heterogeneity of quiescent melanocyte stem cells revealed by single-cell RNA-sequencing

finding: The SNP rs1360780, located within intron 2 of the human FKBP5 gene, was found to modulate FKBP5 demethylation and transcription, influencing susceptibility to stress-related psychiatric disorders. The findings suggest that this SNP plays a role in the link between GR function, DNA demethylation, and FKBP5 transcription, thereby shedding light on the pathobiology of affective disorders.
title: Regulation of neuron-specific gene transcription by stress hormone signalling requires synaptic activity in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs11967262 was found in an intergenic region upstream of VEGFA, a key regulator of angiogenesis, and was significantly associated with varicose veins.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs2842611 was identified as a HDL-associated SNP located within an intron of the gene SNX15. Its cis-regulatory effect was linked to the expression level of the lncRNA SNHG5, which was down-regulated in adipose tissue from patients with obesity. This finding demonstrated the complexity of regulatory mechanisms affecting gene expression related to HDL levels and obesity.
title: Context Dependent Perturbation of Allelic Expression Imbalance Reveals Novel Candidate Therapeutic Targets for Metabolic diseases

finding: The SNP rs9493627, a missense variant in EYA4, achieved a nominally significant association with hearing difficulty (p = 7.7e-10) in the UK Biobank sample. This SNP had been previously observed but gained additional support as a risk locus for hearing loss.
title: Biological insights from multi-omic analysis of 31 genomic risk loci for adult hearing difficulty

finding: The variant rs77910749 was identified as a candidate causal variant in the intergenic region associated with bipolar disorder (BD) and cognitive performance. It was found to increase binding affinity for the transcription factor PAX6 and enhance activity of the LC1 enhancer, which was active in the developing cerebral cortex and amygdala. Additionally, knock-in mice carrying the humanized rs77910749 exhibited behavioral defects related to sensory gating, a trait associated with BD.
title: A candidate causal variant underlying both enhanced cognitive performance and increased risk of bipolar disorder

finding: Lead SNP rs9320913 was associated with educational attainment in Caucasians, which is linked to cognitive performance. This association was supported by significant findings across multiple studies, including confirmation from GWAS meta-analyses for cognitive ability, indicating a strong linkage to cognitive performance.
title: A candidate causal variant underlying both enhanced cognitive performance and increased risk of bipolar disorder

finding: The proxy variant rs1906252 was associated with increased general cognitive ability in two GWAS meta-analyses, demonstrating a significant correlation with the phenotypes of cognitive performance and educational attainment, supporting the interrelated genetic basis for these traits.
title: A candidate causal variant underlying both enhanced cognitive performance and increased risk of bipolar disorder

finding: Another significant proxy variant, rs10457441, was linked to greater cognitive ability in GWAS meta-analyses, aligning with findings of shared genetic influences on cognitive performance and educational attainment.
title: A candidate causal variant underlying both enhanced cognitive performance and increased risk of bipolar disorder

finding: Lead SNP rs12202969 was identified in a GWAS of Caucasian BD patients, correlating with a 10-20% increased risk for BD, thereby affirming its role in the genetic predisposition to this neuropsychiatric disorder.
title: A candidate causal variant underlying both enhanced cognitive performance and increased risk of bipolar disorder

finding: The proxy variant rs1487441, found to be in high linkage disequilibrium with rs12202969, was confirmed in another GWAS study, thus supporting the likelihood of a shared genetic basis for BD and cognitive performance phenotypes.
title: A candidate causal variant underlying both enhanced cognitive performance and increased risk of bipolar disorder

finding: This variant in TREM2 was found to be exome-wide significant (p = 4.8 × 10^-12) and was associated with increased risk of late onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). It was confirmed as a risk allele in the dataset analyzed.
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for a role for PSEN1 and suggest involvement of the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3β and WNT signalling pathways

finding: This high-impact variant in TREM2 was reported to occur in 4 cases and no controls, suggesting a strong association with LOAD, particularly in its homozygous form, which causes Nasu-Hakola disease.
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for a role for PSEN1 and suggest involvement of the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3β and WNT signalling pathways

finding: The rs9471643 polymorphism was found to upregulate PGC transcription and protein expression, indicating its potential role in cancer biology under overdominant or dominant models.
title: SNPector: SNP inspecting tool to detect disease existence and drug response in direct naked sequencing depends on mutation index

finding: Similar to rs9471643, the rs6458238 polymorphism was also noted to upregulate PGC transcription and protein expression, suggesting it might influence cancer pathogenesis.
title: SNPector: SNP inspecting tool to detect disease existence and drug response in direct naked sequencing depends on mutation index

finding: The analysis revealed that the rs10455872 SNP, which is associated with Lp(a) levels and denotes copy number variants in the LPA gene, showed a statistically significant relative increase in Lp(a) levels among individuals carrying pathogenic LDLR alleles compared to noncarriers. This finding was consistent across various analyses, including raw and adjusted Lp(a) levels, and holds relevance in multiple genome-wide association studies, highlighting the importance of this SNP in understanding Lp(a) regulation.
title: Functional interrogation of cellular Lp(a) uptake by genome-scale CRISPR screening

finding: The SNP rs3135388 tagged the HLA-DRB1*15:01 allele, which was confirmed to confer an earlier onset of multiple sclerosis (MS). It was known that carriers of this variant were on average one year younger at onset compared to non-carriers (p<0.001).
title: A higher burden of multiple sclerosis genetic risk confers an earlier onset

finding: This SNP, located approximately 70 kb downstream of HLA-DRB1, was identified as a lead independent risk variant associated with an age at onset (AAO) of MS with a significance of p=6.9×10^-7. It provided evidence of genetic contributions to earlier onset of MS.
title: A higher burden of multiple sclerosis genetic risk confers an earlier onset

finding: The SNP rs149847639 was significantly associated with an AAO of MS, showing a large effect size with a beta of -7.5 years, indicating that increased minor allele copies correlated with an earlier onset (p<0.001).
title: A higher burden of multiple sclerosis genetic risk confers an earlier onset

finding: The SNP rs719316 in the ATXN1 gene was associated with an earlier onset of MS (p=0.020), revealing its potential link with neurodegenerative processes.
title: A higher burden of multiple sclerosis genetic risk confers an earlier onset

finding: The SNP rs12195276, located in the KCNQ5 gene, was significantly associated with variation in pulse pressure. This finding was relevant to the modulation of cardiovascular parameters by the sympathetic nervous system.
title: Novel target identification using single cell sequencing and electrophysiology of cardiac sympathetic neurons in disease

finding: The SNP rs3131638 was tied to the SKIV2L gene, which, when mutated, caused significant reductions in sleep duration and increased sleep latency in zebrafish. This finding indicated a potential insomnia-like state due to hyperarousal, implicating SKIV2L as a crucial factor in sleep behavior.
title: Zebrafish screen of high-confidence targets at insomnia GWAS loci implicates MEIS1, SKIV2L, and ARFGAP2 as conserved regulators of sleep-wake behaviors

finding: The T108A variant (rs376205580 g.138196008A>G) was identified in a small cohort of individuals in Sydney. Most individuals carrying this allele were healthy family members of Māori or Pacific Islander ancestry, suggesting that this missense variant could be associated with a beneficial health status, potentially linked to an improved balance in immune response.
title: Phospho-tuning immunity through Denisovan, modern human and mouse TNFAIP3 gene variants

finding: The I207L variant (rs141807543 g.138196957A>C), identified alongside T108A, shared a similar context where it was found in healthy family members of Māori or Pacific Islander ancestry in Sydney. Its presence in this cohort indicated a potential advantageous effect in immune response, although specific health outcomes linked to this variant were not detailed.
title: Phospho-tuning immunity through Denisovan, modern human and mouse TNFAIP3 gene variants

finding: This SNP, located in the NKAIN2 gene, showed a genome-wide significant interaction (p=3.2×10−8) with sex across disorders including schizophrenia (SCZ) and bipolar disorder (BIP). It was significant for both disorders but exhibited opposite risk directions involving males and females.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The disease risk allele of this SNP had strong associations with SNRPC isoforms, with evidence suggesting its role as a causal gene in systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and altering interferon signaling.
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: This i2-rQTL variant affected SNRPC isoforms and showed strong co-localization with GWAS signals linked to systemic lupus erythematosus, indicating its likely role in SLE pathogenesis.
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: Associated with FHL5, this variant was validated across diverse datasets, confirming its relevance in brain functional signatures.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: The variant rs2750415, also an intronic variant in REPS1, was linked to cardiometabolic diseases in type 2 diabetes, including coronary artery disease and chronic kidney disease, and acted as a splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) for skeletal muscle.
title: Insulin and Exercise-induced Phosphoproteomics of Human Skeletal Muscle Identify REPS1 as a New Regulator of Muscle Glucose Uptake

finding: The variant rs62441843 was associated with lipid traits and was positioned between REPS1 and ABRACL. It showed further associations related to appendicular lean mass, standing height, and sex-hormone binding globulin.
title: Insulin and Exercise-induced Phosphoproteomics of Human Skeletal Muscle Identify REPS1 as a New Regulator of Muscle Glucose Uptake

finding: The rs12193050 variant was associated with corneal-related traits and served as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) specifically for muscle tissue.
title: Insulin and Exercise-induced Phosphoproteomics of Human Skeletal Muscle Identify REPS1 as a New Regulator of Muscle Glucose Uptake

finding: The rs200307517 variant was associated with leisure screen time, highlighting a potential link to lifestyle factors affecting metabolic health.
title: Insulin and Exercise-induced Phosphoproteomics of Human Skeletal Muscle Identify REPS1 as a New Regulator of Muscle Glucose Uptake

finding: The SNP rs433061 was highlighted for its role in regulating CO4A protein levels. It was identified as a significant pQTL and a known eQTL for the C4A gene in multiple tissues.
title: A large-scale multivariate pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: This missense variant was identified as a significant pQTL for the CFAB protein and was found to influence transcription factor binding sites, which may affect multiple gene expressions.
title: A large-scale multivariate pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: The SNP rs2187668 was used as a tag SNP for the HLA-DRB1*03:01 haplotype in the context of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). It was utilized in the GRS analysis, where its association indicated relevance in predicting SLE risk.
title: Genome-wide assessment of genetic risk for systemic lupus erythematosus and disease severity

finding: The SNP rs9267992 served as a tag SNP for the HLA-DRB1*15:01 haplotype in the SLE studies. Its inclusion in the GRS underlined its contribution to SLE susceptibility through genetic risk scoring.
title: Genome-wide assessment of genetic risk for systemic lupus erythematosus and disease severity

finding: The SNP rs9271366 was identified as an important tag SNP for the HLA-DRB1/HLA-DQA1 haplotype in the Chinese cohort. Its incorporation into the GRS showcased its role in genetic predisposition to SLE.
title: Genome-wide assessment of genetic risk for systemic lupus erythematosus and disease severity

finding: The SNP rs9275328 was utilized as a tag SNP for HLA-DQB1/HLA-DQA2 in the Chinese cohort. It contributed significantly to the GRS, evidencing its association with SLE susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide assessment of genetic risk for systemic lupus erythematosus and disease severity

finding: The SNP rs11154337 was associated with pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH) severity and mortality. The presence of the G allele improved six-minute walk distance significantly (p=0.0130) and conferred a survival benefit in two independent PAH cohorts with hazard ratios of 0.44 (p=0.0250) and 0.49 (p=0.0002). This SNP regulated the expression of NCOA7, influencing lysosomal activity and immune activation, thereby linking genetic predisposition to clinical outcomes in PAH.
title: Genetic regulation and targeted reversal of lysosomal dysfunction and inflammatory sterol metabolism in pulmonary arterial hypertension

finding: rs144679016 was identified as one of seven variants from a 95% credible set in highly constrained non-coding regions related to the gene PLG, which encodes the plasminogen protein implicated in coronary artery disease (CAD). This variant was located in the antisense transcript ENST00000659713, suggesting its role in CAD risk through alterations in constrained regulatory elements of PLG.
title: A genome-wide mutational constraint map quantified from variation in 76,156 human genomes

finding: Similarly to rs144679016, rs116480834 was part of the seven variants located in highly constrained non-coding regions associated with PLG, further indicating the prioritized non-coding variants' influence on increasing CAD risk.
title: A genome-wide mutational constraint map quantified from variation in 76,156 human genomes

finding: This SNP was also included among the seven variants in highly constrained non-coding regions related to PLG, underscoring its potential role in the dysregulation of the PLG-plasmin system and its connection to CAD risk.
title: A genome-wide mutational constraint map quantified from variation in 76,156 human genomes

finding: As with other variants related to PLG, rs148517610 was part of the highly constrained non-coding regions and implicated in the CAD risk pathway, reinforcing the importance of regulatory variants in coronary artery disease.
title: A genome-wide mutational constraint map quantified from variation in 76,156 human genomes

finding: Within the context of the constrained analysis, rs143556831 was identified in the 9th intron of PLG, which suggests its regulatory implications in CAD development, consistent with the role of PLG in the disease.
title: A genome-wide mutational constraint map quantified from variation in 76,156 human genomes

finding: The SNP rs12529023 resided in highly constrained non-coding regions near PLG, which likely affects its regulatory elements, contributing to CAD risk through alterations in gene expression.
title: A genome-wide mutational constraint map quantified from variation in 76,156 human genomes

finding: Like rs12529023, rs139095347 was also found in constrained non-coding regions downstream of PLG, further supporting the association between these regulatory variants and CAD.
title: A genome-wide mutational constraint map quantified from variation in 76,156 human genomes

finding: The A to G variant rs11755393, located on chromosome 6 at position 34824636, was shown to have an allele frequency of the alternative allele (G) that increased from 0.132 in individuals with no disease to 0.511 in individuals with CIN3, consistent with disease progression. This finding was confirmed as a true positive due to the absence of a homopolymer sequence in the flanking region adjacent to the variant and the lack of many edges in the sequencing figure, indicating that the region was not difficult to sequence.
title: VisVariant: A java program to visualise genetic variants in next-generation sequencing data

finding: This SNP was significant as a cis-eQTL of both HLA-DQB1 and HLA-DQA2, demonstrating its regulatory role in multiple immune-related genes.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs1897107 was identified as having a high constraint score (Z=6.32) within a constrained genomic window associated with coronary artery disease (CAD). This region, spanning approximately 153 kb downstream of the gene PLG, highlights the significance of this non-coding variant in relation to the disease.
title: A genome-wide mutational constraint map quantified from variation in 76,156 human genomes

finding: The SNP rs1897109 was also found to have a high constraint score (Z=6.32) in the same constrained genomic window as rs1897107, implicating it in coronary artery disease (CAD) due to its location near the PLG gene. This suggests potential functional relevance of these non-coding variants in CAD.
title: A genome-wide mutational constraint map quantified from variation in 76,156 human genomes

finding: The progenitor eSNP rs4897179 was co-localized with the index SNP (rs9388490) for both educational attainment (EA) and global surface area (GSA) GWAS, suggesting it was a significant regulatory element influencing these traits.
title: Genetic effects on brain traits impact cell-type specific gene regulation during neurogenesis

finding: As the index SNP for GSA and EA, rs9388490 was confirmed to have strong associations with cognitive function and surface area metrics in the brain, supporting its role as a major regulatory SNP in these traits.
title: Genetic effects on brain traits impact cell-type specific gene regulation during neurogenesis

finding: Variant rs9388486 disrupted transcription factor binding motifs, affecting the chromatin accessibility at the promoter of the CENPW gene. This alteration correlated with decreased gene expression in progenitors, influencing neurogenesis and cognitive outcomes.
title: Genetic effects on brain traits impact cell-type specific gene regulation during neurogenesis

finding: The SNP rs117780815 in the NKAIN2 locus was found to have a genome-wide significant SNP-by-sex interaction (p=3.2×10^-8), implicating sodium/potassium-transporting ATPase enzymes and associated with risks in bipolar disorder (BIP) and schizophrenia (SCZ) with opposing effects between sexes.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: SNP rs9272785 was prominently associated with multiple phenotypes including rheumatoid arthritis and various diabetes manifestations, showing its influence on a wide range of autoimmune and metabolic conditions.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: The SNP rs20455 in the KIF6 gene was associated with the risk of coronary heart disease (CHD) as demonstrated in a pooled analysis of 50 individual studies. This analysis included a total of 40,059 cases and 64,032 controls, suggesting a significant genetic link between the KIF6 polymorphism and increased susceptibility to CHD.
title: Kif6 regulates cilia motility and polarity in brain ependymal cells

finding: Possessing the alternative allele for rs4880, located in the superoxide dismutase 2 (SOD2) gene, was associated with shorter telomeres. This finding highlighted a genetic factor influencing telomere length, which is an essential biometric marker of biological aging.
title: Markers, Mechanisms and Metrics of Biological Aging: A Scoping Review

finding: This SNP, an intronic variant in the PLEKHG1 gene, was significantly associated with both PVWMH and total WMH, further linking it with vascular and dementia-related conditions.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: The SNP rs6570507 was confirmed to be associated with adolescent idiopathic scoliosis (AIS) in a multi-ethnic meta-analysis. This association suggested that variations in this SNP could influence the genetic regulation of spine morphology and the susceptibility to AIS, thereby providing insights into potential therapeutic targets for managing the disorder.
title: A G protein-coupled receptor is required in cartilaginous and dense connective tissues to maintain spine alignment

finding: The SNP rs62420820 was identified as a deepSNP linked to multiple sclerosis (MS) and exhibited genome-wide significance in the IMSGC GWAS with a p-value of 9.26×10^-36, while showing nominal significance in the KKNMS GWAS (p-value = 1.23×10^-5). It was located in the intergenic region IL20RA-IL22RA2 and was shown to influence the binding of transcription factors MafF and MafK, proposing a potential mechanism contributing to MS susceptibility.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: Identified as an eQTL for DDR1 and PSORS1C1, the rs1264326 SNV enhanced TFAP2A binding, thereby increasing transcriptional expression linked to inflammatory acne rosacea risk.
title: Disease-Linked Regulatory DNA Variants and Homeostatic Transcription Factors in Epidermis

finding: An eQTL for several genes, this SNP correlated with a variety of health issues, indicating its broad implications in genetics.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with snoring in participants.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: Correlated with various health measures including high blood pressure and migraines in the UK Biobank.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The A allele in rs240764 was associated with more frequent neurotic behavior. This SNP was identified as one of the lead SNPs from genomic loci that overlapped with those formerly associated with mental disorders, indicating its relevance in the context of nonresponse due to behavioral factors.
title: Patterns of item nonresponse behavior to survey questionnaires are systematic and have a genetic basis

finding: The SNP rs3129051 was identified only by ESNN, located upstream of the HLA-G gene, which is well-known to be related to Type 1 Diabetes (T1D). This finding suggested that rs3129051 may play a role in the genetic architecture of T1D, potentially through non-additive effects.
title: Uncertainty Quantification in Variable Selection for Genetic Fine-Mapping using Bayesian Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs16894900 was also found solely by the ESNN method and situated between the MAS1L and UBD genes, both of which have been linked to T1D. This suggested that rs16894900 could contribute to T1D susceptibility through non-linear genetic mechanisms.
title: Uncertainty Quantification in Variable Selection for Genetic Fine-Mapping using Bayesian Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs2229634 in the ITPR3 gene was associated with an increased risk of developing coronary artery aneurysm in children suffering from Kawasaki disease. This finding indicated a significant genetic contribution to the severity of the disease, allowing for better understanding and potential future interventions in affected children.
title: IBAS: Interaction-bridged association studies discovering novel genes underlying complex traits

finding: The rs176713 SNP was significantly associated with the BACH2 gene, a transcriptional inhibitor known to affect Nrf2 function, which plays a protective role in progressive neurodegeneration in Parkinson's disease. This association provided crucial insights into the genetic factors underlying PD.
title: CluStrat: a structure informed clustering strategy for population stratification

finding: The SNP rs28383319 demonstrated a genetic association with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) through GWAS-eQTL colocalization near the FKBPL locus in whole blood, highlighting its involvement in inflammatory processes regulated by viral factors.
title: Identification and catalogue of viral transcriptional regulators in human diseases

finding: The SNP rs9268645 was correlated with rheumatoid arthritis through eQTL colocalization affecting FKBPL in whole blood, illustrating its potential influence on inflammation and vascular integrity related to viral pathology.
title: Identification and catalogue of viral transcriptional regulators in human diseases

finding: The SNP rs3778150 was implicated in opioid addiction and identified within the OPRM1 locus. It was associated with a human-specific up-regulated enhancer in Glu neurons, representing a human-specific nucleotide substitution (T -> C) that showed high conservation across mammals. This up-regulation reflected evolutionary changes linked to opioid abuse.
title: Evolution of regulatory signatures in primate cortical neurons at cell type resolution

finding: SNP rs1799971 was associated with opioid abuse and identified within the OPRM1 locus. It overlapped with a human-specific up-regulated promoter in Glu neurons and was characterized by a human-specific C -> T nucleotide substitution, highlighting its role in the evolutionary shift of regulatory mechanisms related to opioid addiction.
title: Evolution of regulatory signatures in primate cortical neurons at cell type resolution

finding: The study found that SNP rs699947, located in the promoter region of VEGFA, exhibited significant genetic divergence between Sherpa highlanders and non-Sherpa lowlanders. The major allele 'C' showed a higher frequency in Sherpas (0.824 vs. 0.854 in healthy Tibetans), indicating a potential role in adaptation to high altitude.
title: Hypoxia-tolerant vascular endothelial growth factor-A (VEGF-A) and the genetic variations of VEGFA in Sherpa highlanders

finding: The SNP rs1570360 in the promoter region of VEGFA was significantly associated with genetic divergence between Sherpa highlanders and other populations, including East Asians and South Asians. The major allele 'G' was prevalent among Sherpas, aligning with their hypoxia adaptation mechanisms.
title: Hypoxia-tolerant vascular endothelial growth factor-A (VEGF-A) and the genetic variations of VEGFA in Sherpa highlanders

finding: SNP rs2010963, located in the 5'-UTR of VEGFA, showed significant allele frequency differences between Sherpa highlanders and non-Sherpa lowlanders, with a major allele 'C' frequency of 0.667 in Sherpas. This SNP was also linked to a protective effect against chronic mountain sickness (CMS).
title: Hypoxia-tolerant vascular endothelial growth factor-A (VEGF-A) and the genetic variations of VEGFA in Sherpa highlanders

finding: Similar to rs699947, SNP rs833061 showed significant divergence in genotype and allele frequency between Sherpas and non-Sherpas, with the major allele 'T' being more frequent in Sherpas. This finding supported the role of this SNP in adaptation to hypoxia.
title: Hypoxia-tolerant vascular endothelial growth factor-A (VEGF-A) and the genetic variations of VEGFA in Sherpa highlanders

finding: The rs10455872 genetic variant was associated with increased risks of hyperlipidemia and cardiovascular diseases. In two PheWAS analyses conducted using ICD-9-CM and ICD-10-CM maps, significant positive correlations were found between the minor allele of rs10455872 and coronary atherosclerosis (p < 0.001, OR = 1.60 for both maps) and chronic ischemic heart disease (p < 0.001, OR = 1.56 for ICD-9-CM and OR = 1.47 for ICD-10-CM). This finding validated the utility of the newly established ICD-10-CM to phecode mapping.
title: Developing and Evaluating Mappings of ICD-10 and ICD-10-CM Codes to Phecodes

finding: The SNP rs2790099-C was associated with PAD as an intron variant of RUNX2, linked to white matter volume in basal ganglia regions, marking it as significant for structural brain relationships.
title: Deep learning based brain age prediction uncovers associated sequence variants

finding: The SNP rs2184968-C was linked to increased CSF in subcortical regions and the size of the fourth ventricle, suggesting its involvement in neuroanatomical variations associated with PAD.
title: Deep learning based brain age prediction uncovers associated sequence variants

finding: The SNP rs910416 was identified as an intronic non-coding variant located in the ESR1 locus, demonstrating a substantial association with breast cancer. It was classified within a cell-constrained domain characterized by H3K27me3 repression across numerous cell types, and showcased the highest posterior inclusion probability (PIP) score of 1 when utilizing the continuous cellular constraint score model, indicating its strong predictive value. Experimental evidence indicated that rs910416 resides in a putative silencer element, where it affected the binding of the MYC transcription factor, thus disrupting the silencer's regulatory roles for ESR1 and RMND1 expression, contributing to breast cancer pathogenesis. This example underscored the utility of cellular constraint in enhancing fine-mapping and in elucidating regulatory mechanisms linking genetic variation to biological function.
title: Epigenetic constraint of cellular genomes evolutionarily links genetic variation to function

finding: The SNP rs6931421 was found to be genome-wide significant in the context of a prior meta-analysis of SHR, replicating results in the UK Biobank study, indicating its association with sitting height ratio.
title: Genetics of skeletal proportions in two different populations

finding: The rs20455 SNP caused a W719R substitution in kinesin family member 6, which was associated with altered responses to statin treatment. It had higher allele frequencies in African (86%) and East Asian (53%) populations, indicating a potential impact on drug response.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: The rare TREM2 R47H missense variant (rs75932628) was associated with late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD) in multiple independent studies. In the context of the study, the Trem2R47H mouse model demonstrated a significantly negative association with immune-related human modules in various brain regions, indicating its relevance in understanding disease processes associated with LOAD.
title: A novel systems biology approach to evaluate mouse models of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The variant was associated with IFNGR1 deficiency and was curated in ClinVar as 'likely pathogenic'. When annotated with reference transcripts, it was classified as low severity (intronic variant), but was reannotated as a stop-gain variant (high severity) with the custom transcriptome, indicating significant functional impact. A novel transcript containing the variant had a predicted open reading frame (ORF) and showed strong support across sequenced samples.
title: SUsPECT: A pipeline for variant effect prediction based on custom long-read transcriptomes for improved clinical variant annotation

finding: The SNP rs6923262 was part of the trans-omic path involving the gene SRF and peptide APP 2. Its significant node importance score indicated a potentially critical role in the network relating to Alzheimer's disease as analyzed by the MoFNet model.
title: Deep multi-omic network fusion for marker discovery of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Selection at the rs7747253 locus in the HLA region began about 8,000 years ago, showing strong signals in immune-related functions, while the allele associated with bone mineral density reduced over time.
title: Population Genomics of Stone Age Eurasia

finding: The SNP rs9267677 showed selection evidence starting 4,000 years ago, increasing in frequency and associated with phenotypes related to educational attainment.
title: Population Genomics of Stone Age Eurasia

finding: The SNP rs34424986, associated with the homozygous p.R275W mutation in the Parkin gene, was examined in the study. Patient-specific neurons with this mutation responded to treatment with 2-Hydroxypropyl-β-Cyclodextrin (HP-β-CD), leading to an increase in the number of dopaminergic neurons, suggesting that this SNP can influence neuronal differentiation and has therapeutic implications.
title: Parkinson’s disease phenotypes in patient specific brain organoids are improved by HP-β-CD treatment

finding: The SNP rs2105898 was identified as a key genetic marker linked to systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and Sjögren’s syndrome (SjS). Specifically, it was associated with a risk increase in SLE with an odds ratio of 1.52 (95% CI: 1.44-1.61; p < 10^-48) in Europeans and 1.49 (95% CI: 1.35-1.63; p < 10^-16) in African Americans, after controlling for C4 effects. Additionally, it was highlighted as part of a short haplotype that influenced immune response by regulating expression of various HLA class II genes, thus suggesting a mechanism by which genetic variations at this locus shape vulnerability to autoimmune diseases.
title: Complement component 4 genes contribute sex-specific vulnerability in diverse illnesses

finding: The SNP rs13205174 was identified in relation to NKT cell immunotherapy effectiveness. The study highlighted the landscape of NKT cell involvement in cancer, including CRC, where alterations in immune responses can be crucial for therapeutic strategies.
title: Immunophenotypic changes in peripheral blood of colorectal cancer patients: a potential diagnostic marker for CD4+ monocytes

finding: The SNP rs483481, located in the OPRM1 gene, was previously identified as being associated with the risk for heroin use disorder. This finding highlighted the genetic implications of this polymorphism in the context of opioid dependency and related disorders.
title: Morphine Re-arranges Chromatin Spatial Architecture of Primate Cortical Neurons

finding:
The SNP rs10455872 was positively associated with increased risks of developing hyperlipidemia and cardiovascular diseases. In two separate PheWAS using the PheCodes derived from different coding systems (ICD-9-CM and ICD-10-CM), significant associations were observed with coronary atherosclerosis and chronic ischemic heart disease. Both analyses yielded similar effect sizes, indicating robust replication of the findings (ICD-9-CM:

< 0.001, OR = 1.60 for coronary atherosclerosis; ICD-10-CM:

< 0.001, OR = 1.60 for coronary atherosclerosis and OR = 1.47 for chronic ischemic heart disease). This highlighted the reliability of the genetic associations within the context of EHR data.
title: Developing and Evaluating Mappings of ICD-10 and ICD-10-CM Codes to PheCodes

finding: Similar to rs1512270, rs17194607 was identified as an eSNP associated with TNFRSF10A expression. The regulation of this gene was modulated by nearby eCpG sites, indicating a possible transcriptional role, but like its counterparts, it was not found as a canonical eQTL or meQTL.
title: memo-eQTL: DNA methylation modulated genetic variant effect on gene transcriptional regulation

finding: This SNP in the TNF region was associated with 11 bacteriophage groups, revealing the influence of genetic inflammation markers on bacteriophage presence.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: Located within the intron of REPS1, this variant was linked to cardiometabolic diseases in type 2 diabetes and acted as an sQTL for skeletal muscle, suggesting its role in muscle-specific gene regulation.
title: Phosphoproteomic Analysis Identifies REPS1 as an Insulin- and Exercise-Responsive Signal Transducer to Glucose Uptake in Skeletal Muscle

finding: Similar to rs66883945, this variant was associated with lipid traits and was significant in the context of metabolic health.
title: Phosphoproteomic Analysis Identifies REPS1 as an Insulin- and Exercise-Responsive Signal Transducer to Glucose Uptake in Skeletal Muscle

finding: As an eQTL for muscle, this variant showed association with differential expression of REPS1 in muscle tissue, indicating its potential influence on muscle-specific gene regulation.
title: Phosphoproteomic Analysis Identifies REPS1 as an Insulin- and Exercise-Responsive Signal Transducer to Glucose Uptake in Skeletal Muscle

finding: This variant was singularly associated with leisure screen time, highlighting its association with lifestyle-related traits.
title: Phosphoproteomic Analysis Identifies REPS1 as an Insulin- and Exercise-Responsive Signal Transducer to Glucose Uptake in Skeletal Muscle

finding: The SNP rs443198 was significantly associated with systemic sclerosis (M34) and was mapped to the gene NOTCH4, which is important for multiple diseases in the musculoskeletal system and connective tissue, including rheumatoid arthritis (M06.9) and psoriatic arthritis (M07.3).
title: A novel method for multiple phenotype association studies based on genotype and phenotype network

finding: The SNP rs241458 was associated with the rheumatoid arthritis pathway and was identified through the network module analysis, revealing its importance despite not being previously reported in the GWAS catalog.
title: A novel method for multiple phenotype association studies based on genotype and phenotype network

finding: The SNP rs3097646 was identified as being related to the rheumatoid arthritis pathway in the context of the network modules, enhancing its significance in the genetic analysis of this disease, although it was not reported in the GWAS catalog.
title: A novel method for multiple phenotype association studies based on genotype and phenotype network

finding: The SNP rs6916921 was associated with diseases in the musculoskeletal system and was selected as a lead SNP in the analysis, providing essential links to its genetic underpinning.
title: A novel method for multiple phenotype association studies based on genotype and phenotype network

finding: The SNP rs13195028 was associated with a specific LAMC2-positive cell population that exhibited an enhanced capacity for self-renewal and was deemed sufficient for tumor initiation and metastasis. The study revealed that this SNP may play a role in mechanisms implicated in pancreatic cancer by influencing the TGF-β signaling pathway, which is critical for tumor growth and dissemination. The findings suggested further investigation into this SNP's role in identifying tumor-initiating cells and its potential use as a therapeutic target or biomarker.
title: LAMC2 marks a tumor-initiating cell population with an aggressive signature in pancreatic cancer

finding: This SNP also demonstrated association with type 1 diabetes (T1D) in both imputed datasets. As with rs11102694, it was noted for its overlapping significance despite differing lead variants.
title: Advantages of genotype imputation with ethnically matched reference panel for rare variant association analyses

finding: The SNP rs1126506 was identified as having strong selection signals for South Asian (SAS) populations and was associated with Anti-rubella virus IgG levels, reflecting evolutionary pressures related to immune response.
title: Improved Characterization of Balancing Selection Genome Wide and a Detailed Look at HLA Genes

finding: The SNP rs833061 was identified as being associated with progression-free survival (PFS) and overall survival (OS) in CRC treatment.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The finding related to SNP rs3135388 implicated this SNP as a tagging variant for HLA-DRB1*15:01, which is significantly associated with Multiple Sclerosis (MS). The analysis involved a genetic burden score calculated from a range of MS-associated SNPs, highlighting the importance of this particular SNP in understanding the genetic predisposition to MS.
title: Multiscale networks in multiple sclerosis

finding: rs3798519 was linked to the risk of nephrolithiasis and was found to be associated with the gene TFAP2B.
title: GWAS identifies nine nephrolithiasis susceptibility loci related with metabolic metabolic and crystallization pathways

finding: Located within EPB41L2, rs6928986 was implicated in the regulation of PTHR activity, related to nephrolithiasis.
title: GWAS identifies nine nephrolithiasis susceptibility loci related with metabolic metabolic and crystallization pathways

finding: This SNP, located within KCNK5, was shown to influence urine pH and calcium phosphate solubility, thus affecting stone formation.
title: GWAS identifies nine nephrolithiasis susceptibility loci related with metabolic metabolic and crystallization pathways

finding: The SNP rs760676508 was associated with a pathogenic in-frame deletion (c.1696_1707del; p.(Gln566_Lys569del)) in the RIPOR2 gene, which was identified as a highly penetrant cause of adult-onset progressive hearing loss that segregated as an autosomal dominant trait in 12 families from the Netherlands. The variant affected a highly conserved protein region and was linked to hearing loss with an average age of onset of 30.6 years.
title: A RIPOR2 in-frame deletion is a frequent and highly penetrant cause of adult-onset hearing loss

finding: The SNP rs200847762, located within the FKBPL gene, was associated with lung cancer, reporting an odds ratio (OR) of 0.21 with a P-value of 1.84×10^-6 in the discovery stage. The association replicated in the first replication study with an OR of 0.19 and a confidence interval (CI) of (0.08 – 0.46). In the second replication study, the estimated OR was 0.66, but the CI included one (0.34 – 1.28). The Mix Bayes approach provided a posterior estimate of OR equal to 0.27 with a credible interval of (0.133-0.55), indicating a genuine causal signal.
title: Quantifying posterior effect size distribution of susceptibility loci by common summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs2298090, found within the HIST1H1E gene, had the second smallest P-value in the discovery study at 6.16×10^-5 but failed to replicate convincingly with an OR of 0.65 and a 95% CI of (0.44 – 1.02). The Mix Bayes posterior mean estimate was OR = 0.48 with a CI of (0.24-1.01), further suggesting uncertainty in its association.
title: Quantifying posterior effect size distribution of susceptibility loci by common summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs9469031, located within the BAT2 (also known as PRRC1A) gene, had a discovery P-value of approximately 10^-4 and was successful in replication during the second stage of the study. The Mix Bayes approach estimated the OR to be 0.68, with a 95% posterior interval of (0.43 – 1.07), indicating a potential association.
title: Quantifying posterior effect size distribution of susceptibility loci by common summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs9481842 was found to significantly influence the transcription factor NKX2-5, linking it to thirteen putative atrial fibrillation (AF) core genes that showed consistent downregulation in both mRNA and protein levels in AF patients.
title: Tissue-specific multiOMICs analysis of atrial fibrillation

finding: Found in the intron of BACH2, this SNP was involved in Treg-related enhancer functions and represented an eQTL linking to Treg expression.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: Associated with BACH2, this SNP showed significant modifications in enhancer activity during Treg activation.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: This SNP was also linked to BACH2 and showed altered chromatin accessibility in stimulated Treg populations.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: This SNP, located in an enhancer region linked to BACH2, was predicted to disrupt binding of transcription factors, suggesting a potential regulatory role in T1D.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: The rs7756992 A/G polymorphism in the CDKAL1 gene was associated with type 2 diabetes mellitus, as established by a meta-analysis that included 62,567 subjects. This finding highlighted the genetic predisposition linked to glucose metabolism and dyshomeostasis, correlating with the role of CDKAL1 in insulin mRNA processing.
title: Acute inhibition of iron-sulfur cluster biosynthesis disrupts metabolic flexibility in mice

finding: The novel polymorphism rs35612982 in the CDKAL1 gene was identified as a risk factor for type 2 diabetes in a case-control study. This further emphasized the connection between CDKAL1 genetic variants and glucose imbalance, reinforcing its importance in diabetes pathophysiology.
title: Acute inhibition of iron-sulfur cluster biosynthesis disrupts metabolic flexibility in mice

finding: The rs45527431 SNP was similarly associated with schizophrenia at genome-wide levels of significance, where alleles associated with left-handedness also elevated schizophrenia risk.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 49 common genetic variants associated with handedness

finding: The SNP rs13215542 was associated with CCR4, a chemokine receptor that was analyzed as a potential therapeutic target for cancer immunotherapy. The context of this finding related to breast cancer, emphasizing the role of chemokine receptors and their potential influence on tumor cell fate and patient survival.
title: CHEMOKINE SIGNALING IN BREAST CANCER: FOCUS ON CC-MOTIF CHEMOKINE LIGANDS

finding: The SNP rs9271209 was identified as an eQTL for HLA-DRB1, where its presence correlated with reduced expression of HLA-DRB1 in patients with Alzheimer's disease. This effect was suggested to occur through inhibition of transcription factor binding, as rs9271209 overlapped with ChIP-seq peaks and DNA-binding motifs for transcription factors MEF2B, CUX1, and ATF2.
title: An integrative systems-biology approach defines mechanisms of Alzheimer’s disease neurodegeneration

finding: The SNP rs13214343 was associated with the assessment of shallow coral habitat on the Great Barrier Reef, providing insights into the spatial dynamics of coral communities. The findings highlighted the importance of specific genetic markers in understanding the interactions between coral species and their environmental conditions, which could affect coral habitat modeling and management strategies.
title: Reproducing within-reef variability in coral dynamics with a metacommunity modelling framework

finding: The SNP rs13215532 was associated with altered expression of genes related to the epithelial to mesenchymal transition (EMT), a mechanism linked to chemoresistance in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). This finding contributed to understanding the genetics underlying drug resistance in PDAC.
title: Multi-omic analysis of HDAC1 function in pancreatic cancer reveals altered GTPase activity impacting chemoresistance

finding: The variant rs9273375 was identified at the 3’ end of the HLA-DQB1 gene, demonstrating a strong association with Lyme disease (P = 6.53×10^-11). This finding was significant within the known impact of the HLA region on infectious conditions.
title: Secretoglobin family 1D member 2 (SCGB1D2) protein inhibits growth of Borrelia burgdorferi and affects susceptibility to Lyme disease

finding: The SNP rs3020314 located in the ESR1 gene was shown to hold a noteworthy association with breast cancer risk, supported by significant findings from the DOT method.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: This SNP was part of a significant linear combination in the ESR1 gene analysis, emphasizing its role as a new potential risk factor for breast cancer.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The findings recognized rs3020424 as contributing to breast cancer risk through its involvement in high-weight combinations among ESR1 SNPs.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The rs985695 SNP was also among the prioritized SNPs in the ESR1 gene, highlighting its potential association with breast cancer.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: Identified in combination analyses, rs2347867 emerged as an important variant in relation to breast cancer risk among ESR1 SNPs.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The SNP rs3003921 was showcased as a new potential breast cancer risk variant based on its significant contributions in the ESR1 gene.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: This SNP was included in the high-weight combinations for the ESR1 gene, reinforcing its profile as a new risk variant for breast cancer.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The rs926777 SNP, although newly identified, showed potential implications for breast cancer risk in combination with other significant ESR1 SNPs.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The rs9383590 SNP, located at the ESR1 enhancer region, was discovered to interact with regulatory elements and activate oncogene transcription. This finding was significant in the context of breast cancer, suggesting that noncoding SNVs can influence gene expression pathways relevant to cancer development.
title: Targeting SLC7A11-mediated cysteine metabolism for the treatment of trastuzumab resistant HER2 positive breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs3777457 was identified in genome-wide association studies to be associated with type 2 diabetes in a Japanese population, demonstrating a significant p-value of 6 × 10−7. This association highlighted the genetic variants of ASRA's role in metabolic disorders, particularly concerning energy regulation and obesity.
title: A brown fat-enriched adipokine, ASRA, is a leptin receptor antagonist that stimulates appetite

finding: This SNP showed significant association with anxiety, located near the ESR1 locus, with a p-value of 1.04×10^-9. Its identification reinforced the genetic basis of anxiety disorders, particularly in relation to estrogen regulation.
title: Reproducible Risk Loci and Psychiatric Comorbidities in Anxiety: Results from ~200,000 Million Veteran Program Participants

finding: The SNP rs74405933 was associated with rheumatoid arthritis and was linked to the expression of CD83, a key gene in B cell activation and maturation. Its predicted binding site related to NFkB/RELA function was highlighted in the study.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Associated with TRIM26 and linked to the promoter of RRM2 with a p-value of 2.69e-7, this SNP was identified as relevant to prostate cancer mechanisms.
title: Reconstructing protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions in prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs6570507 was identified at the ADGRG6 locus, where it overlapped with H3K27ac ChIP-seq peaks, indicating that it is involved in the regulation of genes associated with AIS. Further investigations using luciferase assays in human SW1353 cells confirmed that this SNP is part of two novel enhancers at the ADGRG6 locus, suggesting its functional impact in the genetic pathways linked to chondrogenesis and connective tissue maintenance relevant to adolescent idiopathic scoliosis.
title: Genomic characterization of the adolescent idiopathic scoliosis associated transcriptome and regulome

finding: The study identified rs77910749 as a candidate causal variant within the highly conserved enhancer LC1, associated with both bipolar disorder (BD) and intelligence. Functional assays demonstrated increased enhancer activity in the developing cerebral cortex and amygdala, and behavioral assays on knock-in mice showed defects in sensory gating, a trait linked to BD.
title: A candidate causal variant underlying both higher intelligence and increased risk of bipolar disorder

finding: This lead SNP was identified in GWAS for bipolar disorder and was associated with a significant increase in risk for the condition, with additional data showing its high linkage disequilibrium with cognition-related SNPs.
title: A candidate causal variant underlying both higher intelligence and increased risk of bipolar disorder

finding: Identified as a proxy variant associated with increased bipolar disorder risk, with strong correlation to rs12202969, supporting the idea of shared genetic basis for BD and intelligence.
title: A candidate causal variant underlying both higher intelligence and increased risk of bipolar disorder

finding: The SNP rs10949481 was significantly associated with the epigenetic biomarker IEAA, showing a beta value of -0.20 (P=4.5×10^−54). This locus mapped to the 3' UTR of the NHLRC1 gene on chromosome 6p22.3 and was highlighted as one of the top loci in previous analyses of IEAA.
title: Genome-wide association studies identify 137 loci for DNA methylation biomarkers of ageing

finding: The T allele at rs13204742 (G>T) was found to be protective against type 1 diabetes diagnosed at <7 years, but conferred susceptibility to irritable bowel disease. The variant's implications suggested that increased THEMIS expression might alter T cell selection processes, facilitating the exit of autoreactive T cells into circulation.
title: Specific type 1 diabetes risk genes underpin age-at-diagnosis and indicate joint defects in immunity, beta-cell fragility and responses to viral infections in early-onset disease

finding: The SNP rs1800629 was categorized as a dNMD-QTL that regulated the degradation efficiency of NMD-transcripts associated with the genes HLA-C and ATP6V1G2-DDX39B, a read-through transcription event. It was linked to 58 diseases, with 18 of those associated with neoplastic processes, highlighting its potential role in the regulation of gene expression associated with tumor biology.
title: Mapping genetic variants for nonsense-mediated mRNA decay regulation across human tissues

finding: The SNP rs2003916 exhibited differential effects between individuals with interstitial lung disease (ILD) and unaffected donors. It was identified as a top interaction expression quantitative trait loci (int-eQTL) linked to the gene DSP. The study found that rs2003916 showed significant variation in its influence on DSP expression across four tested epithelial cell types, emphasizing its role as a key regulator in the context of PF.
title: Cell type-specific and disease-associated eQTL in the human lung

finding: The A allele at rs3130008 decreased gene expression variability of RPS18 in T cells treated with PHA+DEX, which is implicated in autoimmune conditions such as rheumatoid arthritis, multiple sclerosis, and psoriasis.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: This SNP confers effects on both mean and variability of HLA-A gene expression, impacting immune response and associated with conditions like asthma and various autoimmune disorders.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The study found that the SNP rs9468925, located between HLA-B and HLA-C, was associated with both psoriasis and vitiligo, indicating it played a role in conditions involving CD8+ T cell responses that target melanocytes.
title: Autoimmune Alleles at the Major Histocompatibility Locus Modify Melanoma Susceptibility

finding: SNP rs72928038 was linked to melanoma risk through its association with vitiligo, indicating a shared genetic risk profile.
title: Autoimmune Alleles at the Major Histocompatibility Locus Modify Melanoma Susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs3135388 was identified as a crucial tag SNP for the HLA allele HLA-DRB1*15:01, which has a known association with multiple sclerosis. During occlusion analysis, it was revealed that the convolutional neural network (CNN) heavily relied on information from this tag SNP. Specifically, masking the SNP in the analysis led to a nearly 50% drop in the probability of correctly imputing HLA-DRB1*15:01, indicating its significant role in the accurate prediction of this allele.
title: HLA Allele Imputation with Multitask Deep Convolutional Neural Network

finding: The SNP rs13215495 was associated with enhanced CD8 T cell recruitment and activation of the intrahepatic inflammasome, as indicated by its role in a murine model of hepatocellular carcinoma. This finding provided insights into the potential implications of the inflammasome pathways, particularly in the context of immune responses and CD8 T cell functionality in health and disease.
title: NLRP3 and NLRP1/CARD8 pathways differently contribute to pyroptosis of CD8+ T cells of ART-treated HIV patients

finding: The SNP rs13205246 was associated with the functioning of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs), which were identified as a road-block in cancer therapy, particularly in the context of solid tumors where CAFs create an immunosuppressive microenvironment.
title: Stromal depletion by TALEN-edited universal hypoimmunogenic FAP-CAR T cells enables infiltration and anti-tumor cytotoxicity of tumor antigen-targeted CAR-T immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs610913, a G>T polymorphism in the MB21D1 gene resulting in a P261H exchange in the cGAS protein, was reported to nominally associate with increased susceptibility to HIV-1 acquisition in a study involving over 6,000 infected individuals compared to controls, indicating its potential role in viral infection susceptibility. Although cGAS(P261H) demonstrated some functional differences compared to cGAS(WT), both variants showed similar steady-state expression patterns of interferon-stimulated genes (ISGs), suggesting that cGAS(P261H) maintains a baseline antiviral state in cells.
title: A base-line cellular antiviral state is maintained by cGAS and its most frequent naturally occurring variant rs610913

finding: The SNP rs6914622 was identified as potentially causal in hypothyroidism, having phyloP and phastCons scores of 2.37 and 1.00 respectively, showing it is constrained in both mammals and primates. It had a PIP of 0.76 using the baseline-LF+Zoonomia model, highlighting its functional relevance compared to other SNPs.
title: Leveraging Base Pair Mammalian Constraint to Understand Genetic Variation and Human Disease

finding: The SNP rs9271602 exhibited a strong association with steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome (SSNS) in the HLA-DR/DQ region, with a p-value of 1.12×10−27 and an odds ratio (OR) of 2.75, indicating that it was a confirmed and original finding associated with the disease.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The novel SNP rs2746432 in the AHI1 gene was identified as having a significant association with SSNS, with a p-value of 2.79×10−8 and an OR of 1.37. This association was confirmed across different populations, supporting the role of immune dysregulation in SSNS.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs9391784 was identified as a second independent signal associated with SSNS, with a p-value of 1.16×10−15. The data suggested its contribution to SSNS alongside rs9271602.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs17212846 reached genome-wide significance with a p-value of 2.57×10−13, contributing to the understanding of the genetic basis of SSNS when conditioned with rs9271602 and rs9391784.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs9260172 was found to be another signal associated with SSNS, reaching a p-value of 3.27×10−9, further corroborating the complex genetic landscape of the disease.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: This SNP was found in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs9271602 and previously associated with SSNS cases, contributing to the established relations in the HLA region.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: Similar to rs2858317, this SNP was in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs9271602 and has been implicated in SSNS through historical genetic studies.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs4642516 was associated in prior studies, reinforcing the linkage around the HLA-DQA1 region and its role in SSNS pathology.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: As another variant found in strong linkage disequilibrium with the lead SNPs, rs1129740 contributed to the understanding of genetic risk factors associated with SSNS.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs1071630 was in linkage disequilibrium with other associated SNPs in the region and has been reported in earlier GWAS related to SSNS.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: This SNP was noted for its previous associations with SSNS, supporting the collective findings in HLA regions.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The variant rs28366266 maintained relevance in the context of existing linkages to HLA-associated SNPs important for SSNS.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2856665 was replicated in the trans-ethnic meta-analysis with a strong association with SSNS (p=2.45×10⁻⁶⁸, OR=4.06), confirming its relevance across populations.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs4896153 was previously implicated in multiple sclerosis and linked to eQTL effects in AHI1, indicating its broader role in immune-related conditions.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs1535500 was identified as being strongly associated with type 2 diabetes (T2DM) in multiple genome-wide association studies across diverse ethnic populations. The strongest association observed had a p-value of less than 2×10⁻⁸. This non-synonymous polymorphism (p.Ala277Glu) resulted in a modest 1.4-fold increase in TALK-1 channel current due to enhanced open probability and increased cell surface localization.
