Furthermore, this risk haplotype was associated with overexpression of the adjacent gene KCNK17, which also encodes a potassium channel (TALK-2), suggesting combined effects leading to reduced glucose-stimulated calcium influx and impaired glucose-stimulated insulin secretion (GSIS). The identification of this SNP's involvement in T2DM alongside the reported novel mutation in KCNK16 that causes Maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY) highlights the significance of TALK-1 in both conditions.
title: A novel mutation in KCNK16 causing a gain-of-function in the TALK-1 potassium channel: a new cause of maturity onset diabetes of the young

finding: The SNP rs4945787, located in the intron of SCML4, was associated with lipid traits. Other intronic variants in SCML4 have been implicated in coronary artery disease and Alzheimer's disease, conditions linked to cholesterol levels.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: The rs7771980 SNP was associated with lower BMD in previous studies, marking a functional distinction between the homozygous rare variant and the more common nucleotide version found in modern humans. This SNP's link to RUNX2 promoter activity suggested that the Homo sapiens-derived variant contributes to reduced RUNX2 transcriptional activity, thus implying potential impacts on bone physiology.
title: Human-derived alleles in SOST and RUNX2 3′UTRs cause differential regulation in a bone cell-line model

finding: The SNP rs1129740, located in the HLA-DQA1 locus, is known to display classical signatures of balancing selection, showing a low MU value despite a relatively high allele frequency.
title: Network-based analysis of allele frequency distribution among multiple populations identifies adaptive genomic structural variants

finding: Identified with CFDP1, showed functionality in gene expression regulation, iterating its importance as a CAD-associated variant.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: Notably, rs72928038 was highlighted again as a candidate causal T1D variant, reinforcing its critical nature in the BACH2 locus contributing to the genetic landscape of T1D.
title: Fine-mapping, trans-ancestral and genomic analyses identify causal variants, cells, genes and drug targets for type 1 diabetes

finding: Evidence indicated that rs2269424 (G/A) is adjacent to the PPT2 and EGFL8 genes, which are associated with immunity. There was strong evidence of selection at this marker, suggesting its relevance in traceable selection pressures over time.
title: A genomic dating tool resolves the origins of ancient Eurasian genomes

finding: Strong associations were made for rs1800562 (G/A), which is situated in the HFE gene related to hemochromatosis. Temporal trends suggested an increase in the risk allele frequency, likely influenced by dietary transitions over time.
title: A genomic dating tool resolves the origins of ancient Eurasian genomes

finding: The intronic variant rs3132467 was the strongest signal among ten independent signals identified in the <italic>cis</italic> region for protein MICA/B (MAF = 0.30, P = 3.04 × 10^-68).
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: The SNP rs9504361, located intronically within EXOC2, demonstrated long-range interactions with the promoters of IRF4 and DUSP22 specifically in MyLa cells. This interaction highlighted the relationship between this SNP and immune response, particularly in the context of psoriatic lesions.
title: An active chromatin interactome in relevant cell lines elucidates biological mechanisms at genetic risk loci for dermatological traits

finding: The analysis revealed a natural variant of GSTA2, specifically a Ser111→Thr substitution, that resulted in a 14 Da mass shift in the GSTA2 proteoform. This mass shift was localized to a specific region of the proteoform and confirmed the presence of a common cSNP (rs2180314) with an allele frequency exceeding 40%. The findings demonstrated the impact of this SNP on the expression and localization of GSTA2 proteoforms in human kidney tissue, highlighting the utility of proteoform imaging in understanding gene expression at the proteomic level.
title: Direct Imaging and Identification of Proteoforms up to 70 kDa from Human Tissue

finding: This SNP was associated with longevity with allele G connected to lower expression of TCF19, contrasting with a type 2 diabetes variant that increased TCF19 gene expression.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: Linked to increased expression of SLC22A1 associated with longevity, this variant's impact was noted amidst evaluations related to hepatocellular carcinoma.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: Associated with higher expression of SLC22A1, this longevity variant's implications in diseases like cancer were observed.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: Associated with lower expression of HLA-B, contributing to potential longevity benefits, especially in the context of colorectal cancer.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: This SNP regulated BTN2A2 in the adult cortex, which is relevant for immune modulation, thereby implicating this pathway in ASD.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: Associated with BTN3A1 in the fetal cortex, this SNP was linked to immune system regulation, emphasizing its potential role in ASD.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: This SNP significantly increased transcript levels of TAP2 in both fetal and adult cortices, linking it to immune pathways relevant in ASD.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: The minor allele of rs3129968 was correlated with decreased transcript levels of HLA-DRB1 in the fetal cortex, highlighting potential immunological implications in ASD.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: The study highlighted that LMP1 significantly affected B-cell metabolism, particularly through upregulation of purine nucleotide biosynthesis. This was linked to the findings of the article by Wang & Ning in 'Cancers', where LMP1 was described as a key factor in EBV signaling that could relate to cancer metabolic pathways.
title: Epstein-Barr Virus Latent Membrane Protein 1 Subverts IMPDH pathways to drive B-cell oncometabolism

finding: The SNP rs2770573, found in LINC00240, was connected to DTI parameters, emphasizing its importance in the genetic architecture of white matter.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: Fine mapping of SNP rs9393777 in LINC00240 indicated its association with white matter structural variance.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: Fine mapping for SNP rs13198474 indicated strong associations with measures of white matter in regions such as the corpus callosum and corona radiata, linking it to psychiatric disorders.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The SNP rs4526212, found on chromosome 6q23.3, was linked to the gene AHI1, which is involved in JAK-STAT signaling pathways and has downstream effects on Th1 and Th2 cells. Its highly significant cis-eQTLs (P<1.0×10^-300) in blood highlighted its potential relevance in asthma.
title: Large-scale Genetic Analysis Identifies 66 Novel Loci for Asthma

finding: The SNP rs9647635, located at chromosome 6q23.3, was noted to be in near perfect linkage disequilibrium (r^2=0.98) with rs4526212 and was previously identified in a GWAS as being associated with selective IgA deficiency, a condition correlated with increased risk of asthma.
title: Large-scale Genetic Analysis Identifies 66 Novel Loci for Asthma

finding: This SNP was associated with Barrett's oesophagus and located within an open chromatin region also found in undifferentiated columnar epithelial cells in BO. It was suggested that it might reduce regulatory activity by disrupting the binding site for the transcription factor KLF5.
title: The metaplastic precursor state to oesophageal adenocarcinoma represents reversion to a transient epithelial cell state in the developing oesophagus

finding: This SNP was connected to Barrett's oesophagus and linked with reduced activity of its regulatory element, potentially creating a repressive binding site for ZNF708, thus being relevant to the regulatory frameworks involved in BO.
title: The metaplastic precursor state to oesophageal adenocarcinoma represents reversion to a transient epithelial cell state in the developing oesophagus

finding: The SNP rs58453446 in the BACH2 gene demonstrated a significant association with FEV1/FVC in never smokers (p-value of 8.9×10^-10), highlighting its role in pulmonary surfactant homeostasis.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The variant rs1349979 was noted as a potential pleiotropic variant affecting the causal relationship between smoking initiation and waist-hip ratio (WHR) and waist circumference (WC). Despite its potential as a confounder, it remained associated with the observed effects.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs183882582 was identified as the most significant variant associated with ADHD across the lifespan, located on chromosome 6, with an odds ratio of 1.43 (95% CI 1.26-1.60) and a p-value of 1.57E-08.
title: Shared genetic background between children and adults with attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder

finding: The SNP rs12197454 was part of the credible set associated with the index variant rs183882582 on chromosome 6, linked to the expression of genes RSPH3 and VIL2 in blood and brain.
title: Shared genetic background between children and adults with attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder

finding: The SNP rs12193182 was associated with a novel mechanism for thermoregulation in maize, where it contributed to non-photochemical quenching (NPQ) as a negative feedback mechanism during photosynthesis. This finding was contextualized within the study indicating that NPQ symptoms acted to increase leaf temperature (T_L) under suboptimal conditions, which in turn related to stress responses in the crop's physiological performance under varying soil moisture levels.
title: Heat dissipation from photosynthesis contributes to maize thermoregulation under suboptimal temperature conditions

finding: The study by Chae et al. (2016) found that the TNF-α (rs1800629) polymorphism had a significant impact on cognitive impairment in Asian breast cancer patients. This suggests a relevant association between this SNP and cognitive outcomes in a specific patient population.
title: An Ensemble Learning Approach for Cancer Drug Prediction

finding: This SNP, located in an intron of the MYLK4 gene at the 6p25.2 locus, was reported with strong association in the replication cohort, making it the most associated SNP with RMM, with a p-value of 0.0056.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: This SNP was shown to be located within a super-enhancer that interacts with the promoter of the MTF1 gene. Its involvement was implicated in the upregulation of cytokine and chemokine production in activated synovial fibroblasts.
title: Parsing multiomics landscape of activated synovial fibroblasts highlights drug targets linked to genetic risk of rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP allele rs3135388-T was absent in all Niedertiefenbach individuals, marking an important distinction from contemporary Europeans, where this allele was prevalent. This finding suggested that the DRB1*15:01 allele, which is related to susceptibility to mycobacterial infections, became incorporated into the European gene pool later, during the Bronze Age.
title: Neolithic genomes reveal a distinct ancient HLA allele pool and population transformation in Europe

finding: The SNP rs6940658 showed a novel association with CER[N(26)S(19)] at a locus located upstream of the CD83 gene (P=2.07×10^-8). This suggests its potential role in modulating plasma ceramide traits.
title: Heritability and family-based GWAS analyses of the N-acyl ethanolamine and ceramide plasma lipidome

finding: The SNP rs13194985 was initially found to be associated with the expression of Vimentin, a protein implicated in the epithelial to mesenchymal transition (EMT), which is a key process in pulmonary fibrosis. The study provided evidence that Vimentin played a critical role in mediating metastasis through EMT, supporting its relevance in the context of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) and highlighting potential pathways for targeted therapeutic interventions.
title: Hypoxia-inducible factor-2 (HIF2) regulates alveolar regeneration after repetitive injury

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with schizophrenia in earlier studies, replicating prior genetic association findings.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The rs652888 variant was identified to have a novel association with non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) risk, as it was linked to several autoimmune diseases and was located in a region implicated in NHL risk associated with Epstein-Barr virus.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: This SNP was identified as strongly associated with NHL risk, with implications for its shared genetic relationship with oral cavity/pharyngeal cancer via variants found in the HLA region.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: Similar to rs9271378, rs3135006 was significantly linked to NHL risk, confirming its role in the shared genetic landscape with oral cavity/pharyngeal cancer.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: SNP rs6902725 demonstrated associations with two traits in opposite directions, indicating its significant impact on differing blood pressure measures.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: This variant at the newly identified HSPA1A locus showed strong associations with telomere length and linked phenotypes related to type I diabetes.
title: Novel genetic determinants of telomere length from a trans-ethnic analysis of 109,122 whole genome sequences in TOPMed

finding: The SNP rs58453446, mapping to the gene BACH2, was associated with FEV1/FVC in never smokers (p=8.9×10^-10). This association highlighted the gene's crucial role in pulmonary surfactant homeostasis.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The M55V variant (rs237025) of SUMO4 was found to be prevalent and associated with multiple human pathologies, particularly diabetes. This finding highlighted the significance of the polymorphism in the context of human health and disease.
title: SUMO monoclonal antibodies vary in sensitivity, specificity, and ability to detect SUMO conjugate types

finding: The SNP rs2270450 was linked to the gene SLC25A27 (UCP4), which is primarily expressed in neurons. It is involved in neuronal metabolism and has been previously associated with schizophrenia and possibly Parkinson's disease.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: Rs4895441 was linked to the modulation of HBG2 in trans, indicating its role in hemoglobin levels.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs9375813 mapped to ARG1 was associated with CRP levels, reflecting its involvement in inflammatory responses.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The rs10455872 variant in LPA was associated with decreased efficacy of statins. Carriers of this variant experienced a reduction in LDL-c levels by 5.9% less compared to non-carriers, which supported the need for stronger therapeutic intervention, such as atorvastatin, to achieve desired cholesterol management.
title: LPA and APOE are associated with statin selection in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs74617384 variant in LPA was significantly associated with increased likelihood of atorvastatin prescription and higher intensity dosing, indicating that it influences statin selection and dosing similar to rs429358.
title: LPA and APOE are associated with statin selection in the UK Biobank

finding: The lead SNP rs9405472 within the FOXF2 locus was associated with eye-related traits, particularly anterior segment dysgenesis. It was an intronic variant with a high significance (p-value = 2.0 x 10^-11) and a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.4279.
title: TransferGWAS: GWAS of images using deep transfer learning

finding: The SNP rs13195019 was associated with the study's findings on the immune composition of high-grade serous ovarian cancers (HGSCs), where it contributed to the understanding of how TSP-1:CD47 interactions might influence anti-tumor immunity. Specifically, this analysis highlighted how monocyte and macrophage populations in the fallopian tube (FT) could serve as potential early detection markers for ovarian tumorigenesis.
title: Human fallopian tube single-cell analysis reveals monocytic transcriptional and interaction changes in high-grade serous ovarian cancers

finding: The SNP rs55982826 was associated with disrupted activity of regulatory elements through loss of transcriptional activator binding sites, specifically affecting factors like KLF5, which are crucial for maintaining proper epithelial phenotype.
title: The metaplastic precursor state to oesophageal adenocarcinoma represents reversion to a transient epithelial cell state in the developing oesophagus

finding: SNP rs1264706 contributed to regulatory changes by creating a binding site for the repressor ZNF708, indicating its role in the altered gene regulatory landscape in Barrett's oesophagus.
title: The metaplastic precursor state to oesophageal adenocarcinoma represents reversion to a transient epithelial cell state in the developing oesophagus

finding: The SNP rs7454108 was significantly associated with increased HLA-DR mean fluorescence intensity (MFI) on monocytes. This SNP tags the high-risk HLA-DR4-DQ8 haplotype, indicating its role as a genetic driver of immune phenotype that appears to act independently of autoantibody positivity or T1D status.
title: Human immune phenotyping reveals accelerated aging in type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs2275913 in the IL-17A gene was found to be significantly associated with the pathogenesis of preeclampsia (PE) in Chinese patients, highlighting its potential role in influencing immune responses related to PE.
title: Preeclampsia-specific immune cell network in placenta revealed by Cytometry by time of flight and single-cell RNA-seq

finding: The SNP rs2003916 was identified as a disease interaction expression quantitative trait loci (int-eQTL), showing differential effects between pulmonary fibrosis (PF) patients and unaffected donors. Specifically, it displayed these differential effects in four tested epithelial cell types, indicating its role as a central regulator that may impact gene expression differently in the presence of disease.
title: Cell type-specific and disease-associated eQTL in the human lung

finding: The polymorphism rs6918698 in the promoter region of the CTGF gene was reported to be associated with systemic sclerosis. Specifically, homozygosity for the G allele was linked with an increased risk of developing scleroderma and notably heightened the risk of interstitial lung fibrosis in patients with this disorder.
title: Connective-Tissue Growth Factor (CTGF/CCN2) Contributes to TGF-β1-Induced Lung Fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs3129882 in HLA-DRA was identified as a high priority genetic marker in the analysis of pesticide-induced nervous system diseases, indicating its potential role in susceptibility.
title: Genetic variability in pathways associates with pesticide-induced nervous system disease in the United States

finding: The variant rs71542466 in the HLA-DQB1 gene was previously identified to regulate gene expression in a context-specific manner. In the study, CRISPR-Cas9 mediated homology-directed repair (HDR) was employed to target this variant in cell lines, confirming its role in modifying HLA-DQB1 gene expression.
title: Defining the function of disease variants with CRISPR editing and multimodal single cell sequencing

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with schizophrenia, which emphasizes its role in severe psychiatric conditions.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The SNP rs13215478 was reported to be associated with phenotypical and metabolic features of the J2-immortalized murine macrophage cell line, which displayed characteristics similar to primary bone marrow-derived macrophages (BMDMs) in their M1 and M2 polarization state, as documented in the research conducted by Spera et al. (2021).
title: Mass spectrometry-based proteomic exploration of diverse murine macrophage cellular models

finding: This SNP was associated with plasma plasminogen levels, lipoprotein A levels, and coronary artery disease, marking it as a significant finding in previous studies.
title: Common homozygosity for predicted loss-of-function variants reveals both redundant and advantageous effects of dispensable human genes

finding: The analysis of SNP rs6570507 from Kou et al. (2018) demonstrated a confirmed association with adolescent idiopathic scoliosis (AIS), suggesting that this SNP may serve as a candidate risk locus for spine disorders in humans. This SNP was linked to genetic factors influencing spine morphology and curvature.
title: Postembryonic screen for mutations affecting spine development in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs6908428 was noted as having significant allelic effects and was implicated in the regulation of AHI1, a gene associated with Multiple Sclerosis, suggesting its contribution to the disease risk.
title: Multiple Causal Variants Underlie Genetic Associations in Humans

finding: Along with rs6908428, rs9399148 exhibited significant effects and was highlighted by previous studies in relation to AHI1's role in Multiple Sclerosis pathology, indicating it may also contribute to the disease risk.
title: Multiple Causal Variants Underlie Genetic Associations in Humans

finding: This SNP was identified as having significant allelic effects and is suggested to regulate AHI1 expression, thereby contributing to the risk of Multiple Sclerosis.
title: Multiple Causal Variants Underlie Genetic Associations in Humans

finding: The SNP rs3044170 was identified in a study that discussed the implications of transcription inhibition, linking it to therapeutic strategies in cancer treatments. The original finding indicated that targeting RNA polymerase II (RNAPII) degradation, highlighted in the broader context of oocyte maturation and chromatin transition, could have significant implications for enhancing reproductive medicine and therapeutic interventions.
title: Reconstitution of chromatin reorganization during mammalian oocyte development

finding: The SNP rs2236256, located in the gene IPCEF1, was associated with chronic lymphocytic leukaemia (CLL) at P = 2×10−10. In this study, it was identified alongside NRS GNRS_28218 which was significantly associated with mean corpuscular haemoglobin and other indices related to anaemia, indicating potential connections of IPCEF1 to these hematological traits and hence suggesting the SNP's relevance in anaemia.
title: Graph pangenome reveals functional, evolutionary, and phenotypic significance of human nonreference sequences

finding: The SNP rs9366778, located near HLA-C, was previously reported as BW-associated, exhibiting a fetal effect with a significance of P = 2.13×10^-7. The association was diminished when this SNP was included in conditional analyses with classical HLA alleles, indicating potential linkage disequilibrium.
title: Partitioning genetic effects on birth weight at classical human leukocyte antigen loci into indirect maternal and direct fetal components using structural equation modelling

finding: The SNP rs6911024, found in the 5’ UTR of MICA, was also noted as BW-associated and showed predominantly maternal effects. In conditional analyses, it was established that this SNP's association with BW was mediated, revealing that the significance of alleles HLA-B*35:01 and HLA-C*04:01 was reduced when adjusted for this SNP.
title: Partitioning genetic effects on birth weight at classical human leukocyte antigen loci into indirect maternal and direct fetal components using structural equation modelling

finding: The SNP rs114892859 was associated with penicillin allergy, showing a genome-wide significant association (P-value 2.21×10⁻²⁸) in the HLA region on chromosome 6. It was identified as a lead variant in the meta-analysis of multiple cohorts, with evidence suggesting it affects the expression of nearby genes including PSORS1C3 and MICA, both implicated in hypersensitivity reactions.
title: Genome-wide study identifies association between HLA-B*55:01 and penicillin allergy

finding: The SNP rs144626001 was found to be a proxy for rs114892859, with a strong correlation with the HLA-B*55:01 allele. It possessed annotations indicative of regulatory functions, although no direct finding of association with a specific phenotype was detailed in the analyzed context.
title: Genome-wide study identifies association between HLA-B*55:01 and penicillin allergy

finding: The SNP rs12203592 was identified as a trans-meQTL hotspot associated with 131 CpGs. It served as a cis-eQTL for the transcription factor IRF4, indicating its involvement in a regulatory network influencing gene expression and DNA methylation changes in melanocytes.
title: Cell-type-specific meQTL extends melanoma GWAS annotation beyond eQTL and informs melanocyte gene regulatory mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs2247315 was linked to the expression of RNASET2 and tagged a risk variant for basal cell carcinoma. It displayed GxE interactions that were responsive to cellular respiration, highlighting its significance in cancer biology.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing of differentiating iPS cells reveals dynamic genetic effects on gene expression

finding: The SNP rs2004's associated sequence demonstrated auxiliary elements that enhance origin activity, reflecting its role in the efficiency of DNA replication origins.
title: Characterization of DNA replicators of a 75-kb region of Chromosome 2 of fission yeast, Schizosacharomyces pombe

finding: The rs2076530 SNP in the BTNL2 gene showed an association with Graves' disease, although its implications for IBD were not thoroughly explored.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and enriched pathways in inflammatory bowel disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This SNP surpassed genome-wide significance for mean IAV burden (p = 1.8 x 10^-8), though it was located in a gene desert and did not correspond to a cis-eQTL.
title: Single-cell genome-wide association reveals a nonsynonymous variant in ERAP1 confers increased susceptibility to influenza virus

finding: There was a significant association reported between the SNP rs75205693 in the CNR1 gene and DNA methylation. This association indicated a potential role of CNR1 in cellular pathways related to proliferation and inflammation within atherosclerotic plaques, as observed in human genome-wide association studies. The findings from the mouse model suggested an interplay between CB1 signaling and key cellular mechanisms that could elucidate the SNP's impact on plaque pathophysiology.
title: Loss of myeloid cannabinoid CB1 receptor confers atheroprotection by reducing macrophage proliferation and immunometabolic reprogramming

finding: The rs1535500 polymorphism in the TALK1 gene was linked to an increased risk of type 2 diabetes. This gain-of-function mutation (A277E) resulted in reduced glucose-stimulated insulin secretion (GSIS) due to impaired intracellular calcium homeostasis, as supported by findings from studies on islet beta-cells from TALK1 knockout mice.
title: Heteromerization of alkaline-sensitive two-pore domain potassium channels

finding: Rs6456883 was identified as a significant splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) for the expression of the ZNF311 gene isoforms, associated with breast cancer (BC) risk. The T allele was linked to the predominant isoform ZNF311-203, while the C allele was associated with increased intron retention, leading to expression of the untranslated isoform ZNF311-204. This suggests that intron retention might decrease the expression of the coding isoform, linked to BC risk.
title: Alternative splicing regulation by GWAS risk loci for breast cancer

finding: Rs9257408 was indicated as a risk-associated single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) linked to breast cancer. It is in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs6456883, suggesting a regulatory role in gene expression.
title: Alternative splicing regulation by GWAS risk loci for breast cancer

finding: This SNP, located near the FOXO3 gene which is involved in IL-9 signaling, exhibited overlap between the posterior body and isthmus of the corpus callosum.
title: The Genetic Architecture of the Human Corpus Callosum and its Subregions

finding: In the analysis of the SLC22A2 region, rs9295128 was prioritized in the context of coronary arteries as it overlapped with an annotated enhancer from EpiMAP. The BTS analysis indicated a significant p-value of 1.7e-3 and a prior odds of 2.85, suggesting its potential role in coronary-related traits.
title: BTS: scalable Bayesian Tissue Score for prioritizing GWAS variants and their functional contexts across omics data

finding: Similarly, in the SLC22A2 region analysis, rs9457927 was prioritized in a different context, specifically within cardiac muscle cells. The BTS analysis showed it located within an annotated open chromatin region identified by DNase assay, with a p-value of 7.1e-4 and prior odds of 5.51, highlighting its relevance to cardiac traits.
title: BTS: scalable Bayesian Tissue Score for prioritizing GWAS variants and their functional contexts across omics data

finding: This SNP was identified as a Time Informative Marker (TIM) adjacent to the PPT2 and EGFL8 genes associated with immunity. Strong evidence of selection was found at this marker, indicating that it may play a significant role in immune responses over time.
title: A genomic dating tool resolves the origins of ancient Eurasian genomes

finding: Located in the HFE gene, this SNP was identified as a TIM. The temporal analysis showed an increase in the frequency of the risk allele associated with hemochromatosis, linking it to environmental or lifestyle changes in ancient populations.
title: A genomic dating tool resolves the origins of ancient Eurasian genomes

finding: The SNP rs1805264 was associated with expression variation of the NLRP1 gene and several other genes across multiple tissues, indicating its role as a <italic>cis</italic>-eQTL. The locus, located in the promoter of <italic>MIS12</italic>, exhibited accelerated evolution between humans and macaques, suggesting positive selection. Human-specific substitutions influenced transcription factor binding, creating unique regulatory activity relevant to immune traits, including higher platelet and lymphocyte counts.
title: Human gene regulatory evolution is driven by the divergence of regulatory element function in both cis and trans

finding: The research indicated that the polymorphic variant rs3088442 in the OCT3 gene was associated with an increased susceptibility to Type 2 Diabetes. This finding suggested a functional implication of this SNP in the transport and metabolism of substrates relevant for diabetes management.
title: Structural basis of organic cation transporter-3 inhibition

finding: The study found that the rs2292334 variant in the OCT3 gene also contributed to susceptibility against Type 2 Diabetes, indicating that individuals with this genetic variant might have altered transporter dynamics, impacting their risk regarding this metabolic disorder.
title: Structural basis of organic cation transporter-3 inhibition

finding: The SNP rs13215365 was linked to the modification process of O-GlcNAcylation in cancer, specifically relating to cholangiocarcinoma (CCA). This SNP was associated with enhanced cell cycle progression and tumor growth by influencing the stabilization of Keratin 18 (K18) through O-GlcNAcylation.
title: O-GlcNAcylation of Keratin 18 coordinates TCA cycle to promote cholangiocarcinoma progression

finding: The SNP rs13205117 was associated with pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors (PanNETs) indicating its potential involvement in the molecular mechanisms governing these tumors.
title: Digital spatial profiling of RNA in pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors highlights the distinct profile of α-SMA positive stroma and its impact on surrounding tumor cells

finding: The SNP rs72928038 was noted as an intronic variant in the BACH2 gene and was also part of the original 95% credible set, making it a positive original finding.
title: Improving the coverage of credible sets in Bayesian genetic fine-mapping

finding: The SNP rs6912739 was related to the gene CYB5R4, which is linked to oxidative stress protection in sperm production. The finding indicated that there was a conserved target site for the microRNA miR-151-5p, which is highly expressed in testis, but this target site was absent in the reference genome. It was identified that the loss of the ancestral target site at this SNP occurred in European populations, while other human groups retained the target allele. This finding demonstrated how population dynamics could elucidate target sites that are missing from reference genomes.
title: PopTargs: A database for studying population evolutionary genetics of human microRNA target sites

finding: rs184670665 was significantly associated with mean activity levels during sleep with a p-value of 2.4×10^-10, located near the gene IMPG1. This association was a novel finding as it was not previously linked to activity levels during sleep.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: The study identified that SNP rs13215365 correlated with glycosylation processes affecting O-GlcNAcylation, particularly in Keratin 18 (K18). This modification on Ser 30 was linked to enhanced tumor progression in cholangiocarcinoma (CCA) as it was involved in stabilizing K18 and promoting cell cycle progression.
title: O-GlcNAcylation of Keratin 18 coordinates TCA cycle to promote cholangiocarcinoma progression

finding: The SNP rs2763979 located in the HSPA1B gene was associated with diagnostic and prognostic risk assessments in asthma, indicating its relevance in understanding asthma pathogenesis and potential therapeutic strategies.
title: Deciphering the Immune Subtypes and Signature Genes: A Novel Approach Towards Diagnosing and Prognosticating Severe Asthma through Interpretable Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs3104367 was identified to be associated with the expression of the gene HLA-DQA1. Specifically, it was found that LPS stimulation reduced the strength of the association between the rs3104367 genotype and HLA-DQA1 expression with a q-value of 0.0038. This finding illuminated how microglial responses to LPS can modulate genetic expression relevant to inflammatory responses in the context of neurodegenerative diseases.
title: The human microglia responsome: a resource to better understand microglia states in health and disease

finding: The SNP rs2234237T allele was positively associated with the development of severe malaria, inferred from higher levels of soluble TREM-1 found in the plasma of affected patients. This association suggested a potential link between TREM-1 genetic variation and inflammatory responses during severe pathologies in viral infections, such as EV71.
title: TREM-1 activation is a key regulator in driving severe pathogenesis of enterovirus 71 infection

finding: The SNP rs2234246 was narrated in the literature to regulate TREM-1 protein and mRNA levels, thus influencing pro-inflammatory gene expression. This finding was significant as it pointed to the gene's involvement in modulating host immune responses which could affect outcomes during EV71 infections.
title: TREM-1 activation is a key regulator in driving severe pathogenesis of enterovirus 71 infection

finding: The rs9271588 T allele induced preferential binding of transcription factor SRF, leading to a higher burst frequency and larger transcription variance in the transcription of HLA-DQA1. This SNP was shown to explain a substantial amount of the variance in burst frequency through its influence on transcription initiation rates.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics in human cell lines

finding: The SNP rs10370 was involved in the encoding of a putative 'bacteriocin biosynthesis protein' with a thioredoxin domain. This domain is known to facilitate disulfide bond formation, which was crucial for the activity of gallocin A peptides. The gene associated with this SNP, renamed blpT, was demonstrated to assist in disulfide bond formation, and deletion of this gene aberrantly affected the ability of Streptococcus gallolyticus to compete with Enterococcus faecalis.
title: Gallocin A, an atypical two-peptide bacteriocin secreted by Streptococcus gallolyticus subsp. gallolyticus

finding: The SNP rs2187668 was identified as the tag SNP for the HLA-DRB1*03:01 haplotype in SLE and showed a significant association with systemic lupus erythematosus. This association mentioned in the context of the HLA region indicates its relevance in the genetic predisposition for SLE.
title: Genetic risk loadings influence the susceptibility and severity of systemic lupus erythematosus

finding: The SNP rs9267992 was recognized as the tag SNP for the HLA-DRB1*15:01 haplotype in SLE. The finding detailed its contribution to SLE susceptibility and is part of the broader analysis of genetic factors influencing the disease.
title: Genetic risk loadings influence the susceptibility and severity of systemic lupus erythematosus

finding: The SNP rs1886248 colocalized with the FingerOA GWAS signal, indicating its role in splicing changes related to OA risk.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs9396861 was associated with alternative splicing of RNF144B and colocalized with the FingerOA GWAS signal.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs13194783 was associated with the transcription factor Meis2, which plays a critical role in the early initiation of TH-MYCN-driven neuroblastoma formation. The findings indicated that the presence of this SNP may contribute to the susceptibility and progression of neuroblastoma, highlighting its potential as a biomarker for this cancer type.
title: 5’UTR translational inhibition of neuroblastoma dependency factors using the CR-1-31-B rocaglate

finding: The SNP rs9261224 was simultaneously recovered with rs6917603 and another instance of rs6917603, with pairwise correlations of r1,2 = 0.618 and r1,3 = 0.984.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: SNP rs6917603 was recovered in a strong association with rs9261224 and another instance of itself, showing high correlations r1,2 = 0.618 and r1,3 = 0.984.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: Under a dichotomized HDL model, SNP rs9261256 was identified along with other SNPs; however, it was not reported in previous analyses.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: The SNP rs2388334 was identified as a lead SNP located 700 kb upstream of <italic>POU3F2</italic>, with a p-value of 1.0e-6, indicating a significant association. This association linked common genetic variations at the <italic>POU3F2</italic> locus to the risk of autism spectrum disorder (ASD), suggesting a regulatory role of <italic>POU3F2</italic> in ASD development.
title: Transcriptome-wide transmission disequilibrium analysis identifies novel risk genes for autism spectrum disorder

finding: The SNP rs62422661 was associated with a p-value of 2.0e-5 in the GWAS and located within a significant interaction bin with the <italic>POU3F2</italic> promoter region (at 98.54-98.55mb on chromosome 6). This interaction was crucial in supporting the link between genetic variations and <italic>POU3F2</italic> expression and, by extension, ASD risk.
title: Transcriptome-wide transmission disequilibrium analysis identifies novel risk genes for autism spectrum disorder

finding: The SNP rs1800620 was identified as being associated with Helicobacter pylori in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus. This finding underscored its importance in the context of disease phenotype involving TNFA interactions with TNFR1A and TNFR1B.
title: CytoSIP: An annotated structural atlas for interactions involving cytokine or cytokine receptor

finding: The SNP rs4645843 was linked to symptom burden and quality of life outcomes in lung cancer survivors, demonstrating its relevance in the interplay between genetic variation and health outcomes in this patient population.
title: CytoSIP: An annotated structural atlas for interactions involving cytokine or cytokine receptor

finding: The SNP rs34421390 within a locus associated with inflammatory bowel disease and multiple sclerosis showed the largest expression-modulating effect in CD4 T cells, indicating that the risk allele reduced transcription significantly.
title: Resolving mechanisms of immune-mediated disease in primary CD4 T cells

finding: The SNP rs6927172 had the strongest expression-modulating effect in primary CD4 T cells. The risk allele was shown to reduce transcription, disrupt an NF-κB binding site, and prevent the formation of a super-enhancer crucial for TNFAIP3 regulation, thus linking it to mechanisms of immune-mediated diseases.
title: Resolving mechanisms of immune-mediated disease in primary CD4 T cells

finding: The SNP rs35771565 was associated with a single amino acid variation (SAV) in the human olfactory receptor 2W1 (OR2W1_HUMAN), specifically a change from aspartic acid to asparagine (D296N). This variation was classified as neutral, indicating that it did not significantly impair the function of the protein. The mutation was located in the extracellular portion of the protein, far from critical annotated sites such as disulfide bonds and transmembrane regions, suggesting that normal functional characteristics were retained. The change involved two hydrophilic amino acids, which supported the preservation of the protein's hydrophilic affinity on its surface. The ASCARIS method successfully predicted this neutral outcome based on the structural and functional features corresponding to this SAV.
title: ASCARIS: Positional Feature Annotation and Protein Structure-Based Representation of Single Amino Acid Variations

finding: The SNP rs2229634 in the ITPR3 gene was associated with an increased risk of developing coronary artery aneurysm in children diagnosed with Kawasaki disease. This finding highlighted the potential role of this genetic variant in contributing to the risk of this specific cardiovascular disease phenotype.
title: IBAS: Interaction-bridged association studies discovering novel genes underlying complex traits

finding: The SNP rs6903956 was associated with the ADTRP locus, supporting annotations made by GWAS.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: The SNP rs12190287 located in TCF21 was part of a significant cluster of non-coding RNAs implicated in CAD.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: The SNP rs12202017 also linked to TCF21 reinforced the involvement of ncRNAs in CAD susceptibility.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: The rs1360780 SNP in FKBP5 was associated with differential expression of FKBP5 mRNA, particularly after glucocorticoid stimulation. The study found that this SNP affected chromatin shape and transcription, leading to higher FKBP5 expression in minor allele (T) carriers following such stimulation. However, the analysis indicated that while there was a significant main effect of case-status on FKBP5 expression, there was no additive effect from the genotype.
title: Associations of psychiatric disease and aging on FKBP5 expression converge on cortical supragranular neurons

finding: The study identified SNP rs9271593 as a regulatory variant between the HLA-DRB1 and HLA-DQA1 genes that explained a significant portion of the genetic risk linked to systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). This lupus-associated variant tagged classical alleles DRB1*03:01 and DRB1*15:01 and was associated with an increased expression of HLA-DRB1, HLA-DQA1, and HLA-DQB1 in monocyte-derived dendritic cells. This finding provided evidence supporting a noncanonical mechanism of HLA-disease association in SLE, focusing on a regulatory role rather than solely on antigen presentation.
title: The lupus susceptibility allele DRB1*03:01 encodes a disease-driving epitope

finding: rs141168133 was noted as an intergenic variant located 19kb from the ID4 gene, recognized as height-associated in this research despite not being found in earlier analyses.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: This SNP was characterized as an upstream variant for the GRM4 gene and was part of the identified rare variants associated with height.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: The rs12190287 variant in TCF21 was associated with coronary artery disease, indicating its potential role in cardiovascular risk, highlighted through extensive meta-analyses and regulatory factor annotations.
title: Genome-wide functional screen of 3’UTR variants uncovers causal variants for human disease and evolution

finding: The risk allele of rs9396861 correlated with decreased expression of RNF144B exclusively in the FN-f treated context, revealing a treatment-specific association relevant to OA.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: Linked to the RNF144B gene in the context of FN-f treatment, rs7771828 displayed condition-specific eQTL effects, valuable for understanding the nuances of OA genetic risk.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: The SNP rs10457592 was linked to major depression. Chromatin loop analysis indicated that POU3F2 was the key neuronal gene targeted by this SNP, while the eQTL data predicted the gene FBXL4, which is less clear in its relation to brain function.
title: Robust Hi-C chromatin loop maps in human neurogenesis and brain tissues at high-resolution

finding: The SNP rs1800769 (T allele) was found to interact significantly with rs9458001 to modify the risk of coronary artery disease (CAD), with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.42 and a p-value of 1.75×10^-13, indicating strong evidence of epistasis. This interaction was replicated in a larger cohort from the UK Biobank with a p-value of 3.09×10^-22.
title: Cis-epistasis at the LPA locus and risk of coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs9458001 (A allele) exhibited significant interaction with rs1800769 affecting CAD risk, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.42 (p-value 1.75×10^-13). This interaction persisted in validation studies, indicating its role in the genetic risk associated with CAD along with rs1800769.
title: Cis-epistasis at the LPA locus and risk of coronary artery disease

finding: The rs2275913 SNP was shown to be associated with protection against tuberculosis; however, it was also related to higher disease severity. This SNP's correlation with the severity of TB was notably highlighted in the context of studies conducted in Argentina.
title: Exaggerated in vivo IL-17 responses discriminate recall responses in active TB

finding: This SNP, located in an exonic region of the Complement Factor B (CFB) gene on chromosome 6, had a significantly larger odds ratio (OR) of 6.00 in severe UC patients compared to 1.81 in mild UC patients, indicating its strong association with severe disease forms.
title: An extremes of phenotype approach confirms significant genetic heterogeneity in patients with ulcerative colitis

finding: Identified as a lead SNP in a genome-wide association study, it had an odds ratio of 1.97 associated with UC and achieved genome-wide significance.
title: An extremes of phenotype approach confirms significant genetic heterogeneity in patients with ulcerative colitis

finding: This SNP was noted as a lead SNP in the HLA region, with a significant odds ratio of 5.52, indicating its strong genetic association with severe UC.
title: An extremes of phenotype approach confirms significant genetic heterogeneity in patients with ulcerative colitis

finding: Identified as a secondary independent risk locus in the HLA region with an OR of 2.18, reinforcing the association with UC severity.
title: An extremes of phenotype approach confirms significant genetic heterogeneity in patients with ulcerative colitis

finding: This SNP replicated in the study was associated with severe UC, contributing to the understanding of allelic heterogeneity across different populations.
title: An extremes of phenotype approach confirms significant genetic heterogeneity in patients with ulcerative colitis

finding: The SNP rs11757081 was significantly associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) in a GWAS meta-analysis, showing a strong correlation (p < 10^-15) among over 3 million individuals. This finding highlighted the potential role of ZBTB9, the closest gene to this SNP, in regulating adipose tissue and metabolic processes.
title: Cell-state dependent regulation of PPARγ signaling by ZBTB9 in adipocytes

finding: The SNP rs210192 demonstrated a significant association with type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk, with a p-value of 4.52e^-8 in a GWAS meta-analysis. This association supported the hypothesis that ZBTB9 may be pivotal in influencing an individual's susceptibility to T2D.
title: Cell-state dependent regulation of PPARγ signaling by ZBTB9 in adipocytes

finding: This variant was found to regulate the expression of both HLA-DQA1 and C4A in THP-1 monocytes and astrocytes, showing significant changes upon excision.
title: Functional regulatory variants implicate distinct transcriptional networks in dementia

finding: The minor allele of rs76735376 was associated with increased lipoprotein(a) (Lp(a)) values, explaining 3.5% of the Lp(a) variance and showing a significant association with increased LPA expression in liver tissue as demonstrated by eQTL data from the GTEx project. The association with higher Lp(a) concentrations (p=1.01e-59) indicated a functional role of the SNP in the regulation of LPA expression.
title: A genome-wide analysis of DNA methylation identifies a novel association signal for Lp(a) concentrations in the LPA promoter

finding: The SNP rs1360780, associated with the FKBP5 gene, was reported to be correlated with reduced weight loss outcomes following bariatric surgery over a period of 26 months. This finding suggested that individuals with this polymorphism experienced less effective weight management, which is particularly relevant in the context of the study highlighting the impacts of VSG (Vertical Sleeve Gastrectomy) in treating obesity and its subsequent health benefits.
title: Single-cell Chromatin Accessibility and Lipid Profiling Reveals a Metabolic Shift in Adipocytes Induced by Bariatric Surgery

finding: The variant rs75932628 in TREM2 was found to be exome-wide significant with a p-value of 4.8 x 10^-12, indicating a strong association with increased risk for late onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD).
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for involvement of PSEN1 and demonstrates protective role for variants in tyrosine phosphatase genes

finding: The high-impact variant rs104894002 in TREM2 was noted to be present in 4 cases and absent in controls; when homozygous, it was recognized to cause Nasu-Hakola disease, linking it as a significant finding related to Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for involvement of PSEN1 and demonstrates protective role for variants in tyrosine phosphatase genes

finding: The SNP rs1800769 was associated with elevated serum lipoprotein(a) concentrations, particularly in the context of the KIV-2 VNTR length in the LPA gene. It was indicated that this SNP increased Lp(a) levels significantly in individuals of African ancestry compared to European ancestry.
title: Protein-coding repeat polymorphisms strongly shape diverse human phenotypes

finding: SNP rs3124784 was identified as one of the Lp(a)-modifying SNPs affecting serum lipoprotein(a) concentration. It contributed to the complex interaction alongside KIV-2 VNTR length in the LPA gene affecting overall Lp(a) levels.
title: Protein-coding repeat polymorphisms strongly shape diverse human phenotypes

finding: This SNP (rs1853021) was also found to influence serum lipoprotein(a) levels and acted in combination with the KIV-2 VNTR within the LPA gene, contributing to variations in Lp(a) heritability among European populations.
title: Protein-coding repeat polymorphisms strongly shape diverse human phenotypes

finding: The ASCA-SNP rs9350250 was strongly associated with the accessibility of a narrow peak in RNM 24 (peak number 183865). This SNP disrupted 100% of the peak's intramodular co-accessibility, indicating a significant impact on the integrity of the RNM. Rs9350250 showed large effects on RNM scores for multiple RNMs (including formative RNMs 3 and 8, and primed RNMs 21, 24, and 37), suggesting its role in influencing the stability of different pluripotency states in hiPSC lines.
title: Unsupervised Machine Learning Identifies Chromatin Accessibility Regulatory Networks that Define Cell State Transitions in Pluripotency

finding: The SNP rs9399137 was significantly associated with hemoglobin concentration, showing a p-value of 5.24e-249 and a beta value of 0.0783 in a meta-analysis involving UKB, BBJ, and PAGE. It was identified as a population-enriched variant relevant to sickle cell anemia.
title: Low generalizability of polygenic scores in African populations due to genetic and environmental diversity

finding: The SNP rs2802295 was originally associated with interindividual variation in general intelligence, with the surface area increasing allele linked to higher intelligence test scores. It also acted as a cortical expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the FOXO3 gene, which is implicated in neuronal stem cell homeostasis.
title: The Evolutionary History of Common Genetic Variants Influencing Human Cortical Surface Area

finding: The T allele of rs9266234, which is an eQTL for the gene CCHCR1 in GM12878, induced preferential binding of transcription factors POUF2F and TBP. This allele was associated with an increased burst size and decreased burst frequency.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: The T allele of rs9271588 was identified as both an eQTL and a GWAS catalog variant for the gene HLA-DQA1. It induced preferential binding of transcription factor SRF and was associated with increased burst frequency and larger transcription variance.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: The C allele of rs72844311, an eQTL at downstream of HLA-DQA1, was found to induce ASB of BHLHE40. It was predicted to have higher TF binding affinity than its counter allele, contributing to increased burst frequency.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: The SNP rs1799945 C>G in HFE was associated with hemochromatosis type 1 and showed lower allele frequencies in the Vietnamese (5.10%) and East Asian populations (3.41%) compared to the world population (10.82%). This finding highlighted discrepancies in allele distribution that necessitated further studies focused on the Vietnamese population.
title: Genetic profiling of 2,683 Vietnamese genomes from non-invasive prenatal testing data

finding: The SNP rs12195276 in the KCNQ5 gene was significantly associated with variation in pulse pressure. This association emerged from human genome-wide association studies and underscored the influence of sympathetic nervous system dynamics on pulse pressure measurement.
title: Novel target identification using single cell sequencing and electrophysiology of cardiac sympathetic neurons in disease

finding: The presence of a lysine in place of an arginine at position 41, corresponding to rs36219699, was associated with invasive GAS disease (p<0.009), supported by evidence linking it to the HLA-DQA1*01:03 allele.
title: Elevated risk of invasive group A streptococcal disease and host genetic variation in the human leukocyte antigen locus

finding: Similarly, rs41547417 which linked to an alanine in place of a serine at position 130, was associated with increased disease risk (p<0.009) and also contributed to the definition of the DQA1*01:03 allele.
title: Elevated risk of invasive group A streptococcal disease and host genetic variation in the human leukocyte antigen locus

finding: The strongest association was observed for rs911196 in the fifth intron of ELOVL2. The minor G allele was found to result in an earlier onset of intermediate age-related macular degeneration (AMD), with a mean of 4.7 months earlier than the major allele. This finding was consistent across both analyzed cohorts: IAMDGC and UK Biobank, with respective earlier onset findings of 5.7 and 4.5 months. The association was statistically significant (P=0.0003).
title: Polyunsaturated Fatty Acid - mediated Cellular Rejuvenation for Reversing Age-related Vision Decline

finding: The G allele of rs9468304, located in the first intron of ELOVL2, also exhibited a significant association with intermediate AMD, indicating an earlier onset by 4.32 months. However, this effect size was deemed weaker compared to rs911196 (P=0.0009).
title: Polyunsaturated Fatty Acid - mediated Cellular Rejuvenation for Reversing Age-related Vision Decline

finding: The SNP rs2485363 was linked to a novel eczema locus located downstream of TAGAP, presenting significant associations in eczema.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The SNP rs12203350 was significant for HFpEF among African American women, with a p-value of less than 5x10^-8.
title: Biological Pathways and Gene Networks Link Inflammation and Vascular Remodeling to Both Heart Failure with Preserved and Reduced Ejection Fraction in Women across Ethnicities

finding: SNP rs9271562 was identified as a candidate functional variant affecting the CTCF motif in blood with a functional score of 4.1. It was in LD with rs3129763 linked to multiple sclerosis and associated with four HLA genes, including HLA-DRB1, involved in the disease.
title: funMotifs: Tissue-specific transcription factor motifs

finding: This SNP, located in the IRF4 gene, was also found to be linked to melanoma susceptibility in the same study involving the Spanish population. It was identified as a significant genetic variant that contributed to the risk of melanoma, implicating it in the molecular mechanisms underlying this type of cancer.
title: Multi-omic signatures identify pan-cancer classes of tumors beyond tissue of origin

finding: The SNP rs6932847 was identified in a study analyzing two traits: Prostate Cancer (PrCa) and Type 2 Diabetes (T2D). It was noted for having a significant association with both diseases, contributing to the understanding of genetic loci that exhibit pleiotropy between these conditions. The study utilized Bayesian colocalization methods, which highlighted rs6932847 in conjunction with other lead SNPs that had the highest posterior probabilities of association with both traits, demonstrating that this SNP was part of a locus where evidence suggested it was a causal factor for both PrCa and T2D.
title: A Powerful Method for Pleiotropic Analysis under Composite Null Hypothesis Identifies Novel Shared Loci Between Type 2 Diabetes and Prostate Cancer

finding: The SNP rs7767396 was significantly associated with the cytokine network with a meta-P-value of 6.93 × 10^-306. It was located 172kb downstream of the VEGFA gene and was found to impact levels of VEGF-A, IL-10, and IL-12, confirming previous findings regarding associations with individual cytokine levels.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: The rs4714729 SNP at the VEGFA locus indicated a conditional meta-P-value of 7.49 × 10^-10, showcasing its role in cytokine variations.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs9294260 was detected through the MVA-significance test; however, the MC-based correlation replication indicated inconsistencies in pleiotropic effects, suggesting it may be linked to a smaller subset of the six traits analyzed rather than a broad association.
title: Beyond power: Multivariate discovery, replication, and interpretation of pleiotropic loci using summary association statistics

finding: The SNP rs2781666 was found to confer risk of Type 2 diabetes mellitus, highlighting its potential significance in the disorder's development.
title: Bioinformatics Analysis of Key Genes and Pathways for Obesity Associated Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus as a Therapeutic Target

finding: The SNP rs2781665 was associated with an increased risk of Type 2 diabetes mellitus, making it a notable finding in the context of genetic predispositions to the condition.
title: Bioinformatics Analysis of Key Genes and Pathways for Obesity Associated Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus as a Therapeutic Target

finding: Significant ASE was detected for CFB rs641153 in a normal sample within the RPE tissue.
title: Patterns of gene expression and allele-specific expression vary among macular tissues and clinical stages of Age-related Macular Degeneration

finding: The SNP rs141826798, a protein-truncating variant in the gene EGFL8, was identified as a risk variant for psoriasis in a UK BioBank genome wide association study. It was observed across 7 individuals and 44 different tissues, with 98% of the observations showing a proportion of reference reads below 0.65, indicating significant allelic imbalance. The SNP was located 3bp from the end of exon 4, which is not conducive to nonsense-mediated decay due to its positioning. This suggests that RNA sequencing from accessible tissues or cell lines can effectively identify unpredicted allelic balance for such variants.
title: Nonsense-mediated decay is highly stable across individuals and tissues

finding: The SOD2 rs4880 SNP was studied in relation to modifiable risk factors and oxidative stress markers in coronary artery disease, showing its potential role in cardiovascular health.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs3117582 interacted with the LSM2 promoter, linking it to the processing of nuclear precursor mRNA splicing, which is pertinent in the context of SLE autoantibody production.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: The accessible SNP rs7769961 showed interaction with the SNRPC promoter, highlighting its potential role in mRNA splicing mechanisms related to SLE autoantibody production.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: Evidence suggested a protective role for the SNP rs805305 of DDAH2 in septic shock through the regulation of DDAH activity, indicating its impact on sepsis outcomes.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The SNP rs2485363 near TAGAP was novel for eczema with significant association and was replicated in the EAGLE consortium.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: This SNP was found overlapping with peaks linked to the BMP6 gene in EC4, further supporting its relevance to coronary artery disease mechanisms in endothelial cells.
title: Single cell ‘omic profiles of human aortic endothelial cells in vitro and human atherosclerotic lesions ex vivo reveals heterogeneity of endothelial subtype and response to activating perturbations

finding: The SNP rs13194852 was related to the expression of immunoproteasome (IP) genes, which were found to correlate with better prognosis and response to immune checkpoint blockade (ICB) therapies in melanoma. This correlation highlighted the potential of using IP expression as a prognostic biomarker along with immune cell infiltration patterns in solid tumours.
title: Prognostic association of immunoproteasome expression in solid tumours is governed by the immediate immune environment

finding: The SNP rs9349379 was found in the intronic region of the gene PHACTR1, which is linked to coronary artery atherosclerotic disease. This SNP is predicted to disrupt an intronic enhancer and was included in a persistent TGIF boundary, demonstrating its involvement in the regulatory variants impacting CVD phenotypes.
title: Examining dynamics of three-dimensional genome organization with multi-task matrix factorization

finding: The SNP rs707939, situated in the MHC region and intronic to MSH5, was identified as the most pleiotropic SNP, being associated with 48 traits spanning 13 different trait domains.
title: A global overview of pleiotropy and genetic architecture in complex traits

finding: The SNP rs9271894 was shown to have significant associations with altered gene expression linked to the HLA genes, resulting in upregulation of multiple TE family gene sets, including the L1 family.
title: An eQTL-based Approach Reveals Candidate L1 Transcriptional Regulators in Lymphoblastoid Cells

finding: The SNP rs9271379 was also correlated with the expression of HLA-DRB6, known to influence L1 expression, demonstrating important mediation roles in cross-ancestry contexts.
title: An eQTL-based Approach Reveals Candidate L1 Transcriptional Regulators in Lymphoblastoid Cells

finding: The risk allele for rs9396861 was found to decrease RNF144B expression specifically in FN-f treated chondrocytes while colocalizing with a Finger OA GWAS signal.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: The intronic SNP rs9357271 in the BTBD9 gene was found to be associated exclusively with restless leg syndrome, highlighting its specific phenotypic linkage.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: This SNP coincided with GWAS peaks for body height, smoking behavior, and schizophrenia, uncovering its multifaceted impact on diverse traits.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Found in high LD related to multiple traits, supporting its regulatory role at the gene level.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Identified as an ASB SNP for TAF1, correlating with several phenotypic traits impacting growth potential.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Co-occurring with a GWAS peak for smoking behavior, signaling its importance in behavioral phenotypes.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Linked with wellbeing traits, showing significant impact on psychosocial health outcomes.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Located in the 5’ UTR of <italic>SAMD3</italic>, this variant was associated with reaction time metrics and was found to act as an eQTL in cortical regions.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: Intronic in <italic>ITPR3</italic>, this SNP showed evidence of association with episodic memory and controlled expression in critical brain areas.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: Variant rs201510617 was found in Patient 16 and was predicted to be deleterious by all three scoring systems. It had an allele frequency of 0.0317 and affected conserved domains related to fibrinogen and fibronectin, implicating its relation to TNXB function.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: This SNP, also in Patient 16, was predicted to be deleterious with an allele frequency of 0.0483, impacting the same conserved domains associated with rs201510617 in the TNXB gene.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: Identified in Patient 16, rs367685759 was predicted to be deleterious, with an allele frequency of 0.00590, further contributing to the deleterious variant profile associated with TNXB.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: When analyzing the locus 130.2 Mbp-130.5 Mbp in chromosome 6, SNP rs1415701 consistently exhibited a high PIP (>0.8) across different methods, highlighting it as a putative causal variant. XMAP's analysis indicated its reliability in identifying potentially causal variants compared to other methods that yielded less stable results.
title: XMAP: Cross-population fine-mapping by leveraging genetic diversity and accounting for confounding bias

finding: SNP rs6569648 also maintained a high PIP (>0.8) in analyses across diverse datasets, reinforcing its status as a likely causal variant within the specified chromosomal locus. XMAP produced consistent results for this SNP, showcasing its effectiveness in multi-population GWAS integration.
title: XMAP: Cross-population fine-mapping by leveraging genetic diversity and accounting for confounding bias

finding: Showed association with TREML3P, a gene related to TREM locus and significant in regulating immune response in Alzheimer's disease.
title: S-BEAM: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP in the third intron of the ATG5 gene was associated with lower pre-bronchodilator FEV1 and a risk of moderate to severe asthma in non-Hispanic Caucasian children, indicating its significant contribution to asthma severity.
title: Autophagy functions in lung macrophages and dendritic cells to suppress TH17 responses and neutrophil accumulation during allergic airway inflammation

finding: This SNP in the 5' UTR/annotated promoter region of the ATG5 gene was linked to increased risk of asthma in children, with the G variant allele resulting in higher ATG5 mRNA expression and increased promoter activity in nasal mucosal cells from children with acute asthma. Additionally, it was associated with increased sputum neutrophil counts in adult asthma patients, pointing to a correlation between dissociated ATG5 expression and neutrophil recruitment during asthma.
title: Autophagy functions in lung macrophages and dendritic cells to suppress TH17 responses and neutrophil accumulation during allergic airway inflammation

finding: The single-nucleotide variant rs2308655 (C>G) was identified as a significant variant associated with the HLA-B 08:01 allele, which played a role in the myositis context by being part of the immune response pathway that involves type I interferons and MHC class I. This variant was particularly relevant as it provided insight into the genetic factors influencing the susceptibility to idiopathic inflammatory myopathies.
title: High throughput screening to identify inhibitors of the type I interferon – major histocompatibility complex class I pathway in skeletal muscle

finding: This SNP represented a significant association in the major histocompatibility complex region with a p-value of 1.62×10−10, but no specific phenotype was mentioned in the findings.
title: The genetic architecture of structural left-right asymmetry of the human brain

finding: The SNP rs13205034 was associated with numerous post-translational modifications and protein sequence variants, highlighting its relevance in clinical proteomics analysis.
title: Diagnostic Ion Data Analysis Reduction (DIDAR) allows rapid quality control analysis and filtering of multiplexed single cell proteomics data

finding: The rs11755527 polymorphism in the BACH2 gene was identified as a significant finding related to type 1 diabetes mellitus (T1DM), specifically in a Brazilian population.
title: Identification of candidate biomarkers and pathways associated with type 1 diabetes mellitus using bioinformatics analysis

finding: In the Mexican cohort, SNP rs2844455, located in the 5' UTR of the ZBTB12 gene, was indicated to be under selection with an AdaptMix P-value of 5.45×10^-8, relating to immune responses.
title: Disentangling signatures of selection before and after European colonization in Latin Americans

finding: In the Mexican cohort, SNP rs28724903, found intronically in the HLA-DMA gene, showed selection post-admixture with an AdaptMix P-value of 3.87×10^-8, indicating its connection to immune functions.
title: Disentangling signatures of selection before and after European colonization in Latin Americans

finding: In the Peruvian cohort, SNP rs6941112, located intronically in the STK19 gene, demonstrated selection post-admixture with an AdaptMix P-value of 7.57×10^-9, related to immune system responses.
title: Disentangling signatures of selection before and after European colonization in Latin Americans

finding: SNP rs4636058 at 6p22 was found in the Chilean cohort, selected post-admixture with an AdaptMix P-value of 5.70×10^-10, potentially connected to cardiac function and related metabolic traits.
title: Disentangling signatures of selection before and after European colonization in Latin Americans

finding: The rs2781666 SNP was associated with an increased risk of Type 2 diabetes mellitus, indicating its relevance in diabetes-related complications.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs2781665 SNP was found to confer risk of Type 2 diabetes mellitus, highlighting its potential impact on diabetes pathology.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs9275390 was associated with the presence of anticentromere autoantibodies (ACA) in systemic sclerosis (SSc) patients, and this association had been previously reported in a GWAS on SSc.
title: Genetic interactions affect lung function in patients with systemic sclerosis

finding: In 2021, the SNP rs13193976 was identified as a significant predictor of maize yield at an early developmental stage through the use of multispectral images combined with genotype data. This research highlighted the potential for utilizing specific genetic markers like rs13193976 to enhance preliminary hybrid selection in maize breeding.
title: Global Genotype by Environment Prediction Competition Reveals That Diverse Modeling Strategies Can Deliver Satisfactory Maize Yield Estimates

finding: The T allele at rs12203592 in the IRF4 gene conferred an increased risk for developing de novo acute myeloid leukemia (AML), de novo myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS), and therapy-related MDS (t-MDS) as evidenced by an odds ratio (OR) of 1.38 (95% CI, 1.26-1.51, P<sub>meta</sub>=2.8×10<sup>-12</sup>). This SNP was identified in both genome-wide association studies (GWAS) and transcriptome-wide association studies (TWAS). Additionally, increased IRF4 gene expression was associated with higher risk of de novo AML and MDS (OR=3.90, 95% CI, 2.36-6.44, P<sub>meta</sub>=1.0×10<sup>-7</sup>).
