title: Genome-wide association analyses identify variants in IRF4 associated with acute myeloid leukemia and myelodysplastic syndrome susceptibility

finding: The A allele at rs62389423 showed a putative association with de novo AML and MDS, with an odds ratio of 1.36 (95% CI, 1.21-1.52, P<sub>meta</sub>=1.2×10<sup>-7</sup>). This SNP was identified in conjunction with rs12203592 and demonstrated modest linkage disequilibrium with it (r<sup>2</sup>=0.7).
title: Genome-wide association analyses identify variants in IRF4 associated with acute myeloid leukemia and myelodysplastic syndrome susceptibility

finding: The missense variant rs75932628 (p.R47H) in TREM2 at chromosome 6 was associated with late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD), with notable effects on serum TREM2 levels and mortality post-incident LOAD.
title: Human serum proteome profoundly overlaps with genetic signatures of disease

finding: The association between SNP rs1321311 and colorectal cancer (CRC) was studied in a sample of 191 male carriers of the germline PMS2 mutation, with significant results observed using the new generalized weighted cohort method. This method yielded larger estimated effects compared to the unweighted Cox regression, supporting the hypothesis that this risk allele increases susceptibility to CRC. The study controlled for ascertainment bias by employing a novel weighting method due to previous negative weight outcomes in the traditional approach.
title: A new inverse probability of selection weighted Cox model to deal with outcome-dependent sampling in survival analysis

finding: The study identified SNP rs71542466 as a causal variant influencing T cell-specific expression of HLA-DQB1. CRISPR/Cas9 editing demonstrated that altering this variant led to significant changes in HLA-DQ expression, confirming its role in the Late-Spike regulatory program associated with autoimmunity.
title: Allele-specific expression changes dynamically during T cell activation in HLA and other autoimmune loci

finding: This missense variant in KIAA0319 was associated with poor performance on spelling, showing its important contribution to dyslexia performance metrics.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: Another missense variant in KIAA0319, associated with poor spelling performance, which was linked to its biological role in dyslexia.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: This variant in KIAA0319 co-occurred in a region associated with dyslexia, showing significant negative impact on spelling performance.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: Co-located with other variants in KIAA0319, this SNP was strongly associated with decreased spelling performance, implicating its role in dyslexia.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: This variant was in close association with the cluster of missense variants in KIAA0319, exhibiting significant impact on spelling performance.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: This SNP was predicted to disrupt a transcription factor binding site in KIAA0319 and was associated with reading and spelling performance.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: This variant in DCDC2 was significantly associated with spelling performance and indicated a regulatory role affecting dyslexia risk.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: Associated with multiple phenotypes in DCDC2, including suggestive evidence for spelling, the variant was implicated in transcriptional regulation.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: In associated haplotype blocks, it showed disruption to transcription factor motifs, linking it to potential dyslexia risk.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: The CD2AP rs9349407 polymorphism was identified as a significant factor associated with Alzheimer’s disease (AD) susceptibility in a study analyzing 54,936 samples. Lower levels of CD2AP in brain vessels were linked to cognitive deficits in AD volunteers, thus highlighting the importance of this SNP in understanding the vascular dysfunction and cognitive implications related to AD.
title: Deregulation of brain endothelial CD2AP in Alzheimer’s disease impairs Reelin-mediated neurovascular coupling

finding: The SNP rs9469775 was replicated in the ALM of the elderly cohort, indicating its association with muscle mass variation. It was one of the loci linked to significant genetic differences influencing ALM.
title: Genome-wide associations reveal human-mouse genetic convergence and modifiers of myogenesis, CPNE1 and STC2

finding: At the HLA region, the intergenic variant rs7747253 showed strong selection indicative of protection against diseases like chickenpox, with frequency decreasing after 8,000 years ago, suggesting a trade-off in immune responses.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The SNP rs9267677 at the C2 locus demonstrated gradual frequency increase starting around 4,000 years ago, correlated with immunity against sexually transmitted diseases and potentially increased psoriasis risk.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The SNP rs2395029 was historically associated with HIV susceptibility as detailed in the GWAS findings by Limou and Zagury (2013) and Fellay et al. (2007). This finding highlighted the genetic influence on disease susceptibility concerning the HIV virus.
title: Optimal HLA imputation of admixed population with dimension reduction

finding: Found particularly associated with risk of HER2-positive subtypes (P=1.84×10⁻⁷).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Strongly associated with TN disease (P=8.26×10⁻²³).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Associated with TN disease (P=1.24×10⁻¹⁹).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The SNP rs652888, located in EHMT2, was identified as a novel risk variant associated with non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) and is linked to various autoimmune and infectious diseases, marking its importance in pleiotropy.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs9271378 was associated with non-Hodgkin lymphoma risk, where it was linked to the HLA region, reinforcing its significance in cancer risk analysis.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: Like rs9271378, SNP rs3135006 was associated with NHL and fell within the HLA region, underscoring its relevance to cross-cancer risk.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The variant rs75932628, associated with the p.R47H amino acid change, was identified as a strong genetic risk factor for developing late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD). This variant disrupted ligand binding capabilities in the TREM2 protein, predicting a partial loss-of-function mutation that could diminish TREM2 signaling in the context of Alzheimer's pathology.
title: An alternatively spliced TREM2 isoform lacking the ligand binding domain is expressed in human brain

finding: Similar to rs75932628, the rs143332484 variant, causing the p.R62H amino acid change, was also reported as a significant risk factor for late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD). This genetic variant affected TREM2's ligand binding, predicted to contribute to a partial loss-of-function phenotype that may impair the normal immune response in Alzheimer's disease.
title: An alternatively spliced TREM2 isoform lacking the ligand binding domain is expressed in human brain

finding: The germline variant rs2185379 in PRDM1 was found to be associated with long-term recurrence-free survival in advanced ovarian cancer patients. This indicated its potential role as a biomarker in predicting patient outcomes.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs2010963 polymorphism in the vascular endothelial growth factor gene was associated with markers of carotid atherosclerosis in type 2 diabetes mellitus patients.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: A SNP, rs6570507, located in an intron of ADGRG6, was found to be associated with gender body fat distribution, particularly having a larger effect in female visceral adipose tissue (VAT) than in males. This SNP was linked with female trunk fat distribution and waist-to-hip ratio adjusted for BMI and obesity in females.
title: ADGRG6 promotes adipogenesis and is involved in sex-specific fat distribution

finding: SNP rs9403383, in high linkage disequilibrium with rs6570507 (r2=0.99), was associated with female trunk fat with a strong significance (P-value=5.03 x 10^-13). This SNP was found to reduce enhancer activity affecting transcription factor binding, ultimately leading to impaired adipogenesis in human adipocytes.
title: ADGRG6 promotes adipogenesis and is involved in sex-specific fat distribution

finding: The variant rs62418762 showed strong evidence of association with cerebral malaria (CM) and severe malaria anaemia (SMA), with a combined Bayes factor indicating significant replication evidence. It was identified to affect susceptibility likely via a previously unrecognized mechanism.
title: New insights into malaria susceptibility from the genomes of 17,000 individuals from Africa, Asia, and Oceania

finding: The SNP rs145578678 in an intron of the gene DEK was found to have a suggestive association with the rate of cognitive decline in Alzheimer's disease, with a reported p-value of 3E-6. This indicated that genetic variation in DEK could alter the odds of developing late-onset Alzheimer's disease.
title: The proto-oncogene DEK regulates neuronal excitability and tau accumulation in Alzheimer’s disease vulnerable neurons

finding: The risk SNP rs34662244 was identified in an intergenic region on chromosome 6 and was associated with chromatin interaction clusters linked to the target genes ZNF165, ZSCAN16, and ZSCAN16-AS1. The study showed that this SNP potentially regulated these target genes over long distances through enhancer-promoter interactions. Additionally, a significant proportion of the genes interacting with this SNP exhibited higher expression levels in lung cancer samples compared to normal samples, indicating a potential driver role for the SNP in lung cancer.
title: Mapping Multiple Factors Mediated Chromatin Interactions to Assess Regulatory Network and Dysregulation of Lung Cancer-Related Genes

finding: The variant rs10455872 was identified as being associated with increased risks of developing hyperlipidemia and cardiovascular diseases. In a PheWAS, two genotype-phenotype associations for rs10455872 were replicated with significant effect sizes: coronary atherosclerosis with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.60 (P < .001) and chronic ischemic heart disease with an OR of 1.5 (P < .001) using the ICD-9-CM mapping, and with similar values when using the ICD-10-CM mapping (coronary atherosclerosis: OR 1.60, P < .001; chronic ischemic heart disease: OR 1.47, P < .001). This indicated strong reproducibility in the associations across different mapping systems.
title: Developing and Evaluating Mappings of ICD-10 and ICD-10-CM Codes to PheCodes

finding: The ARG1 SNP rs2781666 was associated with an increased risk of T2DM, indicating its potential influence on the disease's etiology.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs2781665 in the ARG1 gene was also found to confer risk for T2DM, further implicating ARG1 variants in diabetes susceptibility.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The VEGF polymorphism rs2010963 was connected to T2DM and markers of carotid atherosclerosis, suggesting its role in vascular complications associated with diabetes.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The rs10305492 G>A (A316T) SNP was linked to protective effects against type 2 diabetes (T2D) and cardiovascular disease. In vivo studies using a humanized knock-in mouse model demonstrated that the A316T variant resulted in lower fasting blood glucose levels, improved glucose tolerance, and enhanced insulin secretion under metabolic stress conditions. This SNP was characterized by its gain-of-function properties, leading to alterations in the islet cytoarchitecture and changes in beta-cell identity when exposed to a high-fat, high-sucrose diet. Despite these indications of enhanced metabolic traits, mice carrying the A316T variant exhibited a blunted response to pharmacological GLP-1R agonists, showing the complexity of its effects on therapeutic outcomes.
title: In vivo functional profiling and structural characterisation of the human Glp1r A316T variant

finding: The A allele of rs149644985 was linked to increased chromatin accessibility in both progenitors and neurons over a caPeak associated with increased expression of FABP7. This SNP and its LD proxies were found to disrupt SMARCC1 and FOS::JUN motifs, affecting the expression of FABP7.
title: Cell-type specific effects of genetic variation on chromatin accessibility during human neuronal differentiation

finding: The C allele of rs144376334 in association with rs149644985 was found to disrupt binding of FOS::JUN, leading to decreased chromatin accessibility and reduced expression of FABP7.
title: Cell-type specific effects of genetic variation on chromatin accessibility during human neuronal differentiation

finding: The SNP rs370140172, a 5' UTR variant located on chromosome 6, was positively associated with Type-2 diabetes (T2D) in Native Hawaiians. The study identified a significant association with T2D (OR = 1.096, P = 1.25×10−5), marking it as a potential candidate locus that relates to the increased prevalence of T2D in this population.
title: The impact of global and local Polynesian genetic ancestry on complex traits in Native Hawaiians

finding: This SNP was part of a list of T2D-associated variants shown to significantly impact transcriptional activity in beta cells via MPRA.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: For the first time, rs2881632 was nominated as a putative causal variant in a T2D locus based on its transcriptional activation effects identified by MPRA.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: Marker rs7088 was identified as related to resistance against the PFTTT race and was likely associated with previously mapped QTLs.
title: Identification of novel leaf rust seedling resistance loci in Iranian bread wheat germplasm using genome-wide association mapping

finding: The SNP rs3777588 was linked to primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG). It was fine-mapped to a low-complexity regulatory element (LCRE) of the gene CLIC5, which is specifically open in Müller Glia (MG) cells of the retina. This variant was significantly associated with the expression of CLIC5, as indicated by the colocalization of GWAS and eQTL signals, with a posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 0.72. Furthermore, it was predicted to strengthen binding of the transcription factor HSF1, highlighting its potential role in the regulatory mechanisms underlying POAG.
title: Integrated multi-omics single cell atlas of the human retina

finding: The tag-variant rs7768920, as associated with the HERC2 duplication, demonstrated significant influences on gene expression levels of nearby genes, highlighting its potential involvement in pigmentation-related traits.
title: Resolving the insertion sites of polymorphic duplications reveals a HERC2 haplotype under selection

finding: This SNP was validated in trans-ethnic studies and showed directional consistency with the novel BMI signals near ADCY5 in the AAAGC and GIANT consortia.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: Lead SNP for a novel BMI signal near C6orf106 with high posterior probability for causality; this SNP demonstrated tight LD in trans-ethnic analyses.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: Represented a novel signal in proximity to C6orf106, showing transferability to GIANT at a proxy SNP (rs1573905) with strong LD.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: In this study, <italic>TPMT</italic> risk variants, including rs1800462, were genotyped and evaluated for their impact on thiopurine toxicity. However, cases carrying <italic>TPMT</italic> variants were excluded from further analysis to focus on <italic>NUDT15</italic> variants. Despite exclusion, rs1800462 represented an important variant previously associated with variations in thiopurine sensitivity.
title: Massive parallel variant characterization identifies NUDT15 alleles associated with thiopurine toxicity

finding: The missense variant rs75932628 (p.R47H) in the gene TREM2 was identified to confer a high risk of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD) and was linked to low levels of soluble TREM2 protein.
title: Coding and regulatory variants affect serum protein levels and common disease

finding: The SNP rs9349279, located near PHACTR, was similarly identified as a strong outlier and was associated with candidate traits linked to a higher risk of coronary heart disease (CHD). The examination suggested that this SNP played a role in identifying pathways that could influence CHD.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways

finding: The SNP rs7764984, located near HIST1H2BJ, was found to be associated with candidate traits like self-reported coeliac disease and body composition, providing insights into possible influences on schizophrenia via an outlier analysis.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways

finding: The V380L variant (rs1801582) showed a trend for association with T1R (p = 0.09; OR (95% CI) = 1.44 (0.94 - 2.20)), indicating that this common missense variant contributed to the susceptibility to T1R, despite being overshadowed by the stronger association of the rare variants.
title: Pleiotropic effects for Parkin and LRRK2 in leprosy type-1 reactions and Parkinson’s disease

finding: The rs1265053 SNP exhibited the most significant signal in the AD-PID GWAS, located in the Class I region close to HLA-B and HLA-C genes. This finding marked an important association in understanding the genetic basis of primary immunodeficiency.
title: Whole genome sequencing of a sporadic primary immunodeficiency cohort

finding: The rs9273841 variant was identified as having the strongest association signal within the conditional analysis at the MHC locus, close to HLA-DRB1 and HLA-DQA1 genes. The discovery of this SNP played a critical role in uncovering independent signals at the MHC locus related to AD-PID.
title: Whole genome sequencing of a sporadic primary immunodeficiency cohort

finding: The coding mutation rs201979175 (c.C303G:p.F101L) in SIRT5 was identified to segregate dominantly with finger interphalangeal joint osteoarthritis (OA) in a family from the Utah Population Database. This mutation results in the substitution of an evolutionarily invariant phenylalanine (Phe–F) with leucine (Leu–L) at position 101 in the catalytic domain of SIRT5. It was associated with higher malonylation levels and decreased expression of cartilage extracellular matrix (ECM) genes, along with upregulation of inflammation-related genes, indicating its role in the metabolic dysfunction related to OA.
title: Sirt5 regulates chondrocyte metabolism and osteoarthritis development through protein lysine malonylation

finding: The SNP rs3129787 was found as an eQTL in the brain with significant correlation to various health issues, including blood pressure and diabetes.
title: Brain aging comprises many modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: SNP rs7766042 showed association with snoring among the UK Biobank population.
title: Brain aging comprises many modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: This SNP correlated with high blood pressure, migraine, headache, and vascular problems.
title: Brain aging comprises many modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The SNP rs2814993 was associated with leg mass, initially showing a suggestive P-value of 1.1 × 10⁻⁶ with standard GWAS. However, using the SynSurr method, this association was elevated to genome-wide significance (GWS) with a P-value of 2.3 × 10⁻²⁰. Additionally, this SNP was previously linked to height in both a meta-analysis of European populations and an Australian twin study.
title: Leveraging a machine learning derived surrogate phenotype to improve power for genome-wide association studies of partially missing phenotypes in population biobanks

finding: The SNP rs2072783 was associated with the gene CLIP2, identified as a trans-eQTL with a q-value FDR ≤ 0.11, and extended from the cis-association with GMPR, highlighting its relevance in the inferred network.
title: Causal Network Inference from Gene Transcriptional Time Series Response to Glucocorticoids

finding: The rs72928038 variant was associated with multiple sclerosis (MS) susceptibility, showing a protective odds ratio for the G allele of 0.8663. This variant was prioritized as a putative causal gene linked to the BACH2 locus in a GWAS study, with a strikingly low p-value of 8.38*10^-29. It was also found to be a significant eQTL, correlating with increased expression of BACH2 in naive CD4+ T cells and Tregs.
title: The chromatin landscape of Th17 cells reveals mechanisms of diversification of regulatory and pro-inflammatory states

finding: In the context of a human genome-wide association study, it was identified that the SNP rs75205693 in the CNR1 gene was associated with DNA methylation. This association suggests a potential role of this SNP in modulating gene expression related to the pathological mechanisms in atherosclerosis.
title: Loss of myeloid cannabinoid CB1 receptor confers atheroprotection by reducing macrophage proliferation and immunometabolic reprogramming

finding: The SNP rs9273363 was located near HLA-DQB1 and was found to have strong main effects on T1D risk, along with significant interactions with multiple other variants. The presence of the homozygous AA allele indicated increased risk and showcased the SNP's relevance in complex genetic interactions.
title: Deep integrative models for large-scale human genomics

finding: In the study, SNP rs762624 was reported as being intronic within the CDKN1A locus and was significantly associated with various metabolic traits, including body weight, fat and fat-free mass, and energy expenditure in the UK Biobank. The minor allele 'C' was linked to protective effects, associated with increased fat-free mass and basal metabolic rate, as well as lower levels of hemoglobin A1C, indicating a potential protective role against diabetes. Furthermore, this SNP was identified as a significant splicing quantitative trait locus (QTL) in the METSIM study, enhancing the expression of a non-coding transcript isoform of CDKN1A.
title: Single-cell dissection of obesity-exercise axis in adipose-muscle tissues

finding: SNP rs2395655, identified as a missense variant in the CDKN1A locus, showed strong significant associations with anthropometric and metabolic traits in diverse populations including the UK Biobank and the Million Veteran Program. The 'G' minor allele of rs2395655 was connected with protective traits such as increased fat-free mass and lower hemoglobin A1C levels. Similar to rs762624, this SNP demonstrated significance as a splicing QTL, affecting the expression of a specific non-coding transcript isoform of CDKN1A and was also linked with triglyceride measurements.
title: Single-cell dissection of obesity-exercise axis in adipose-muscle tissues

finding: The rs9349379_A>G variant, an eQTL for PHACTR1, was associated with migraine-related traits and medications such as triptan, ibuprofen, and paracetamol, as well as with angina and myocardial infarction.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The tag SNP for HLA-DRB1*15:01, observed first in an Italian Neolithic individual, was noted for its role as the largest genetic risk factor for MS. Its frequency increased rapidly during the emergence of the Yamnaya culture around 5,300 years ago in Steppe populations.
title: Elevated genetic risk for multiple sclerosis originated in Steppe Pastoralist populations

finding: This SNP tagged the HLA-DRB1*15:01 haplotype and showed the largest change in genetic risk over time in the pan-ancestry analysis, indicating strong evidence for positive selection within the past 5,000 years.
title: Elevated genetic risk for multiple sclerosis originated in Steppe Pastoralist populations

finding: Associated with the HLA-DRB1*15:01 haplotype, evidence of selection was observed in Steppe populations, mirroring trends found with rs3135388, further linking it to MS risk.
title: Elevated genetic risk for multiple sclerosis originated in Steppe Pastoralist populations

finding: This SNP was also identified as tagging the HLA-DRB1*15:01 haplotype and showed consistent selection signals strongest in the CHG ancestry, contributing to the understanding of MS risk.
title: Elevated genetic risk for multiple sclerosis originated in Steppe Pastoralist populations

finding: Tagging HLA-DRB1*04:01, this SNP displayed evidence of continuous negative selection until approximately 3,000 years ago, contrasting with findings related to MS-associated SNPs.
title: Elevated genetic risk for multiple sclerosis originated in Steppe Pastoralist populations

finding: The conserved regulatory region containing SNP rs11751128 was associated with human intelligence and overlapped with the TIAM2 gene, which is highly expressed in the human brain and involved in neural cell development. This region was closed in the nucleus accumbens and dentate gyrus but open in the Ammon's horn after METH treatment.
title: Methamphetamine induced regional-specific transcriptomic and epigenetic changes in the rat brain

finding: This SNP, near C6orf106, was a lead signal found during the HISLA meta-analysis and had a strong LD with another significant variant.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: This SNP represented a novel BMI signal near C6orf106 and showed consistency in its effect across studies, although its significance varied.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: This SNP was identified as a proxy for the novel BMI signal near C6orf106 and showed strong LD with the lead HISLA SNP.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: This SNP was reported as an intronic variant with potential as an additional signal in the context of height.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The SNP rs9368197 was associated with breast cancer risk and was located within an intron of the CDKAL1 gene. This finding contributed to the body of evidence identifying genetic factors associated with increased risk of breast cancer.
title: Finding associations in a heterogeneous setting: Statistical test for aberration enrichment

finding: The T allele of rs9266234 acted as an eQTL for the gene CCHCR1, promoting the preferential binding of transcription factors POUF2F and TBP. This was linked to an increased burst size but a decreased burst frequency, indicating a regulatory role of this SNP on transcriptional dynamics.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: As both an eQTL and a GWAS Catalog variant, the T allele of rs9271588 was shown to induce preferential binding of the transcription factor SRF, correlating with a higher burst frequency and larger transcription variance. This SNP also exhibited associations influencing hematopoietic stem cell behavior through HLA-DQA1.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: The C allele of rs72844311, located downstream of HLA-DQA1, was linked to ASB of transcription factor BHLHE40. This SNP was shown to have higher predicted TF binding affinity in phase with rs9271588_T, resulting in an associated increased burst frequency and decreased burst size.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: The SNP was identified as newly FDR significant through Flexible cFDR, leveraging functional genomic data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP was identified as newly FDR significant through Flexible cFDR, leveraging functional genomic data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP was identified as newly FDR significant through Flexible cFDR, leveraging functional genomic data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP was identified as newly FDR significant through Flexible cFDR, leveraging functional genomic data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP was identified as newly FDR significant through Flexible cFDR, leveraging functional genomic data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP was identified as newly FDR significant through Flexible cFDR, leveraging functional genomic data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP was identified as newly FDR significant through Flexible cFDR, leveraging functional genomic data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP was identified as newly FDR significant through Flexible cFDR, leveraging functional genomic data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP became FDR significant after applying Flexible cFDR, leveraging H3K27ac data; however, it did not replicate in the UK Biobank data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP became newly FDR significant after utilizing H3K27ac fold change data, replicating in the UK Biobank.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP was identified as newly FDR significant through the application of Flexible cFDR leveraging H3K27ac data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP rs2046210, located in the genomic region Chr6:151485998-151682606 (chr6q25.1), was associated with the transcription factor (TF) ESR1. Previous research indicated that ESR1 was within 1 million base pairs of this SNP, suggesting a potential regulatory role in breast cancer-related genetic expression.
title: Tissue-specific transfer-learning enables retasking of a general comprehensive model to a specific domain

finding: The SNP rs185805779 G>A in gene GCNT2 was classified as pathogenic, presenting with allele frequencies of 1.52% in the Vietnamese population, significantly higher than 0.17% in East Asia and 0.03% globally.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs9277535 was identified as significantly associated with the hepatitis B virus. This association was highlighted due to the extensive amount of research on this SNP across a variety of populations, particularly from Asian regions including China, Japan, Turkey, Korea, and Indonesia. The mention of HLA loci and the prevalence of this SNP in studies indicated its important role in the context of infectious diseases.
title: HLA-SPREAD: A Natural Language Processing based resource for curating HLA association from PubMed abstracts

finding: The SNP rs9379084 was classified as a primary signal at the RREB1 locus, showing shared effects between islet (TOA=0.31) and adipose (TOA=0.27) tissues.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The PPARD rs2016520 (T/C) polymorphism affected the therapeutic efficacy of nateglinide in Chinese patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus, suggesting its significance in diabetes treatment.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The ARG1 single nucleotide polymorphism rs2781666 was associated with an increased risk of type 2 diabetes mellitus, indicating its potential as a genetic marker for the disease.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: Similar to rs2781666, the rs2781665 SNP was linked to susceptibility to type 2 diabetes mellitus, reinforcing the genetic association with this condition.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs660895, located near HLA-DRB1/DQA1, was also strongly associated with self-rated health and resilience, with a significance level of P = 2 x 10^-22. Like rs429358, this SNP was previously validated in external cohorts linked to the same traits of human ageing.
title: Genetically independent phenotype analysis identifies LPA and VCAM1 as drug targets for human ageing

finding: The rs76773039 variant (L83I) was shown to affect morphine efficacy, increase receptor internalization, enhance morphine tolerance, and was associated with higher morphine dependency.
title: Understanding and predicting ligand efficacy in the mu-opioid receptor through quantitative dynamical analysis of complex structures

finding: The rs201310502 variant (T120M) was indicated to affect the response to tramadol.
title: Understanding and predicting ligand efficacy in the mu-opioid receptor through quantitative dynamical analysis of complex structures

finding: It demonstrated strong association with risk of TN and luminal-like subtypes.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: This variant had strong evidence of associations with risk of TN and luminal-like subtypes.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: It was most strongly associated with risk of HER2-positive subtypes.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: SNP rs2076295 was found to co-localize with an eQTL for desmoplakin (DSP) gene expression in lung tissue and also with the lung function phenotype (FEV1/FVC). It was implicated in both Interstitial Lung Disease (ILD) and DSP expression, suggesting a potential role in epithelial integrity and a common causal pathway related to OSA.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy to discover and interpret GWAS results for sleep-associated traits

finding: The missense variant rs1042044 was linked to GLP1R and presented with a PPA of 71.6%. It had an associated p-value of 1.79 x 10^-6, implicating GLP1R in obesity regulation via its role as a receptor for the satiety hormone GLP-1.
title: A Unifying Statistical Framework to Discover Disease Genes from GWAS

finding: The SNP rs72928038 was noted as an intronic variant in the BACH2 gene and was included among the original 95% credible sets.
title: Correcting the coverage of credible sets in Bayesian genetic fine-mapping

finding: The PGx variant (rs2500535) in the Uronyl 2-Sulphotransferase (UST) gene was found to affect nortriptyline efficacy in patients with major depressive disorder. Patients carrying the A allele experienced decreased improvement in depressive symptoms. The variant was notably more common in Hispanic individuals, who had an odds ratio of 6.07 for risk-associated genotypes.
title: Population structure and pharmacogenomic risk stratification in the United States

finding: The SNP rs369580 located at 6p21.32 was associated with progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP), with an odds ratio of 1.43, indicating its role as a risk factor for the disorder.
title: Genetic, transcriptomic, histological, and biochemical analysis of progressive supranuclear palsy implicates glial activation and novel risk genes

finding: SNP rs12197948 at 6p21.1 was associated with increased RUNX2 expression across various brain datasets, supporting its potential role in PSP.
title: Genetic, transcriptomic, histological, and biochemical analysis of progressive supranuclear palsy implicates glial activation and novel risk genes

finding: The variant rs4714854, which is in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs12197948, was also associated with RUNX2 expression, suggesting a shared effect on gene regulation in PSP.
title: Genetic, transcriptomic, histological, and biochemical analysis of progressive supranuclear palsy implicates glial activation and novel risk genes

finding: The lead SNP rs2523524 at 6p21.32 was correlated with elevated C4A expression. Furthermore, C4A copy number was significantly associated with PSP status, indicating that this SNP is likely involved in the etiology of PSP.
title: Genetic, transcriptomic, histological, and biochemical analysis of progressive supranuclear palsy implicates glial activation and novel risk genes

finding: At the BACH2 locus, the 'A' allele at the top eSNP (rs72928038) was associated with decreased BACH2 expression and increased risk of autoimmune diseases such as autoimmune thyroid disease, celiac disease, multiple sclerosis, rheumatoid arthritis, and type 1 diabetes.
title: Neonatal genetics of gene expression reveal the origins of autoimmune and allergic disease risk

finding: A synonymous variant in KIF6, this SNP was associated with specific facial traits and embryonic development crucial for facial morphology.
title: Novel genetic loci affecting facial shape variation in humans

finding: The SNP rs35571244 was noted as a cis-eQTL for PBX2 and indicated a role in the regulatory network despite being located relatively distant from the PBX2 transcription start site.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs62399063 was associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) and was found in an LSD1-bound site that interacts with the IER3 promoter in human islets. This indicated a link between this genetic variant, regulation of gene expression through histone acetylation, and insulin secretion.
title: Nutrient regulation of the islet epigenome controls adaptive insulin secretion

finding: For rs60755019, the original study indicated TREML2 as the most likely gene associated with this SNP. However, the new annotation found significant eQTL in blood with ADCY10P1 as the associated gene.
title: snpXplorer: a web application to explore human SNP-associations and annotate SNP-sets

finding: The variant rs3088442 in the SLC family was associated with coronary heart disease and was found to inhibit lipopolysaccharide-induced inflammatory response, highlighting its potential involvement in cardiovascular diseases.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This SNP affected the expression of FOXO3, important for oligodendrocyte progenitor cell differentiation, with a z-score of 6.64.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: The tag SNP rs3135388 was linked to HLA-DRB1*15:01, the major genetic risk factor for MS. This SNP first appeared in an Italian Neolithic individual and showed a significant rise in frequency during the emergence of the Yamnaya culture around 5,300 years ago. Its associated risk was considered essential in understanding the genetic predisposition to MS.
title: Genetic risk for Multiple Sclerosis originated in Pastoralist Steppe populations

finding: The SNP rs3129934 was noted as driving the largest change in genetic risk for MS over time, with strong selection signals found in both pan-ancestry and CHG analyses. This SNP tags the HLA-DRB1*15:01 haplotype, demonstrating its relevance to MS risk among ancient populations.
title: Genetic risk for Multiple Sclerosis originated in Pastoralist Steppe populations

finding: The SNP rs3129889, which tags the HLA-DRB1*15:01 haplotype, showed evidence of positive selection, particularly in CHG ancestry, similar to rs3135388. Its association with higher MS risk was significant in the ancient population context.
title: Genetic risk for Multiple Sclerosis originated in Pastoralist Steppe populations

finding: The SNP rs3135391 tagged the HLA-DRB1*15:01 haplotype, displaying a pattern of positive selection within Steppe populations. This suggests its important role in elevating MS risk, paralleling findings for other tag SNPs of HLA-DRB1*15:01.
title: Genetic risk for Multiple Sclerosis originated in Pastoralist Steppe populations

finding: This SNP was linked to a reduced risk of PD and associated with eQTL impacts on HLA-DRB1, implicating immune response pathways in neurodevelopment and neurodegeneration.
title: Establishing gene regulatory networks from Parkinson’s disease risk loci

finding: Similar to rs504594, this SNP was associated with reduced PD risk, emphasizing the relevance of immune processes in PD progression.
title: Establishing gene regulatory networks from Parkinson’s disease risk loci

finding: The SNP rs12195276 in the KCNQ5 gene was significantly associated with pulse pressure variation, indicating its relevance to cardiovascular health and the possible influence of the sympathetic nervous system on this trait.
title: M-current downregulation leads to stellate ganglia sympathetic hyperactivity associated with hypertension

finding: The SNP rs75932628, also known as p.R47H, was identified as a risk factor for Alzheimer’s disease (AD). It is located near the 3' end of circTREM2_1 and circTREM2_3, which were studied in the context of AD pathology.
title: A TREM2-derived circRNA is upregulated in the entorhinal cortex of Alzheimer’s disease patients

finding: The SNP rs143332484, corresponding to p.R62H, was described as a risk factor for Alzheimer’s disease (AD). It was also noted to be included within circTREM2_2, and is situated close to the 3' ends of circTREM2_1 and circTREM2_3.
title: A TREM2-derived circRNA is upregulated in the entorhinal cortex of Alzheimer’s disease patients

finding: The SNP rs7772537 was associated with atrial fibrillation (AF) and resided within a TF footprint of FOXJ3. It interacted with the promoter of TBC1D32 over 850-kb away, contributing to the understanding of heart disease-related gene regulation.
title: Dissecting Regulatory Non-Coding Heart Disease GWAS Loci with High-Resolution 3D Chromatin Interactions Reveals Causal Genes with Pathophysiological Relevance to Heart Failure

finding: The SNP rs1919875 was independently associated with atrial fibrillation and found in an open chromatin region interacting with GJA1 over 400-kb away. This interaction provided insights into how gene regulatory mechanisms may be influenced in heart disease.
title: Dissecting Regulatory Non-Coding Heart Disease GWAS Loci with High-Resolution 3D Chromatin Interactions Reveals Causal Genes with Pathophysiological Relevance to Heart Failure

finding: The missense variant rs75932628 in TREM2 was associated with variable levels of the anti-inflammatory protein TREM2 known to confer significant risk of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD).
title: Coding and regulatory variants affect serum protein levels and common disease

finding: The SNP rs2894251 was identified as significant within the European (EUR) population with a p-value of 2.144 e-15 and a minor allelic frequency (MAF) of 0.12. However, it was not significant in the East Asian (EAS) population with a p-value of 0.05156 and a MAF of 0.02. This finding tied to the C4A gene in the MHC class III region suggests that low allele frequency and different linkage disequilibrium patterns contributed to the distinct SCZ risk gene profiles between the populations.
title: Brain transcriptional regulatory architecture and schizophrenia etiology converge between East Asian and European ancestral populations

finding: The eSNP rs2894254 was found to be very uncommon in the EAS population, with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of less than 0.001, while it had a MAF of 6% in the EUR population. The disparity in allele frequencies exemplified how population-specific SCZ risk genes could emerge and suggests that the distinct allele frequency and linkage disequilibrium across populations influence the detection of SCZ risk genes.
title: Brain transcriptional regulatory architecture and schizophrenia etiology converge between East Asian and European ancestral populations

finding: The SNP rs185805779 G>A was identified as a stop-gained variant in gene GCNT2, with an allele frequency of 1.52% in the Vietnamese population, classifying it as pathogenic and associated with cataract 13 with adult i phenotype.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs4947332, a tag SNP for HLA-DRB1, was identified as significantly associated with RA, with an OR of 4.23 and p-value of 0.04, indicating its strong association with RA risk.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: The SNP rs7752903, located downstream of TNFAIP3, was significantly associated with RA, as evidenced by a strong association with a p-value of 2.33×10^-4.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: SNP rs4285314, located in miR-3135b, was confirmed to have a significant association with RA with a p-value of 1.10×10^-13.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: SNP rs9268839, located in HLA-DRB9, was shown to have a consistent risk effect in RA, with an OR of 2.47 in the Caucasian population validated with an OR of 1.72 in the study cohort.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: The SNP rs9275376, situated in HLA-DQB1, was significantly associated with RA, highlighting its potential as a risk factor.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: The SNP rs9461218, located in an intronic region of the SLC17A1 gene, demonstrated a significant genetic association with reduced urine levels of Lac-Phe, with a beta value of -0.242 and a P value of 9.9e-26. The non-effect allele was G and the effect allele was A, with a frequency of the effect allele at 0.22. The association was linked to the extended SLC17A1-4 locus, which includes SLC17A2, SLC17A3, and SLC17A4. Despite the association with urine Lac-Phe levels, no significant correlation was found with blood Lac-Phe levels.
title: SLC17 transporters mediate renal excretion of Lac-Phe in mice and humans

finding: The SNP rs13205171 was identified as having a notable relationship with the efficacy of chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T-cell therapy when analyzed in the context of mathematical models of cellular interactions. This SNP was linked with better functional responses in CAR T-cells against glioblastoma cells, providing important insight into the genetic factors influencing treatment outcomes in cancer therapies.
title: Data driven model discovery and interpretation for CAR T-cell killing using sparse identification and latent variables

finding: rs9501077 was newly identified as significant after applying flexible cFDR, with a decrease in FDR from 3.99e-04 to 6.36e-05, leveraging H3K27ac counts in asthma relevant cell types. This SNP is located within the HCG27 gene, linked to psoriasis, but did not replicate in the UK Biobank data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: rs4148869 became significant after flexible cFDR application, reducing its FDR from 9.28e-04 to 7.96e-05, due to high H3K27ac fold change values. This SNP is a 5' UTR variant in the TAP2 gene associated with various immune-related disorders.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: rs9467715 had a raw p-value nearly significant in the original GWAS (p = 8.96e-08) and showed an increase in significance after using flexible cFDR, with its FDR pushed past the significance threshold (FDR = 1.37e-04). This SNP represents a regulatory variant.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: This SNP was associated with the expression of the SLC17A1 gene in spatial transcriptomic data from human kidneys. This gene expression was localized predominantly within proximal tubules, highlighting its relevance to kidney function.
title: Spatially resolved transcriptome profiles of mammalian kidneys illustrate the molecular complexity of functional nephron segments, cell-to-cell interactions and genetic variants

finding: Similar to rs765285, this SNP was linked to the SLC17A1 gene's expression in the proximal tubules of human kidneys, indicating its involvement in chronic kidney disease.
title: Spatially resolved transcriptome profiles of mammalian kidneys illustrate the molecular complexity of functional nephron segments, cell-to-cell interactions and genetic variants

finding: This SNP was identified within the spatial transcriptomic dataset associated with the SLC17A1 gene, which showed significant expression in proximal tubules, thus contributing to the understanding of genetic factors in chronic kidney disease.
title: Spatially resolved transcriptome profiles of mammalian kidneys illustrate the molecular complexity of functional nephron segments, cell-to-cell interactions and genetic variants

finding: As with the other SNPs, rs12212049 was found to be associated with SLC17A1, whose expression patterns in proximal tubules were examined, affirming its significance to the pathophysiology of chronic kidney disease.
title: Spatially resolved transcriptome profiles of mammalian kidneys illustrate the molecular complexity of functional nephron segments, cell-to-cell interactions and genetic variants

finding: The rs1360780 SNP in FKBP5 was associated with heightened FKBP5 gene expression, particularly in case individuals carrying the risk T allele. This was evident as cases with the T allele exhibited significantly higher FKBP5 expression levels compared to control homozygotes and T carriers. The findings suggested that this genotype contributed to exacerbated FKBP5 transcription following stress exposure, particularly influencing pathways related to synaptic transmission and neuroinflammation with age.
title: Brain expressed FKBP5 delineates a therapeutic subtype of severe mental illness

finding: The SNP rs9296736 was previously associated with liver enzyme measurements. Our findings indicated that when adjusted for methylation, the association with the gene MLIP weakened significantly, suggesting that high levels of methylation (ranging from 0.89 to 0.97) around this SNP influenced the gene's expression and its relationship to liver enzymes.
title: Incorporation of DNA methylation into eQTL mapping in African Americans

finding: The finding related to rs2269424 (G/A), adjacent to the PPT2 and EGFL8 genes, indicated strong evidence of selection regarding immunity. This TIM illustrated the role of this SNP in evolutionary pressures that favored genetic variants associated with immune responses.
title: A genomic dating tool for ancient genomes resolves the origins of hundreds of Eurasian genomes

finding: This SNP (G/A) was noted within the HFE gene and linked to hemochromatosis. The study found increased allele frequency over time, illustrating the impact of dietary transitions on the prevalence of this genetic risk factor.
title: A genomic dating tool for ancient genomes resolves the origins of hundreds of Eurasian genomes

finding: The rs2842980 variant was linked to the lengthening of the 3' UTR of the SOD2 gene by creating a canonical PAS, with an association to a higher risk of atrophic macular degeneration. Its intergenic variant rs2842992, which was in strong LD, was previously associated with this condition.
title: The genetic determinants of the relative expression of alternative 3’UTR isoforms in human

finding: Originally reported for adult antisocial personality disorder with an odds ratio of 0.63 (P=1.64E-09), this SNP was found to have an opposite effect in AGG overall (β=0.0022, P=0.41), indicating a lack of significant association with childhood AGG despite its relevance to antisocial behavior.
title: Genetic Association Study of Childhood Aggression across raters, instruments and age

finding: The SNP rs140068132 was identified in a previous genome-wide association study (GWAS) and was part of a 71-SNP polygenic risk score (PRS) analyzed by Allman et al. The finding was considered positive and original as it relates to breast cancer risk. In the current study, the performance of the 180-SNP PRS that included this SNP among others showed an odds ratio (OR) per standard deviation increment of 1.58 and an area under the receiver operating characteristic curve (AUCROC) of 0.63, indicating its significant association with breast cancer risk in a Latina population.
title: A polygenic risk score for breast cancer in U.S. Latinas and Latin-American women

finding: The SNP rs149197213 in the ADGRF5 gene was found to be significantly associated with suicide death. Its identification as a high-impact, rare SNP supports its potential influence in the genetic landscape concerning suicide risk.
title: Rare protein coding variants implicate genes involved in risk of suicide death

finding: This SNP was associated with CpG site cg20406979, which had a strong association (P = 7.60 × 10^-25), located 314 nucleotides upstream of the transcription start site for the gene RNASET2, evidencing its potential role in CD-related methylation patterns.
title: Methylation Quantitative Trait Loci are Largely Consistent across Disease States in Crohn’s disease

finding: The SNP rs9379084 was identified as a primary signal at the RREB1 locus, demonstrating tissue-sharing with islet (TOA=0.31) and adipose (TOA=0.27) effects.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: This SNP was part of a cluster near <italic>DAAM2</italic>, influencing Wnt signaling and showing eQTL associations indicating its probable regulatory impact on bone mineral density.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: Like rs2504105, this SNP was identified as a regulatory element influencing <italic>DAAM2</italic> expression and contributing to variations in bone density.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: This SNP was included in the <italic>DAAM2</italic> tier-1 SNPs, suggesting its role in bone mineral density regulation via enhancer/promoter activities.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: The variant rs75932628, which is a c.140G>A; p.R47H change in TREM2, was identified as a highly penetrant microglia risk gene for Alzheimer’s disease (AD). This finding indicated that the presence of this TREM2 variant was linked to an increased risk of developing AD, as it was prevalent in the Control/MCI/AD/TREM2^var group comprised of donors diagnosed with AD.
title: TREM2 impacts brain microglia, oligodendrocytes and endothelial co-expression modules revealing genes and pathways important in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs9349407 polymorphism in the CD2AP gene was associated with an increased susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease, as supported by data from a study that analyzed 54,936 samples. This finding was originally reported in 2015 and subsequently confirmed in 2022, indicating its relevance to late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD).
title: The Alzheimer’s disease risk gene CD2AP functions in dendritic spines by remodelling F-actin

finding: The rs9349379 SNP was identified as an intron variant and eQTL for PHACTR1, shown to be associated with migraine and migraine-related medications, as well as some cardiovascular traits, indicating its complex pleiotropic nature.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The SNP rs12203592 was associated with freckles, brown hair, and high sensitivity of the skin to sun exposure. It was shown to create a ZEB/SNAI-like motif that negatively affected the MEL topic score of the IRF4 enhancer. This repressive motif contributed to decreased enhancer activity, as the presence of the motif correlated with reduced prediction scores for the MEL state. Additionally, mutating this motif improved the topic score, indicating its role as a transcriptional repressor.
title: Cross-species analysis of melanoma enhancer logic using deep learning

finding: The rs45527431 SNP was identified as genome-wide significant for schizophrenia. Similar to other SNPs, the associated alleles increased both left-handedness and risk for schizophrenia.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 48 common genetic variants associated with handedness

finding: The rs9360616 SNP showed a strong association with long sleep duration and colocalized with a variant in KCNQ5, highlighting its potential significance in sleep-related traits.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide analysis identifies common genetic variants for self-reported sleep duration and shared genetic effects

finding: The rs6909225 SNP in KCNQ5 was associated with long sleep duration and showed significant colocalization with napping frequency, suggesting its influence on sleep traits.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide analysis identifies common genetic variants for self-reported sleep duration and shared genetic effects

finding: The SNP rs58453446 in the BACH2 gene was significantly associated with FEV1/FVC in never smokers (p=8.9×10^{-10}), implicating it in pulmonary surfactant homeostasis.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The rs10499197 variant was associated with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). It was identified near a putative enhancer 55 kb upstream of the TNFAIP3 gene, and disrupting this enhancer impaired TNFAIP3 expression, thereby suggesting a causal role in SLE pathogenesis.
title: A novel regulatory element upstream of TNFAIP3 promoter may be influenced by SLE risk variants

finding: The rs58905141 variant was located in a putative enhancer region overlapping with SLE risk variants, indicating its potential relevance to SLE. It was part of a 109 kb risk haplotype associated with SLE, enhancing the understanding of genetic contributions to the disease.
title: A novel regulatory element upstream of TNFAIP3 promoter may be influenced by SLE risk variants

finding: The non-synonymous rs763780 SNP in the IL17f gene was found to be associated with increased susceptibility to tuberculosis and correlated with advanced disease severity in a study conducted in Argentina.
title: Using population-specific add-on polymorphisms to improve genotype imputation in underrepresented populations

finding: This SNP was categorized as a rare variant linked to American ancestry, and it achieved significance in the pooled analysis.
title: Cloud gazing: demonstrating paths for unlocking the value of cloud genomics through cross-cohort analysis

finding: The BACH2 rs3757247 polymorphism's association with type 1 diabetes and complications could provide insights into shared autoimmune pathways relevant to Crohn's disease.
title: Identification of hub genes and key pathways in pediatric Crohn’s disease using next generation sequencing and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SOD2 rs4880 polymorphism was studied for its potential conformance to risk profiles related to inflammatory conditions, indicating its potential implication in Crohn's disease.
title: Identification of hub genes and key pathways in pediatric Crohn’s disease using next generation sequencing and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The W719R substitution in kinesin family member 6 was associated with altered response to statin treatment, with higher allele frequencies observed in African (86%) and East Asian (53%) populations.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs7753394 was associated with Crohn's disease. It lay in a putative enhancer region, suggesting it could alter A20 expression levels which might contribute to the disease.
title: A zebrafish functional genomics model to investigate the role of human A20 variants in vivo

finding: The SNP rs7773904 was also linked to Crohn's disease and was found in a conserved regulatory region that may affect A20 expression, indicating a potential role in disease mechanism.
title: A zebrafish functional genomics model to investigate the role of human A20 variants in vivo

finding: The SNP rs10499197 was associated with Systemic lupus erythematosus. Its location in a putative enhancer region suggests it might influence A20 gene expression and thus be relevant to the pathogenesis of the disease.
title: A zebrafish functional genomics model to investigate the role of human A20 variants in vivo

finding: The SNP <italic>rs4896735</italic> at the <italic>UTRN</italic> locus was associated with serum urate levels in both European and Indian GWAS data.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control

finding: The <italic>rs675209</italic> SNP at the <italic>RREB1</italic> locus exhibited strong colocalization with serum urate association signals.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control

finding: The SNP chr6:26370572:C:T was identified as an interaction eQTL variant for the gene BTN3A2. It showed colocalization with the GWAS signal for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE), indicating its relevance in the context of this autoimmune disease. This finding highlighted the SNP's significant role in modulating gene expression related to specific cellular contexts.
title: Uncovering context-specific genetic-regulation of gene expression from single-cell RNA-sequencing using latent-factor models
